¶ He wende and heorde eft heore prechingue &punctelev; and sei&yogh; þat hit was guod
"To longue," he seide, "ich habbe abide &punctelev; ar ich þis vnderstod."
he turnde him to cristindom &punctelev; and liet him baptisen anon
And biliefde on ihesu crist &punctelev; and is Men echon
Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; þe furste þat euere cam
Seint Austin huy maden þo &punctelev; to holde up cristindom
¶ Seint Austin brou&yogh;te cristindom &punctelev; þus into Enguelonde
Wel au&yogh;te we his [dai] Anouri &punctelev; &yogh;if we weren wel vnderstonde
¶ His day is toward þe ende of May &punctelev; for in þat day he wende
Out of þis lijf to ihesu crist &punctelev; þat after him þo sende
Bidde we &yogh;eorne seint Austin &punctelev; þat cristindom so brou&yogh;te
Þat we moten to þulke Ioye come &punctelev; to &yogh;wan ore louerd us bou&yogh;te
SEint Barnabe þe Apostle &punctelev; þat guod was and hiende
IMartred he was for godes loue &punctelev; in strongue deþe atþenende
After þat ore swete louerd &punctelev; to heouene gan iwende
Þe Apostles precheden cristindom &punctelev; ase he heom gan wit siende
¶ Seint Barnabe isai&yogh; þo &punctelev; þat his bileue nas nou&yogh;t
he turnde sone to þe Apostles &punctelev; and to ore louerd al is þou&yogh;t
Of lond he hadde ane grete feld &punctelev; and he it solde wel faste
to þe Apostles he wende anon &punctelev; and to heore fet þe panes caste
And forsok al þis world[r. worldes] guod &punctelev; and heore felawe bicam
And Imartred he was with heom &punctelev; for loue of cristindam
Sethþe þo seint powel &punctelev; to þe Apostles wende
Þe Apostles ne lefden it nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat ore louerd him to heom sende
Ake wenden þat he a gylur were &punctelev; so þat hit was longue
For he hadde so luþur man ibe— &punctelev; are huy dorsten him vnder|fongue
¶ Seint Barnabe iknev him ferst &punctelev; so þat he formest brou&yogh;te
Þe apostles in cuthrade with him &punctelev; and in ri&yogh;te þou&yogh;te
And tolde heom hov ore swete louerd &punctelev; bi weye to him cam
And smot him and binam him is si&yogh;t &punctelev; and brou&yogh;te him to cristindom
¶ Sethþe þo fram Ierusalem &punctelev; þe Apostles gonne wende
Forto prechi godes lawe &punctelev; þat so guod is and hende
And to þe londe of Cypre &punctelev; seint Barnabe huy gonne þo sende:[This v. om. in other MSS.]
Ase he wende forth in is wei &punctelev; in one stude he fond
A felau&yogh;schipe of quoynte Men &punctelev; þe wiseste of al þe lond
he spac with heom so quoynteliche &punctelev; ase he bi heom cam
Þat þar nas non of heom alle &punctelev; þat ne wondrede of his wisdam
"Sire sire," seide on of heom &punctelev; þat was of grete fame
"Tel us of &yogh;wannes þou art &punctelev; and &yogh;wat is þi name
And fram &yogh;wannes þou art hidere icome &punctelev; and for &yogh;wuche þingue
Þou comest here into ore lond &punctelev; ich wot for sume tiþingue."
¶ Seint Barnabe þis holie Man &punctelev; fondede in eche pointe
to answerien heom wel quoynteliche &punctelev; for huy weren heomself so quoynte
"Sire," he seide, "þov axest wel &punctelev; and ich ou wulle telle
Barnabe ich am icleoped &punctelev; þe deueles fo of helle
Iesu cristes man ich am &punctelev; þat me gan hidere siende
Fram Ierusalem ich am icome &punctelev; and þus aboute wiende
Forto prechi is holie name &punctelev; þat brou&yogh;te us out of biende
Bileueth on him and &yogh;e worþeth in Ioye &punctelev; euere withoute ende."
he prechede so þis grete men &punctelev; þat huy turnden heore þou&yogh;t
And weren þare to cristindom &punctelev; þoru&yogh; seint Barnabe ibrou&yogh;t
And biliefden on Iesu crist &punctelev; and heore heorte ope him caste
And prechede also of ihesu crist &punctelev; and turnde þut folk wel faste
Seint Barnabe wende him forth &punctelev; and to þe londe of cipre he com
to tuyrne men to ihesu crist &punctelev; and to prechi cristindom
He cam and fond a foul dede &punctelev; þat schendful was to do
Men vrne nakede al aboute &punctelev; and wummen also
Seint Barnabe was þarof aschamed &punctelev; for it was a schenful dede
Þat þe schrewene neren aschamede nou&yogh;t &punctelev; to schewi heore wrechhede
To þe temple he wende anon &punctelev; ope &yogh;wan huy avouweden heore schame
And amansede þat sori temple &punctelev; in ore louerdes name
Anon with þis mansingue &punctelev; al þat on half dachste adovnn
Þoru&yogh; grete wreche of þis temple &punctelev; with gret noyse and soun
Þo þe schrewes isei&yogh;en þe wreche &punctelev; þat so schamelese were
huy bilefden þulke schendfole dede &punctelev; huy ne dorsten nonoþur for fere
þis holie man wende him forth &punctelev; ferrore in þe lond :[MS. londe]
Tymon, þat was an holi man &punctelev; in a stude he fond
Þat in a strong acces was of a feuere &punctelev; and al atþe deþe nei&yogh;
Þe godspelles of seint Mathev &punctelev; with him euere he ber
In a bok; ase god it wolde &punctelev; with him he hadde as þer
Þis bok he leide ope þis man &punctelev; ase he so sijk þer lay
he bicam anon hol and sound &punctelev; ase al þat folk isay,[MS. i isay]
And wende forth with him aboute &punctelev; hol and glad inov&yogh;
And prechede &yogh;eorne of ihesu crist &punctelev; and folk fram sunne drov&yogh;
Of ore swete louerd of heouene &punctelev; seint Barnabe hadde swich grace
Þat, &yogh;if he founde ani sijk man &punctelev; ase he wende in ani place
And he leide ope him þis bok &punctelev; þat so holi and guod was
Of þe godspelles of seint Mathev &punctelev; so strong siknesse non nas
Þareþoru&yogh; he maude mani men &punctelev; to Iesu criste gon
Þoru&yogh; vertue of þis holie Man &punctelev; and of þis holie bok also
Muche fair mi&yogh;thte ore louerd hath &punctelev; in his seriaunz ido
Þis holie man seint Barnabe &punctelev; &yogh;et forþere he wende
And prechede þe giwes faste &punctelev; hore lijf forto amende
Manie he tornede to cristindom &punctelev; and þene holi gost on heom tende
Þoru&yogh; miracles þat he dude &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; grace þat god him sende
¶ Bareu was a luþur giv &punctelev; þat euere weorrede faste
Seint powel and seint Barnabe &punctelev; and cudde it at þe laste
For þo he fond seint Barnabe &punctelev; þat folk to ore louerd so wiende
To þe luþere Iustise of þe lond &punctelev; þe tiþingue he gan siende
Þis holi man was sone inome &punctelev; and to dome ibrou&yogh;t
huy tormenteden him harde and stronge &punctelev; forto torni is þou&yogh;t
Alle manere turmenz huy him duden &punctelev; þat huy mi&yogh;thten on biþenche
huy ne mi&yogh;thten him nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot enes make &punctelev; fram god is þou&yogh;t blenche
¶ Ase huy weren with al heore mi&yogh;te &punctelev; aboute him[al. om.] faste and longue
Forto defouli þis holie man &punctelev; with tormenz harde and strongue
¶ Þe Aumperores o cosin &punctelev; þat of gret power was
Into toune cam þulke time &punctelev; ase it feol bi cas
Þe giwes weren so sore adrad &punctelev; laste he hem binome
Þoru&yogh; strencþe seint Barnabe &punctelev; and ladde him to rome
Ani&yogh;ht huy nomen þis holie man &punctelev; ase he was toraunsed so
And teiden ane rop aboute is necke &punctelev; and knutten him faste þerto
And drowen him out of heore synagoge &punctelev; with seoruwe and pine inov&yogh;
And mauden aboute him swiþe gret fuyr &punctelev; and barnden him alto nou&yogh;te
his soule wende to þe Ioye of heouene &punctelev; þat he wel deore abou&yogh;te
¶ Þo nomen þe luþere men heore red &punctelev; &yogh;wanne huy mi&yogh;ten atþe laste
his bones þat weren bileft vnbarnd &punctelev; amidde þe .se. to caste
Ake cristine Men þat weren biside &punctelev; stelen to bi ni&yogh;te
And bureden as wel stilleliche &punctelev; with ase gret honour ase huy mi&yogh;te
Nov bidde we &yogh;eorne ihesu crist &punctelev; king of alle kinge
For loue of seint Barnabe &punctelev; þat he us to heouene bringue
SEint Iohan was þe beste bern &punctelev; þe holie baptist
Þat euere of womman was ibore &punctelev; withoute ihesu crist
Ake of al þat he on vrþe was &punctelev; we ne findez nou&yogh;t iwrite
Þat he ani Miracle dude &punctelev; þat man mi&yogh;hte vnder&yogh;ite
Mani men þinchez þerof wonder &punctelev; so guod man ase he was
For manie miracles sum oþur dude &punctelev; þat fulliche so holi man nas
Ake al it was for þe luþere giwes &punctelev; þoru&yogh; ore louerdes wille so
For &yogh;if he hadde here on eorþe &punctelev; ani miracle ido
Þo giwes wolden habbe iwent &punctelev; þat he ore louerd were
For he bigan ferst cristindom &punctelev; and þat folk þerto lere
Þarefore ore louerd dude miracles &punctelev; and ne liet him do non
For þe giwes scholden iwite &punctelev; &yogh;wuch he were echon
¶ Seint Iohan for ore louerdes loue &punctelev; was sethþe ibrou&yogh;t of dawe
Forto holden up cristindom &punctelev; and þe ri&yogh;hte lawe
Heroudes, þat was þo king &punctelev; in a time to rome
Wende to þe Aumperour &punctelev; ase is wone was forto done
So þat bi þe weie he wende &punctelev; bi sire phelipe, his broþur
And maude gret feste, ase ri&yogh;t was &punctelev; heore eiþur with oþur
So þat heroudes spac &punctelev; mid is broþer wiue
Þe[r. þat] he hire wolde to wiue habbe &punctelev; þe &yogh;wuyle he were aliue
And þat he wolde framward rome &punctelev; þareforth a&yogh;ein wende
And nimen hire and leden hire forth with him &punctelev; and holde hire is liues ende
At on acord huy weren sone &punctelev; to don þis sorie dede
Ase twei schrewene acordiet sone &punctelev; to ane luþere rede
¶ Þis kyng heroudes wende forth &punctelev; in is wei toward rome
And þou&yogh;te to take is broþer wijf &punctelev; &yogh;wane he a&yogh;einward come
His owene wijf it vnder&yogh;at &punctelev; ase sum freond hire word sende
to hire fader, þat [was] king &punctelev; of Damasche, sone heo iwende
to beon þare forto heo wuste &punctelev; hou þis dede wolde anende
Þe king heroudes bi is broþer &punctelev; A&yogh;einward gan eft iwende
And, also it was er bispeke &punctelev; þis wijf with him he nam
And heold hire with strencþe ase is owene &punctelev; in spousbruche and horedam
And tiemde bi hire deolfolliche &punctelev; in sunne and with gret wou&yogh;
And duden him harm bi al heore mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; and boþe weren is fon
Ake he heold him faste in his folie &punctelev; and bilefde euere in on
¶ So þat seint Iohan þe Baptist &punctelev; to him a day com
And calangede him of is sunne[MS. sunnne] &punctelev; to ligge so in horedom
And seide, it was a&yogh;ein heore lawe &punctelev; and a&yogh;ein cristindom
Heroudes þarefore in wrathþe &punctelev; seint Iohan wel faste nam
And, forto paye þe luþere hore &punctelev; in strong prisun him caste
Þareinne he lay al a &yogh;er &punctelev; iwarded strangue and faste
And sethþe he liet smite of is heued &punctelev; as &yogh;e ihereth ofte telle
Also man redez in is daye in heruest &punctelev; biforen eov in þe godspelle
¶ In þe Castel of Arabie &punctelev; is heued was of ismite
Þe luþere quene it binam hire dou&yogh;ter &punctelev; and liet it faste wite
his desciples wenden stilleliche &punctelev; þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace
And bureden þis holie bodi &punctelev; in a wel fair place
Bitwe[ne] Abel and Elysee &punctelev; þat prophetes &yogh;wilene were
Stille was is holie bodi &punctelev; wel longue ibured þere
¶ Þis false quene þat heued wuste &punctelev; þat men ne founden it nou&yogh;t
laste it were in ani time &punctelev; to þis bodie ibrou&yogh;t
And a rise fram deþe to liue &punctelev; and bicome at þe laste
A prophete ase he was er— &punctelev; þerefore heo wuste it faste
A day ase heo biheold þat heued &punctelev; inwardliche in þe face
heo feol adoun ded anon &punctelev; as it was ore louerdes grace
Þulke wreche to hire cam &punctelev; þat deth hire adoun caste
Me þinchez heo ne ou&yogh;te nou&yogh;t bili&yogh;he &punctelev; hire schreuhede atþe laste
Ne þat luþere best, hire dou&yogh;ter, noþer. &punctelev; for ase heo &yogh;eode a dai
And pleide upon .yse. in hire game &punctelev; ase mani a man it[r. i] sai
Þat .ys. tobrak vnder hire &punctelev; and heo adronk anon
And in þe deueles name (!) &punctelev; boþe flechs and bon
Þis hadde moder and eke Dou&yogh;ter &punctelev; to heore Mede atþen ende
And also schal ech luþur man &punctelev; &yogh;wanne vre louerd it wole him siende
¶ Þat heued was sethþe wel priueliche &punctelev; to Ierusalem ibrou&yogh;t
And ibured stilleliche &punctelev; þat Men ne founden it nou&yogh;t
Of þis holi bodi, þare it lay &punctelev; manie Miracles come
A luþer Aumperour þere was þo &punctelev; þe luþere Iulian
Þa[t] reneyede ore louerdes lawe &punctelev; and was swyþe vuel Man
Þo Men tolden him of þis Miracles &punctelev; In grete wrathþe and onde
he liet nimen þis holie bones &punctelev; and tosprede into al þe londe
And casten heom aboute ech fram oþur &punctelev; þat no man þarenei&yogh; ne come
Ne ne founden[r. founde] heom to fette is bote &punctelev; ase men duden er ilome
Ake &yogh;ut for al is felonie &punctelev; ne bilefde ore louerd nou&yogh;t
Þat manie sike men þat comen þarenei&yogh; &punctelev; to hele weren ibrou&yogh;t
¶ Þo was þis luþere Iulian &punctelev; wroþere þane he was er
Ase is bones weren er to[s]prad &punctelev; his men he sende þer
And liet heom fette a&yogh;ein wel clene &punctelev; and withoute þe toun anon
he liet heom sette on strongue fuyre &punctelev; and furberne echon
And þut doust þarof wel wide &punctelev; he liet blowe mid þe winde
For men ne scholden of him on vrþe &punctelev; neuereft more ifinde
Cominde toward baptisingue— &punctelev; ase attwelfte day
Toward þe watere of Iordan &punctelev; and loude gradde and cride and sede
"lo here godes lomb, þat binimeth &punctelev; þe worldes misdede:"
Forsoþe no fuyr ne mi&yogh;te come &punctelev; on þat fingur one
Ake elles was al to douste ibarnd &punctelev; bodi and bones echone
No fuyr ne mi&yogh;hte þat finguer brenne &punctelev; for none cunnes þingue
For þe holie dede þat he þarewith &punctelev; tei&yogh;hte to þe hei&yogh;e[MS. holie, on the margin hei&yogh;e] kingue
Ake he bilefde hol, and &yogh;uyt is &punctelev; and þere nis non more bileued
On vrþe of him bote þilke fingur &punctelev; and his holie heued
For al is bodi was forbarnd &punctelev; bote vnneþe þulke two
his day, ase falleth in heruest &punctelev; þis dede was ido
¶ Þat is bodi was þus ibarnd. &punctelev; and also þulke day
Þeraftur longue men founden is heued &punctelev; vnder vrþe ase it lay
Of þulke two þingues men holdeth is feste &punctelev; þanne, þat &yogh;e it wite
For men ne mowen nou&yogh;t on ore leuedi day &punctelev; þo is heued was of ismite
A manere martyrdom it was &punctelev; is bones so todrawe
Þarefore men mouwe þanne holde &punctelev; is feste bi ri&yogh;te lawe
¶ His holie heued, þat þus was &punctelev; at Ierusalem ihud
Þoru&yogh; fair miracle of seint Iohan &punctelev; formest was ikud
For to tweie Monekus at Ierusalem &punctelev; himsulf he cam bi ni&yogh;hte
And schewede heom &yogh;ware is heued lay &punctelev; ase it were in a si&yogh;hte
huy wenden forth and sou&yogh;ten it[orig. is] sone &punctelev; and in þulke here iwounde
Þat he werede in wildernesse &punctelev; atþe laste huy it founden
And þane fyngur huy founden also &punctelev; þat was of him bileued
With gret honour huy beren forth &punctelev; þat fingur and þis h[e]ued
¶ For fair relike huy weren iwust. &punctelev; and &yogh;ut atþe laste
Eftsone huy weren &yogh;uyt ihud &punctelev; and in a put icaste
And leyen þare longue ihudde &punctelev; ase fewe þarof þou&yogh;te
Ake weren on vrþe al for&yogh;ite &punctelev; ase noman of heom ne rou&yogh;te
Bote seint Iohan it nolde nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat huy lei&yogh;en to longue þere
To þe Abbod Marcel[MS. Maroel] he cam a ny&yogh;ht &punctelev; in metyngue ase it were
And bad him nime is heued up &punctelev; and seide &yogh;ware it lay
Þis guode man aros up sone &punctelev; and ne abod nou&yogh;t forto day
Ake he openede is celle dore &punctelev; and biheold aboute
Ane steorre he fond bifore þe dore &punctelev; houinde þarewithoute
And putte forth is hond and wolde hire take. &punctelev; ake he ne mi&yogh;hte hire nou&yogh;t areche
Ake þe steorre gan softe to glide forth &punctelev; also it were þene wey to teche
¶ þis Abbod hire siwede euere forth &punctelev; and þe steorre bifore wel softe
Þe Abbot Anourede his ledare &punctelev; fale siþes and ofte
Forth wende þe steorre, forto huy comen &punctelev; ouer þat ilke place
Þare his holie heue[d] lay &punctelev; þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace
Þo heo cam ouer þulke place &punctelev; heo houede þare ane stounde
Forto Marcel þis holie Monek &punctelev; hadde þis heued ifounde
¶ To þe guode bischop Iulian &punctelev; Marcel tolde þis cas
Þoru&yogh; heom boþe þat holie heued &punctelev; Inomen up of þe vrþe was
his heued &yogh;ut, and is finguer also &punctelev; boþe huy beoth hole and sounde
Aseint Iohanes day in heruest[29 Aug.] &punctelev; þus huy weren ifounde
Þarefore &yogh;uit þoru&yogh; heste of Rome &punctelev; so wijd so is cristindom
Men holdez þane dai in ho[nu]raunce[MS. hor|aunce] &punctelev; of is holi martyrdom
¶ For in ore leuedie daye in leynte &punctelev; as he was to deþe ibrou&yogh;t
For þe oþur festene þat þare beoth &punctelev; of him men ne redez nou&yogh;t
Nouþe seint Iohan þat in þe flym Iordan &punctelev; baptisede godes sone
Lieue us þoru&yogh; ore cristindom &punctelev; to þe Ioye of heouene come
SEint Iemes þe holi Apostle &punctelev; guod is to habbe in mone
Seint Iohanes broþur þe Ewangelist &punctelev; and ore louerdes aunte sone
his Moder was ore leuedi soster &punctelev; Marie cleophe
Of guode kunne he was icome &punctelev; non betere ne mi&yogh;hte be
he au&yogh;hte wel himself beo guod &punctelev; ase &yogh;e mowe alle ise
In þe londe of Samarie he prechede &punctelev; and also in Ivde
Þoru&yogh; is prechingue mani on &punctelev; he turnde to cristindom
To hermogenes þe luþere prince &punctelev; þe tiþingue sone com
¶ Þilke prince was wichche strong &punctelev; and enchauntour also
Þoru&yogh; þe deuel he wolde al day &punctelev; gret Miracle do
Ane desciple he hadde of is Art &punctelev; philet was is name
him he sende to seint Ieme &punctelev; to fondi to don him schame
&YOGH;if þat he mi&yogh;hte with is Art &punctelev; seint Ieme ouercome
Togadere huy comen forto playdi &punctelev; ase þe day was inome
Godes desciple and þe feondes &punctelev; bigonne to playdi faste
Ac seint Ieme, þat was godes desciple &punctelev; aboue was atþe laste
Blinde men he &yogh;af heore sij&yogh;ht &punctelev; and maude hole in þe place
Meseles and þe crokede also &punctelev; al þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace
¶ Þo philet isai&yogh; him þus ouercome &punctelev; to is maister he wende sone
Hermogenes, and tolde him fore &punctelev; ase is ri&yogh;hte was to done
"Sire," he seide, "ne hope þov nou&yogh;t &punctelev; to come seint Ieme with|Inne
For nau&yogh;t it is, for þov ne schalt nou&yogh;t &punctelev; ouercome him with al þi ginne
Þarefore do ase ichulle þe rede &punctelev; and go we to him, we twei&yogh;e
And crie him merci and bicome we &punctelev; his desciples beye
For siker þou beo, ichulle it do &punctelev; þei þou nelle nou&yogh;t also."
So wroth was þe prince þat he nuste &punctelev; &yogh;wat for wrathþe do
Þoru&yogh; strencþe of þe deueles Art &punctelev; he made philet anon
Þat he ne mi&yogh;hte non more þane a stok &punctelev; a fot of þat stude gon
¶ "Nov," he seide, "we schullen iseo &punctelev; &yogh;wat Iemes þe mai don here
&YOGH;weþer he þe mai a&yogh;ein me vndo &punctelev; and a&yogh;ein mine godes pouwere."
he liet him ligge þare ase astok &punctelev; and forth awei fram him wende
Philet nam ane man anon &punctelev; and seint Ieme word sende
hou faste þoru þe deueles mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; he lai þer ibounde
And bad him helpe his desciple &punctelev; and bringue þene deuel to grounde
¶ Seint Ieme him sende a luyte cloth &punctelev; þat he with him ber
Þat he touchede him þarewith &punctelev; and seide þeos two vers of þe sauter
"Ore louerd vnbind þat beoth ibounde &punctelev; and &yogh;if þe blinde is si&yogh;hte
Ore louerd ri&yogh;tht heom þat buth vnri&yogh;ht &punctelev; for þou louest[al. oure louerd loueþ] alle ri&yogh;hte."
¶ Þo philet hadde þis ido &punctelev; ase seint Ieme word him sende
Onbounde he was of þe deueles bendes &punctelev; and &yogh;wodere he wolde he wende
he þrettnede faste hermogenes. &punctelev; to seint Ieme sone he cam
And godes desciple was and is &punctelev; and aveng cristindom
Þo hermogenes iherde þis &punctelev; þat he was so vnbounde
And þat seint Ieme hadde ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; al is dede to grounde
¶ Manie deuelene he conIurede &punctelev; þat huy to him wende
"Wel &yogh;e wutez," he seide, "&yogh;wi it is &punctelev; þat ich after eov sende
Ore alre fo, Iemes, hath &punctelev; mine desciple me binome
Bote &yogh;e beon strengore þane ich am &punctelev; iwis we beoth ouercome
Ich hote eov þat &yogh;e wenden anon &punctelev; and doth a god prei&yogh;e
Nimeth and bringuet heom to me &punctelev; faste ibounde bei&yogh;e
Certes, bote &yogh;e it mouwen do &punctelev; ase &yogh;e wel iseoth
Ouwer power nis nou&yogh;t wurth an hawe &punctelev; for ouercome we beoth."
¶ "We schulle sone," þe deuelene seiden &punctelev; "with heom on vrþe[Vern. a noþur] plei&yogh;e
Faste ibounde al to þine wille &punctelev; we schulle heom bringue bey&yogh;e
huy comen fleo oppe in þe loft &punctelev; ouer þe apostle seint Ieme
And anon so huy weren ouer him icome &punctelev; huy guonne to grenne and reme,[al. feme]
Belewi and wel foule crie &punctelev; "Iemes, Iemes, þin ore
We brennez here are it ore tyme be &punctelev; and beth itormented ful sore."
"Ho tormentede[al. tormenteþ] eov," quath seint Ieme &punctelev; "and &yogh;wat wolde &yogh;e nouþe here?"
"Bote we buth icome," þe feondes seiden &punctelev; "to nime þe and þi fere
Hermogenes us made hidere wiende &punctelev; þoru&yogh; is conIuringue
Þat we eov scholden faste ibounde &punctelev; bei&yogh;e to him bringue
Bote anon so we comen here ouer þe &punctelev; Aungles to us come
With brenninde raketei&yogh;ene &punctelev; and faste vs bounde and nome
here huy us beteth and tormentieth &punctelev; with brenninde fuyre
A wey, wei, Iemes, &yogh;wat schulle we do? &punctelev; we ne mowen nou&yogh;t þis duyre
A, Iemes, Iemes, leoue louerd &punctelev; of us wrechches haue reuþe
And neuereft we nelleth nei&yogh; þe come &punctelev; pli&yogh;hte we wolleth ore treouþe."
¶ "&YOGH;e wrechche foles," quath seint Ieme &punctelev; "I not &yogh;wat &yogh;e wolden here
Of þat &yogh;e þou&yogh;ten me anuye &punctelev; drawe &yogh;e schullen arere
Al onbounde ich &yogh;yue eov leue &punctelev; a&yogh;ein forto fleo
And bringuth him þat hidere eov sende &punctelev; faste ibounde to me
Þat &yogh;e ne don him non oþur harm!— &punctelev; for icholde with him speke."
"Wel is us nouþe," þe schrewen seide &punctelev; "we worþet wel awreke."
¶ To hermogenes huy comen sone &punctelev; and to grounde him caste
huy drowen him and is hondene bounden &punctelev; bihinden him wel faste
Þus[al. þef] huy seiden, "þou sendest us &punctelev; þare we gret wo ifielde
In gret torment and brenningue &punctelev; and nouþe we wollez þe &yogh;elde."
huy harleden forth þusne wrechche &punctelev; and to seint Ieme heo him brou&yogh;te
And seiden, "lo sire, &yogh;ware he is her &punctelev; þat to swuche torment us wrou&yogh;te
&YOGH;if us ferst leue þat we moten &punctelev; ore tormens awreke
And þe muchele vnri&yogh;ht þat he us hath ido &punctelev; are þou with him speke!"
¶ "Nay, certes," quath þis holie man &punctelev; "&yogh;e ne schullen nou&yogh;t so
For ore louerd us hiet þat we scholden &punctelev; guod for vuele do
&YOGH;wy ne come [&yogh;e] nou&yogh;t nei&yogh; philet &punctelev; þat stant here bi me?"
"Wel þou wost," þis oþure seiden &punctelev; "þat we ne moten for þe."
"No. goth þanne," quath seint Ieme &punctelev; "to eower kuynde stude
And ne cometh neuereft nei&yogh; no guod man &punctelev; þei a fol eov habbe i|bede."
¶ Euere stod hermogenes &punctelev; and criede milce and ore
he quakede for drede and for pine &punctelev; And wep swiþe sore
¶ "Philete, philete," quath seint Ieme &punctelev; "þes hath þe schame ido
Þov schalt don him guod a&yogh;ein vuel &punctelev; for mi louerd het me so
he bond þe þo þov were vnbounde &punctelev; and a&yogh;ein þulke luþere dede[The last halflines are transposed in the MS.]
Þov schalt vnbinde him þat is bounde &punctelev; for so mi louerd sede."[The last halflines are transposed in the MS.]
Philet vnbond þane wrechche &punctelev; and dude him vuel for guod
Þe wrechche ne dorste nou&yogh;woder gon for fere &punctelev; ake quakyinde þare he stod
"Go &yogh;ware þov wolt," quath seint Ieme &punctelev; "for mi louerd nele it nou&yogh;t
Þat euere ani man a&yogh;ein is wille &punctelev; to him beo ibrou&yogh;t."
¶ "A, merci," quath hermogenes &punctelev; "þis deuelen me beteh[r. beten] so sore
Þat Ine dar anne fot fram þe go &punctelev; laste huy me nimen more
huy me wullez asle, &yogh;if huy me afongueth eft &punctelev; and þarefore ich bidde þe
Þat þov me take sum þing þat ich mouwe &punctelev; for heom bere with me."
Seint Ieme him tok is staf on honde &punctelev; "go nov forth," he seide
"Þere nis no deuel þat dorre nouþe &punctelev; nei&yogh; þe come, for drede."
Hermogenes wende him forth. &punctelev; his bokes alle he nam
Þat he hadde of his enchauntemenz &punctelev; to þe Apostle a&yogh;ein he cam
And bad þat he as forbrenne scholde. &punctelev; þe Apostle sone heom nam
And caste heom in þe deope .se &punctelev; faste ibounde echon
¶ Hermogenes criede him merci &punctelev; and wilnede cristindom
So þat he icristned was &punctelev; and swiþe holi man bicam.
Abiatar, þat þo was &punctelev; Iustise, luþur inov&yogh;
For þis dede he was wroth &punctelev; toward seint Ieme, with gret wou&yogh;
he nam him faste and swor is othþ &punctelev; þat he it scholde abugge deore
to þe kyingue heroudes he liet him lede &punctelev; a rop aboute is swere
Heroudes &yogh;af his dom anon &punctelev; his þrote to smite atwo
And Iosie þe quellare he was bitake &punctelev; þulke dede forto do
Ane Rop he dude aboute is necke &punctelev; and ladde him toward is dome
Ane Man he helde of þe palasie &punctelev; are heo þudere come
Þo Iosie þis isai&yogh; &punctelev; merci anon he criede
Seint Ieme þe holie Apostle &punctelev; he bad wel sone abide
And cristni him in þe place &punctelev; anonri&yogh;tes þere
Aseinte marie day in leinte &punctelev; bihaueded boþe heo were
Ake holie curche halt of ore leuedi &punctelev; feste þat ilke day
Bifore lamasse seueni&yogh;ht &punctelev; we holdeth is day þerfore,[MS. bifore]
For þulke daye is bodi was &punctelev; into schrine ibore
¶ Anon so seint Ieme þe holie man &punctelev; bihaueded was þere
his desciples him wolden lede awei &punctelev; ac huy ne dorsten for fere
And þat bodi wel stilleliche &punctelev; out of þe countreye bere
In a schip huy leiden it in þe se &punctelev; and forth þarewithþ huy wende
And none &yogh;eme ne nomen &yogh;woderward fare &punctelev; bote ase god he[m] kende
Þat schip wende forth bi himseolf &punctelev; and hit cam on a day
Into þe lond of Galeis &punctelev; þare ase þe quene lay
Þat luþur [was] and schrewe inov&yogh;. &punctelev; seint Iemes Men anon
Op of þe schipe nomen þat holie bodi &punctelev; and leiden it opon a ston
Þe ston bigan to wexe abrod &punctelev; and holu&yogh; bicam amidde
Ase euene imaud to þe holie bodi &punctelev; as ani man wolde bidde
¶ Ne scholde no man so euene a þrov&yogh; &punctelev; in lengþe and i[n] brede
To[al. make to] him ase þat ston bicam &punctelev; ase ech man þat it isai&yogh; seide
his desciples, ase it was ri&yogh;ht &punctelev; to þe Quene erest wende
"Dame," huy seiden, "we habbeth ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat ore louerd þe hider sende
Seint Iemes bodi his Apostle &punctelev; of &yogh;wam þov nome ofte þi red
To laten him nime þe &yogh;wyle he was quik &punctelev; ase mani men it habbeth iseid
Ore louerd him hath hidere isent &punctelev; ase he himseolf bed.[orig. bad]
Loke &yogh;ware þov him legge wolt &punctelev; for icome he is to þe ded."
¶ "Ey, traytours," quath þe luþere Quen &punctelev; "&yogh;weþer &yogh;e beon of his
&YOGH;wane ine mi&yogh;hte of him beo awreke &punctelev; of eov ichulle, iwis."
Þis guode Men he nam echone &punctelev; and to þe king of spaygne heom sende
Þat he heom brou&yogh;te to strong dethþe &punctelev; oþur don heom heore lawe wende
Echone þe king nam anon &punctelev; and in strongue prisone heom brou&yogh;te
Ac ore louerd ne for&yogh;at heom nou&yogh;t &punctelev; ake wel sone on heom þou&yogh;te
For an Aungel fram heouene cam &punctelev; and þat prisoun brak wel sone
Þo þe kyng was þarof iwar &punctelev; he nuste &yogh;wat was to done
¶ Kny&yogh;htes he liet siende inowe &punctelev; aftur heom wel wide
Þat febleliche agonne in heore neodes &punctelev; for schame heom gan bitide
For ase huy wolden ouer ane hei&yogh;e brugge &punctelev; after þis guode men gon
Vnder heom þe brugge brak &punctelev; and huy adrounken echon
Of is luþere [þou&yogh;t][om.] þat he þou&yogh;te &punctelev; for drede he him withdrov&yogh;
Mildeliche he to heom he sende &punctelev; þat huy a&yogh;ein comen him to
And þat he heom wolde amendi faire &punctelev; of al þat he hadde heom misdo
A&yogh;ein huy wenden to þe kyng &punctelev; and he faire a&yogh;ein heom cam
&YOGH;wareþoru&yogh; he and al is Men &punctelev; afenguen cristinedom
¶ Þe king sende þe Quene word &punctelev; þat heo scholde heore wille al do
Ful sori was þe Quene þo &punctelev; and sore anuyd also
Ake heo ne dorste nou&yogh;t beo a&yogh;ein is heste &punctelev; nere hire no so [wo]
Wilde bollokes heo wuste fale &punctelev; ope ane hei&yogh;e hulle go
"Gothþ," heo seide, "ope þulke hulle &punctelev; finde &yogh;e mowen þere
Oxene and Bolen strongue inov&yogh; &punctelev; forte leden with ouwer bere
Tei&yogh;eth heom to þulke wayne &punctelev; and þat bodi leggez þarinne
And ledeth it &yogh;ware eouwere wille beo— &punctelev; godes leue &yogh;e habbe and minne."
¶ For þe Bollokes wilde were &punctelev; þe luþere Quene so seide
For huy ne scholden heom temie nou&yogh;t &punctelev; eniþing forto lede
his desciples wenden forth &punctelev; to þulke hulle hei&yogh;e
A fuyr Drake þaropon &punctelev; a&yogh;ein heom cominde huy sei&yogh;e
Swiþe ferliche he blaste fuyr &punctelev; and asayllede heom faste
Mani a man he hadde aslawe &punctelev; and al þe contreie of him agaste
¶ Þis desciples mauden þe signe sone &punctelev; of þe Creoyz heom bifore
Anon hadde þis luþere worm &punctelev; is pouwer al ilore
Þat hit ne mi&yogh;hte ane fot forþere passe. &punctelev; þis desciples forth wende
And topouneden it al to deþe &punctelev; and ech lime fram oþur rende
Þe Bollokes and þe &yogh;oungue steores &punctelev; þat weren er so wilde
Anon so huy touward heom[superscribed.] come &punctelev; huy woxen tame and milde
Þe beste huy chosen þat huy wolden &punctelev; and to þe wayne heom ladde
And huy drowen þat bodi so mildeliche &punctelev; þat ech man þarof wonder hadde
¶ Þis desciples nomen seint Iemes bodi &punctelev; and opon þe wayne it leide
Þe bestes it drowen forth wel mildeliche &punctelev; withoute eche fole breide
huy comen and driue þane wayn &punctelev; þare as þe Quene was
hire wondrede muche and dradde sore &punctelev; þo heo isei&yogh; þat cas
¶ Heo forsok hire false bileue &punctelev; and tok hire to cristindom
For þe wonder þat heo isei&yogh; &punctelev; and guod womman bicom
Al hure paleys þat heo was inne &punctelev; and al heore oþure bone
Forto honouri þat holie bodi &punctelev; heo grauntede heom wel sone
Amidde þe paleys þis holi bodi &punctelev; huy bureden with grete pruyte
Þare he hath euereft to þis dai ibeo &punctelev; and so he is &yogh;uyte
¶ Heo liet arere ane noble churche &punctelev; and gret tresor he &yogh;af þarto
And gret lond, þat &yogh;uyt þareto lijth &punctelev; and grete rentes also
&YOGH;wareþoru&yogh; of religioun &punctelev; a gret hous nouþe þare is
Of Chanones, þat Men &yogh;eot iseoth and sechethþ &punctelev; at seint Iemes of Galys
A gret pilegrimage it is iholde &punctelev; oueral, ase &yogh;e iseothþ
To sechen þat ilke holie stude &punctelev; þare seint Iemes bones beothþ
Mani miracle is pilegrimes seggeth &punctelev; þat þare hath ofte icome
Þei we ne mouwen nou&yogh;t alle telle &punctelev; þenche we moten on some.
¶ Þritti Men at one tyme &punctelev; pilegrimes bicome
To seint Iemes þe holie stude &punctelev; alle þene wei huy nome
Ase huy wenden bi þe wei&yogh;e &punctelev; so gret loue huy hadden and trewe
And so guod heorte ech to oþur hadde &punctelev; þat a foreward huy mauden newe
Þat non ne scholde failli oþur &punctelev; in perile ne in neode
Ake wedbreþerne huy bicomen echon &punctelev; ase huy þat wei eode
heore treuþes huy pli&yogh;hten alle bote on &punctelev; ake he nolde his nou&yogh;t pli&yogh;te
Ake þat foreward he bihet to holde &punctelev; treuweliche ope al is mi&yogh;hte
¶ So þat it bifeol bi þe weie &punctelev; þat on ivuelede a day
And vnder þe hulle of seint Mi&yogh;hel &punctelev; longue sijk he lay
his felawes þat hadde him treouþe ipli&yogh;ht &punctelev; fiftene dawes þere
Abiden him; so þat heom þou&yogh;te longue &punctelev; for sore anuyde huy were
And seiden, "we ne mouwen no leng abide &punctelev; late we him ligge[ligge on the margin.] stille
Do we moten ore pilegrimage &punctelev; god do bi him is wille."
huy nomen heore leue and lieten him ligge &punctelev; and wenden forth echon
Bote þilke þat nolde is treuþe pli&yogh;hte— &punctelev; he nolde nou&yogh;t fram him gon
¶ "Certes," he seide, "god do is wille &punctelev; and lieue eov wel to wende
I nelle anne fot fram him gon &punctelev; are ich wute of him sum ende."
Mid him he bilefde al one &punctelev; forto þat he ded were
Betere is trewe dede þane fals word &punctelev; as it was isene þere
Þis trewe Man þat was with þe bodi &punctelev; ful sore adrad he was
For he was so feor fram toune &punctelev; and no man nei&yogh;h him nas
For he was with þe dede al one &punctelev; and it was nei&yogh;h ni&yogh;hte
he nuste &yogh;wat with þat bodi to do &punctelev; bote seint Ieme him helpe mi&yogh;hte
his help he bad with guode heorte. &punctelev; and in þe eueningue ri&yogh;ht
Seint Ieme cam to him ride &punctelev; in wel fair atyr of kni&yogh;ht
¶ "Cum here," he seide, "forth with me &punctelev; ne haue þou of noþing drede
Bifore me cast þat bodi her &punctelev; and ich it wolle hennes lede
And lupe þou up bihynde me." &punctelev; and þo þis was al ido
Þis holie Man ladde þene dede forth &punctelev; and þene quike also
Fyftene Iorneies grete are day— &punctelev; in þulke luytele &yogh;wile,
To þe mount of Ioie &punctelev; þat is bisides seint Iemes a mile
Þo huy comen to þulke Mount &punctelev; seint Ieme gan abide
"Go," he seide to þe quike manne &punctelev; "to mine churche herebiside
And sei&yogh;e mine Canones þat þarinne beoth &punctelev; þat ich heom word bi þe sende
Mine pilegrim þat me was leof &punctelev; þat in treowenesse mine wei wende
Þat huy him burien among heom þere &punctelev; with fair seruise and li&yogh;hte
For ded he schal þudere come &punctelev; &yogh;wane he aliue ne mi&yogh;hte
And seie heom þat þine felawes were &punctelev; þat heore wei is al ilore
For heore treouþe þat huy breke &punctelev; heore felawe, þat is nov bifore
And þine &yogh;wyle ichulle þe &yogh;elde &punctelev; þat þou hast þus treowe ibeo."
Mid þusse worde he wende forth &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;hte him nonemore ise
¶ Aboute þat bodi for þis Miracle &punctelev; folk cam þicke reke
Here man mai sumdel iseo &punctelev; &yogh;wuch [it is] treouþe to breke
And &yogh;wuch it is þane holie wey &punctelev; to seint Iemes forto go
Þis Miracle is so Murie &punctelev; ich mot &yogh;eot telle of mo.
¶ Hit was a guod man and is sone &punctelev; þat toward seint Iemes wende
To þe cite of Tolouse &punctelev; a&yogh;ein eue huy hem kende
Al ni&yogh;ht huy bilefden þere &punctelev; at ane luþere mannes Inne
he þou&yogh;te with &yogh;wuche tricherie &punctelev; he mi&yogh;hte panewes winne
¶ Nou was þe lawe in þulke stude &punctelev; as þe schrewe wel onderstod
Þat hoso anhengue anine[r. anne] man &punctelev; he scholde habbe al is guod
Þe schrewe heom made fair semblaunt &punctelev; ase is manere was to done
Þat huy were fordronke beie &punctelev; and aslepe lei&yogh;en sone
A coppe of seluer stilleliche &punctelev; þis luþere Man gan bringue
And dude in heore schrippe softeliche &punctelev; among heore oþur þingue
¶ Þis guode Man awok and is sone &punctelev; so sone so it dai was
And nomen heore leue and wenden forth &punctelev; and nusten nou&yogh;t of þat cas
Þo huy come withoute toune a luyte &punctelev; þis luþere man aftur cam
hotinde out, with grete siwte &punctelev; and þis trewe men beie he nam
And seide huy hadden is coppe istole &punctelev; and in heore scrippe ibounde
Þat folk þis iliefde anon &punctelev; þo huy þe coppe founde
¶ Þis pilegrimes, þei huy treowe weren &punctelev; to dome weren ibrou&yogh;t
Eche manere þeofþe huy fursoken &punctelev; ake þat folk ne liefde heom nou&yogh;t
For huy weren inome hond habbinde &punctelev; þe court lokede anon
Þat huy heore dom with heom beren &punctelev; and hanguy scholde þat on
¶ "Alas, alas," þe fader seide &punctelev; "&yogh;weþur i schulle novþe hongue
And are ich habbe seint Ieme isou&yogh;t &punctelev; þis file dethþ afongue?"
"Nai certes," quath is sone &punctelev; "þat nolde ich graunti þe
For to beo louerd of al þe world &punctelev; þat þov deidest bifore me
hanguy ichulle for us boþe &punctelev; þene deth inelle nou&yogh;t forsake
And also wis ase we gultlese beoth &punctelev; mine soule ich god bitake."
"A, mi leoue sone," quath þe fader &punctelev; "so ne schal it nou&yogh;t beo
Scholdest þou dei&yogh;e and ich libbe &punctelev; inelle neuere þane day iseo
Swuch a child touward as þou art &punctelev; iloked it were wroþe
Þat þov scholdest hanguy and ich libbe! &punctelev; ichulle hangy for us boþe."
"A, fader, fader," quath þe sone &punctelev; "be stille, ich bidde þe
For I nelle neuere þane day abide &punctelev; þat þou schulle hongue bifore me
¶ Ake go þane wey for us boþe &punctelev; and ichulle hangy for us beye
And bide seint Ieme þat he me graunti &punctelev; sum part of þine weye."
Bitwene þe fader and þe sone &punctelev; þe striuingue laste longue
Þat ech man hadde deol þerof— &punctelev; &yogh;weþur scholde þene dethþ afongue
So þat it ful atþenende &punctelev; þei it were with wrongue
Þat þe sone for heom bei&yogh;e &punctelev; gulteles was anhongue
¶ Alas, alas, þe deolfole cas &punctelev; to heore so muche falshede
Wel &yogh;eorne boþe fader and sone &punctelev; seint Ieme help huy bede
Welle louerd, þe deol of þe fader— &punctelev; grettore neuere non nas
Þo he isai&yogh; is sone anhongue &punctelev; and for he gulteles was
he bitey&yogh;te is soule Iesu crist &punctelev; þo þare nas non oþur won
And is wei with sorewe inov &punctelev; to seint Iemes he gan gon
Also wel for is sone ase for him &punctelev; seint Ieme he bad faste
And wende, þo he hadde al ido &punctelev; hamward at þe laste
Are he come þare is sone was &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te swyþe longue
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;hte finde oþur iseo &punctelev; ani lime of him hongue
For þe lawe was þere þat euerech man &punctelev; þat anhangued were
hanguy scholde þe &yogh;wyle ilaste[al. he laste] &punctelev; and forto ech lime fram oþur totere
¶ Þis &yogh;oungue Man sixe and þritti dawes &punctelev; heng upon þe galutreo
Are is fader a&yogh;ein to him come &punctelev; þat iroted he au&yogh;te to beo
he cam and fond him &yogh;uyt &punctelev; and ner him he gan teo
he weop and criede and wrong is hondene &punctelev; þat deol it was to seo
¶ "Leoue fader," þe sone seide &punctelev; "ne weop þou nou&yogh;t to bliue
For ich nam to biweope nou&yogh;t &punctelev; &yogh;eot ich am aliue
Me nas neuere on eorþe so wel &punctelev; ase me hath sethþe ibeo
Ich am ase þei ich were in heouene &punctelev; þei ich hanguy here on þis treo
For seint Ieme me halt up &punctelev; and Ioye inov&yogh; me dieth make
Me ofþuncheth þat þou so sone come &punctelev; laste þov me adoun take."
Louerd, þe Ioye þat þe fader &punctelev; hadde þulke stounde
Þo he aftur al is sor &punctelev; his sone aliue founde
¶ To toune he orn with Ioye inou&yogh; &punctelev; and cleopede folk wel faste
Muche folk him siwede and al þe soþe &punctelev; isei&yogh;en atþe laste
Withþ gret Ioye huy nomen him adoun &punctelev; and to þe toune him brou&yogh;ten
Þene traitur þat him maude anhongue &punctelev; wel sone out huy sou&yogh;ten
And anhenguen him wel hei&yogh;e anon &punctelev; and nou&yogh;t bote he wuyrþe were
Þus seint Ieme þe holie man &punctelev; is pilegrim halp þere.
¶ In þe Cite of leouns &punctelev; a &yogh;oung man þare was also
Þat ofte wende to seint Iemes &punctelev; and gret loue hadde þarto
At one tyme ase he þudere wolde &punctelev; he dude er ane folie
Þat manie Men to helle bringueth &punctelev; þe sunne of lecherie
Toward seint Iemes he wende forthþ &punctelev; are he ischriue were
Þe deuel was wel &yogh;eorne aboute &punctelev; &yogh;if he mi&yogh;hte him mislere
¶ A&yogh;ein him he cam in þe wei &punctelev; swiþe milde and softe
Ri&yogh;ht ase it seint Ieme were &punctelev; ase þe schrewe gyleth men wel ofte
"&YOGH;wost þou euere," he seide, "ho ich am?" &punctelev; þe &yogh;oungue man seide nay
"Icham þilke," he seide, "þat þov hast &punctelev; Iserued wel mani a day
Seint Ieme toward &yogh;wam þou art. &punctelev; I ne may make no mone
Of þe þat þov wel ne dest &punctelev; of eche þingue bote of one
Þat þou dust[MS. dẹust; dust=dudest] lecherie &punctelev; are þou wendest to me
Among alle men, &yogh;if þat nere &punctelev; mest ich preisie þe."
¶ "Seint Ieme, merci," quath þis man &punctelev; "ich crie þe milce and ore
For&yogh;if me þulke luþere sunne &punctelev; inelle don as neuereft more."
"Ov, beau frere," quath þe schrewe &punctelev; "strong is þe misdede
Þov ne mi&yogh;ht me neuere paye wel &punctelev; bote þov do ase ich rede
Þe menbre þov most keruen of &punctelev; &yogh;warewithþ þou isunegut hast
Þe sunne ichulle for&yogh;iue þe þanne &punctelev; &yogh;wanne he is fram þe icast
Ak next me þou scholdest in Ioye beo &punctelev; in þe blisse of heouene aboue
&YOGH;if þou woldest beon a martyr &punctelev; and þiseolf martri for mi loue."
¶ "A, louerd seint Ieme," quath þis man &punctelev; "þov haue merci of me
Ichulle, mine sunnes to bete, misulf martri &punctelev; and forto pay&yogh;e þe."
Þis wrechche Man carf of is membres &punctelev; and awei fram him caste
Ful redi was þe schrewe þer &punctelev; þe soule he nam anon
And wel glad þarewith in his manere &punctelev; toward helle he gan gon
Ne fur&yogh;at nou&yogh;t seint Ieme is pilegrim &punctelev; for þat cas þat him gan bi|tide
A&yogh;ein þe deuel he cam adoun &punctelev; and bad þane schrewe abide
And seide, "þou berst more þane þin owe. &punctelev; þat i schal kuyþe þe
&YOGH;wi hast þou mine pilegrim bitraid? &punctelev; gret schame þou dest me."
"&YOGH;e, al for nau&yogh;t," quath þe schrewe &punctelev; "þou art hidere icome
In his sunne himsulf he aslou&yogh; &punctelev; and þarewith ich him habbe i|nome
Ne may no man in dedlich sunne &punctelev; into heuene wende
Ase wel þou mi&yogh;ht gon hom a&yogh;ein &punctelev; he is min withouten enden."
¶ "Bel amy," quath seint Ieme &punctelev; "þou bitraidest him with fals|hede
And with tricherie þou to him come. &punctelev; lat him gon, ich rede!"
"Ich habbe leue," quath þe schrewe &punctelev; "to bigyli and bitraye also
Mid eche quointise þat ich mai. &punctelev; &yogh;wi wolde he aftur me do?"
Þis strif ilaste bitwene hem longue. &punctelev; ake þo seint Ieme ne mi&yogh;hte
habbe þe soule ne withinne him come &punctelev; with no resun ne ri&yogh;hte
"Þou schalt," he seide, "come with me &punctelev; to an herre Iustise
Þat þe schal cuyþe þi tricherie &punctelev; of &yogh;wam þe schal agrise."
Bifore ore leuedi swete and milde &punctelev; þane schrewe he gan lede
he &yogh;al and quakede deolfulliche &punctelev; þo he isei&yogh; hire, for drede
¶ "Þov luþere þing," ore leuedi seide &punctelev; "&yogh;wi fondeste in alle wise
To binime us and bitrai&yogh;e men &punctelev; þat beth in ovre seruise
Þou ne schalt neuere þe soule brouke &punctelev; for þine tricherie."
"leoue leuedi," quath þe schrewe &punctelev; "merci ich þe crie
Vnderstond þat ich habbe leue &punctelev; to bigylie men inou&yogh;
And þat ich fond him in dedlich sunne &punctelev; and þareinne himsulf he slov
And no man neuere in swuch cas &punctelev; to heuene come ne mi&yogh;hte
Ase he is min mid alle lawe &punctelev; hold me, ich bidde, to ri&yogh;hte!"
¶ "Þov luþere best," ore leuedi seide &punctelev; "to muche ower pouwer is
Alas þat men nellez beon iwar &punctelev; are huy don amis
Ase þou mid þine tricherie &punctelev; his lijf him binome
Also ichulle him &yogh;iuen a&yogh;ein &punctelev; is lijf with ri&yogh;hte dome
So þat þe ne tit of him no part &punctelev; for guod man he wo[l] &yogh;eot be."
Ore leuedi made þe soule anon &punctelev; to þe bodi a&yogh;en fleo
Fram deþe to liue he aros &punctelev; þoru&yogh; ore leuedi ore
And guod lijf ladde euere afturward &punctelev; and þe deuel doutede þe more
¶ His menbres, þat he carf of &punctelev; euereft he dude misse
Manie Men for þulke miracle &punctelev; seint Ieme louieth þe more
Nou bidde we &yogh;eorne euerechone &punctelev; seint Ieme milse and ore
Þat he for þat holie stude &punctelev; þat he hath in galiz
helpe us and alle is pilegrimes &punctelev; and bringue us to heouene blis
SEint Oswold þe holie king &punctelev; of þe on ende of enguelonde
King was, ase þulke tyme bifeol &punctelev; in northþhomberlonde
Cristine man he was guod inov&yogh; &punctelev; and with al is pouwer
he heold up þe lawe of cristindom &punctelev; and tei&yogh;te as feor and ner
For he was king are cristindom &punctelev; puyrliche stable were
Al is men þarto he brou&yogh;te &punctelev; so wijsliche he gan heom lere
To þe princes he sende of scothlond &punctelev; and bad þat huy him sende
Ane wise clerk, is men to wissi &punctelev; heore lijf forto amende
huy senden him ane holie man &punctelev; þat icleoped was aydan
Þat wende and prechede al is lond &punctelev; and tornede mani a man
Cristindom into al þat lond &punctelev; stable was inou&yogh;
Seint Oswold maude þesne holie man &punctelev; Bischop in is londe
And made him al is conseiler &punctelev; and herede godes sonde
he ne dude noþing withouten him &punctelev; ake with him he heold him faste
And togadere al heore lijf huy weren &punctelev; and in heouene atþe laste
¶ A day ase he sat and eat is mete &punctelev; seint oswold þe holie man
And þis holie man bi him &punctelev; þe Bischop guode aydan
Þat o seriaunt[MS. seriannt] seide þat þare withoute &punctelev; manie pouere men were
And beden sum guod for godes loue &punctelev; and guod was þat men him[r. hem] bere
Þe king nam inov&yogh; of is mete &punctelev; þat bifore him stod
And sende þarof wel largeliche &punctelev; heom þat beden him guod
Ane Dischs of seluer he nam also &punctelev; þat bifore him was ido
And tobrak it al to smale peces &punctelev; and sende heom also
Þe Bischop sat and biheold &punctelev; ase þei he were in þou&yogh;te
Bi þe hond þe king he nam &punctelev; and a swete word out brou&yogh;te
"Ne forrotie neuere þis hond &punctelev; ake iblessed be heo," he sede
"And euere hol and sound bileue &punctelev; þat dude so guod a dede!"
¶ His bone was fole wel iheord. &punctelev; for it bifeol atþe laste
Þat heþene men come into is lond &punctelev; and weorreden on him wel faste
he stod a&yogh;ein with al is mi&yogh;hte. &punctelev; so bifeol þat huy come
And imetten heom with heore host &punctelev; and þe batayle nome
At þe tounne of Maserfeld &punctelev; huy smiten togadere faste
And seint Oswold þe holie Man &punctelev; aslawe was atþe laste
¶ And Imartred of þis luþere men &punctelev; for ore louerdes loue
Al huy toheowen is bodi &punctelev; þo huy weren aboue
Ake huy ne mi&yogh;hten for no þing &punctelev; makie none wonde
In noþer of is holie hond &punctelev; ake smiten as of hole and sounde
And so huy beoth &yogh;eot, of ase fair heu&yogh; &punctelev; ase huy euerer were
And iholde for fair relike &punctelev; ase men mowe iseo þere
¶ He was of ei&yogh;te and þritti &yogh;er &punctelev; þo he imartred was,[a. 642]
And Nye &yogh;er he hadde king ibeo— &punctelev; bote luytel &yogh;wile it nas
Nov seint Oswold þe swete Martyr &punctelev; ore erinde to gode beode
Þat he us for&yogh;iue ore sunnes &punctelev; and us helpe at alle ore neode
And ore soule for is swete loue &punctelev; into blisse lede
SEint Edward þe &yogh;ungue &punctelev; was kyng of Enguelonde
Wel &yogh;oung he imartred was &punctelev; þoru&yogh; tricherie and onde
Þo is Moder þe guode Quene &punctelev; ase god wolde, was ded
his fader nam an oþur wijf &punctelev; þat luþur was and qued
Þat sent Edward louede luyte &punctelev; and euere radde luþur red
Bi hure he hadde ane oþur sone &punctelev; þat ihote was Atheldred
Ake seint Edward heo louede luyte— &punctelev; for stepmoder is selde guod
heo wilnede more þane aniþing &punctelev; þat seint Edward ded were
Þat hire owene sone aftur þe king &punctelev; þe heritage bere
Þo þe king wende out of þis world &punctelev; seint Edward, and[r. as?] is sone
Aftur him was king jmad &punctelev; ase lawe was and wone
¶ Þe guodnesse of þis &yogh;oungue king &punctelev; ne may no man telle
he was meoke and milde inou&yogh; &punctelev; and fair of flechs and felle
Debonere forto speke with &punctelev; ant with pouere men mest
Chaste, and wis of conseil &punctelev; and pruyte he louede lest
Wylde Men ne louede he nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat rechelese weren of þou&yogh;te
And wise Men to him he drou&yogh; &punctelev; and aftur heom he wrou&yogh;te
Aftur þe Erchebischope of Caunterburij &punctelev; seint Dunston þat was þo
Ech dede þat he wolde do &punctelev; þe meste del scholde go
Glad was þe holie man of him &punctelev; and al þat lond also
Of swuch a king þat heore louerd was &punctelev; þat alle þing wolde wel do
Guod pais þare was in Enguelonde &punctelev; and loue and muruþe inov&yogh;
Richesse and al oþur guod &punctelev; elles it were &yogh;wov&yogh;
For &yogh;wanne þat heued hathþ godes grace &punctelev; and loueth alle guode
Wonder it were bote alle his &punctelev; þe betere heom onderstode
¶ To þe guodnesse of þis holie Man &punctelev; þe deuel hadde envie
And is stepmoder þe luþere Quene &punctelev; þat ful was of tricherie
For heo þou&yogh;te Ni&yogh;ht and day &punctelev; &yogh;if heo mi&yogh;hte in ani manere
Þat seint Edward were aslawe &punctelev; and hire sone kyng were
For he was eldest aftur him &punctelev; and þe kingues sone also
Þis luþere wumman narewe hire biþou&yogh;te &punctelev; hou þis mi&yogh;hte beo do
To some þat weren hire conseilers &punctelev; hire luþere þou&yogh;t he[= heo] seide
þat huy holpen with some Gyle &punctelev; to don þat luþere dede
Þis luþere[MS. þuþere] Men also forthþ with hire &punctelev; weren in grete þou&yogh;te
With &yogh;wuche gyle huy mi&yogh;hten do &punctelev; þat huy to ende [it] brou&yogh;te
¶ So þat heo hadde to hire conseil &punctelev; Inowe atþenende
For fellere þing nis non ase wumman &punctelev; &yogh;ware heo wole to vuele wende
Nadde þis &yogh;ungue king ibeo &punctelev; in is kynedom vnneþe
Bote þreo &yogh;er and Ey&yogh;hte dawes &punctelev; þat he nas ibrou&yogh;t to deþe
For a day he wente on hontethþ &punctelev; with is kni&yogh;htes bi cas
In a fayr wode in deorsete &punctelev; þat biside waraygne was
Fair wode þare was þulke tyme &punctelev; ake nouþe heo is al adoune
Bote þornes and þunne boskes &punctelev; þat stondeth bisides þe toune
¶ Ase þis &yogh;oungue king wende on hontethþ &punctelev; a gret wille him cam to
Forte seo is &yogh;oungue[MS. &yogh;onngue] broþur &punctelev; and in eche manere he wolde it do
For he was þere a luyte biside &punctelev; ase is stepmoder was
In a toun þat men clepeden Corf &punctelev; þat bote þreo Mile þanne it nas
A strong castel þare is nouþe &punctelev; ake þe &yogh;uyt nas non þere
Þis holie man þou&yogh;te longue &punctelev; are he at is broþur were
Ane fewe men with him he nam &punctelev; and þuderward he gan ride
his Men pleiden and Arnden bi þe weie &punctelev; and spradden aboute ful wide
So þat with heom[r. him] ne bilefde non &punctelev; al one he was sone
Ake naþeles forth he wende is wei &punctelev; ase he þou&yogh;te to done
Þe court he biheold afer &punctelev; þare ase is broþer was
Þudere he wende wel mildeliche &punctelev; ake no man with him nas
he ne þou&yogh;te to no man bote guod &punctelev; ne no man he nadde misdo
Towar[d] is deþe forthþ he wende &punctelev; and mildeliche also
Þo is stepmoder þe luþere Quiene &punctelev; al one isei&yogh; him come
heo þou&yogh;te to don hire wille of him &punctelev; ase heo hadde hire red inome
Þe luþere Men heo cleopede sone &punctelev; þat weren at hire rede
And bispeken bi &yogh;wuche feolonie &punctelev; to don þis luþere dede
¶ þo þis holie Man was nei&yogh; icome &punctelev; þe Quiene a&yogh;ein him eode
With fair Meyne and gret honour &punctelev; and gret loue gan him beode
þe feste þat heo with him made &punctelev; no tongue telle ne may
And swor þat he scholde ali&yogh;te &punctelev; and with hire bileue alday
"Nai certes, dame," seide þis king &punctelev; "so ne may it nou&yogh;t beo
Ake lat me speke with mi broþur &punctelev; for me longueth him to seo
For er þane ich him habbe isei&yogh;e &punctelev; Ine worþe nou&yogh;t bliþe, iwis
Min heorte is so muche opon him &punctelev; and no wonder it nis."
¶ "A, sire," quath þe luþere Quiene &punctelev; "&yogh;wane it ne mot oþur beo
Furst ichulle to þe drinke &punctelev; and þu schalt him sethþe iseo."
Iredi was þe Botiler &punctelev; and brou&yogh;te him drinke anon
Among þe oþere þat þare weren &punctelev; o schrewe þare cam gon
And welcomede him with fair semblaunt &punctelev; and made him Ioye inov&yogh;
And custe him Iudases cos &punctelev; and sone him þere aslov&yogh;
For ase he stoupede and custe him &punctelev; redi he was inov&yogh;
Þoru&yogh; is wombe he smot a knijf &punctelev; and is gottes altodrov&yogh;
Þis holie Man sat upri&yogh;ht &punctelev; and biheold is deþes wounde
he ne rod bote wel luyte wei &punctelev; are he feol to grounde
And liet þere is swete lijf— &punctelev; is soule to heouene wende
Alas, luytel vuel þou&yogh;te he &punctelev; þo þe schrewe is wombe rende
Ake he was luþur ase Iudas &punctelev; þat so feolliche him custe
And with tricherie is wombe rende &punctelev; are he it euere wuste
Þo þis holie Man imartred was &punctelev; huy þat him brou&yogh;ten þerto
Biþou&yogh;ten hou huy mi&yogh;hten best &punctelev; with þis holie bodie do
Into a dierne stude huy wenden &punctelev; and þarinne is bodi huy caste
Wel filliche and stilleliche &punctelev; and bureden it þare wel faste
¶ þo þis holie Man imartred was &punctelev; þe Quiene hadde hire wille
For li&yogh;htliche Men holdeth euere with þe quike &punctelev; and þe dede is sone stille
Men nomen þo þat child Aþeldred &punctelev; þat was þe Quiene sone
And aftur is broþur mauden him king &punctelev; as ri&yogh;ht was and wone
¶ Þe hei&yogh;e men alle of þe lond &punctelev; with him heolden echon
Ase with heore prince and heore louerd &punctelev; and þene dede for&yogh;ete anon
Ake among lowe Men and simple &punctelev; deol þere was inou&yogh;
huy corseden alle withoute god &punctelev; þat heore louerd aslou&yogh;
"Alas," huy seiden, "&yogh;wat schulle we nouþe? &punctelev; ho schal for us beo
ho schal us nouþe fram weorre wite[MS. us wite]? &punctelev; &yogh;wodere schulle we nouþe fleo
ho schal nou pais in londe holde? &punctelev; ore ioye is al ido
Of weorre and wo we mouwen beo sikere &punctelev; al wrechhede comethþ us to."
¶ Grete wille hadden þe guode Men &punctelev; of þe contreie biside
In sum fair place þat bodi legge &punctelev; and sou&yogh;ten it wel wide
huy ortreuweden wel þat it were &punctelev; in sum foul stude ido
huy sou&yogh;ten it ofte wide aboute &punctelev; and ne couþen nou&yogh;t come þerto
On a time ase þis guode men &punctelev; of wareygne þare biside
In þe contreye wenden and sou&yogh;ten &punctelev; þis holie bodi ful wide
huy stoden and biheolden[MS. biheoldem] heom biside &punctelev; þo isei&yogh;en huy gret li&yogh;ht
And cler withalle aboute one place &punctelev; ase apiler stonde upri&yogh;ht
¶ Huy þou&yogh;ten þat þere was godes grace. &punctelev; þudere huy wenden and sou&yogh;te
And founden þere þis holie bodi &punctelev; and up of þe eorþe it brou&yogh;ten
Þare was wop and sor inov &punctelev; þo huy sei&yogh;en is grisli wounde
Ake &yogh;eot was heore heorte glad &punctelev; and Ioyful, þo huy him founde
With wel fair procession &punctelev; þis bodi forth huy bere
Into þe toun of warayne &punctelev; and faire it bureden þere
In a churche&yogh;erd of ore leuedi &punctelev; bi este þe churche a luyte
Þare huy bureden þat swete bodi &punctelev; with gret honur and pruyte
A chapele þare is arerd &punctelev; ase þat holie bodi lai
In þe toun of warygne &punctelev; þat stant &yogh;eot to þis dai
Þe put þare he was feorst ifounde &punctelev; a welle þare gan springue
Fair and cler, þat &yogh;eot ilast &punctelev; and is ofte gret botningue
Þat Men cleopieth &yogh;eot to þis day &punctelev; "seint Edwardes welle;"
þare Mani Miracle hath ibeo &punctelev; ase þe contreie dethþ telle
¶ Þat holie bodi lay guode &yogh;wyle &punctelev; þare it was ido
In þe toune of waraygne &punctelev; and Mani man cam þarto
Þe tiþingue hov he imartred was &punctelev; sone sprong wel wide
And þe Miracles þat for him comen &punctelev; aboute in eche side
An hei&yogh; Eorl þare was alonde þo &punctelev; þat ihoten was Alfez
Þat seint Edward louede muche &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle he liuede her
Þo he heorde of þe Miracles telle &punctelev; þat ore louerd for him wrou&yogh;te
Glad and bliþe he was inou&yogh; &punctelev; ase ech Man wel ou&yogh;te
him þou&yogh;te it was wel vuele ido &punctelev; þat he lai so lowe þere
Þat he nere ibured in herre stude &punctelev; ase he wel wuyrþe were
Gret deol he hadde in is herte &punctelev; þat he was amorþred so
And swuch a creature ase he was &punctelev; in so lowe stude ido
In deorsete he wende wide aboute &punctelev; to þe hei&yogh;e men alle þere
To Bischopes and to Abbodes also &punctelev; þat in Enguelonde were
And bad heom of þulke holie bodi &punctelev; þat huy it þannes bere
To herre stude ase it was wuyrþe &punctelev; and þat huy þarea&yogh;ein nere
his Messagers he sende aboute &punctelev; for þis þing wel wide
And to þe Abbesse of wiltone &punctelev; þat ihote was wilfride
And to Eadithþe þe holie wumman &punctelev; þat Nonne also was þar,[orig. þer]
Þat was seint Edwardes suster &punctelev; and þe kingus dou&yogh;ter Edgar
So þat Bischopus and Abbodes &punctelev; and hei&yogh;e Men mani on
Togadere comen in a time &punctelev; ase huy bispeken echon
¶ To þis holi bodi huy wenden. &punctelev; and þo huy þerto come
hol and sound huy founden it ligge &punctelev; þo huy þat bodi up nome
Also hol it was withoute weomme &punctelev; ase it euer er aliue was
Þare nas nou&yogh;t on þat it isei&yogh; &punctelev; þat glad and Ioyful þerefore nas
Ake Eadithþe, is holie suster &punctelev; to þat bodi orn anon
And biclupte þat bodi and custe it faste &punctelev; bifore heom euerechon
For gladnesse heo lov&yogh; and weop &punctelev; teres wel mani on
Þo heo sai&yogh; hire broþur so aslawe &punctelev; and so sovnd of flechs and bon
hoso nadde neuere deol isei&yogh;e &punctelev; of hire he mi&yogh;hte þere
Þis hei&yogh;e men with gret honur &punctelev; þat holie bodi forth bere
With gret song and procession. &punctelev; muche folk þuderward drov&yogh;
Ore louerd dude þare for is loue &punctelev; fair Miracle inov&yogh;
¶ For tweie crupeles þat in heore limes &punctelev; al furcrokede were
Mid gret hope leien in þe wey &punctelev; and abiden þe bere
hore limes bigunne to rechchen ari&yogh;ht &punctelev; and hole bicomen anon
Þare was Ioye and blisse inou&yogh; &punctelev; among þis men echon
¶ His stepmoder, þat him þareto brou&yogh;te &punctelev; herof herde telle
hire ofþou&yogh;te, þo he swuch man was &punctelev; þat he[= heo] him let so quelle
Ope hire palefrey heo werth a day &punctelev; aftur þat bodi to wiende
To bidde for&yogh;iuenesse of hire misdede &punctelev; &yogh;if god hire wolde siende
¶ Ase heo wolde þuderward wiende &punctelev; and with hire mani on
huy ne mi&yogh;hten make hire palefrey &punctelev; þat it ane fote wolde gon
huy schouen it faste forthþeward and drowen &punctelev; and neuere þe betere it nas
Þe Quiene þou&yogh;te on hire misdede &punctelev; þat al þarefore it was
heo ali&yogh;hte of hire palefrey &punctelev; and wolde afote gon
Toward þat holie cors. &punctelev; ake heo nadde power non
A&yogh;einward heo mi&yogh;hte wel gon &punctelev; ake forthþeward for noþing
Heo bilefte, þo it was non oþur &punctelev; in gret deol and mournyng
Of hire misdedes heo repentede hire sore &punctelev; ase manie Men habbeth ised
And cam to guod mendement &punctelev; are þat heo were ded
¶ Þis Men ladden þis holie bodi &punctelev; with gret honur and pruyte
To þe Abbeye of Schaftesburi &punctelev; þare ase he lijth &yogh;uyte
Among blake Nonnene þat þare beoth &punctelev; and also þare weren þo
Þat fram þe toun of waraygne &punctelev; is twenti Mile and mo
In þe northha[l]f of þe hei&yogh;e Autere &punctelev; in þe walle biside
huy leiden þis holie bodi &punctelev; þat manie men sechez wide
Into þulke Abbeie of Schafteburij &punctelev; seint Edward huy ladde
For þe kyng Alfred, is grauntsire &punctelev; þat hous arerd hadde
And made þarinne is dou&yogh;ter Nonne &punctelev; þat was ihote al&yogh;yue
For hire loue he hadde þat hous arerd &punctelev; and muche guod þudere in i&yogh;iue
An hondret hidenene[r. hidene] of guod lond &punctelev; with hire he &yogh;af þer
Þat hous, also freo in eche point &punctelev; ase he himsulf it heold er
In þis Abbeie seint edward &punctelev; lai on and twenti &yogh;er
So þat huy iseien tokningue ofte &punctelev; þat he nolde nonmore beo þer
For &yogh;wane men comen ofte to is toumbe &punctelev; ase li&yogh;thliche up huy as bere
And heuen as up and doun ase huy wolden &punctelev; ase þei it li&yogh;ht treov were
¶ Seint Edward cam also ani&yogh;ht &punctelev; ase in a visioun
To an holi man þat þere was nei&yogh; &punctelev; in an oþur religion
"Go," he seide, "to Schafteburi &punctelev; to þe Abbesse of þe house
Dame Aldred þat clene Maide &punctelev; þat is godes spouse
And seie hire þat inelle nonmore &punctelev; ligge þare ich nou do
Þat ich beo ibrou&yogh;t in an oþur stude &punctelev; and þat heo segge mi broþer so."
¶ Þis guode Man amorewe aros &punctelev; and ne fur&yogh;at nou&yogh;t þis cas
To þe Abbesse he wende of Schafteburi &punctelev; and tolde al hou it was
Þis guode womman was glad inou&yogh;! &punctelev; to þe kyngue heo wende sone
And of is broþur tolde him al &punctelev; and &yogh;wat þerof were to done
Welle, þe kyng was one glad &punctelev; þo he iheorde telle
So swete tiþingue of is broþur &punctelev; þei is moder him liete aquelle
¶ He wolde habbe iwent to schafteburi &punctelev; In shrine him to bringue
Ac he was so biset mid weorre &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;hte for no þingue
For is fon ornen so faste him upon &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;hte þannes wiende
To heie Men aboute in þe londe &punctelev; wel sone he gan siende
And to wilfin þe guode bischop &punctelev; þat was bischop þo
Þat huy scholden with gret honour &punctelev; to schafteburie go
And his broþur in schrine bringue &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;th was forto done
¶ Þe Bischop with þis oþur Men &punctelev; to schafteburi comen sone
With swiþe fair procession &punctelev; to is toumbe huy wende
A swiþe fair Miracle among heom alle &punctelev; ore louerd for him þere sende
For anon so huy openeden þat lid &punctelev; of is swete toumbe þere
Þare cam adoun þoru&yogh; al þe churche &punctelev; ase þei it a mist were
Among al þe prece þat þere was &punctelev; þat huy iseien alle with ei&yogh;e
Fleu&yogh;[al. flen] amon[g] heom also a myst— &punctelev; so swote þing neuere huy er ne sei&yogh;e
¶ So swote was þe smul and guod &punctelev; þat alle þat þere were
For muruþe þou&yogh;ten þat huy stoden &punctelev; in parays and nou&yogh;t þere
Þis holi bodi up huy nomen &punctelev; with gret honour and pruyte
And leiden it in a wel fair schrine &punctelev; þare ase it lijth &yogh;uyte
In þis manere he was ischrined &punctelev; in þe on an twentiþe &yogh;ere
Þat þe hei&yogh;e men him brou&yogh;ten fro waram &punctelev; and bureden him furst þere
A þousend &yogh;er it was and on &punctelev; after þulke stounde
Þat ore louerd was on eorþe ibore &punctelev; and ali&yogh;hte for us to grounde
¶ His broþur, þe king Aþeldred &punctelev; guod man was inou&yogh;
Edward was is sone ihote &punctelev; þat to alle guodnesse drou&yogh;
Þat king was sethþe aftur him &punctelev; and hei&yogh; halewe in heouene is
Icleoped seint Edward aftur is vncle &punctelev; at WestMunstre he lijth, iwis
¶ Opon Mi&yogh;helmasse fourteneny&yogh;ht &punctelev; his day fallez in þe &yogh;ere
And amidde þe Monþe of luyde[18 March] &punctelev; seint Edwardes dai þere.[= þe ere]
Nov god for þe loue of heom boþe &punctelev; þet swete kingues were
To þe Ioye of heouene þat huy beoth inne &punctelev; with heom us bringue þere

div1.head: 18 Franceys.[This life is based on the Vita s. Fr. by S. Bonaventura, in Act. SS. Boll. Oct. 4, p. 742 ff.]

lg.l: SEint Fraunceys, þe frere Menour &punctelev; þat guod man was inov&yogh;
his Marchaundise he maude a[al. al] day &punctelev; in þe cite of Asise
And in almesdede he spendede an[om. an] on pouere Men &punctelev; muchedel is Marchaundise
For no loue of catel &punctelev; he it nolde bileue
&YOGH;wane ani pouere man him bede &punctelev; bote he him som&yogh;wat &yogh;eue
¶ Ase he cam a day bi þe wei &punctelev; he gan mieten bi cas
Ane kni&yogh;t þat hadde Riche ibeo &punctelev; and[MS. and and] swiþe apouered was
vuele he was icloþed also &punctelev; and bad him sum guod
Seint Fraunceys hadde reuþe of him &punctelev; and one &yogh;wyle he withstod
¶ he strepte of is cloþes of is rug &punctelev; and &yogh;af þis pouere kny&yogh;t
And þeraftur ase he lay aslepe &punctelev; in is bedde any&yogh;t
A swiþe noble paleys &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te þat he isei&yogh;
he Axede was þat paleys were &punctelev; þat so riche was and hei&yogh;
Men seiden him þat it was his &punctelev; and is kni&yogh;tes also
Þo þis holie Man awok &punctelev; sum&yogh;wat he þou&yogh;te do
In þat paleys him þou&yogh;te he sai&yogh; also &punctelev; kny&yogh;htes Armes þere
And with afair creoiz þoru&yogh;out &punctelev; Imarkede alle huy were
¶ Þou&yogh;te he, "ore louerd it wole &punctelev; þat ich miseolf kny&yogh;t beo
And swyþe feble ich am þareto &punctelev; bote ich me bet biseo."
he þou&yogh;te kny&yogh;t beo imaud of him &punctelev; þuderward he gan wende
Ase he wende towar[d] þis Eorl &punctelev; forto beo imaud kni&yogh;t
Ore swete louerd in Auision &punctelev; to him cam a ni&yogh;th
"Sei&yogh;e me," he seide, "of þe louerd &punctelev; and of þe hyne also
And of þe riche man and of þe pouere &punctelev; &yogh;wuch may þe mest guod do?"
"Bote þe louerd," quath þis oþur &punctelev; "and he þat is riche."
"Þou haddest almest ichose," ore louerd seide &punctelev; "þat ful oniliche
For truste of þe hyne &punctelev; þene louerd þou forsoke
Þov nome vuele þin Avision &punctelev; þou most þe bet biloke
¶ Þe Armure and þe paleis &punctelev; þat þou so noble isei&yogh;e
Elles&yogh;ware þov schalt finde &punctelev; Ake þou ne comest nou&yogh;t &yogh;uit so hei&yogh;e
Kny&yogh;tes þov schalt habbe onder þe &punctelev; þulke Armes forto lede
Þarefore wend þe hom a&yogh;ein &punctelev; and biþench bet þi dede!"
¶ Þis holi man, þo he awok &punctelev; a&yogh;ein wende to Asise
And þou&yogh;te al on Ihesu crist &punctelev; and bilefde is Marchaundise
And bad ore louerd ny&yogh;ht and dai &punctelev; þat he scholde him rede
And some tokningue senden him &punctelev; hov he scholde is lijf lede
¶ A day, ase þis holie man &punctelev; withoute Asise him drou&yogh;
he mette a lodlich Mesel &punctelev; þat revlich was inou&yogh;
And bad him sum guod for godes loue. &punctelev; seint Fraunceys ali&yogh;hte
And biclupte and custe þane sike man &punctelev; ase faire ase he mi&yogh;hte
And of is seluer him tok &punctelev; and bad him habbe guod day
Þo nuste he &yogh;ware he was bicome &punctelev; ne in none stude him ne say
¶ Þo þou&yogh;te wel ho it was &punctelev; and aftur þulke dede
he wep and cride on ihesu crist &punctelev; þat he scholde him sum&yogh;wat rede
And ofte he wolde bi costome &punctelev; to Meseles fare
And sechen heom at heore owene hous &punctelev; bote he founde hem elles|&yogh;ware
And cusse heore hondene and heore fet &punctelev; and heore Mouth als[o]
And &yogh;yue heom guod wel largeliche— &punctelev; bi costome he wolde it do.[a later hand adds als]
¶ Bi a churche of seint Damian &punctelev; a day he cam gon
Þat ope þe poynte was to falle adoun. &punctelev; In he wende anon
And kneolede adoun bifore þe croiz &punctelev; ase he dude wel ofte
Þo spac a voiz þareinne &punctelev; wel Mildeliche and softe
Þat, þou sixt, fallez to grounde &punctelev; and al destruyd is nei&yogh;."
¶ Seint Fraunceys, for þe churche was &punctelev; adoneward al ibrou&yogh;t
Wende þat ore louer[d] þarebi seide— &punctelev; ake þarof nas it nou&yogh;t
he wende and solde is cloþes anon &punctelev; and muche of is oþur þingue
And þe panes þat he nam þarewith &punctelev; to þis church gan bringue
Þe pr[e]ost of þe churche he fond þere &punctelev; þe panes he wolde him take
To arere up þe pouere churche. &punctelev; and he heom gan forsake
he ne dorste nou&yogh;t for is fader &punctelev; ne for is oþur freond, he seide
So muche tresor nime of him &punctelev; bote it were bi heore rede
¶ Seint Fraunceys nam þat tresor &punctelev; þo þe oþur it forsok
And in a fenestre leide it þere &punctelev; and in ore louerdes warde it tok
Þo þe tyþingue cam to is fader &punctelev; þat he hadde isold is guod
Toward him he wende anon &punctelev; and for wrath was nei&yogh; wod
Seint Frau[n]ceys was iwar of him &punctelev; and ne bilefte nou&yogh;t bihinde
he wende and hudde him in a Dich &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;hte him nou&yogh;t finde
In þis Diche wel longue he lay &punctelev; in hunguer and wrechhede
And euere cride on Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat he scholde him betere rede
Atþe laste in meseise inov&yogh; &punctelev; he wende to Asise
Þat folk, þo huy seien him com[e] &punctelev; heom gan ful sore agrise
And seiden "here cometh a wod Man" &punctelev; huy harleden him wel faste
And smiten and pulten here and þere &punctelev; and dunge on him caste
Seint Fraunceis wende euere forth &punctelev; ase þei him noþing nere
¶ his fader cam also bi cas &punctelev; and imette him þere
he ladde him hom to is hous &punctelev; and beot him sore inov&yogh;
Þo he ne mi&yogh;hte habbe non oþur word &punctelev; he bond him swiþe strongue
So þat þis guode man &punctelev; in prisone lay ful longue
Atþe laste, þe &yogh;wyle is fader &punctelev; out of toune gan iwende
his Moder hadde reovþe of him &punctelev; and brou&yogh;te him out of bende
Þo he was out of bendes ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; he ne bilefte no leng þer
he wende to þe Dich a&yogh;ein &punctelev; fro &yogh;wannes he cam er
¶ Þo þis housebonde cam hom &punctelev; and ne founde him nou&yogh;t þere
Swiþe sore he beot is wijf &punctelev; and axede &yogh;ware he were
To þe churche of seint Damian &punctelev; þe housebonde wende þo
And fond þat tresor alhol þere &punctelev; ase he it hadde ido
And sethþe he wende to þe Dich &punctelev; and founde is sone þere
he axede at him for &yogh;wat þingue &punctelev; þat tresor awei he bere
he ladde Fraunceys forth with him &punctelev; ant bifore þe Bischop him brou&yogh;te
And bad, &yogh;if he alles wolde &punctelev; þe worldes guod bileue
Þat he bifore þe Bischope þer &punctelev; þat tresor up &yogh;eue
¶ Seint Fraunceis with þulke worde &punctelev; glad and Ioyful stod
Þare and bifore god he &yogh;af up &punctelev; al his eorþelich guod
And streopte of is cloþes &punctelev; anon to is bare liche
And bifore þe Bischope tok is fader &punctelev; and bad him beo guod and riche
he seide, "ich þe habbe fader icleoped &punctelev; euere to þis day
And nouþe it is so feor icome &punctelev; þat non more ine may
Segge ich mot mi .paternoster &punctelev; heonneforthþeward iwis
And to mi fader holde me &punctelev; þat in heuene is."
Nakede he wende fram is fader &punctelev; bifore heom þare echon
Worldes guod aftur þulke tyme &punctelev; ne bod he neuereft non
¶ A seli vplondischse Man &punctelev; þat nakede sai&yogh; him go
Gret deol in is heorte hadde &punctelev; for is chele and for is wo
he &yogh;af him ane olde Mantel &punctelev; his bones þarewith to hele
Seint Fraunceis it vnderfeng &punctelev; to witien him fram chele
A&yogh;en þare he was ibore &punctelev; to Asise he him drov&yogh;
¶ Ase he hadde er ibeo so riche &punctelev; and so wel was iknowe
A beggare he cam a[n]d bad is mete &punctelev; þereaftur in a þrowe
Fram dore to dore he bad is mete &punctelev; and wonede him þarto
Some weren wroþe for is dedes &punctelev; and no guod nolden him do
Of þe ordre of frere Menours &punctelev; he ne made noþing &yogh;uyte
he bigan in pouerte inov&yogh; &punctelev; and with luyte pruyte
¶ Men of þe contreie weren &punctelev; aboute forto amende
Seint Damianes churche &punctelev; þat al adoneward wende
Þare ase seint Fraunceys hadde ibeo &punctelev; and tresor bileft þere
Þo he ne mi&yogh;hte non oþur do &punctelev; þe churche forto arere
he wende þudere and sore swonk &punctelev; and bar morter þarto
And sethþe he eode and bad is mete &punctelev; &yogh;wane he hadde al ido
¶ Ane churche sethþe of seint peter &punctelev; men arerden elles&yogh;[w]are
Þis holie man in is miseise &punctelev; wel sone he was þare
And Morter and ston drou&yogh; þerto &punctelev; and sore swonk also
And sethþe eode and bad is mete &punctelev; þo he hadde al ido
&YOGH;wane he heorde of ani churche &punctelev; þat ou&yogh;wer was fortarere
he wende þudere, and longue him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; are he were þere
¶ To seinte Marie in desert &punctelev; ate laste he wende wel stille
And criede on ore louerd ni&yogh;ht and day &punctelev; þat he dude bi him is wille
And þat he &yogh;eue him is grace þere &punctelev; in &yogh;wat manere he best mi&yogh;hte
his churche þat adoneward was &punctelev; best arere up and di&yogh;hte
So þat god him &yogh;af þe grace &punctelev; þat he þare bigan
Þe ordre of frere Menours &punctelev; to saui mani a man
¶ In þe biguynningue of þis ordre &punctelev; ase ore louerd &yogh;ef þat cas
Ane masse he iheorde a day &punctelev; þat of þe Apostles was
As man rat &yogh;uyt among us &punctelev; in þe godspelle it seide þo
Þat ore louerd hiet is desciples &punctelev; þo huy scholden aboute go
Þat huy ne beren with heom gol[d] ne seluer &punctelev; &yogh;wane huy wenden ouer lond
Ne baggue, ne tweie curtles noþur &punctelev; ne schon, goinde with ouer lond[Ashm. ne staf in hor hond]
¶ In þis manere ore louerd hiet &punctelev; his Apostles gon
Þo seint Fraunceis iheorde þis &punctelev; he dude of is schon
And poruei&yogh;ede þat frere Menours &punctelev; barefot scholden gon
Withoute bagge, withoute staf &punctelev; withoute ani þing to spene
Bote ech frere Menour do also &punctelev; he ne halt nou&yogh;t is ordre, ich wene
In stude of is gurdel also &punctelev; with rope he him bond
In þis manere frere Menours &punctelev; scholden go ouer lond
¶ Seint Fraunceis biþou&yogh;te þus &punctelev; to don þis holie dede
And made þe ordre of frere Menours &punctelev; al ase þe godspel sede
¶ Bernard, þat was a guod scholer &punctelev; formest to him cam
And þe ordre of frere menours &punctelev; of him formest he nam
he axede at him hov he scholde best &punctelev; þe world clanliche forsake
To seint Nicholas churche huy wenden &punctelev; ane massebok huy gonne take
Þe bok was iclosed faste to &punctelev; seint Fraunceis hine gan vndo
Al onmundliche he ondude þe bok &punctelev; and þe furste þat he cam to
Þat was a godspel þat seith &punctelev; "&yogh;if þou wolt parfijt beo
Sul al þi guod and &yogh;if pouere men &punctelev; and sethþe siwe me!"
¶ Al vnMundlingue he cam eftsone &punctelev; to a godspel þat seide
Þat man ne scholde seluer ne gold &punctelev; bi þe weie lede
Þe þridde tyme al onMundlingue &punctelev; þe massebok he wende
Þo cam he opon þis godspel &punctelev; ase ore louerd him grace sende
"hoso wole come after me &punctelev; himsulf he schal forsake
And is owene rode bere &punctelev; and þene wei after me so take."
¶ "Þov ifuxt here," quath seint Fraunceis &punctelev; "hou ore louerd in a stounde
Sent us grace ope &yogh;wuche þingue &punctelev; we schullen þis ordre founde
Opon þeos þreo godspelles, þov fuxt &punctelev; þat we habbeth furst ifounde
We schullen foundi al ore ordre &punctelev; and opon þis strongue grounde."
Opon þis[MS. þis þis] þreo godspelles he maude[maudre] is ordre &punctelev; and is riule[Ryvle on the margin.] for|sothþ
And þe frere Menor brekez is ordre &punctelev; þat þarea&yogh;ein ou&yogh;t dothþ
¶ Fre Gyles was þo þe ferste— &punctelev; þat guod scoler hadde ibeo
Þat aftur frere Bernard þe ordre nam &punctelev; and sethþe oþur þreo
So þat vnder heom alle sixe freres &punctelev; togadere weren ibrou&yogh;t
And þei þis ordre were imaud &punctelev; iconfermed nas heo nou&yogh;t
¶ Seint Fraunceys þe holie Man &punctelev; þo god þe tyme sende
To confermi is ordre ari&yogh;ht &punctelev; toward Rome he wende
Ake swiþe sore he was ofdrad &punctelev; laste þe pope were
Contrarious a&yogh;ein is Ordre &punctelev; þat heo iconfermed nere
Ake forth he wende to fondi &punctelev; he nolde nou&yogh;t beo bihynde
And euere he bad Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat he moste som grace finde
¶ Þo þou&yogh;te him in a wision &punctelev; þat [he] isai&yogh; a gret treo
So hei&yogh; þat he was adrad &punctelev; toward þe coppe iseo
And netheles on aunture he him dude &punctelev; and nam þarof a bov&yogh;
Aboue in þe hexte stude &punctelev; and toward him it drov&yogh;
hit bei&yogh; al adoun to him &punctelev; aftur is wille inov&yogh;
For al þat him dradde furst &punctelev; þat it was hei&yogh; and tov&yogh;
¶ Þo þis holie man awok &punctelev; on þis sweuene he þou&yogh;te longue
Also he hopede þene hei&yogh;e pope &punctelev; to is wille bringue inov&yogh;
To þe pope Innocent &punctelev; þo he to Rome cam
he bad graunti is Religion &punctelev; to amendi cristindam
A[n]t þat he scholde is ordre preouen &punctelev; and is Revle also
Þoru&yogh; þe godspel of godes word &punctelev; and þeraftur do
¶ Þo þe pope is Revle isei&yogh; &punctelev; þat heo was clene and guod
And ope þe godspelle ifounded al &punctelev; ase he wel onderstod
In is herte he grauntede it &punctelev; ake nou&yogh;t with is Mouth anon
For he moste is cardinales &punctelev; conseili þareuppe echon
¶ So þat aMong þis Cardinales &punctelev; counseil þere was inome
Some heolden þarea&yogh;ein &punctelev; and also þarewith some
Þo was þer a Cardinal &punctelev; þat Bischop was also
Maister Iohan of seint poul &punctelev; þat faste heold þerto
And seide, "&yogh;if we destourbieth him &punctelev; a&yogh;ein þe godspelle we beothþ
&YOGH;wane he spechut al vpe godes word &punctelev; ase we wel iseothþ."
¶ In Avisioun to þe pope &punctelev; ani&yogh;ht also it cam
Þat he grauntede him is Reule &punctelev; to saui cristindom
So þat þe pope grauntede him &punctelev; al is Reule to do
And confermede þoru&yogh; al þe court &punctelev; and bihiet him more þerto
Þo wende forthþ þis holie Man &punctelev; and is freres withþ him nam
And prechede aboute þe godspelles &punctelev; to amendi cristindom
¶ Þo þe contrei&yogh;e isei&yogh; heom ferst &punctelev; gret speche was þere
