For so doth foles þat wilniez muche &punctelev; of &yogh;elpingue and of sunne
Naþeles ichulle, ake for no pruyte &punctelev; tellen eov of mine kunne
Ich am þe kingus dou&yogh;ter coste &punctelev; þat þou wost &yogh;wuch is
hidere ich cam to speke mid eov &punctelev; of þat &yogh;e bileuez amis
Mid vnri&yogh;te heo beozþ icleped godes &punctelev; þat o fot ne mouwen go[MS. gon]
Ne no man helpe in none neode &punctelev; ne heomsulue noþemo."
¶ "Maide," seide[MS. seide seide] þis Amperur &punctelev; "&yogh;if þat þis sothþ were
Al þis world were fals and guydi &punctelev; &yogh;if þou one heom[MS. heom heom] scholdest [lere]
And we schulle betere ileue alle men &punctelev; and more it wole beo note
Þane ani fol womman ase þou art— &punctelev; for ouwer bolt is sone ischote."
"Sire," seide þis Maide þo &punctelev; "þei þou luyte telle of me
Also guod mai beo mi reson &punctelev; ase þat comez of þe
For, sire Aumperur, þou[MS. ich þou] art &punctelev; ase ech man is also
Þat hote mai and hys men moten &punctelev; nede hys hestes do
Of bodi and of soule þou art ymaud &punctelev; ase þisulf mi&yogh;t iseo
Mid ri&yogh;te þi soule Maister is &punctelev; and þi bodi is hyne schal beo
&YOGH;if þi bodi maister is &punctelev; and þi soule[superscribed later.] is hyne
Þoru&yogh; hire clergie þat holi Maide &punctelev; resones made so quoynte
Þat þe Aumperour ne non of his &punctelev; ne couþe hire ansuerie in none pointe
"Maide," he seide, "þou schalt abide &punctelev; In warde here mid me
And oþere ichulle bi tyme finde &punctelev; þat schullen Answerie þe."
Þis Aumperour sende anon &punctelev; wide aboute is sonde
Þat þe gretteste maistres of clergie &punctelev; to him comen In eche londe
grete Mede of him to habbe &punctelev; to don a luytel Maystrie
And forto susteinen op heore lawe &punctelev; þoru strencþe of clergie
So þat þare comen fifti Maistres &punctelev; þe gretteste þat man fond
Also wide ase men mi&yogh;ten seche &punctelev; ou&yogh;were In ani lond
Þe Aumperour heom seide anon &punctelev; &yogh;warefore he after heom sende
Forto desputi a&yogh;ein a &yogh;ong womman &punctelev; þat al heore lawe schende
"Nou is þis," þat .o. Maister seide &punctelev; "gret schame, ich onderstonde
An Aumperur to sende aboute &punctelev; so wide in eche londe
After þe gretteste Maistres, forto despuyti &punctelev; a&yogh;en a fol wenche
&YOGH;wane on of heore knaue mi&yogh;ten sone &punctelev; hire resones alle aquenche!"
"Nai," seide þis Aumperour &punctelev; "heo is wisore þane &yogh;e wene
&YOGH;if &yogh;e mouwen ou&yogh;t a&yogh;en hire don &punctelev; sone it worth isene
For ich habbe leouere þat &yogh;e hire ouercome &punctelev; with resones In some wise
Þane we with strencþe hire maden &punctelev; to don þe sacrefise."
"Lat bringue hire[superscribed.] forth," seide þat on &punctelev; "and heo schal segge anon
Þat heo ne spac neuere wit wisore men &punctelev; are heo fram us gon."
¶ An Aungel to þis maide cam &punctelev; and bad hire of noþing drede
And seide heo scholde heom alle þoru hire reson &punctelev; to cristinedom lede
And heo alle scholden þoru hire reson &punctelev; afonge martyrdam
Þo þat Maide iherde þis &punctelev; gret Ioie to hire heo nam
baldeliche heo eode forth &punctelev; þo men aftur hire come
"Sire," he[= heo] seide to þe Aumperur &punctelev; "&yogh;ifst þou a wis dom
Þat þus fale maistres of clergie &punctelev; bringest and sest abenche
And meself to desputy a&yogh;eines heom &punctelev; þat nam bote a fol wenche
And &yogh;if þat heo me ouercomez &punctelev; þou bihast heom gret mede
And makest me mid strencþe with heom speke &punctelev; and ne bihast me bote luyte
Þat þinchez me with onri&yogh;te it is &punctelev; &yogh;wane ich am one a&yogh;ein heom alle
¶ Nov ichulle, for god is min help &punctelev; afonge þat me wole falle."
"Seie, dame conIoun, &yogh;wat artþou?" &punctelev; þis o legistre seide
"Þenchestþou speke a&yogh;ein ore clergie? &punctelev; turne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede
Þov seist þat god almi&yogh;ti &punctelev; dethz on eorþe þolede here
Ichulle proui þat he ne mi&yogh;te aliue beo &punctelev; nouþe In none manere
For, hoso deiez, he ne may &punctelev; neuerefft to liue come
&YOGH;wane þe vertue of al is bodi &punctelev; þoru deþe him is binome
And þi god almi&yogh;ti is ded &punctelev; þou ne mi&yogh;t libbe nou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if he þat scholde &yogh;iue þe lijf &punctelev; is to deþe ibrou&yogh;t."
¶ "Nai," seide þis holi mayde &punctelev; "þou faillest of þin art
Anoþur þou most segge, &yogh;if þou þencst &punctelev; of þine maistrie to habbe part
God hadde euere and euere he schal &punctelev; mid him is godhede
And for loue of us In ore flesche &punctelev; he nam him manhede
Of twei þingus he was þo imaked &punctelev; eiþur moste þo is kuynde afonge
For þe kunde of manhede us to bugge &punctelev; he þolede deth wel stronge
Ake forto bileue ded, a&yogh;en kuynde it was &punctelev; ase of is godhede
Þarefore he aros fram deþe to liue &punctelev; þo he hadde idon al is dede
For þe stronge deþe þat þoru&yogh; Adam &punctelev; we weren to ibrou&yogh;t
Þoru&yogh; is godhede, imeynd In ore kuynde &punctelev; nede moste beon ibou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if þou withseist þis reson &punctelev; an oþur ichulle þe make
Þat grete clerkes seiden In heore lawe &punctelev; þat man ne may nou&yogh;t forsake
¶ Platon, þe grete philosophe &punctelev; þat was heþene of ouwer lawe
he seide þat god wolde deie &punctelev; and himselue to liue a&yogh;en drawe
Lokiez In is boke,[omit in is boke] hov it mi&yogh;te beo soth &punctelev; nouþe In ouwere[r. oþer] manere
bote þe muchele god of heuene &punctelev; bicome a luyte Man here
Also Balaam, ouwer prophete &punctelev; þat heþene was also
In is bok he seide—&yogh;e wuten wel &yogh;ware &punctelev; &yogh;if &yogh;e wollez loki þerto
Þat þare scholde of Iacobes kuynde &punctelev; a steorre arise wel bri&yogh;t
Þat scholde kinges and princes &punctelev; al binimen heom heore mi&yogh;t
Þat was þat ore louerd wolde &punctelev; of Iacobes kuynde beon ibore
&[added.] ouercomen alle þat euere weren &punctelev; sethþe oþer bifore
And &yogh;uyt þre kinges of ouwer lawe &punctelev; on þulke steorre þou&yogh;ten
For þe steorre þo god was ibore &punctelev; and þarefore lok him brou&yogh;ten."
Þo þeos Maistres heorden þis mayde speke &punctelev; of so grete clergie
heo ne couþen answerie hire of neuere a word &punctelev; and &yogh;euen hire þe maistrie
¶ Þo seide þe Aumperur In grete wrathþe &punctelev; "nis non of eov þat can
Among so manie grete Maistres— &punctelev; answerie a fol womman?"
"Certes, sire," þis Maistres seiden &punctelev; "so gret clerk nov nis
Þat scholde to hire reson &yogh;iue answere &punctelev; for heo seith so[al. soþ] iwis
We seggeth, þe holie gost is with hire &punctelev; and In hire mouþe
Þat we ne conne hire answerie nou&yogh;t &punctelev; ne we ne dorren þei we couþe
Þarefore, bote we betere of oure lawe &punctelev; þane we &yogh;eot iseon
Alle we seggez with one mouþe &punctelev; cristine we wollez beon."
"Ey, trichours," seide þe Aumperur &punctelev; "is it icome þerto
Certes, &yogh;e schullen euerechone &punctelev; beo to stronge deþe ido."
he het þat Men scholden amidde toun &punctelev; furberne heom echone
And huy afenge þe deth for godes loue &punctelev; withoute anie mone
And muche reuþe heo maden to katerine &punctelev; Ibaptizede þat heo nere
Þat Maide heom confortede wel &punctelev; and cristine lawes gan heom lere
And seide þat heore stronge martyrdom &punctelev; þat heo þoleden þere
In stude of cristinedom scholde beon &punctelev; &yogh;if heo studefaste were
¶ Þis Maistres weren wel glade þo &punctelev; gladliche forth heo eode
And nomen þane deth for godes loue &punctelev; þat men heom wolde beode
Heo maden þe signe of þe croiz &punctelev; þo men in þat fuyre hem caste
And þo heo hadden longe ibarnd &punctelev; and dede weren atþe laste
And þat fuyr was al aqueynt &punctelev; alhole heo leien þere
Þare nas so luyte wem on heom &punctelev; þat þe leste of heore here
Oþur of heore cloþus apeirede weren— &punctelev; heo leien with faire chere
Þis Aumperur let fette anon &punctelev; þat Maide katerine
"haue reuþe of þisulf," he seide &punctelev; "and schild þe fram pine
haue reuþe of þi noble bodi &punctelev; þat is so fair and hende
For þou schalt beon in grete nobleye &punctelev; &yogh;if þou wolt þi þou&yogh;t wende
In mi paleis ich schal þe make &punctelev; hext after þe quene
After þi fourme ichulle þe make &punctelev; An ymage, bri&yogh;t and schene
Ouerguld and quoynte inov &punctelev; and sette as amidde þe cite
Þat ech man hire honouri schal &punctelev; for honour of þe
Ase men schullen to one god do. &punctelev; þou ne schalt mid al þi lore
So muche nobleie biþenche þe &punctelev; þat I nelle don þe more."
¶ "Sire Aumperur," þis Maide seide &punctelev; "let þi fole þou&yogh;t
For þov nast non more &yogh;wile to spille &punctelev; þane speken embe nou&yogh;t
god almi&yogh;ties spouse ich am &punctelev; and al þi blaundisinge
Ne alle þine tormenz ne schullen min heorte &punctelev; enes fram him bringe."
Þe Aumperur hire let strep[e] naked &punctelev; and to a piler faste hire bounden
With stronge schourges men beoten hire sore &punctelev; and maden hire harde wounden
Þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten þarewithal &punctelev; turnen hire þou&yogh;t
In depe prisone and swiþe deorke &punctelev; sone heo was ibrou&yogh;t
Þat no man hire mete ne &yogh;af ne drunch &punctelev; þei heo scholde for hungur deie
For heo scholde to heore lawe hire þou&yogh;[t] tuyrne &punctelev; and beon ibrou&yogh;t out of teie
In þat prison þat Maide lai &punctelev; twelf dawes and twelf ni&yogh;t
Þat heo noþer .et. ne dronk &punctelev; ne isai&yogh; non eorþelich li&yogh;t
A &yogh;wit coluere þare cam fram heuene &punctelev; to hire euerech dai
And brou&yogh;te hire fram heuene mete &punctelev; Into prisone ase heo lai
A day ase þe Aumperur was &punctelev; out of þe toune ifare
Þe Aumperesse þou&yogh;te on katerine &punctelev; and hadde of hire gret care
Of hire bede wel priueliche &punctelev; heo aros at midNi&yogh;t
And nam with hire sire porfirie &punctelev; þat was hire priue kny&yogh;t
Þo heo to þe prisone come &punctelev; heo isei&yogh;en þare gret li&yogh;t
gret wounder heom þou&yogh;te &yogh;warof were &punctelev; þe deorke stude so bri&yogh;t
And an Aungel of heuene with hire stonde &punctelev; and smerede hire wounde
¶ Þe Aumperesse cride anon &punctelev; "Katerine," heo seide, "þin ore
Mine ri&yogh;te bileue þov tech me &punctelev; I nelle beo fol non more."
Þe kni&yogh;t also, sire porfirie &punctelev; loude cride also
Þat muche folk þat þareaboute was &punctelev; sone cam þerto
Sire porfirie ful adoun to hire fet &punctelev; and merci he gan crie
With grete Ioye þis Maide prechede heom &punctelev; of god and seinte marie
So þat Aumperesse and porfirie &punctelev; þoru&yogh; þis Maide þere
And twei hondred of oþur folk &punctelev; Ibaptizede weren
¶ Ore louerd himsulf cam sethþe adoun &punctelev; to seinte katerine
"Lo," he seide, "here ich am &punctelev; for &yogh;wam þou hast þis pine
In þine tormenz beo studefast &punctelev; Ichulle beo mid þe
Þi sege is in heue[ne] imaud &punctelev; þare þov schalt wonien mid me."
An oþur dai þe Aumperour &punctelev; after þis Maide sende
Þat heo were ded, oþur al furfare &punctelev; swiþe wel he wende
Þis Maide was bifore him ybrou&yogh;t &punctelev; swiþe fat and round
"&YOGH;wat," he seide, "hou geth þis? &punctelev; heo is hol and sound
&YOGH;ware beoth þis traitores," he seide &punctelev; "þat hire In prisone wuste
Stilleliche heo hire habbeth ifed &punctelev; þat no man it nuste
bi þe treuþe þat i schal to Mahon &punctelev; heo ne schullen so nonmore!"
he let nime alle þe gayholers &punctelev; and tormenti heom ful sore
¶ "Sire Aumperur," þis Maide seide &punctelev; "is þis a guod Ivggement
gultelese Men for mine gulte &punctelev; to bringe in swuche torment
he þat hath me ifed &punctelev; him ne drat of þe ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t
For an Aungel it was of heuene &punctelev; þat mete me hath ibrou&yogh;t
Do me &yogh;wat torment þat þov wolt &punctelev; and lat heom quite gon
Forsoþe, þat[al. of þat] þou on heom seist &punctelev; gult heo ne habbez non."
"Ey., hendie Maide Katerine" &punctelev; seide þis Aumperour
"Þench opon þi noble stat &punctelev; of alle Maidenes þov art flour
Torne þi þou&yogh;t and þou schalt beon &punctelev; þe Aumperesse per
heo ne schal noþing bifore þe habbe &punctelev; bote þat heo me mot beo ner."
"guode man," seide þis holie mayde &punctelev; "þov spext embe nou&yogh;t
For al þi pouwer þou ne schalt &punctelev; fram ihesu crist wende mi þou&yogh;t
Al þat torment þat þou mi&yogh;t þenche &punctelev; And of alle [day longe,[d. l. wr. by a later hand on an erasure.]
Þov mi&yogh;t don me &yogh;if þou wolt &punctelev; redi ich am to fonge
For ich ne wilni noþing so muche &punctelev; ase mi flechs and mi blod, iwis
to &yogh;iue for mi louerdes loue &punctelev; þat for me he &yogh;af his."
Þo was þe Aumperur so wroth &punctelev; þat he was nei&yogh; iswowe
Four &yogh;weles of Iren he let fullen &punctelev; with rasores, kene Inowe
And with ginne heom makede tuyrne aboute &punctelev; þe tweien on þat on half opward
Þe oþur tweine euene heom a&yogh;ein &punctelev; In þat oþur half adoneward
Þat, hoso bitwene were &punctelev; In none half ne mi&yogh;te him wende
Þat þe rasores nolden al is flechs &punctelev; todrawen and torende
Sone so þis Maide was idon þaron &punctelev; hire bodi forto schende
Ore swete louerd fram heuene &punctelev; an Aungel to hire gan sende
Þis Aungel with a drawe swerd &punctelev; þe &yogh;weoles altohev
Þat þe peces aboute flowen &punctelev; ase corn &yogh;wane man it sev
And smot[al. smite] of þis luþere men &punctelev; wel harde to þe grounde
Four þousend þ[er]e weren aslawe &punctelev; In a lutel stounde
Þo nuste þe Aumperur &yogh;wat he mi&yogh;te don &punctelev; for deol ne for sore
Þe Aumperesse nolde hele hire stat &punctelev; lengore þo nammore
¶ "Sire," heo seide, "hou gez þis? &punctelev; for godes loue, þin ore
Ich iseo þat þis mayde is guod &punctelev; and of holi lore
Ower Maumates ichulle forsake &punctelev; Inelle on hem bileue more."
Þo gan þe Aumperur for wrathþe &punctelev; loude &yogh;eolle and rore
he ne mi&yogh;te fram Ihesu crist &punctelev; hire þou&yogh;t noþing wende
he het men þat[r. þat men] scholden hire lede &punctelev; to þe tounes ende
And hire bresten fram hire bodi &punctelev; with Irene crokes rende
And þareafter smiten of hire heued &punctelev; þe more forto[r. hire to] schende
Wit guode heorte þe Aumperesse &punctelev; þane deth gan afonge
Þe quellares heo bad hi&yogh;en faste &punctelev; and ne abiden nou&yogh;t to longe
Heo nomen þe kene crokes of Ire &punctelev; þat hire flechs depe gnowe
And, also man draweth with combes wolle &punctelev; hire tetes heo todrowe
Fram hire bodi mossel mele &punctelev; and sethþe smiten of hire heued
Þat bodi, for houndes it scholden ete &punctelev; vnbured it was bileued
Ake porfirie it burede ani&yogh;t &punctelev; þat holi bodi and guod
Þo þe Aumperur þat bodi miste &punctelev; he was wroth and wod
he tormentede þarefore manie Men &punctelev; þat ne mi&yogh;ten heom nou&yogh;t skere
Þo eode porfirie forth &punctelev; and seide, "sire, lo me here
Ich burede þat holie bodi &punctelev; þat was cristus make
And to Ihesu crist ich habbe also &punctelev; al min heorte itake
For no pouwer þat þou mi&yogh;t don &punctelev; Inelle him forsake."
Þo gan þe Aumperur for deol and sor &punctelev; alle is lymes to schake
¶ "Mahun," he seide, "hou schal þis beo? &punctelev; &yogh;wat schal ich nou do
Nov Ich habbe mi wif forlore &punctelev; and mi kni&yogh;t porfirie also
And porfirie al min heorte was! &punctelev; &yogh;wy neltþou me rede?"
Þo wenden þis oþure kny&yogh;tes forth &punctelev; and loude heo gonne grede
"We nellez þane deth for godes loue &punctelev; no leng bileue for drede."
Þo gan þe Aumperur todrawe is her &punctelev; and sore siche and grone
"Mahun," he seide, "&yogh;wat schal ich do? &punctelev; hov schal ich bileue allone
&YOGH;wi neltþou raþer fette me &punctelev; and bringe me of þusse liue
Þane soffri alle mine men to leose &punctelev; after mine leoue wiue
Þei þou nelle, mahun, helpe me &punctelev; Ine forsake þe nou&yogh;t
Þis foles þat habbez þe forsake &punctelev; to deþe heo schulle beo brou&yogh;t."
He let nime porfire þene guode kny&yogh;t &punctelev; and is felawes echone
And smiten of heore heuedes withoute toun &punctelev; ase Mahones fon
Þo let he fette katerine &punctelev; "Dameysele," he seide
Þei þov me binome mi wijf &punctelev; mid þine fole rede
Ichulle, &yogh;if þou wul torni þi þou&yogh;t &punctelev; fur&yogh;iue þine misdede
And with gret nobleie ase min Aumperesse &punctelev; oueral with me þe lede."
¶ "Certes, sire," þis Maide seide &punctelev; "þis wordes beoth alle for nau&yogh;t
Þov ne schalt me neuere bringue fram him &punctelev; þat hath min heorte icau&yogh;t
Do þat þov wolt, and haue idon &punctelev; and bring þi wille to ende
For þou ne schalt neuere for noþing &punctelev; min herte fram Ihesu wende."
"&YOGH;ware beo &yogh;e, mine quellares?" &punctelev; þe Aumperur þo seide
"Faste &yogh;e schulle þe wychche binde &punctelev; and withoute toune lede
And smitez[r. smite] of hire heued anon &punctelev; an don þe guode dede
Þat heo ne bringe us neuereft &punctelev; In soruwe ne In drede."
Þo þis Maide was ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; to slene withoute þe toun
hire preiere heo maude to god &punctelev; aknes heo sat adoun
"Louerd," heo seide, "graunte þou me &punctelev; þat ech man þat hath in[om. in] mone
In ani neode oþur in ani anuy &punctelev; of mine passione
graunte þat he mote to is wille &punctelev; help afonge sone."
Þo cam ore louerd himself to hire &punctelev; and grauntede hire bone
¶ "Cum forth," he seide, "mi suete leman &punctelev; mi leue spouse also
heuene&yogh;at a&yogh;ein þe Iopened is &punctelev; þare þou schalt comen to."
A quellare hire heued of smot. &punctelev; þat folk þat aboute heom stode
&YOGH;wijt Milk heo isei&yogh;en eorne out of þe wounde &punctelev; and nou&yogh;t o drope of blode
Aungles comen and nomen þat bodi &punctelev; among alle þe manne
And to þe hul of synay it beren &punctelev; tuenti Iorneies þanne
And bureden it þare In one faire place &punctelev; wit grete nobleye and riche
Þare þoru&yogh; Ihesu cristes grace &punctelev; hire bones restez &yogh;uyte
Þareof &yogh;eot to þis day &punctelev; þare eornez eoille wel riue
&YOGH;warewith manie sike Men &punctelev; beoz to hele ibrou&yogh;t and to liue
Wide In londe it is ilad &punctelev; þat hoso it habbe mote
Noble relike it is also &punctelev; sike Men to don bote
Þre hundred &yogh;er and twenti &punctelev; after þat god was ibore
IMartred was þis holie Maide &punctelev; of &yogh;wam we tolden bifore
Ihesu crist, for þe suete loue &punctelev; of seinte Katerine
graunti us þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; and schilde us fram helle pine
Amen amen, segge we alle &punctelev; for is holie tyme
SEinte lucie, þat holie Mayde &punctelev; In Cezile was ibore
&YOGH;ong heo bigan to serui god &punctelev; and bilefde sunne and hore
Dame Evtice hire Moder het &punctelev; þat hire to wommane brou&yogh;te
Of hire childe wel glad heo was &punctelev; ase heo suyþe wel ou&yogh;te
So bifeol þat on Dame Eutice cam a siknesse &punctelev; swiþe greuous and long
Four &yogh;er he[= heo] hadde gret pine— &punctelev; þe menison of blode wel strong
On leches heo hadde ispendet[MS. i spendedet] &punctelev; Muche del of hire guod
Ake þare nas non þat hire hele mi&yogh;te &punctelev; þat heo ne bledde euere blod
So þat wide In þe londe Men tolden &punctelev; of seinte Agace
Of Miracles þat comen at hire schrine &punctelev; þoru ore louerdes grace
In þe cite of Cathenes &punctelev; þere þis holi womman lay
Folk wende þudere wel wide &punctelev; boþe Ni&yogh;t and day
bi manie scor togadere &punctelev; of eche londe aboute
Þo seinte lucie þis isai&yogh; &punctelev; al dai so gret route
"Moder," heo seide, "þou hauest an vuel &punctelev; ful greuous withalle
And we hereth of miracles al day &punctelev; þat of seinte Agace doth falle
go we þudere forth mid oþure &punctelev; to þe holie seint Agace
And þare þou schalt to hele come &punctelev; þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace."
¶ Nov was lucie stilleliche &punctelev; Itorned to cristinedom
Ake hire Moder heþene was &punctelev; and al þat heo of com
Lucie to ane heþene manne &punctelev; was iweddet In hire &yogh;onghede
Ake Naþeles clene Mayde heo was &punctelev; withoute eche fol dede
Hire Moder heo nam stilleliche &punctelev; and with oþere Men heo wende
To seinte Agace Toumbe &punctelev; hire Moder forto amende
Þo heo weren þudere icome— &punctelev; so longue[al. a stounde] heo lefden þere
So þat þe godspel was þat day &punctelev; ase lucie onderstod
Of a womman þat &yogh;wylene hadde &punctelev; þe menison of blod
And cam ant touchede þe lappe &punctelev; of ore louerdes cloþes ene
Ase he eode In grete prece &punctelev; and was hol anon and clene
"Leoue Moder," seide lucie &punctelev; "&yogh;if þov bileuest on holi churche
And þe wordes of þis godspel &punctelev; and þerafter wolt wurche
Þoru&yogh; touchingue of seinte Agace toumbe &punctelev; þou&yogh; schalt beo hol anon
Ase þeo womman &yogh;wylene was &punctelev; þat aftur ore louerd gan gon."
Þo þat folk was al iwent &punctelev; seinte lucie cam
To seinte Agace holie toumbe &punctelev; and ire Moder with hire nam
Þare heo leien In heore beden &punctelev; heo nolden þannes gon
¶ So þat lucie, þat clene Maide &punctelev; werth aslepe anon
Seinte Agace, þat holie Maide &punctelev; to hire fram heuene ali&yogh;te
With gret felau&yogh;schipe of Aungles— &punctelev; hire croune schon wel bri&yogh;te
"Lucie," heo seide, "leoue soster &punctelev; &yogh;wy trauaillestþou so
And &yogh;wy biddestþou me so &yogh;eorne þat þing &punctelev; þat þou mi&yogh;t þiself do
For þine bileue, þat is so guod &punctelev; helpez þi Moder, iwis
And nov þoru þe and þine guodnesse &punctelev; þi Moder iheld is
Also schal þi contreie &punctelev; Anoured beon for þe
For þi clene Maidenhod &punctelev; and for þi holie lif, iwis
Þi woneingue is wel &yogh;are imaket &punctelev; with us in heueneblis."
Þo þis holie Maide awok &punctelev; heo bigan to quakien sore
¶ "Moder," heo seide, "þov art hol &punctelev; ne þarfþe drede nonmore
For þe loue of þat holie Maide &punctelev; þat þe hath to hele ibrou&yogh;t
Ne fonde þov neuere to bringue me &punctelev; of mi clene þou&yogh;t
And ne soffre þou nou&yogh;t mine spouse in folie &punctelev; mi Maidenhod aspille
Ne lat me nou&yogh;t leose þat longue lif &punctelev; for a luytel fol wille
Ake al þat þou igrauntet hast &punctelev; forto &yogh;iue him with me
Lat me it &yogh;iue þe pouere men &punctelev; Moder, ich bidde þe."
Þe Moder, þo heo hol was &punctelev; guod womman bicam
And þe dou&yogh;ter bi hire Moder wille &punctelev; þat guod to hire heo nam
heo hit delte among pouere Men &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle þare ilaste ou&yogh;t
to him þat hire spouse was &punctelev; þe teoþingue was ibrou&yogh;t
he wende to seinte lucies norice &punctelev; and axede hire wel stille
&YOGH;wat lucie were on bicome &punctelev; heore guod forto aspille
¶ And &yogh;wi heo dude it so awei &punctelev; and &yogh;wodere heo dude it bere
Þis norice wel quoyntelich &punctelev; &yogh;af him anon answere
"heo hath ifounde forto sulle &punctelev; swyþe derewurþe þing, iwis
Þat is suych a þousent more wurth &punctelev; þanne al þat þing þat is
Woldestþou gon þareInne In part &punctelev; riche man þou were inou&yogh;"
Þat was þe chaffare þe blisse of heuene &punctelev; þat heo hadde ibou&yogh;t
gret wonder he hadde of þulke Answere &punctelev; and stod in gret þou&yogh;t
So þat he onder&yogh;at sone &punctelev; þat heo cristine was
In grete wrathþe he tolde fore &punctelev; þe Iustice, þat het pakas.[MS. þakas]
Lucie was sone ifet &punctelev; and bifore þe Iustice ibrou&yogh;t
"Maide," seide þe Iustice &punctelev; "&yogh;wat hast þou iþou&yogh;t
¶ Let þi folie," he seide &punctelev; "Ich rede, on alle wiffe
And to ore godes, ase ri&yogh;t is &punctelev; do þine sacrefise!"
"Ich habbe," quath þis holie Maide &punctelev; "al þis þre &yogh;er ido
Mine sacrefise to Iesu crist &punctelev; and &yogh;uyt ichulle also
Al þat ich hadde ich habbe ispended &punctelev; and bitake In is lore
And þerto ichulle mi bodi take &punctelev; &yogh;wane me nis bileued nomore
Spene[corr. to spend by a later hand.] ichulle nou al mi bodi &punctelev; fram þe fot to þe heued
And euerech lime In is seruise &punctelev; nov me nis more bileued
Ich &yogh;elde him op al mi bodi &punctelev; sire Iustise, here bifore þe
to spene[corr. to spend by a later hand.] ech lime In is seruise— &punctelev; do &yogh;wat þou wolt bi me!"
¶ "Nov ich wot," quath þe Iustise &punctelev; "&yogh;wareto þou tornest þi mod
For In horedom and In lecherie &punctelev; þou hast ispend al þi guod
Þaron þou wolt þi bodi al spene[corr. to spend by a later hand.] &punctelev; and þarof þou dest preche
&YOGH;wane þov nast non more to spene[corr. to spend by a later hand.] &punctelev; forsoþe þou worst a wrechche
For þov spext ase an hore strong &punctelev; &yogh;wane þou wolt forsake
"Iwedded ich was to Ihesu crist" &punctelev; þis holie maide him tolde
"Þo ich was ibaptized &punctelev; and þulke weddingue ichulle holde
Ake to horedome þov woldest me bringue &punctelev; &yogh;wane þov me woldest make
Mine spousede louerd Ihesu crist &punctelev; for ani oþur man forsake."
"Þou schalt forsake him," quath þe Iustise &punctelev; "haddestþou it iswore
For to þe commune bordel þov schalt beo &punctelev; ilad oþur ibore
[The following part of this legend is written as prose, in two columns on each page on f. 60b.]And þare schal mani a moderchild &punctelev; go to þi foule licame
And ligge bi þe, alle þat wollez &punctelev; in horedom and in schame."
¶ "Ne mai no wumman," quath þis maide &punctelev; "of hire maidenhod beo ido
For no dede þat men deth þe bodie &punctelev; bote ire herte beo[a later hand adds consente.] þerto
For þe more þat mi bodi a&yogh;ein mi wille &punctelev; here defouled is
Þe clenore[MS. clenore] is mi maydenhod &punctelev; and þe more mi mede, iwis."
¶ Þe Iustise let wide aboute &punctelev; into al þe contreie crie
Þat alle þat wolden &punctelev; bi a swuch fair wumman don anie folie
Comen to hire, alle þat wolden &punctelev; for alle heo scholde heom take,[a later hand adds consente.]
For in bordel heo scholde beo ido &punctelev; þare heo ne scholde non fursake
he hiet is men nimen hire faste &punctelev; and to þe bordel hire lede anon
Alle þat mi&yogh;hten nei&yogh;h hire come &punctelev; faste huy hire drowen echon
huy schoue and drowe al þat huy mi&yogh;hte &punctelev; ake huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire anne fote iwinne
Ne o fote uchchen of þe stude &punctelev; þare as heo stod inne
Þo nomen huy ropes strongue inou&yogh; &punctelev; ant to fet and hondene teide
And alle þat mi&yogh;hten þere nei&yogh;h come &punctelev; faste huy drowen and breide
A þousend men with al heore main &punctelev; on hire gonne drawe
Ac euere heo lai stille a&yogh;ein &punctelev; huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe
¶ "&YOGH;wat, hou goth þis?" quath þe iustise &punctelev; "&yogh;wat resun mai þis beo
Þat a þousend ne mouwen nou&yogh;t þis womman &punctelev; of þe stude enes teo?"
¶ "Sire iustise," þat Maide seide &punctelev; "þou hontest aboute nou&yogh;t
For, þei þou haddest &yogh;eot to heom &punctelev; ten þousend mo ibrou&yogh;t
&YOGH;uit it scholde biforen eov alle &punctelev; bi folfuld bi me her
Þat holie vers þat seint Dauid &punctelev; seithþ in þe sauter:[Ps. 90]
Þat a þousend men scholden in mi side falle &punctelev; and to grounde beon ibrou&yogh;t
And ten þousend in mi ri&yogh;ht side &punctelev; and nei&yogh;h me ne comen nou&yogh;t
Þarefore it is al for nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat þou hontest hereaboute
God is strengore þane þou be &punctelev; and þarefore inabbe no doute."
¶ "Þou art strong wichche," quath þe iustise &punctelev; "and þarof Man schal þe bringue
Mine clerkes and mine enchauntours &punctelev; binime schullen þi wich|chingue."
His clerkes he let bringue forth &punctelev; and his enchauntours echone
And huy maden heore coniurisones &punctelev; aboute þis Maide alone
And þo huy hadden al ido þat huy couþen &punctelev; þat folk gan eftsones drawe
Ake euere heo lai iliche stille &punctelev; huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe
¶ Þe Iustise, þo he þis isei&yogh; &punctelev; for wrathþe he was nei&yogh;h wod
"Certes," he seide, "hire wichchingue &punctelev; ne schal do hire no guod."
Strongue temene he liet fette &punctelev; of Oxene mani on
And bringue þere þis Maide was &punctelev; and to hire tei&yogh;en echon
He liet heom prikie and harli faste &punctelev; and huy guonne drawe and pluchche
And euere lai þis Maide stille &punctelev; huy ne mi&yogh;hten hire enes wawe
¶ "Certes," he seide, "ore fare nis nou&yogh;t &punctelev; oþur&yogh;wat we moten do
With oþer þing we schullen hire to nau&yogh;te bringue &punctelev; &yogh;wane we ne mouwen so
Makieth ope þe hore, þare heo lijthþ &punctelev; &yogh;wane we ne mouwen hire winne heonne
Also strong fuyr ase &yogh;e conne &punctelev; þat heo alto douste brenne!"
A strong fuir and gret inou&yogh; &punctelev; þis tormentores wrou&yogh;te
Aboute þis holie clene maide &punctelev; to brenne hire alto nou&yogh;te
Þo þis fuyr was wel strongue imaud &punctelev; heo sat amidde ful stille
Þat fuyr ne mi&yogh;hte don hire non harm &punctelev; þat were wurth a fille
Þo nomen huy pich and brumston &punctelev; and welden it wel faste
And ope hire nakede tendre bodi &punctelev; alfuyri it casten
¶ Euere sat þis Maide stille &punctelev; it ne greuede hire noþing
Ake euere heo prechede with glade heorte &punctelev; of Ihesu, heuene king
¶ Þo nuste þis luþere iustise &punctelev; &yogh;wat he mi&yogh;hte don more
&YOGH;wane he ne mi&yogh;hte þis clene þing &punctelev; ouercome mid al is lore
A scharp swerd and a kene &punctelev; þoru&yogh; hire þrote he liet do
To binimen hire speche &punctelev; and hire lijf also
And prechede euere of Ihesu crist &punctelev; and wel smere lou&yogh;
¶ "&YOGH;e þat beoth cristine &punctelev; glade and bliþe &yogh;e beo
Of noþing ne habbe &yogh;e drede &punctelev; for gret ioy ich iseo
Ane Ioyeful þyþingue ich eou telle &punctelev; þat sothþ is and nou&yogh;t les
Þat ri&yogh;ht nouþe is holi churche &punctelev; ibrou&yogh;t in guod pes
For hire tweie wiþerwines &punctelev; þat habbez ibeo so &yogh;are
Ri&yogh;ht nouþe beoth to nau&yogh;t ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; &yogh;e þorue habbe of heom no kare
For þe luþere dioclician &punctelev; þat so muche harm hath ido
he is ipult out of his kynedom &punctelev; he ne cometh nonmore þarto
And also Maximian &punctelev; þat so luþur hath ibeo
Ri&yogh;th nouþe he deide in luþur deth &punctelev; &yogh;e schulle him nonmore iseo
So þat þe luþere wiþerwines &punctelev; þat a&yogh;ein holie churche were
Out of heore mi&yogh;hte beoth ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; ne habbe &yogh;e none fere
¶ Þus glade tyþingue ich eov bringue &punctelev; þei huy feor heonne beo
Ihered beo god, þat ich moste &punctelev; þis dai aliue iseo
Ichulle biteche ou ihesu crist &punctelev; for fram eov ich mot wende
Bringuth me ore louerdes flechs and is blod &punctelev; for þat schal beo mi[corr. to my] ende."
¶ Þe preostes wenden forth anon &punctelev; and folk þat þere stod
And fetten to þis holie maide &punctelev; godes fl[e]chs and is blod
Þo heo it hadde underfongue &punctelev; and hire ri&yogh;htes also
And þe oresones weren alle iseid &punctelev; þat bifullen þerto
Mid þe laste [word][om.] heo &yogh;af þene gost &punctelev; ase huy amen seide
Aungles þare weren redie Inowe &punctelev; hire soule to heuene lede
Þere heo is with ihesu crist &punctelev; in Ioye withouten ende
Nou god for seinte lucie loue &punctelev; þudere us late iwiende! Amen

div1.head: 27 ¶ Ici poez oyer coment seint Thomas de Kaunterbures nasqui. e de quev manere gent de pere e de Mere.

lg.l: WOlle &yogh;e nouþe iheore þis englische tale &punctelev; þat is here iwrite
Of seint Thomas of Caunterburi &punctelev; alhou he was bi&yogh;ite
Of londone is fader was &punctelev; A bordeys[r. borgeys] hende and fre
Gilbert Bekat was is name &punctelev; þe bok tellez me
Ake is Moder was of heþenesse. &punctelev; nov sone &yogh;e mouwen iheore
Alhou heo cam into engelonde &punctelev; are heo icristned were
Gilebert him biþou&yogh;te &punctelev; þe Croiz forto fo
Into þe holie lond &punctelev; his penaunce þe bet to do
So þat, þo he þudere cam &punctelev; he was sone inome
Ase A sclaue forth ilad &punctelev; and idon In prisone
And faste was igwiued &punctelev; he and manie mo
And iwust wel sikerliche &punctelev; þat he ne scholde awei go
In þe Amirales prisone[orig. prisones] &punctelev; heo hadden ibeo so longue
To &yogh;eres and an half &punctelev; In bendes swiþe strongue
So þat god &yogh;af þe Amiral &punctelev; boþe heorte and wille
Þe more to louien Gilebert &punctelev; for he was meoke and stille
Eche daie &yogh;wane þe Amiral &punctelev; to is mete wolde go
he bad, Gilebert to is mete &punctelev; scholde come also
gret auantage, forsoþe, it was &punctelev; þat he mi&yogh;te so gon
Ake euere he hadde ane peire feteres &punctelev; faste him upon
And oftesiþes þe Amiral &punctelev; dude for Gilebardes loue
Auantage to is felawes &punctelev; þat with him weren In prisone
hit bifeol þat Amiral &punctelev; Ane faire dou&yogh;ter hadde
Childrene of is owene &punctelev; none mo forsoþe he nadde
priueliche heo dude for Gilebert &punctelev; Auantages manie and fele
And oftesiþe heo wolde speke with him &punctelev; &yogh;wane heo mi&yogh;te to bi|stele
For heo ne dorste bifore hire fader &punctelev; laste he it onder&yogh;ete
Þat it were for gyle &punctelev; þat heo with him speke
&YOGH;eot it bifeol In a dai &punctelev; þat heo sai&yogh; þo heo mi&yogh;te
to Gillebert heo eode priueliche &punctelev; and echste him &yogh;wat he hi&yogh;te
And of &yogh;wat bileue he were &punctelev; and of &yogh;wyche londe
And &yogh;if he wolde for is louerdes loue &punctelev; þene deth afonge
Gilbert hire Ansuerede þo &punctelev; In swiþe fair manere
"Of engelonde ich am, and cristine Man &punctelev; þei ich beo nouþe here
Mi name is Gilbert beket &punctelev; of Londene þe cite
gladliche icholde þane deth afongue &punctelev; for is loue þat[MS. þad.] bou&yogh;te me
And forto saui mi cristinedom &punctelev; and mine trewe bileue also."
Þis womman to Gilbert wel sone &punctelev; þeos wordes heo seide to
"Cristinedom ichulle onderfonge &punctelev; for þe loue of þe
And þou anon afturward &punctelev; treweliche weddi me."
Gilbert was ful sore adrad &punctelev; of þis wommane sawe
Laste heo wolde biMeldi him &punctelev; &yogh;wareþoru&yogh; he were aslawe
To &yogh;eres and an half he was sclaue &punctelev; and þat him þou&yogh;te longe
So þat he and is felawes &punctelev; gonne heom onderstonde
Þat heo wolden þet prison breke &punctelev; and Aweiward gon
Sore heo weren alle aferd &punctelev; for traison of þat womman
Þat prison heo breken &punctelev; ri&yogh;t þulke daie at eue
Forth heo wenden alle awei &punctelev; þare nolde non bileue
In þe morewetide heo weren isou&yogh;t &punctelev; bote þer nas non ifounde
Ak þo biþou&yogh;te þat Maiden hire &punctelev; In wel luyte stounde
hov heo mi&yogh;te best on take &punctelev; and &yogh;wat heo mi&yogh;te do
So þat heo porueide hire &punctelev; and fort awei gan go
Albi ny&yogh;te heo wende awei &punctelev; men nusten &yogh;ware heo bicam
Ne heo ne couþe nanne wei &punctelev; bote god was hire lodesman
Þoru&yogh; godes grace heo was ilad &punctelev; with men þat onderstoden hire langage
So þat heo cam to þe se &punctelev; and redi fond hire passage
Þane wei heo Axede In hire langage &punctelev; Into engelonde
So þat heo cam with pilegrimes &punctelev; ase ich me onderstonde
Ouer þe se sauf and wel &punctelev; þoru&yogh; grace þat heo hadde
Of Iesu crist, and socur of men &punctelev; þat hire ouer ladden
heo ne couþe noþing conteini hire &punctelev; ne speken noþemo
Ake euere heo axede In hire langage &punctelev; to londone forto go
Mid pilegrimes and þoru grace of god &punctelev; to londone heo cam
And þo heo was þudere icome &punctelev; þare ne knev heo no man
Ne heo ne couþe speke ne hire biseo &punctelev; bote ase a best þat astrayed were
Þarefore on hire gapede alday &punctelev; swyþe muche fol[c] þere
boþe Men and wommen &punctelev; and children suyþe fale
for hire continaunce was wonderful &punctelev; and hire speche no Man ne couþe þare
In Manie stretes heo hadde iwandret— &punctelev; þat Man may wel iwite
So þat bifore gilbertes house &punctelev; þe Noyse was onder&yogh;ite
For þe knaue þat hadde with him &punctelev; In heþenesse ibeo
to þe dore he orn swyþe &punctelev; þe dune forto iseo
he isai&yogh; þat it was þe Amirales dou&yogh;ter &punctelev; þat al þe wondringue was on
hasteliche he tornede In a&yogh;en &punctelev; to is louerd anon
And seide, þe Amirales dou&yogh;ter was &punctelev; In þe strete þareoute
And suyþe gret prece of gurles and Men &punctelev; comen hire alaboute
he seide, "al þe gredinge is for hire &punctelev; þat &yogh;e doth nouþe iheore."
"Louerd," seide gilbert, "&yogh;weþur heo beo &punctelev; alone withouten fere?"
he het is knaue loki sothþeliche &punctelev; &yogh;if þat heo it were
And bad hire leden to ane guode wyues house &punctelev; and astunte with hire þere
And þat heo hire scholde finde inou&yogh; &punctelev; of al þat heo hadde neode
ri&yogh;t ase heo wolde is owene bodi &punctelev; and he hire þarof bede
Also tyme ase þis knaue &punctelev; to þis Mayde cam
For Ioye heo ful adoun iswowe &punctelev; opon þe harde ston
Þo hire stat was a&yogh;ein icome &punctelev; þe knaue hire op nam
And heo wel gladliche with him eode &punctelev; to þulke guode womman
And heo hire onderfeng swiþe faire &punctelev; for gilberdes loue
heo makede hire wel anAyse &punctelev; and was hire swyþe welcome
Gilbert him biþou&yogh;te &punctelev; anon so he hadde iete
To þe bischop forto gon &punctelev; with him forto speke
Þare he was at seint poules &punctelev; of him to habbe red anon
Al&yogh;wat him were of þat Maide &punctelev; is beste forto don
Þane bischop of londone &punctelev; forsoþe he fond þere
And fyue oþur bischopes &punctelev; with him þare were
So þat he fond þare six bischopes &punctelev; þe beste of Engelonde
And þo Gilbert isai&yogh; heom alle &punctelev; bifore heom he eode stonde
he bigan to telle is tale &punctelev; þoru&yogh; is owene Mouth
And are he hadde al itold &punctelev; heo was swyþe selcouth
he tolde hou he In þe Amirales prisone &punctelev; in heþenesse hadde ibe
And hov þe Amirales dou&yogh;ter to him seide &punctelev; þat was so fair and fre
Alhov þat heo wolde cristine bicome &punctelev; for enchaison of him
&YOGH;if he wolde weddi hire &punctelev; and forsaken al hire kun
And hou he and is felawes &punctelev; bitwene hem alle bispeke
For drede of hire wordes &punctelev; þat prison forto breke
&YOGH;If þat heo mi&yogh;ten grace habbe &punctelev; awei forto gon
laste heo weren alle for hire &punctelev; to stronge deþe idon
And alhou heo was to londone icome &punctelev; and fram so fer igon
gret wonder þarof he hadde &punctelev; for language ne couþe heo non
Þo þis bischopes hadden iheord &punctelev; þat gilbert heom hadde itold
Þe bischop of wynchestre it wel onderstod &punctelev; for he was wis and bold
Þat hit was al þoru&yogh; godes grace &punctelev; þat heo was so fer icome
Out of hire owene londe so fer &punctelev; þat heo þoru miseise ne hadde ibe nome;[MS. nonome.]
For heo ne couþe language non &punctelev; with men forto speke
With &yogh;wan heo mi&yogh;te iwinnen hire &punctelev; herboruwe and drinke and mete
he seide, "withoute faille &punctelev; &yogh;if god hathþ iporueid so
þat heo for gilberdes loue &punctelev; cristinedom wole onderfo
And gilberd hire wolde weddi &punctelev; sum blede of hire schal come
Þat schal holie churche holde to ri&yogh;te &punctelev; and serui godes sone
For we it mowen wel iwite &punctelev; and we wollen us onderstonde
Þat heo is into þis londe icome &punctelev; it is godes sonde
for þat þing þat god helpe wole &punctelev; ne schal nou&yogh;t beo forfare."
Alle þeos oþure bischopes &punctelev; acordeden to þis tale
And seiden þat gilberd scholde weddi hire &punctelev; and holden hire to wiue
&YOGH;if heo wolde icristned be &punctelev; and tuyrne to clene liue
So þat anonri&yogh;t þene moruwe &punctelev; iporueid it was al&yogh;are
At seint poules churche, þat heo scholde &punctelev; Icristned beo ri&yogh;t þare
Þo þe baptisterie was alredi &punctelev; to hire baptizingue
Þe bischopes beden þat Men scholden &punctelev; þe womman bifore heom bringe
Þo heo cam bifore þe bischopes &punctelev; heo axeden hire wel sone
&YOGH;if heo wolde icristned beo &punctelev; ase lawe was forto done
heo answerede In hire langage &punctelev; wel sone heom a&yogh;en
&YOGH;if gilbert wolde hire weddi &punctelev; icristned heo wolde ben
And bote he hire weddi wolde &punctelev; heo nolde cristinedom afongue
heo seide heo wolde raþer tuyrne a&yogh;en &punctelev; Into hire owene londe
Gilberd couþe hire language. &punctelev; þare he stod wel stille
to þe bischopus he seide &punctelev; he wolde don heore wille
So þat heo icristned was &punctelev; ase god hire &yogh;af þe grace
Of alle þe six bischopes &punctelev; and ispouse in þe place
hire heþene name ne j nou&yogh;t telle &punctelev; forsoþe &yogh;wat heo hiet
Þe name þat heo of cristindom hadde &punctelev; iwute &yogh;e schullen &yogh;et
heo was inemd Alisaundre &punctelev; as ich me onderstonde
Seint Thomas was on hire bi&yogh;ite &punctelev; prismartyr of engelonde
Þo Gilbert[orig. Gilberd] hire hadde iweddet &punctelev; wel glad of him heo was
Þe furste Nij&yogh;t þat he knovlei&yogh;te hire &punctelev; he bi&yogh;at seint thomas
Fram þe tyme þat he was bi&yogh;ite &punctelev; forto þat he was ibore
he ne lai non more bi hire &punctelev; þane he dude bifore
Anonri&yogh;tes amorewe &punctelev; so gret wille him nam
to þe holi londe forto gon &punctelev; þat he cam erore fram
Þat him þoute dei&yogh;e he scholde &punctelev; bote he wende a&yogh;enward sone
Ake he biþou&yogh;te him of is wiues stat &punctelev; &yogh;wat were of hire to done
laste heo wolde mourny swyþe &punctelev; &yogh;wane he were agon
And gret deol to hire nime— &punctelev; for langage ne couþe heo non
Þat ani Man couþe onderstonde &punctelev; þat heo speke to
bote gilbert oþur [his] knaue. &punctelev; þarefore him [was] ful wo
So þat gilbert was in grete þou&yogh;te &punctelev; and bigan to sike sore
laste is wif gret harm habbe scholde &punctelev; &yogh;wane he iwend weore
Þarefore gilbert mournede muche &punctelev; and si&yogh;te stille and softe
laste is wif furfare scholde &punctelev; he biþou&yogh;te him ofte
for þe mourningue þat he makede &punctelev; is wif it onderstod
And for he si&yogh;te ilomeliche &punctelev; þat ichaunged was is mod
his wif him axede swiþe &yogh;eorne &punctelev; and araysonede him wel tou&yogh;te
&YOGH;if him mislikede aniþing &punctelev; þat grefde him in þou&yogh;te
So streitliche heo fraynede him &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te no leng forsake
he tolde hire hov gret wille he hadde &punctelev; þene wei a&yogh;ein to take
Forto trauaili is bodi more &punctelev; ase euerech man wel ou&yogh;te
Al forto honouri Iesu crist &punctelev; þat him so deore abou&yogh;te
Þo heo sai&yogh; gilbertus wille &punctelev; þat it was so guod
heo nolde noþing a&yogh;en him beo &punctelev; forto chaungi is mod
Ake heo &yogh;af him conseil þane wei to gon &punctelev; þat he hadde In þou&yogh;te
And forto queme Iesu crist &punctelev; þat him deore bou&yogh;te
Þare was isene þat heo was treowe &punctelev; and of studefast mod
heo nolde letten hire louerd nou&yogh;t to done &punctelev; þat him þou&yogh;te god
Ake euere heo bad him þane wei gon &punctelev; þat he hadde In þou&yogh;t
Forto serui is creatour— &punctelev; þarea&yogh;ein heo nolde beo nou&yogh;t
And &yogh;eorne he[= heo] bad for enchaison of hire &punctelev; he ne scholde it nou&yogh;t bileue
Saue[MS. sone] heo bisou&yogh;te gilbert &punctelev; þat he one bone hire &yogh;eue
Þat heo moste is knaue with hire habbe &punctelev; þat hire langage couþe
And for he scholde hire solas beo &punctelev; and speke to hire with mouþe
heo truste so muche to Iesu crist &punctelev; þat to cristinedom ire hadde ibrou&yogh;t
Þat heo ne scholde nou&yogh;t furfare— &punctelev; so treowe was hire þou&yogh;t
Gilebard lefde is knaue wit hire &punctelev; his name was Richard Mone
he greiþede him wel hasteliche &punctelev; and wende is wei wel sone
To þe holie londe he wende &punctelev; In penaunce ase he dude er
And þare he bilefde þo &punctelev; fulle furthþehalf &yogh;er
Þo he hadde þre &yogh;er þare ibe &punctelev; and an half &yogh;er more
Into is owene londe &punctelev; alongued he was sore
&YOGH;if þat he was þare ou&yogh;t iknowe &punctelev; Ine can ou tellen non ende
bote, ase þe bok us tellez &punctelev; hamward he gan þo wende
his wif and thomas, is &yogh;onge sone &punctelev; boþe hole and sounde
Welle, muche was þe Ioie &punctelev; þat he makede with is sone
And also he dude with is wif &punctelev; þo he was hom Icome
And is wif gret Ioie made &punctelev; with hire housebonde
For he was hire swiþe welcome &punctelev; Into engelonde
Þat child heo setten to lore &punctelev; are it were seue &yogh;er eld
Ich wot, it leornede swiþe wel &punctelev; and wax swiþe quointe and beld
Þo þat he was wel iwoxe &punctelev; of bodi and of clergise
Þat þe bischop of londone &punctelev; wilnede is seruise
he nolde serui þe bischope nout &punctelev; ake he bilefde athom
And preide is fader wel &yogh;erne &punctelev; þat he moste to schole gon
Of is fader and of is moder &punctelev; &yogh;e habbez iheord telle
Acke of seint thomas himselue &punctelev; þat beste cometh nou to spelle

div1.p: ¶ Hic Isci Comence la vie seint Thomas Erceeueske de Kaunterbury.

lg.l: ENgelond, wel glad þov beo &punctelev; for þou mi&yogh;t wel eþe
And also holi churche &punctelev; for one Mannes deþe
Þe erchebischop seint Thomas &punctelev; þat[al. þat ou] wel deore bou&yogh;te
With is blod and with is brayn &punctelev; þat þe scharpe swerd sou&yogh;te
Seint Thomas, þis holi Man &punctelev; to Alle guodnesse he drov&yogh;
At londone he was ibore &punctelev; of guode Men inou&yogh;
For of londone is fader was &punctelev; a wel guod emne Man
Þis child was &yogh;ong to schole iset &punctelev; And swiþe wel he bigan
His Moder him wolde al day rede &punctelev; and wel ofte on him crie
Chaste lijf and clene forto lede &punctelev; and forsake lecherie
And louien bifore al oþur þing &punctelev; god and seinte Marie
And serui hem and holi churche &punctelev; and bileuen alle folie
Þis child, þei it were &yogh;ong &punctelev; swiþe wel þis understod
For seli child is sone ilered &punctelev; þare he þenchez to beon guod
Þo þis child was bet in elde &punctelev; and of to and twenti &yogh;er
his moder wende out of þis liue &punctelev; þat so muchel him louede her
Þis child wolde lengore gon to scole &punctelev; ake is fader him nolde finde
For þat child þat is modur forleost &punctelev; is help is muche bihinde
Þis child þoru&yogh; is fader heste &punctelev; ase man þat oþur red not
Seruede A borgeys of þe toun &punctelev; and his acountes wrot
So longe þat he cam to court &punctelev; and was in guod offiz
With þe erchebischop of Kaunterburi &punctelev; sire tebaud, guod and wis
He seruede him so hendeliche &punctelev; þat In a luytel stounde
he makede him his conseiller &punctelev; so studefast he him founde
his ercedekne he makede him sethþe &punctelev; and dude al bi is rede
Swyþe wel bigan þis Ercedekne &punctelev; holi churche bilede
And stifliche heold op hire ri&yogh;te— &punctelev; þat alle Men iseie
An þarof nolde he þolien no wrong &punctelev; þei he scholde þarefore deie
Wel ofte he wende to rome &punctelev; for holi churche also
Swuche prelatus alto fewe &punctelev; beoth nouþe In office ido
¶ So þat henri king of Engelonde &punctelev; after sire steuene þe blays
Duyk of Normandie— &punctelev; ymaked was al In pays
Þis king henri þe &yogh;ongue &punctelev; þo he to londe cam
louede muche wel to do &punctelev; and guode Men to him nam
And fondede to habben guod conseil &punctelev; and wis bi al is mi&yogh;te
Forto holden riche and pouere &punctelev; euerech man to ri&yogh;te
Of þe Ercedekne Thomas &punctelev; Men tolden him sone inou&yogh;
hov he was stable Man and wis &punctelev; and to alle guodnesse drou&yogh;
Þoru&yogh; þe Erchebischopes graunt &punctelev; he makede him chaunceler
For euere Man mot him abouwie &punctelev; þat hauez mest pouwer
Þo þis holi Man was itorned &punctelev; fram þe office of holi churche
To a gret office of þe world &punctelev; þareafter he moste wurche
Alto nobleie of þe worlde &punctelev; his continaunce he brou&yogh;te
Of swuche porture neuere Man iholde nas— &punctelev; þei oþur were is þou&yogh;te
With more nobleie he rod inou&yogh; &punctelev; þane he was iwonet to do
his loreins weren al of seluer &punctelev; stirapes and spores also
pley he siwede of hauekus &punctelev; and of houndes Inou&yogh;
bote In is heorte it was anoþur &punctelev; hovso he him bere
And euere he was chaste þoru&yogh; alle þing &punctelev; hovso it euere were
Ake euere he was for holi churche &punctelev; and for pouere Men also
A&yogh;en þe proute courteoures &punctelev; þat a&yogh;en heom wolden ou&yogh;t do.[Both verses were orig. transposed in the MS.]
¶ To holden op holi churche ri&yogh;te &punctelev; so muche wo he gan drie
A&yogh;en þe luþere courteours &punctelev; þat anuyden him of is liue
Also he tolde þe Erchebischope &punctelev; wepinde swiþe sore
And oþere ofte In priueite &punctelev; þat loueden him þe more
he wilnede mest of alle þinge &punctelev; and on ore louerd he gan crie
Þat he moste with honour &punctelev; bileue þulke baillie
And ech oþur seruise of court &punctelev; with þe kingus gode wille
For he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t is court paie &punctelev; bote he wolde is soulle spille
Ake þe king him fond so stable &punctelev; and so guod conseiller
Þat he nolde make for noþing &punctelev; non oþur chaunceler
he ne truste to no man so muche &punctelev; ne þare nas non so hei&yogh;
Þat he tolde is priueite so muche &punctelev; ne þat him were so nei&yogh;
So muche he caste is heorte on him &punctelev; þat In his warde he let do
his eldeste sone sire henri— &punctelev; he was is .Eyr. also
Þat he were is wardein &punctelev; and al is ordeinour
Aftur is wille to wissi him &punctelev; to þe kingus honur
Þe king wende Into Normandie &punctelev; forto soiorni þere
And lefde is sone with seint Thomas &punctelev; þat he is wardein were
¶ boþe þe fader and þe sone &punctelev; mest heore heorte heo caste
Ope seint thomas þe holi Man &punctelev; þe &yogh;wile it wolde ilaste
Þare nas Man In engelond &punctelev; þat hadde so gret power
Of þe reaume ase seint thomas &punctelev; boþe fer and ner
Hit bifel þat sire Tebaut &punctelev; ase god þe grace sende
Þe Erchebischop of Kaunterburi &punctelev; out of þis liue wende
Þat word was sone wide couth &punctelev; among þeuwe and freo
Þat seint Thomas after him &punctelev; scholde Erchebischop beo
Þe king also In Noremandie &punctelev; þo men tolden him þat cas
Anon bar is heorte him mest &punctelev; to don þare seint thomas
Þat couent of Caunterburi &punctelev; desirede him also
So ase ech Man it wolde &punctelev; ibrou&yogh;t he[al. it] was þarto
At Westmunstre he was ichose &punctelev; to þat heie pouwer
Þe fifte &yogh;er þat he was imad &punctelev; þe kingus Chaunceler
he was of elde þulke tyme &punctelev; of foure and fourti &yogh;er
his owene deth he onderfeng &punctelev; and is Martyrdom þer
For þe king was In Normandie &punctelev; Ipresented he was
to henri, is sone, In Engelonde &punctelev; þo non oþur kyng þere nas
Ake þei it were a&yogh;en is wille &punctelev; he nolde it nou&yogh;t forsake
¶ Þo[MS. þo he Axede In &yogh;wuche Manere &punctelev; þo Axede he in &yogh;wuche m.] Axede he in &yogh;wuche manere &punctelev; þe croiz he scholde take
Men seiden him þat he scholde afongue &punctelev; holi churche so freo
Þat he[MS. heo] ne scholde onder noman &punctelev; bote onder þe pope beo
Ne noþing þenche bote holden op wel &punctelev; holi churche lawe
"In þis manere," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "ich hire afongue fawe."
Þis was ri&yogh;t at witsonentid &punctelev; þat þis dede cam to ende
Þis guode Man to Caunterburi &punctelev; anon bigan to wende
Al þe contreie, to don him honour &punctelev; a&yogh;en him cam and drov
Þare was for him In Caunterburi &punctelev; Ioie and blisse Inov
Þat dai of þe Trinite &punctelev; bischop isacret he was
And onderfeng þis dignete &punctelev; þe guode Man seint thomas
Sire henri, þe kingus sone &punctelev; was at his sacringue
And sixtene bischopus also &punctelev; þis dede to ende bringue
Þo þis dede was idon &punctelev; heo gonne sende sone
Aftur is palliun to rome &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t was forto done
Alisaundre, þat was pope þo &punctelev; he was at Mountpellers
Þudere wenden þis wise men &punctelev; þat weren is Messagers
¶ Þe Abbod Adam of Euesham &punctelev; heore cheuenteyn huy nome
to þe pope Alisaundre &punctelev; to Mountpellers heo come
heore erinde heo hadden sone of him &punctelev; for [he] hem noþing ne wernde
And heo nomen heore leue of him &punctelev; and hamward a&yogh;ein heo turnden
And þis pallion wel sone was &punctelev; to seint thomas ibrou&yogh;t
Þis holi Man it afonge &punctelev; with wel milde þou&yogh;t
¶ Þo he was in is dignete &punctelev; al clanliche ido
he chaungede euerechdel is lif &punctelev; and is maneres also
Þe here he dude on next is liche &punctelev; is flesches maister to beo
Schuyrte and brech streit inov &punctelev; anon doun to is kneo
For him þou&yogh;te þat he wel mi&yogh;te &punctelev; of oþure habbe þe maistrie
&YOGH;if he hadde of is owene flesche &punctelev; alovt þe seignorie
&YOGH;if is soule Maister were &punctelev; and is flesch is hyne
him þou&yogh;te he mi&yogh;te is dignete &punctelev; bringue to guode fine
Sethþe onouewarde þe here &punctelev; þe Abite of Monek he nam
And aboue al þan clerkene Robe &punctelev; ase to is stat bicam
So þat he was clerk withoute &punctelev; and withInne Monek also
Þoru&yogh; þe Abite þat he hadde on him &punctelev; priueliche ido
In penaunce and In fastingue &punctelev; he was ni&yogh;t and dai
And In is oresones, bote som &yogh;wile &punctelev; þat he slepe lai
And &yogh;wane he scholde eten is mete &punctelev; for þat he moste nede
Euere he preide ore swete louerd &punctelev; þat he moste wel spede
And euere &yogh;wane he Masse song &punctelev; he wep and si&yogh;te sore
he hastede euere þarewith faste &punctelev; ne mi&yogh;te no man more
¶ Swiþe faire he fedde him at is bord &punctelev; with grete nobleie and pruyte
And of þe beste himsulf he et &punctelev; ake ofte bote luyte
Of is ordres he was ful streit &punctelev; and he was in grete fere
Forto ordeinen ani Man &punctelev; bote he þe betere were
Idul nolde he neuere beo &punctelev; ake euere doinde he was
In eche manere of betere liue &punctelev; neuere no bischop nas
Sire henri, þe kingus sone &punctelev; þat with him was er ibrou&yogh;t
bilefde euere In is warde &punctelev; fram him nolde he nou&yogh;t
Þe loue þat was hem bitwene &punctelev; nas neuere more iseie
Ne of no Man þis child nadde &punctelev; neuere more loue ei&yogh;e.[al. ne ei&yogh;e]
[Reditus regis.]HIt bifel þat þe king &punctelev; ovt of Noremandie cam
Into Enguelonde, þe stat to loke &punctelev; and also is kynedom
Seint Thomas nam with him &punctelev; sire hanri, is sone
And wel faire with honour &punctelev; wende to southhamptone
Þare was Ioie and blisse inou&yogh; &punctelev; þo heo togadere come
heo custen and heo clupten faste &punctelev; and hereden god ilome
Þe king bilefde In Engelonde &punctelev; to wardi is kynedom
Seint thomas to is priueitez &punctelev; eueremore he nam
And heold him euere ase he dude er &punctelev; is hexte conseiller
bi is wille he nolde habbe ihaued &punctelev; non oþur chaunceler
Euere &yogh;wane he aniþing dude &punctelev; þat were a&yogh;en þe ri&yogh;te
Seint thomas it withseide &punctelev; euere with al is mi&yogh;te.
Hit bifel þat þe bischop of wirecestre &punctelev; sone þereafter ded was
And þe bischop of hereforde also &punctelev; ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas
Þe bischopriches fullen boþe &punctelev; Into þe kingus hond
Forto onderfonge al þe prov þareof &punctelev; ase lawe was in þe lond
¶ Þe king heom nolde nou&yogh;t &yogh;iue sone &punctelev; bote heold heom swiþe longe
In his hond, þat he mi&yogh;te þarof &punctelev; þe more prov afonge
Hit ne likede nou&yogh;t seint Thomas &punctelev; þat holi churche so
Scholde for a luytel coueitise &punctelev; In þe kingus warde beon ido
he þou&yogh;te þat it was swiþe muche &punctelev; a&yogh;en ore louerdes wille
And þat þe king mi&yogh;te In swuche manere &punctelev; holi churche aspille
he bad þe kinge In faire manere &punctelev; þat he ne scholde it nou&yogh;t bileue
Þat þulke tweie bischoperiches &punctelev; some guode Men he &yogh;eue
Þe king him grauntede mildeliche &punctelev; and nas nou&yogh;t a&yogh;en is bone
Ake Þeos bischopriches boþe he &yogh;af &punctelev; twei guode Men wel sone
¶ Seint thomas þou&yogh;te wel &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t paie
þe kingue ne his conseil &punctelev; bote he wolde holi churche bitraie
In gret care and in soruwe he was &punctelev; hov he mi&yogh;te best do
For he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t paien Ihesu crist &punctelev; and þene kingue also
Seint Thomas halewede þat ilke &yogh;er &punctelev; þe churche of Redinge
Þat ifounded was and arerd &punctelev; þoru&yogh; henri þe oþur kingue
Þat &yogh;eot lith þare wel faire ibured— &punctelev; willames sone bastard
In þulke &yogh;ere seint thomas &punctelev; schrinede seint edward
At westmunstre, þare he lijth &punctelev; þat bifore king willame was
bote king harald heom was bitueone &punctelev; forto is power no leng nas
Þe loue was euere gret inou&yogh; &punctelev; bitweone seint thomas
And þe kinge, forto þe feond &punctelev; destourbede hit, allas
luyte an luyte þat contek sprong &punctelev; for pouere Mannes ri&yogh;te
paie ore louerd and þe kinge &punctelev; þis holi man ne mi&yogh;te
Þe furste tyme þat seint thomas &punctelev; ovtliche him withseide
hit was for þe king a&yogh;en pouere Men &punctelev; dude onri&yogh;tful dede
¶ Þe king nam fro &yogh;er to &yogh;ere &punctelev; þoru&yogh; Engelond wel wide
After is wille ane summe of panes &punctelev; ideld bieche side
And sethþe þoru anqueste &punctelev; he let þoru&yogh; þe contreies anquere
hov muche ech Man scholde pai&yogh;e &punctelev; and hov muche is ri&yogh;te were
So longue he nam taillage &punctelev; þat he axede atþe laste
Eche &yogh;ere ane certeyne rente &punctelev; þoru&yogh; al engelond wel faste
&YOGH;wat for ei&yogh;e, &yogh;wat for loue &punctelev; no man him ne withseide
bote euere þou&yogh;te seint thomas &punctelev; þat hit was an onri&yogh;tful dede
he þou&yogh;te al on god and on is soule &punctelev; and bilefde al his manhede
And wende forth wel baldeliche &punctelev; to þe king withouten drede
"Sire," he seide, "&yogh;if it is þi wille &punctelev; þou art riche and hende
And king of gret pouwer inov— &punctelev; ore louerd þe more sende
A taillage þov taxt fram &yogh;er to &yogh;er &punctelev; þoru&yogh;out al þi londe
And axest it for a certeine rente &punctelev; with onri&yogh;te, ich onderstonde
For ri&yogh;te rente þov dest it take &punctelev; at a certein daie in þe &yogh;ere
A certeyn summe asigned &punctelev; And so ne dude no king ere
&YOGH;wareþoru&yogh; þat þat certein rente, me þinchez &punctelev; þov ne mi&yogh;t it nou&yogh;t make
A taillage it is, and sumdel &punctelev; with vnri&yogh;te itake."
¶ "Thomas, thomas," quad þe king &punctelev; "þou art mi chaunceler
Þou au&yogh;test more to holden op &punctelev; þane to withseggen mi power."
¶ "Sire," quath þis holi Man &punctelev; "ich habbe ibeo with þe
And þou hast, ore louerd fur&yogh;elde þe &punctelev; gret guod idon me
An oþur baillie ich habbe afongue &punctelev; þei it were a&yogh;en mi wille
And I ne mai nou&yogh;t loki boþe wel &punctelev; bote ich scholde min owene aspille
For ich am to luyte wuyrth &punctelev; þat on forto loke
Þanne dude he gret folie &punctelev; þat boþe me bitoke
Þarefore ich þe &yogh;elde up here &punctelev; alout þe chauncelerie
And take me al to holi churche &punctelev; to god and to seinte Marie."
Þo was þe king wel of Inou&yogh; &punctelev; wroþere þane he was er
Ake naþeles is heorte bar &punctelev; euere to Thomas þer
Þat þridde þing &yogh;eot mest of alle &punctelev; and sonest in wrathþe hem brou&yogh;te
A preost, þat[al. þer] was a luþer Man &punctelev; þat luyte of god rou&yogh;te
Þat of Manslau&yogh;t was bicleoped &punctelev; and þarefore inome also
And In þe bischopes prisone of Salesburi &punctelev; þarefore he was ido
Þe Mannes frend þat was aslawe &punctelev; siweden ope him so faste
So þat þe preost to Iuggement &punctelev; Ibrou&yogh;t was atþe laste
Men acuseden him faste of þe dede. &punctelev; he ne answerede nou&yogh;t þerto
Acke heold him faste to holi churche &punctelev; and ope none oþere he nolde him do
¶ Iloked him was to puyrgi him &punctelev; þoru&yogh; clergie, &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te
And dai him was þarto iset &punctelev; þoru&yogh; holi churche ri&yogh;te
Þo þe dai was icome &punctelev; he ne mi&yogh;te him puyrgi nou&yogh;t
he was sone ilad a&yogh;en &punctelev; and into prisone ibrou&yogh;t
Þo was þe bischop in grete care &punctelev; &yogh;wat þerof were to done
Forto habbe þe wisore red &punctelev; to seint thomas he sende sone
And he him sente word a&yogh;en &punctelev; þat he scholde þene preost take
And onordeini him of euerech ordre &punctelev; and ase a lewede Man him make
And sethþe don him in strongue warde &punctelev; þat he neuereft þarof ne wende
In penaunce and in pine inou&yogh; &punctelev; his sunnes forto amende
Þe bischop of Salesburi &punctelev; dude seint thomas heste
So þat þe preost was ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; In tormenz bi þe meste
Þe tiþinge herof sone &punctelev; to þe kinge cam
Þat a luþer þef, a manquellare &punctelev; hadde a so li&yogh;t dom
him þou&yogh;te þat it nas nou&yogh;t ri&yogh;t &punctelev; ne þat it ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t beo so
And phelipe de boys, a Chanoyne &punctelev; him hadde also misdo
Þarefore was ech oþur clerk &punctelev; þe more him a&yogh;en wille
him þou&yogh;te þat swuch lawe scholde &punctelev; þe pais of þe londe aspille
To westmunstre he let somony &punctelev; alle þe bischopes of engelonde
And oþure, þe gretteste clerkes also &punctelev; and þe hexte, ich onderstonde
[Ait Rex.]¶ "Beav seignours," þe king seide &punctelev; "I not &yogh;wat &yogh;e habbeth iþou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if &yogh;e goth forth with ower wille &punctelev; ore pais ne worth ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if a clerk hath ane Man aslawe &punctelev; oþur strong þeffþe ido
And he mouwe þanne desordeined beo &punctelev; and to liue comen so
heo wollez þanne misdon al day &punctelev; and beon þareoppe wel bolde
And so schal þe pays of þe londe &punctelev; wel vuele beon iholde
Luyte heom wolde rechche &punctelev; to leosen heore ordre so
&YOGH;wane heo for heore ordre ne spariez nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þefþe forto do
And euere þe herre heore ordre is &punctelev; me þinchez bi puyr lawe
þe strengore scholde heore dom beo &punctelev; &yogh;wane heo wolden to þefþe drawe."
[Ait Thomas.]¶ "Sire, sire," quad seint Thomas &punctelev; "&yogh;if it is þi wille
Lothz vs were anyþing to don &punctelev; þi pays forto aspille
Þe clerkus þat beoth Iordeynede &punctelev; þov wost wel heo berez a signe
Þat heo beoth lymes of holi churche &punctelev; þat so noble is and digne
&YOGH;if heo weren with þulke signe &punctelev; to vile deþe ido
Aviled were alholi churche &punctelev; and foule ischend also
And &yogh;if heo beoth formest onordeined &punctelev; and for þulke sulue dede
For it nas neuere lawe ne ri&yogh;t &punctelev; double dom to take
For o trespas, ase &yogh;e wel wuteth &punctelev; and sunne it were to make
And vnwuyrþere þane a lewed Man &punctelev; holi churche were so
A lewed Man for o trespas &punctelev; bote o Iuggement nis ido
Þarefore þine grace we biddeth þe &punctelev; &yogh;if it is þi wille
Þat þov ne arere none newe lawe &punctelev; holi churche to spille
For we biddez ni&yogh;t ant day &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t is forto do
Þat god holde þe þine ri&yogh;te &punctelev; and þine reavme also."
Ich hadde lothz bi mi concience &punctelev; don holi churche wov&yogh;
For lawes þere beoth and costomes &punctelev; þat habbethz euere beon iholde
Of bischopus þoru&yogh; al Engelond &punctelev; ase ovre Aunceteres us tolde
And bi þe kingus daye henries &punctelev; þat ovre grauntsire was
Iconfermede weren and iholde &punctelev; And no man þarea&yogh;en nas
Woltþu þulke lawes holde? &punctelev; do me to witene sone!"
"We schullen do," seint Thomas seide &punctelev; "al þat is to done—[Thomas.]
Alle þe lawes and þe costomes &punctelev; we schullen holde bi ore mi&yogh;te
Þat beothz to holde and habbeth ibeo &punctelev; sire,—sauue oure ri&yogh;te."
[Rex.]"Sauue ouwer ri&yogh;te?" quath þe king &punctelev; "bev sire, &yogh;wi seistþou so
bi þulke worde Ine scholde noþing &punctelev; a&yogh;en þine wille do
Þat þov noldest segge þat it were &punctelev; a&yogh;en holi churche ri&yogh;te
And so þou mi&yogh;test bringe al þat lond &punctelev; In contek and In fi&yogh;te
&YOGH;e moten holde þe lawes &punctelev; forsoþe ich onderstonde
Þat word me þinchez venimous &punctelev; to þe pays of þe londe."
[Thomas.]"Sire," quath þis holi man &punctelev; "ne meue &yogh;e ov ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t
Wel þov wost þat ech of us &punctelev; are we weren hereto ibrou&yogh;t
Trewenesse we þe sworen ase ri&yogh;t was &punctelev; and eorþelich honour also
Sauue ore ordre and ore ri&yogh;te— &punctelev; bote þat was out ido
hou scholde we, sire, nouþe oþur do? &punctelev; &yogh;e ne Au&yogh;ten it us nou&yogh;t beode
For godes loue hold us to ri&yogh;te &punctelev; for nouþe we habbez neode."
Þov art Icome to late &punctelev; to binimen us ovre lawe
Þov woldest makien me more wrechche &punctelev; þane euere ani kyng was
Þareto þov art icome to late &punctelev; þou cast aumbes as."
þe king [aros] in wrathþe anon &punctelev; and let heom sitte echone
Into is chaumbre he wende &punctelev; and ne grette heom neuer one
Fram londone he wende sone &punctelev; In wrathþe ase þei it were
he ne seide no man of is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; ake bilefde heom alle þere
Þare weren fewe bote seint thomas &punctelev; þat toward him ne drou&yogh;
¶ On seint Thomas heo criden faste &punctelev; is þou&yogh;t forte wende
Oþuer he wolde al þat lond &punctelev; for þulke one worde schende
kni&yogh;tes and oþure ofte comen &punctelev; þat with þe kinge were
And beden seint Thomas ententifliche &punctelev; þat he þat word forbere
And þat it were him gret folie &punctelev; þe kinge In wrathþe bringe
And also destourbi al þat lond &punctelev; for so luytel þingue
Seint thomas stod longe in þou&yogh;te. &punctelev; "leoue breþren," he seide
"A&yogh;en þe kyngus honur Ine schal &punctelev; neuere don no dede
Ake euerech word ichulle bileue &punctelev; þat a&yogh;en is honur is."
Þo weren þis oþure glade inou&yogh; &punctelev; þo heo iheorden þis
And radden him wende to þe kinge &punctelev; is wrathþe forto stille
"Lef me were," quath seint Thomas &punctelev; "with ri&yogh;te to don is wille."
He wende to þe kinge to Oxenford &punctelev; and with him þare he fond
grete Eorles and barones also &punctelev; þe hexte of al þe lond
Þe king welcomede seint Thomas &punctelev; ake he ne made him nou&yogh;t fair chere
bischopes and Eorles he let cleopien &punctelev; alle þat þere were
[Rex.]¶ "Bev sire," he seide, "ich am king &punctelev; with ri&yogh;te of þis londe
Customes here weren bifore &punctelev; Ivsed, ich onderstonde
And so muche wrechche nam ich nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat ich nelle þe lawes holde
Þat ovre Auncestres heolden &yogh;wyle &punctelev; ase ore conseil us tolde
Þarefore ichulle þat þulke lawes &punctelev; iconfermede beoth echon
Of mine eorles and mine barones also &punctelev; heo ne withseggez non
Þarefore ich hote ov euerechone &punctelev; þat &yogh;e beon þat ilke dai
At mi maner at Clarindone &punctelev; withouten ani delai
Forto confermi þis lawes. &punctelev; ope peyne þat i schal ou sette
Ich hote þat &yogh;e beon þare echone— &punctelev; þat non oþur ne lette."
So departede þe court þo &punctelev; and euerech to is In drou&yogh;
And euere was seint thomas &punctelev; In care and soruwe inou&yogh;
[Clarendon.]¶ þis bischopes and þe baronie &punctelev; alle comen to þe dai&yogh;e
to clarindone In wilteschire &punctelev; þe kingue forto paye
Þo heo comen to þe parlement &punctelev; þe king axede heom anon
&YOGH;weþur heo wolden holde þe lawes &punctelev; ase heore Auncestres heolden echon
[Thomas.]¶ "Sire, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "&yogh;if it þi wille is
Ech man mot speke for himselue &punctelev; and ich for me, iwis
For mi stat and for holi churche &punctelev; Ich answerie þarto
Þat alle þe olde guode lawes &punctelev; And þat &yogh;eot beoth also
graunti ichulle for holi churche &punctelev; forto habben þin ore
Sauue ore ri&yogh;tes and ore ordre. &punctelev; þou ne mi&yogh;t axi nonmore."
¶ Þe king was wodwroth for þat word &punctelev; þat him gan þo mislike
Seint Thomas wep In is heorte &punctelev; and sore bigan to sike
Alto blodi was þat word iseid &punctelev; and deore it was abou&yogh;t
Þarefore was seint Thomas &punctelev; to stronge deþe ibrou&yogh;t
Þe bischop of Salesburi &punctelev; and of Northwiche also
Wepinde knevleden to seint thomas &punctelev; þat he scholde anoþur do
And habbe revþe of alholi churche &punctelev; and of heom echone
"Þat we ne beon alle to grounde ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; for þulke worde one."
hei&yogh;e Men þat with þe kingue weren &punctelev; mani on als[o] wende
And knevleden to seint Thomas &punctelev; þat word forto amende
¶ "Louerdyngues," quath seint Thomas &punctelev; "ich am &yogh;et a &yogh;ong man
And luyte &yogh;wule habbe bischop ibeo &punctelev; and þaron luytel ich can
Þarefore of ower olde lawes &punctelev; transcrit &yogh;e me take
And þareoppe ichchulle conseillen me &punctelev; &yogh;wuche beon to forsake."
þe king him let a traunscrit take &punctelev; of þis customes echon
Seint Thomas grauntede some of heom &punctelev; and withseide mani on
[Prima lex.]¶ Þe lawes þat ichulle nouþe telle &punctelev; he grauntede wel fawe
'&YOGH;if a bondeman hath ane sone &punctelev; þat to clergie beo idrawe
He[MS. Ne] schal nou&yogh;t withoute is louerdes leue &punctelev; no&yogh;were icrouned beo
For þevMan ne mai nou&yogh;t beon imaket &punctelev; a&yogh;en is louerdes wille freo.'
[Alia lex.]¶ An oþur lawe he grauntede also &punctelev; þat &yogh;e mowen nouþe iseo
'&YOGH;if ani man of holi churche &punctelev; halt aniþing of layfe
person, preost, oþur &yogh;watso he beo &punctelev; he schal don þerefore
Þe seruise þat to þe kinge bifallez &punctelev; þat is ri&yogh;te nere forlore
And In plaidingue stonde in eche place &punctelev; and In iuggement also
bote &yogh;ware ani Man schal beon bileomed &punctelev; oþur to deþe ido.'
[Tertia lex.]¶ He grauntede also, '&yogh;if ani Man &punctelev; þe kingues traytur were
And ani man is chateus &punctelev; to holi churche bere
Þat holi churche ne scholde nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þe chateus with strencþe lette
Ake þe king hem scholde wel baldeliche &punctelev; ase is howene fette
For al þat þe kingus feloun hath &punctelev; þe kingus catel it is
And ech man in holi churche &punctelev; is owene take iwis.'
Seint Thomas grauntede bluþeliche &punctelev; þeos and oþure mo
Ake þeos oþere he withseide— &punctelev; þat dude him muche wo
[Ia contradicta.]¶ '&YOGH;if bitwene tweie lewede men &punctelev; were ani striuingue
Oþur bituene a lewed man and a clerk &punctelev; for holi churche þingue
Ase for Avouweson of churche &punctelev; &yogh;weþur scholde þe churche &yogh;iue
Þe king wolde þat In his court &punctelev; þat plai scholde beon idriue
¶ for ase muche ase a lewed Man &punctelev; þe o partye, was
clanliche onder þe kingue &punctelev; and onder no bischop nas.'
[ija.]¶ An oþur lawe was 'þat no bischop &punctelev; ne clerk noþemo
Scholde out of engelonde &punctelev; withoute þe kingus leue go
And þanne heo scholden swerien heore oth &punctelev; opon þe boke, iwis
Þat heo ne scholden purchaci non vuel &punctelev; þe kingue ne none of his.'
[iija.]¶ Þe þridde was, '&yogh;if ani man &punctelev; In mansingue were ibrou&yogh;t
And sethþe come to amendement &punctelev; and a&yogh;en ri&yogh;te nere nou&yogh;t
Þat he ne scholde nou&yogh;t swerie opon þe boke &punctelev; ake borewes finde he scholde
to stonde to al þat holi churche &punctelev; with ri&yogh;te him lokie wolde.'
[iiija.]¶ Þe ferþe was 'þat no man &punctelev; þat of þe kinge heolde ou&yogh;t
In chief oþur In seruise &punctelev; in mansingue nere ibrou&yogh;t
bote þe wardeins of holi churche &punctelev; brou&yogh;te[al. þat br.] him þerto
Þat[al. þe kyng s.] seiden, oþur is baillifs &punctelev; &yogh;wat he hadde misdo
And lokede formest &yogh;weþer heo wolden &punctelev; to amendement it bringe
And bote huy wolden, bi heore leue &punctelev; þanne don þe mansingue.'
[va.]¶ Þe fifte was 'þat no bischopriche &punctelev; ne non Abbeie also,[al. þat bischopriches: & abbayes also]
Þat were voyde withoute prelat &punctelev; In þe kingus hond were Ido
And þe king scholde al þat lond &punctelev; ase is owene take
Forto atþe laste þat him luste &punctelev; ani prelat make
And þanne scholde þilke prelat &punctelev; of is chapele ichose beo
Of is clerkus &yogh;wuch þat he wolde &punctelev; þat benefiz to biseo
And þanne &yogh;wane he were ichose &punctelev; In is chapele þere
homage he scholde don to him &punctelev; are he jconfermed were.'
[vja.]¶ Þe sixte was, '&yogh;if ani plait &punctelev; to chapitle were idrawe
And ani man made ani apel &punctelev; &yogh;if men duden him a&yogh;en lawe
Þat to þe bischop fram þe Ercedekne &punctelev; his apel [he][om.] scholde make
And fram þe bischop to þe Erchebischop &punctelev; and sethþe non herre take
bote þe Erchebischopes court &punctelev; to ri&yogh;te him wolle[r. wolde] bringe
Þat he scholde fram þulke court &punctelev; bicleopien to þe kinge
And fram þe kinge non herre'— &punctelev; so þat atþenende
Þe playdingue fram holi churche &punctelev; to þe kingue scholde iwende
And þe king amendi scholde &punctelev; þe Erchebischopes dede
And beon chief of holi churche— &punctelev; ake seint thomas it withseide
[vija.]¶ Þe seueþe was 'þat playdingue &punctelev; þat of dette were
forto &yogh;elde þoru&yogh; treuþe ipli&yogh;t &punctelev; and nou&yogh;t iholde nere
Alþei it þoru&yogh; treuþe were &punctelev; þe playdinge scholde beon ibrou&yogh;t
bifore þe kinge and is baillifs &punctelev; and to holi churche nou&yogh;t.'
[viija.]¶ Þe ei&yogh;teþe was 'þat In þe londe &punctelev; citation non nere
Þoru&yogh; bulle of þe pope of rome &punctelev; Ake clanliche bileued were.'
[ixa.]¶ Þe Ninþe was 'þat peteres panes &punctelev; þat men gaderiez mani on
Þe pope nere nou&yogh;t on isend &punctelev; ake þe kingue euerechon.'
[xa.]¶ Þe teoþe was, '&yogh;if ani clerk &punctelev; ase felun were itake
And for kingus felon jproued were &punctelev; and he ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t forsake
And þoru&yogh; ri&yogh;t Iuggement of þe londe &punctelev; bringe him of lijfdawe.'
Þeos customes, and manie oþere &punctelev; þe king pulte forth anon
And het þoru&yogh;out al þis lond &punctelev; þat Men heom heolden echon
Þene feorþe dai bifore candelemasse &punctelev; þo þis was ido
Þe king het seint thomas anon &punctelev; and þe oþere bischopus also
On þis chartre heore seles sette &punctelev; þat non afturtale nere
Þat þulke costomes weren iholde &punctelev; þoru&yogh; al þe londe þere
"Sire, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "for godes loue þin ore
to conseili us betere &yogh;if us furst &punctelev; are we speken herof more!"
So þat respit was þarof Inome &punctelev; and ech wende In his side
¶ Seint thomas nam þat transcrit &punctelev; and nolde no lengore abide
hov he mi&yogh;te holi churche schilde &punctelev; fram þis muchele wov&yogh;
&yogh;wane oþur Men weren faste aslepe &punctelev; he wep and si&yogh;te sore
"And Iesus[al. & bad god] helpe holi churche" &punctelev; and cride him milce and ore
he isai þat þer nas bote o wei &punctelev; oþur he moste stif beo
Oþur holi churche was al bineþe &punctelev; þat with ri&yogh;te was so freo
Sori and careful he was Inov &punctelev; þat he tok on so
Forto entri into Answere &punctelev; þare he ne ou&yogh;te nou&yogh;t to do
Þat he afeng þat transcrit &punctelev; and respit hadde ibede
For him þou&yogh;te þat alholi churche &punctelev; In þat he misdude
For holi churche ne scholde &punctelev; In none stude stonde to dome
Ne Ansuerie kinge ne prince noþur &punctelev; bote þe pope of rome
¶ Þe deol þat thomas makede &punctelev; no tounge telle ne may
"Louerd," he seide, "alas, alas &punctelev; þat ich euere isai&yogh; þis day
Þat ich þe warde of holi churche &punctelev; so folliche scholde take
And so freo ase heo was er &punctelev; þus þeu sethþe hire make
heo þat was er so hei&yogh; and freo &punctelev; bi mine Auncestres daye
Þat ich hire scholde bineoþe bringe &punctelev; Allas! and so bitraie
for þis Martyrs þat &yogh;wylene weren &punctelev; for hire to stronge deþe ido
heo is nouþe þev þoru&yogh; me imaked! &punctelev; Allas, &yogh;wi dude ich so
luytel wuyrth ich am of holi churche &punctelev; wardein forto beo
For ich nam nou&yogh;t, ase ri&yogh;t was &punctelev; fram none ordre inome
Ake fram hei&yogh;e kingus court to holi churche &punctelev; and þat wolde vuele bicome
Of houndes ich was wardeyn &punctelev; and of hauekes with þe king
And nov am wardein of soulene imaked &punctelev; and þat ne Ioyneth noþing
Ich þat forsok min owene &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle ich was chaunceler
So manie soulene habbe to loke &punctelev; allas! &yogh;wat schal ich her
Ich drede þat god habbe me fursake &punctelev; hov tok ich on, alas!"
Þe deol þat þis holi man makede &punctelev; withouten ende it was
he wep and si&yogh;te ny&yogh;t and dai &punctelev; and heold him al forlore
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te asoilled beo &punctelev; to þe pope he wolde þerfore
And wende toward Caunterburi. &punctelev; sone þe kinge men tolde
Þat þe Erchebischop nolde nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þe newe statuz holde
Þe king het his baillifs sone &punctelev; and sende aboute is sonde
Þat heo scholden greui seint thomas &punctelev; oueral on is londes
¶ Þis baillifs weren preste inov&yogh; &punctelev; and ope is maneres wel faste
Nomen is bodene and greueden him— &punctelev; heo wenden þarewith him agaste
Seint thomas let heom al iworþe &punctelev; and opon ore louerd is heorte caste
And wende him wel priueliche &punctelev; bi ny&yogh;te atþe laste
to þe se, toward rome &punctelev; þat none of is men it nuste
bote twey Men þat he tok with him &punctelev; þat is priuete mest wusten
Sethþe þo is men him misten &punctelev; and nusten &yogh;ware he bicam
And seien þat heo withoute louerd weren &punctelev; euerech is red nam
forto don euerech is beste &punctelev; ech wende In is side
Ase men þat weren louerdlese— &punctelev; heo nusten &yogh;wat abide
Þis holi Man wende him forth &punctelev; and dude him In schipe sone
And wende forþeward in þe se &punctelev; ase he þou&yogh;te forto done
¶ Þe wind cam ase ore louerd it wolde &punctelev; and drof him a&yogh;en to londe
Sethþe he wende eft into þe se &punctelev; þe passage forto fonde
Þe wind cam and drof him a&yogh;ein. &punctelev; and ofte[al. eft] In he wende
And euere he was a&yogh;en idriue &punctelev; ase ore louerd þe grace him sende
Þat he þe &yogh;eot of londe wende &punctelev; he turnde a&yogh;en wel stille
