On of is seriaunz sat a ni&yogh;t &punctelev; þe &yogh;wile þat men woke
In his chaumbre at caunterburi[MS. caum|terburl] &punctelev; þe chaumbre forto loke
In þe Eueninge he bad is knaue &punctelev; to steken þe dore faste
Þis knaue eode toward þe dore &punctelev; is ei&yogh;ene aboute he caste
Þo isai&yogh; he þis holi man &punctelev; In one huyrne stonde
he orn and tolde his maister fore &punctelev; and þonkede godes sonde
Þe seriaunt ne lefde þat nou&yogh;t &punctelev; naþeles op he aros
And fond seint Thomas In þe huyrne &punctelev; and sumdel him agros
¶ Heo setten bord and spradden cloth &punctelev; and bigonne to soupe faste
Seint thomas tolde hem þo &punctelev; wel Mildeliche atþe laste
&YOGH;wodere he þou&yogh;te to habbe iwent &punctelev; and &yogh;wuch cas god him sende
And hou it nas nou&yogh;t godes wille &punctelev; þat he þe &yogh;wyt forth wende
Þe tiþinge to þe kinge cam &punctelev; þat þe guode Man sein thomas
A&yogh;en þe status of clarindone &punctelev; of londe iwent he was
For þat o statuit was þat no bischop &punctelev; ne scholde bi none ende
Withoute leue of þe kinge &punctelev; oute of londe wende
Ake þe king sende is men sone &punctelev; to saisi al is lond
And also al is bischopriche &punctelev; ase is traitores, Into is hond
Þis baillifs comen to caunterburi &punctelev; ase heo ihote were
¶ Þo heo wenden to habben al heore wille &punctelev; heo founden seint thomas þere
Noþing ne mi&yogh;ten heo saisi þo &punctelev; heore wei heo hadden forlore
Also huy comen heo wenden a&yogh;en &punctelev; and tolde þe kinge fore.
&YOGH;uyt seint thomas him biþou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat he wolde fondi more
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te of þe kinge habbe &punctelev; betere grace and ore
he &yogh;arknede him wel mildeliche &punctelev; and to him þane wei he nam
At is manere at wodestoke &punctelev; to þe kinge he cam
Ase is erþeliche louerd &punctelev; he grette him, faire inov&yogh;
"thomas," he seide, "hou is þis? &punctelev; beo we so grete fon
Þat we ne mowen in one londe wonie? &punctelev; thomas, hov schal þis gon?"
"Sire, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "god ne late hit neuere so beo
Ake god us sende, and holi churche &punctelev; betere grace to þe
And sende þe wille to louien hire bet &punctelev; And Iesus for is mi&yogh;te
Ne late me neuere a&yogh;ein þi wille &punctelev; don þing with onri&yogh;te."
¶ Þe Erchebischop of Euerwyke &punctelev; fondede forto bringe
Acord and loue bi is pouwer &punctelev; bitwene thomas and þe king
Þe king swor anon is othþ &punctelev; þat non oþur acord he nolde
bote þat þe status of clarindone &punctelev; ech bischop holde scholde
And nameliche þeos bifore alle oþure &punctelev; '&yogh;if a clerk hath misdo
And he þe kingus felun ipreoued were &punctelev; and for þeofþe also
Þat Men him[MS. him him] scholden desordeini &punctelev; and sethþe anon þoru&yogh; lawe
to þe kingus baillifs deliueri him &punctelev; to anhangi oþur todrawe.'
Seint thomas isai&yogh; wel þo &punctelev; þat þare nas wei bote on
Oþur he moste stif withstonde &punctelev; oþur is ri&yogh;tes forgon
¶ he þou&yogh;te þat he nolde neuere &punctelev; holi churche bitraye
Ne þat heo ne scholde beo in suyche seruage &punctelev; neuere bi is daye
Raþur he wolde, ase oþere weren &punctelev; to Martyrdom beon ido
Þane holi churche were so bineoþe— &punctelev; Iredi he was þarto
Neuere ne mi&yogh;ten þe king ne he &punctelev; noþing acordi þer
Ake departeden al with wrathþe &punctelev; ase heo hadden idon ofte er
Þe king makede him wroth inov&yogh; &punctelev; þat so ofte in barate was
For o man þat him withseide &punctelev; and non oþur a&yogh;ein him nas
In grete wrathþe he swor is oth &punctelev; þat he wolde of him beon awreke
And þat þe holi Man scholde &punctelev; anoþur with him speke
he let somony seint thomas &punctelev; þat þe nexte þoresdaie he were
At Norehamptoune bifore seint lucus dai &punctelev; to &yogh;iuen him Answere
And alle þe bischopus of þe lond &punctelev; And þe baronie also
he het beon þare at þulke daie &punctelev; is hestes forto do
Alle seint thomas londes &punctelev; into is hond his men nome
Ase it were forto destreynen[MS. destruyen] him &punctelev; þat he to his court come
¶ Ore louerd helpe nouþe seint thomas &punctelev; for oþur frend nath he non
Among so manie tyraunz forto come &punctelev; þat weren alle is fon
bodi and soule he bitok &punctelev; Iesu, godus sone
And to is daie ase he Isomoned was &punctelev; wende to Norehamptone
In þe castel sat þe motinge &punctelev; of þis tyraunz echon
Þis holi man agodes name &punctelev; among[MS. a mond] heom wende anon
¶ "Sire king," he seide, "god þe loke &punctelev; and saui þi dignite
Somounz ich hadde at þis daie &punctelev; here to Ansuerien þe
Ake non Erchebischop of caunturburi &punctelev; nas neuere isomoned so
Ne so destreyned of no king. &punctelev; I not &yogh;wat þov me þencst to do
I not &yogh;wat is þe newe statuit &punctelev; þat þou þencst forth to drawe
bote hit beo on of clarindone &punctelev; þat þou woldest bringe to lawe
On me nastþu power non &punctelev; swych destresse forto do
Heued of holi churche ich am imaked &punctelev; þei ich onwuyrth beo þerto
And also ich am þi gostlich fader &punctelev; þei[MS. þei þou] of me luytel þov lete
It nas neuere ri&yogh;t ordre þat þe sone &punctelev; is fader scholde bete
Ne þat desciple beote is maister. &punctelev; al þis were a&yogh;en lawe
Al þis, hoso ri&yogh;t bihalt &punctelev; þov biginnest forth to drawe
And þis bischopes also guod &punctelev; þat wardeins beoth mid me
to holde op þe honur of holi churche &punctelev; and þe þi dignite
heo beoth nouþe aboute hire forto schende &punctelev; and bringe Into vilte
gret reuþe it is þat Man schal so &punctelev; hire bringe bineþe for me
&YOGH;if þov wolt ou&yogh;t to me &punctelev; þov wost wel ine may nou&yogh;t fi&yogh;te
Ich am &yogh;are deth forto afonge &punctelev; for holi churche ri&yogh;te."
[Rex.]¶ "Inelle no man," quad þe king &punctelev; "for holi churche quelle
beau sire, þov spext ase a fol &punctelev; anoþur þov schalt me telle
Acke com tomorewe bi spechetyme— &punctelev; þat þov þinne dai ne breke!
And Ansuere me of oþur þinge &punctelev; þat ichulle to þe speke."
Þus departede þe court þo. &punctelev; amorewe, þene friday
Seint thomas wende þudere a&yogh;en &punctelev; þo he þe time isai
Þe king [sat] an hei in is sce &punctelev; and acoupede him wel faste
"Þov were," he seide, "mi chaunceler— &punctelev; ake alto longe it laste
Ich þe lende þo fif hondred pound &punctelev; and þov ne &yogh;olde me nou&yogh;t on
Sete me þarof ane schorte day &punctelev; for þov schalt heom &yogh;elde echon."
[Thomas.]¶ "Sire, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "god sende us bet þin ore
Ine wende neuere of þulke panes &punctelev; iheore acountes more
For ich hadde þulke tyme &punctelev; betere grace to ov&yogh;
Þulke panes þo þov me &yogh;eue &punctelev; and woldest &yogh;et wel mo
Sire, þarof ich am suyþe wel aknowe &punctelev; þat ich heom afeng of þe
Of þine &yogh;ifte with guode heorte &punctelev; forsoþe þov &yogh;eue hem me
And so hei&yogh; man ase þov art &punctelev; it mi&yogh;te wel beo stille
to Axi þing þat þov &yogh;eue er &punctelev; with þine so guode wille."
[Rex.]¶ "Nov, louerdingus," quath þe king &punctelev; "alle &yogh;e iheorez þis
Þat of þat tresor þat he is aknowe &punctelev; þat ich him tok iwis
Þe &yogh;ifte ne mai he proui nou&yogh;t &punctelev; Ase alle &yogh;e mowen iseo
Iugement ich axi of þis court &punctelev; hou it þareof schal beo."
Þe court him lokede &punctelev; ase he was &punctelev; aknowe of þat þing
And ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t þe &yogh;ifte preoui &punctelev; to &yogh;elden ech ferþing
Þe king him het þe panewes &yogh;elde &punctelev; oþur sikernesse him make
Oþur is Marschales scholden swiþe anon &punctelev; is bodi to prisone take
Þis holi man of is bischopriche &punctelev; hadde wel luytel guod
Ake al helples among is fon &punctelev; withoute conseille he stod
Þe Marchales iredie weren &punctelev; to prisone him lede anon
heo heten him don heom sikernesse &punctelev; oþur he scholde with hem gon
Þis holi man nuste non oþur red &punctelev; bote soffri al heore wou&yogh;
Fif kni&yogh;tes nomen hem to rede &punctelev; and wenden to þe kingue
And token an hond for seint thomas &punctelev; of alle þulke þinge
euerech of an hondret pound &punctelev; for þis seli man to paie
Þo was þis guode Man quit Inov &punctelev; ase at þulke daie
¶ AMoruwe, þene saturdai &punctelev; to court eftsone he wende
Forto heore þe kingus wille &punctelev; &yogh;if is heorte wolde ou&yogh;t amende
Þe kyng sat adoun In is sce &punctelev; thomas bifore him stod
"bel ami, þou hast," quad þe king &punctelev; "istole me muchel guod
Mi chaunceler þov were, alto longe &punctelev; and haddest In þin hond
Abbeies and bischopriches &punctelev; and muche del of þat lond
And þov ne &yogh;olde me þarof none acountes. &punctelev; þat rewez me wel sore
Þarof þritti þousent pound &punctelev; þov me schalt, and wel more
Þarefore make þe &yogh;are inov &punctelev; þine acountes to &yogh;elde
Sikur þov beo þov schalt it do &punctelev; &yogh;if ich þe may awelde."
Alle þat heorden þeos demaunde &punctelev; In grete wonder stoden þere
And to[al. ech to o.] oþur seide þo &punctelev; þat heo ne heorden þerof neuer er
And þat seint thomas was al bineþe &punctelev; and ope þe pointe he was
to beon icast In prisone &punctelev; for non oþur wei þare nas
Seint thomas stod In þou&yogh;te longue &punctelev; and with ri&yogh;te þe kinge bed
Þat he moste is conseil nime &punctelev; of þat he hadde to him iseid
Þe bischopes he nam to is conseil &punctelev; þe king ne wernde him nou&yogh;t
In one Chaumbre, faste iloke &punctelev; alle heo weren ibrou&yogh;t
Þat he ne scholden ascapien &punctelev; are heo hore answere seide
"Nov, louerdinges," quad þis guode man &punctelev; "herof &yogh;e moten me rede
For, also god me bringe of care &punctelev; Ine habbe þarof gult non
Ake me forto schende he axeth þis &punctelev; with onri&yogh;te echon
For ich was with him er wel inov &punctelev; and þat bringeth me nouþe in teone
Þare ne tok ich no witnesse &punctelev; of þat us was bitweone."
[Consilium. episcopus Wincestrie.]¶ Þe bischop henri of winchestre &punctelev; furst bigan him rede
"S[i]re," he seide, "þus me þinchez &punctelev; þov mi&yogh;t don of þis dede
Forsoþe me þinchez with gret wrong &punctelev; þe calangez þe king
Þo þov wendest of his seruise &punctelev; he ne Axede þe noþing
And þo þov þe bischopriche afenge &punctelev; so clene and so freo
Þat þov of none oþur þinge &punctelev; ne scholdest icharget beo
And he quath þe quit al clanliche &punctelev; of ech oþur wike þer
An ne axede þe noþing &punctelev; of þat þov haddest idon er
&YOGH;wareþoru me þinchez of none þinge &punctelev; þou ne schalt ansuerien nou&yogh;t
bote to god and holi churche— &punctelev; of alle oþere þov art ibrou&yogh;t."
[episcopus london'.]¶ Þe bischop gilbard of londone &punctelev; seide þo his avis
"Sire," he seide, "&yogh;if þov þe biþenchest &punctelev; ase a guod Man schal and wis
&YOGH;wat power þe king þe hath bitake &punctelev; and to &yogh;wuche guode ibr[o]u&yogh;t
Al is wille þov most soffri &punctelev; and a&yogh;en him ne beo þov nou&yogh;t
In muche wo þov bringst us alle &punctelev; and holi churche also
And þin owene bodi In perile &punctelev; bote þov is wille do
&YOGH;if þov þis wel onderstode &punctelev; me þinchez forsoþe, iwis
Þov woldest fondi him to paye &punctelev; and elles þov dudest amis."
[episcopus Wincestrie.]¶ Þo seide þe bischop of wynchestre &punctelev; "sire gilbert, beo stille
We sospendiez swuch conseil &punctelev; for it nis nou&yogh;t wurth a fille
&YOGH;if þe Erchebischop scholde beo &punctelev; al to þe kynges wille
Þe honour of holi churche he lore &punctelev; and is soule he mi&yogh;te so spille."
[episcopus Cicestrie.]¶ Þe bischop hyllarie of Chichestre &punctelev; bigan to speke þo
"Sire," he seide, "mi conseil is &punctelev; houso it euere go
Forto fondi In faire manere &punctelev; to paie þe kingues wille
With faire biheste, forto eftsone &punctelev; þat it were sumdel stille
Þanne we mi&yogh;ten, &yogh;wane we weren &punctelev; of þusse destresse ibrou&yogh;t
Þe betere acheui In ore conseille— &punctelev; for nouþe ne do we ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t."
[episcopus lincoln'.]¶ Þe bischop Robert of lincolne &punctelev; radde wel þareto
"Sire Erchebischop," he seide &punctelev; "forsoþe þov most it do
Oþur þov schalt leose þine bischopriche &punctelev; and perAuenture þi lif
Þanne bi&yogh;ete þov wel luyte &punctelev; me þinchez, of þis strif."
[episcopus Exon'.]¶ Þe bischop bartholmev of Eccetre &punctelev; bigan to segge is þou&yogh;t
"In al þe soruwe of þe world &punctelev; and care we beoth ibrou&yogh;t
betere it were þat on heued &punctelev; In peril him brou&yogh;te
Þane alholie churche were bineþe &punctelev; and ido to nou&yogh;te."
[episcopus Wigorn'.]¶ Þe bischop Roger of wyrecestre &punctelev; longe in þou&yogh;te stod
"Inelle ov segge on ne oþur &punctelev; for inot &yogh;wat is guod
&YOGH;if ich radde him fortabouwien &punctelev; alto þe kingus wille
Min owene Mouth himsulf demez &punctelev; alholi churche to spille
And &yogh;if ich rede a&yogh;en him to beo &punctelev; In þis place sum is
Þat wolde telle þe kinge fore &punctelev; and maken him mi fo, iwis—"
bi þe bischope of londone &punctelev; þat ilke word he sede
for he was euere a&yogh;ein seint thomas &punctelev; with wordes and with dedes
"Þarefore," he seide, "on ne oþur &punctelev; Inelle segge iwis
guod conseil god us &yogh;iue— &punctelev; for muche neod it is."
Þare nas non þat couþe is conseil &punctelev; with menske bringe to ende
Ne þat wuste hov heo mi&yogh;ten best &punctelev; ovt of þe chaumbre wende
[Thomas.]¶ Atþe laste ope seint thomas &punctelev; þis conseil moste al gon
Tweie eorles of þe kingus hous &punctelev; he let cleopie anon
"Louerdingus," he seide, "we habbez ispeke &punctelev; faste of þusse þinge
And also fer forth ase we mowen &punctelev; we wollez paye þe kinge
Ake for we nabbeth nou&yogh;t iredi here &punctelev; ore conseil alclene
Forto þe nexte daie we biddez furst &punctelev; þat &yogh;e it graunti nouþe ene."
So þat heom was respit igraunted &punctelev; and ech wende in is wei&yogh;e
Manie of seint thomas men &punctelev; bilefden him for ei&yogh;e
And kni&yogh;tes þat with him weren &punctelev; alle fram him heo drowe
Seint thomas nam pouere men &punctelev; bi þe weie inowe
And ladde hem to is Inne &punctelev; and to þe mete heom sette
he seruede heom is owene bodi &punctelev; And inov&yogh; mete and drinke heom fette
"Þis beoth," he seide, "godes kni&yogh;tes &punctelev; þis oþur men me habbeth for|sake
Þeos kni&yogh;tes ich loue more &punctelev; to heom ichulle me take."
Þene sonenday þare nas no court iholde &punctelev; for it was an hei&yogh;day
And þe Monenday sore syk &punctelev; þe bischop thomas lay
In þe syknesse of maldeflanke &punctelev; þat to him ofte cam
And for þe care þat he was Inne &punctelev; wel þe worse him nam
Men seiden þat he makede him sik &punctelev; for he ne dorste to court wende
Þe king in grete wrathþe inov&yogh; &punctelev; after him gan sende
"Wel &yogh;e iseoth," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "þat Ine may come nou&yogh;t
Forsoþe tomoruwe ichulle &punctelev; hovso ich beo þudere ibrou&yogh;t
Þei ich schulle beo þudere ibore &punctelev; In baruwe oþur In bere
Þudere ichulle, þoru&yogh; godes grace— &punctelev; crist me helpe þere."
Amorewe, þane tywesday &punctelev; ore louerd him gan arere
Þe furste dai after seint lucus dai &punctelev; ase it fallez In þe &yogh;ere
Þat dai he au&yogh;te onderstonde &punctelev; and mani an oþur also
For bi custome alle is grete anuy &punctelev; bi twyesdai cam him to
Alle þe bischopes þane tywesday &punctelev; erliche to him wende
And seiden, "sire, þov art in feble point— &punctelev; god it þe amende
We habbez ore red þarof inome &punctelev; and mid one mouþe echon
to queme þe kinge we redez þe &punctelev; hovso it euere gon
Oþur he þe wole bere on hond &punctelev; þat þov art is traitur
And furswore &yogh;wore[al. &yogh;wane þu swore] him to don &punctelev; eorþelich honovr
And ne dost him non ake tricherie— &punctelev; he þe wole bere on honde
And binime þe þi stat &punctelev; and perantur bringue þe out of londe."
¶ "Mine leoue breþren," quad seint thomas &punctelev; "&yogh;e iseoz wel echon
Þat al þe world grat on me one &punctelev; and alle [beoz] mine fon
And þat [is] &yogh;uyt mest reuþe of alle &punctelev; þat &yogh;e þat mine breþren beoz
And me, þei ich sunful beo &punctelev; ouwer fader In torment iseoz
&YOGH;e beoz mine meste fon of alle &punctelev; and also &yogh;e bez al&yogh;are
In seculer court to demen me &punctelev; and þat nolde nou&yogh;t wel fare
For &yogh;e habbez þis among ov today &punctelev; bispeke swyþe ilome
Nov god helpe alholi churche &punctelev; and take þarto gome
Ake In obedience ich ov hote &punctelev; þat &yogh;e þarenei&yogh; ne beon
&YOGH;if ich am ibrou&yogh;t to Iuggement &punctelev; ake þat &yogh;e raþur fleon
And &yogh;if ani man hond on ov[al. me] set &punctelev; ich ov hote also
Þat &yogh;e þe sentence of holi churche &punctelev; for swuche violence &yogh;e[om. &yogh;e] do
And holdez vp holi churche ri&yogh;te &punctelev; þat ov is bitake
Man ne schal for none drede of deþe &punctelev; hire ri&yogh;tes forsake."
Þe bischopes weren þo wroþe inou&yogh; &punctelev; ant wenden to court echone
Nou god helpe þis holi man &punctelev; for he was þare al one
bote þe bischop of wynchestre &punctelev; þere ne lefde with him nou&yogh;t on
And Iocelin, þe bischop of Salesburi &punctelev; þat ne weren alle fram him igon
¶ Þis holi man truste muche to god &punctelev; and greiþed him anon
And song ane Masse of seinte steuene &punctelev; are he come among is fon
he song þulke masse ilome &punctelev; for also heo biginnez
Þe furste offiz is propre inov &punctelev; to þe stat þat he was Inne
Þe biginninge of þulke masse &punctelev; In englischs so is þis
"For &yogh;wane þe princes habbez isete &punctelev; and a&yogh;en heom men spekez,[al. a&yogh;en me speke] iwis
And luþere men pursiweden me &punctelev; louerd, min help þov beo!"[Ps. 119.]
Manie seiden þat þis iheorden &punctelev; "novþe we mouwen wel iseo
Þat he singuth þis Masse for þenones &punctelev; for þe kinge and for alle his
And þat he halt heom alle luþere &punctelev; þat a&yogh;en him spekez, iwis."
Þis word cam to court wel sone— &punctelev; &yogh;wareþoru&yogh; heo weren echon
In þe more wrathþe a&yogh;ein him &punctelev; and wel þe more is fon
¶ Þo seint thomas hadde is masse isongue &punctelev; his chesible he gan of weue
Alle is oþur uestimenz &punctelev; on him he let bileue
Oþur Armure nadde he non &punctelev; for holi churche to fi&yogh;te
Aboue he caste is cope &punctelev; þat bifeol to is ri&yogh;te
he tok godes flechs and is blod &punctelev; with him swiþe stilleliche
Ane Creoyz he nam in is hond &punctelev; and wende forth baldeliche
Þe uestimenz was is Armure &punctelev; ase bifeol to swuche ane kni&yogh;te
Þe fourme of þe creoiz was is baner &punctelev; for holi churche to fi&yogh;te
Forth wende þis guode kni&yogh;t &punctelev; among alle is fon
Swete Iesus beo is help &punctelev; oþur frend nadde he non
Þe creoiz in is hond he bar forth &punctelev; and arerde op is baner
Þe bischop Robert of hereford &punctelev; bigan to gon him ner
"Sire," he seide, "ich crie þin ore &punctelev; þi chapeleyn ich mote beo
bifore þe lat me bere þe croiz &punctelev; for it ne fallez nou&yogh;t to þe."
"Þe &yogh;wyle ich hire bere," quad seint thomas &punctelev; "and þe fourme iseo
Ich ne drede me of no man &punctelev; þe hardiore ich may beo."
Þanne seide þe bischop of londone &punctelev; þat euere was is fo
"Ine rede nou&yogh;t þat þou bifore þe kingue &punctelev; In swyche manere go
For wrathi he wole him anon &punctelev; and awreken him In þe place."
¶ "Ich bitake me," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "al to godus grace."
"Þov hast euere al þi lif," þis oþur seide &punctelev; "a muche fol ibeo
And þi folie nelt neuere bileue &punctelev; ase men mai nouþe iseo."
[Curia.]Þis holi Man wiz is creoiz &punctelev; Into þis court gan gon
[Rex.]And þo þe king isai&yogh; him so come &punctelev; he wrathþede him anon
¶ "Louerdinges," he seide, "here &yogh;e iseoz &punctelev; hov þis man me schent
In &yogh;wuche manere is he Into þis court &punctelev; among us hidere iwent
Ase þei we ne lefden nou&yogh;t on cristindom &punctelev; ne In godes name
Ne mot ich nedes awreke me? &punctelev; ne doth he me gret schame?"
Þo seide al þe court anon &punctelev; "sire, wel &yogh;e mouwen iseo
Þat [he] is prou&yogh;t and conteckor &punctelev; and euere hath ibeo
In despijt of þe and alle þine &punctelev; þis dede he hath ido
For &yogh;if þou wolt, þou mi&yogh;t beon iwar &punctelev; eftsone to take on so
to bringe men In so gret povwer &punctelev; swiche ase he is
to beon þe hexte of þine londe &punctelev; ase þou madest him, iwis
Þarefore we ne bimenez þe nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þou noldest beo iwar bifore
We seggez bi him echone &punctelev; þat he is puyrliche forswore
And ase bi a swuch Man þou do bi him &punctelev; and ase bi þine fon
For he þe swor eorthþelich honur &punctelev; and nele don þe non."
Þe budeles and þe oþur schrewes &punctelev; grenneden on him faste
And euere abiden þe kinges heste &punctelev; In prisone him to caste
¶ Þe king let crie anon aboute &punctelev; &yogh;if ani so wod were
Þat stode In conseile wit seint thomas &punctelev; oþur felau&yogh;schipe him bere
Ase þe kingus traitour &punctelev; Men scholden him nime anon
And laten him al one stonde &punctelev; and fondi &yogh;wodere he wolde gon (!)
Þe bischop of Eccestre to seint thomas &punctelev; he feol adoun akne
"For godes loue þin ore! &punctelev; for soruwes þat þov mi&yogh;t ise
haue reuþe of þe and of us &punctelev; oþur þou wolt us alle schende
Alle we worþez ibrou&yogh;t to nou&yogh;te &punctelev; bote þov þi þou&yogh;t wende."
"Sire bischop," quad seint thomas &punctelev; "ase wel þou mi&yogh;t be stille
go henne fram me &yogh;if þov wolt &punctelev; and lat ech man don is wille."
Þe bischopes wenden togadere echone &punctelev; and heore conseil nome
And þo heo hadden heore fourme iset &punctelev; to þe kinge a&yogh;en heo come
¶ "Sire," heo seiden, "&yogh;e beoth anuyd &punctelev; and þat us forþinchez sore
For&yogh;if us þat &yogh;e on us berez &punctelev; we nellez þe misdon nonmore
Wel we wutez þat þis wrechche &punctelev; þat scholde ore chief beo
he is fals and forsworen &punctelev; and [þat][om.] mai ech man wel iseo
For he suor to holde þe eorþelich honur &punctelev; and hath ibroke is oth
And þat man mai wel proui on him &punctelev; &yogh;if &yogh;e nellez nou&yogh;t beo wroth
Fur&yogh;if us þine wrathþe, we biddez þe &punctelev; ant to rome we wollez wende
to binimen him is Erchebischopriche &punctelev; and ase a wrechche him schende
Puyrliche forsuore we schullen him preoui &punctelev; sire king, bi eovwer rede."
Þe king bihet heom gret honur &punctelev; to don þat ilke dede
to seint thomas, þare he was &punctelev; heo wenden alle anon
Þe bischop hyllarie of Chichestre &punctelev; tolde for heom echon
"Sire," he seide, "ore gostliche fader &punctelev; þov were herebifore
For fader we fursaketh [þe] &punctelev; þov art fals and forswore
For þou suore þe kynge eorþelich honour &punctelev; and nelt don him non
Þarefore to þe court of rome &punctelev; we bicleopiez þe echon
to ansuerien us bifore þe pope &punctelev; of þat þov hast ido amis."
"Louerdingus," quath þis holie man &punctelev; "ich iheore wel al þis."
¶ Nov suete Ihesu beo is freond &punctelev; &yogh;wane alle oþure were is fon
Þe king him let cleopien faste &punctelev; þat he come forth anon
Þe Eorl Robert of lecestre &punctelev; and oþur men mani on
Comen after him and heten him sone &punctelev; bifore þe kingue gon
"Louerdingues," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "&yogh;e wuyten wel echon
hou wel ich was with þe king &punctelev; þei ich habbe nouþe manie fon
Erchebischop he made me— &punctelev; forsoþe a&yogh;ein mi wille
For euere ich dradde for oncunninge &punctelev; mi soule forto spille
¶ Þo axede ich bifore al þat folk &punctelev; In &yogh;wuche manere he me toke
Þe Maistrie of holi churche &punctelev; to wardi and to loke
holi churche me was bitake &punctelev; In eche manere so freo
Þat ich were quit of alle oþure courtes— &punctelev; and &yogh;eot with ri&yogh;te it scholde so beo
And &yogh;wane holi churche is so freo &punctelev; Inelle ansuerien þe kingue
Ne non oþur in his court &punctelev; of none eorþeliche þinge
For gold ne passez nou&yogh;t so muche &punctelev; In bounte led, iwis
Also dignete of þe preost &punctelev; herre þane þe kingus is
And is gostliche fader ich am &punctelev; &yogh;if he wolde nime &yogh;eme
And it nere no lawe þat þe sone &punctelev; þe fader scholde deme
Þarefore i segge at o word &punctelev; þat Inelle me noþing take
to Iuggement of kingus court &punctelev; ake clanliche it wolle forsake
And take me to holi churche &punctelev; and to none erþeliche dome
And Ich bicleopie ov here echone &punctelev; to þe court of rome
Al þe stat of holi churche &punctelev; and al mi dignite
¶ Þoru&yogh; Ihesu crist it beo iwardet &punctelev; &yogh;wan it ne mai oþur beo
And ou bischopus ich bicleopie &punctelev; to þe court of rome also
for &yogh;e Anourieth more ane erþeliche king &punctelev; þane &yogh;e god almi&yogh;ti do
to bringe þeos cause of holi churche &punctelev; bifore þe pope to ende."
Þis holi Man wel mildeliche &punctelev; out of þis court gan gon
Þe king, and þat mid him was &punctelev; wrathþeden heom anon
heo criden on þis holi man &punctelev; and beleweden echon
Wit Also[MS. Ahso] grete noyse &punctelev; ase anie Men mi&yogh;ten don
heo ne mi&yogh;ten makie non more cri &punctelev; þei al þe toun were afuyre
Ase[al. þane] heo duden opon þis holi man &punctelev; þat wide men it mi&yogh;ten ihuyre
Þis guode man eode softe forth &punctelev; ase him noþing ne rou&yogh;te
for &yogh;uyt more men schenden Ihesu crist &punctelev; þo men him to deþe brou&yogh;te
he werth opon is palefrai &punctelev; and to is Inne he wende also
Vnneþe he mi&yogh;te with is hondene &punctelev; þeos þre þingus do
blessi þat folk and bere þe croiz &punctelev; and is bridel wisse
Þat simple folk orn abouten him &punctelev; with Ioye inov&yogh; and blisse
for heo wenden þat he hadde ibeo &punctelev; atþe court faste inome
heo þonkeden muche Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat he moste among heom come
¶ to is In, at seint Andreues &punctelev; heo siweden him faste inov&yogh;
Seint thomas alle þe pouere men &punctelev; with him to þe mete he drov&yogh;
And seide, "comiez here forth with me &punctelev; for mine freond &yogh;e beoth
Ine habbe none freond bote eov &punctelev; ase alle men nouþe iseoth."
he let heom Alle fede wel &punctelev; a gret housful nei&yogh;
Ase þis holi man sat at is mete &punctelev; þei he grete wille þerto nadde
Þis word þat ore louerd het &punctelev; is redare bifore him radde
"&YOGH;if Men ov pursiwiet In one toune &punctelev; Into anoþur toun &yogh;e fleo."
Þis holi man þou&yogh;te þat bi himself &punctelev; þat word mi&yogh;te wel soth beo
And þat it godes wille was &punctelev; Into An oþur londe gon
As þe holi godspel seith &punctelev; a man forto fleo is fon
Þis holi man was þo wel þe hardiore &punctelev; of londe forto wende
&YOGH;wane he mi&yogh;te aschapie wel &punctelev; and god wolde þe time sende
¶ Þo it was towar[d] eue &punctelev; twei seriaunz þare come
Sore weopinde, and warneden him &punctelev; þat he sum red him nome
For þe kyngus Men hadden iswore &punctelev; þoru&yogh; heste of þe kinge
&YOGH;wareso heo him mi&yogh;ten finde &punctelev; to stronge deþe him bringe
Seint thomas þou&yogh;te anoþur. &punctelev; he let maken is bed a&yogh;en ni&yogh;t
Op Inþe heie churche &punctelev; bitwene twei weuedes ri&yogh;t
Þo alle oþur men weren aslepe &punctelev; and no man nas him nei&yogh;
he aros up and biheold &punctelev; on þe ymage an hei&yogh;
bifore þe auter he feol don akne &punctelev; and on ore louerd bigan to crie
And formest he seide þe seuen salmes &punctelev; and sethþe þe letanie
Al wepind ech haluwe he bad &punctelev; is help forto beo
bifore ech ymage he op aros &punctelev; and eft he sat adoun akne
Þo he hadde iseid is beden &punctelev; stilleliche he gan gon
A luyte bifore þe cockes crowe &punctelev; out of þe churche anon
And wende him outward of engelonde &punctelev; þat no man with him nas
bote a frere of Semplingham &punctelev; þat wel priue to him was
Þis guode Man flev al Engelond &punctelev; for holi churche ri&yogh;te
Of al is wo ne &yogh;af he nou&yogh;t &punctelev; &yogh;if he it amendi mi&yogh;te
¶ Þe tiþingue cam of þis cas &punctelev; to þe kingue ful sone
Þe hei&yogh;e men nomen heore red &punctelev; &yogh;wat were þarof to done
Þe king and al is baronie &punctelev; and þe bischopes echon
Þat au&yogh;ten with seint thomas habbe ibe &punctelev; and weren mest is fon
to þis conseil euerechone &punctelev; heo concenteden at þen ende
Þat þe king scholde of is hexte Men &punctelev; to þe court of rome sende
A&yogh;en him &yogh;wane [he] þudere come &punctelev; and þe pope don onderstonde
Þat he was fals and forswore &punctelev; and destourbour of þe londe
Forto don þis grete neode &punctelev; þe wiseste Men heo nome
And þat is þing were al in pais &punctelev; forto heo a&yogh;en come
Þe Erchebischop of Euerwike &punctelev; and þe bischop of Eccestre
to rome[MS. rome rome] heo wenden for þis neodes &punctelev; and þe bischop of Cicestre
And þe bischop of londone &punctelev; and of winchestre also
And also eorles and barouns &punctelev; and manie clerkes þerto
to beren witnesse of þe falshede &punctelev; &yogh;wane heo to court come
Noble &yogh;iftes and oþur Iueles &punctelev; with hem also heo nome
he nadde none &yogh;iftes forto &yogh;iue &punctelev; to holden up is ri&yogh;te
Fram Norehamptone bar he eode &punctelev; for holi churche to fi&yogh;te
¶ Fram seint Andreues þis holi man &punctelev; of Norehamptone he wende
With a frere of Semplingham &punctelev; are god þane dai heom sende
Fiue and twenti mile he wende &punctelev; to þe toune of graham
Are he stunte in anie stude &punctelev; with þe frere of Sempringham
Al Northward he drou&yogh; him furst &punctelev; awei al fram þe se
Þat þe kinges Men ne scholden him finde &punctelev; to nimen ne forto sle
Sethþe he wende fram graham &punctelev; fiue and tuenti Mile also
to þe toun[added later.] of lincolne &punctelev; are he wolde reste ifo
Þene moruwe ope seint lucus day— &punctelev; tiwesdai it was þo
he departede fram þe kingus court &punctelev; with much seoruwe and wo[MS. we]
his wei þane wodnesni&yogh;t &punctelev; out of þe toune he nam
Sone morewe þene þoresdai &punctelev; to lincolne he cam
At one follares house &punctelev; his In he nam ri&yogh;t þare.[þare corr. to þere]
And bi ni&yogh;te euere he eode is wei &punctelev; þat he awaited ne ware
At lincolne he dude him into watere &punctelev; are god þane dai sende
And þane fridai fourti mile &punctelev; al bi watere he wende
to þe Ermitage of Semplingham &punctelev; þat amidde þe watere is
And þare he bilefde al hardiliche &punctelev; þre dawes, iwis
And sethþe he wende to seint botulf &punctelev; þat was heonnes ouer ten mile
Þare he dude him eft Into watere &punctelev; and cam in a luytel &yogh;wile
to þe hous of hauerholt &punctelev; þat of Simplingham is
Þe frere him ladde bi þulke house &punctelev; þe sikerore to beon, iwis
Fram þannes he wende to eistreþe[r. estreye] &punctelev; his o maner with ri&yogh;te
Þe Erchebischopes of kaunterburi &punctelev; &yogh;if he hadde ani mi&yogh;te
And awaitede is point to passi ouer &punctelev; &yogh;wane hit best tyme were
¶ Seueni&yogh;t he bilefde þare &punctelev; forto alle soulene dai
In A Chaumbre ri&yogh;t bi þe churche &punctelev; dai&yogh; and ni&yogh;t he lai
Þat no man no scholde him onder&yogh;ite &punctelev; ne iwar of him beo
Þoru&yogh; þe churche he made an hol &punctelev; þe sacringe forto seo
And forto heren þare is masse— &punctelev; and Men þat to churche come
Nusten nou&yogh;t þat he was so nei&yogh; &punctelev; ne þerof heo ne token none gome
An alle soulene dai, þene tywesdai&yogh; &punctelev; are god þene dai sende
he bitok god al holi churche &punctelev; and Into þe se he wende
heo roweden forth al þane dai &punctelev; and a&yogh;en þe eueninge
bisides ane hauene heo ariueden &punctelev; þat men cleopez graueninge
In Flaundres, ase god it wolde. &punctelev; bote hors ne hadde he non
Þis holi man al afote &punctelev; forth is wei gan gon
Þat no man ne scholde him knowe &punctelev; þe Abite of frere he nam
And also a frere forth he eode &punctelev; þo he to Flaundres cam
blac was is cope aboue &punctelev; is Cuyrtel &yogh;wijt blaunket
Opon is rugge is cope he bar &punctelev; &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te go þe bet
Þe reyn was gret and suyþe st[r]ong &punctelev; and þe wei ful deop
Swiþe weri was þe holi man &punctelev; onneþe he bar up is fet
he was so trauailled In þe weie &punctelev; and in þe se bifore
Þat he sat adoun and ne mi&yogh;te no fer &punctelev; bote he were ibore
Þo wende forth a man, þat with him eode &punctelev; and huyrde him a mere
For an Englichs peni, with an haltre &punctelev; þis holi man to bere
Þe holi Man is cloþes tok &punctelev; and opon þe Mere heom caste
And werth op aboue alle is cloþes &punctelev; and rod him forth wel faste
¶ Allas þat suych a noble man &punctelev; vuele was it is ri&yogh;te
So febleliche ouer lond to wende— &punctelev; wel muche is godes mi&yogh;te
Vuele was it is ri&yogh;te to gon afote &punctelev; oþur ope swuch a best to ride
holi churche he abou&yogh;te deore &punctelev; þat men tellez of wel wide
With one haltre ope þe mere &punctelev; forth rod þis holi man
As þei it were a frere, and let him cleopie &punctelev; frere cristian
For he nolde nou&yogh;t lie &punctelev; þat cristian he was
And he was adrad to beon iknowe &punctelev; &yogh;if man cleopede him thomas
At one gode mannes house &punctelev; his In ani&yogh;t he nam
At þe bordes ende he sat &punctelev; Ase vuele it him bicam
And al withInne seten is men &punctelev; as þei he lowest were
his oste nam wel gode &yogh;eme &punctelev; hov heo heom alle bere
he tok kepe of þe holi man &punctelev; þat sat atþe bordes ende
hou milde he was among alle &punctelev; and mest corteis and hende
And hou hendeliche he delde is mete &punctelev; heom þat bifore him stode
And hov luytel he .et. himselue &punctelev; with wel simple mode
his limes also he biheold &punctelev; hou faire heo weren and freo
Þe hondene faire and longe fingres &punctelev; fairore ne mi&yogh;ten none beo
And euere mest bifore alle oþere &punctelev; is heorte to him drou&yogh;
¶ Of þe Erchebischope of Caunterburi &punctelev; he gan him vnderstonde
Þat it was couth oueral aboute &punctelev; þat he was iwend out of londe
his heorte him bar þat it was he. &punctelev; In gret studie he was ibrou&yogh;t
he rounede in is wiues ere &punctelev; and tolde hire al is þou&yogh;t
his wijf after þulke tyme &punctelev; þat soþe also þou&yogh;te
heo bigan to serui þis holi man &punctelev; and deinteþes to him brou&yogh;te
Applene. & peoren. and notes also &punctelev; and fondede in alle manere
Among alle þis oþur men &punctelev; to gladien wel þene frere
heo bilefde to serui alle þe oþere &punctelev; and opon him was al hire þou&yogh;t
Seint thomas it vnder&yogh;at &punctelev; and þarewith ne paide him nou&yogh;t
So þat he biheold aboute &punctelev; anon after soper
Wel mildeliche he bad is oste &punctelev; forto comen him ner
And to sitte bi him adoun &punctelev; for solaz, one stounde
"A, sire, merci," quad þis oste &punctelev; "Ichulle sitte on þe grounde
And sat him adoun at is fet. &punctelev; seint thomas him bad arise
"Certes, sire," quad þis oste &punctelev; "Inelle In none wise
¶ Nolde god þat ich bi þe sete! &punctelev; mi louerd, ihered þou beo
Þat In mine house þov scholdest come &punctelev; and þat ich þane dai mi&yogh;te iseo."
"Luyte deinte," quat seint thomas &punctelev; "of a swuch pouere man
Of swuch a frere ase ich am &punctelev; icleoped frere cristian."
"Sire, þin ore," quath þis oste &punctelev; "wel ich onderstonde
Þov art Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; iwend out of engelonde."
"&YOGH;wy seistþov so?" quad seint thomas &punctelev; "þov hauest selde isei&yogh;e
Þene Erchebischop of caunterburi &punctelev; wende in swuche manere bi weie!"
"Sire," quad þe oste, "þov it art &punctelev; also me seith mi þou&yogh;t
And ich bidde þe for þe loue of god &punctelev; ne withsak it a&yogh;ein me nou&yogh;t."
Þis holi man him biþou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat oþur he moste lie
Oþur beo biknowe þat he[MS. heo] it was &punctelev; so heo gonnen on heom[al. so þe oþer gan on him] crie
Ate laste he was aknowe &punctelev; ake with him amorewe he nam
his oste, þat he ne scholde him wrei&yogh;e &punctelev; forto he aftur[r. a fer] weie cam
to [þe] Abbeie of seint Bertin &punctelev; þis holi man iwende
And þare he bilefde &punctelev; forto ore louerd oþur grace him sende.
Þe bischopus of engelonde &punctelev; and þe barones also
to þe kinge of Fraunce heo comen &punctelev; and lettres with heom bere
fram þe king of engelond &punctelev; þat þus muche an Englisch were
"to is louerd þoru&yogh; godes grace &punctelev; sire lowis þe kinge
henri king of engelonde &punctelev; sende loue and gretinge
¶ Thomas, þat Erchebischop was &punctelev; of caunterburi bifore
Out of mine londe he is iwend &punctelev; ase mi traitore and forsuore
Þarefore ase min erþeliche louerd &punctelev; ich bidde þe bi mine sonde
Þat þov ne suffri nou&yogh;t þat he beo &punctelev; Irecetted In þine londe."
Þo þis king þis bone iheorde &punctelev; ane &yogh;wile in þou&yogh;te he stod
"Certes," he seide, "ase me þinchez &punctelev; þis bone nis noþing god
So strong þeof nis non in engelonde &punctelev; &yogh;if he in Fraunce come
Þat he ne mi&yogh;te In Fraunce duelle &punctelev; ase heo doth ilome
And wel raþur scholde a suych hei&yogh; man &punctelev; ne come he no so sone
Ake noþur ich ne þe king of engelonde &punctelev; with ore bischopes nabbez to done
For mine bischopes with holi churche &punctelev; heore wille ich late heom do
And fairore were þe kinge anouri him &punctelev; and late him iworþe also."
¶ Ne mi&yogh;ten þis hei&yogh;e men of him &punctelev; non oþur word a fonge
So þat heo wenden forth heore wei &punctelev; þo heo hadden abide longe
Maister herebard of Boseham &punctelev; and oþure sethþe iwende
to þe kinge lowis of Fraunce &punctelev; ase seint thomas him sende
Þe king weop, þo he iheorde þis &punctelev; and made deol inou&yogh;
And tolde heom hov þe kingus men &punctelev; at him weren bifore
And &yogh;wuch ansuere he heom &yogh;af &punctelev; þat heore [wei][om.] was forlore
Þis gode men with ioie inov &punctelev; heore leue of him heo nome
And þannes heo wenden sone inou&yogh; &punctelev; to þe court of rome
Þare neren heo nou&yogh;t faire onderfonge &punctelev; for þe bischopes comen bifore
And desclaundreden seint thomas &punctelev; þat he was fals and forsuore
Ake naþeles þe grace heo hadden &punctelev; þat to þe pope heo mi&yogh;ten go
himsulue heo tolden in priuete &punctelev; al seint thomases wo
Of þe status of clarindone &punctelev; hou heo furst forth come
And hou he was ibrou&yogh;t at norehamptone &punctelev; bifore þe kinge to dome
And hov he wende out of engelonde &punctelev; In muchele miseise and wo
And alhov he chaungede is name &punctelev; þe sikerloker forto go
[papa.]¶ Þe pope bigan to siche sore &punctelev; and[al. om.] with ful dreori þou&yogh;t
Þe teres fullen out of is ei&yogh;ene &punctelev; he ne mi&yogh;te withholden heom nou&yogh;t
he þonkede god þat swuch a prelat &punctelev; under him moste beo
So studefast to holi churche &punctelev; and þat he mi&yogh;te þane dai iseo.
Amorewe comen þis bischopes &punctelev; and þe eorles also
To procuri seint thomas al þat vuel &punctelev; þat heo mi&yogh;ten do
bifore þe pope, ase [he] sat &punctelev; ful nobleliche heo come
And bifore þe cardinales &punctelev; and al þe court of rome
[episcopus london'.]¶ Þe bischop of londone &punctelev; þat euere luþur was
bigan formest to telle is tale &punctelev; a&yogh;ein seint thomas
he stod up bifore al þe court &punctelev; "beu pere," anon he seide
"To þe we comieth to make ore mone &punctelev; of strong lif þat we ledez
Ower ri&yogh;te it is up to holde &punctelev; alle þat guode beoth
And foles to bringuen of heore folie &punctelev; &yogh;wane &yogh;e heom iseoth
A destaunce þare is isproungue &punctelev; li&yogh;tliche in Engelonde
Þat destourbez al þat lond &punctelev; with onri&yogh;te, ich onderstonde
Þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; is al a&yogh;ein ore wille
Folliche he bigan In engelonde &punctelev; holi churche forto spille
And to binime þe kynge is fraunchise &punctelev; and is ri&yogh;tes also
Ake he ne mi&yogh;te us make for noþing &punctelev; concenti þerto.[This verse on the margin.]
And for wrathþe þat we nolden &punctelev; alle is wille do
Opon us he caste is owene gult &punctelev; and opon þe kinge also
And atþe laste, ase þei it were &punctelev; þut lond forto blende
Þo noman ne dude him strencþe &punctelev; of londe he gan iwende
for men nusten nou&yogh;t þe soþe &punctelev; þat heo scholden onderstonde
Þat þe king him dude onri&yogh;th &punctelev; and driue him out of londe."
Þo he hadde al is tale itold &punctelev; and imaked is grete wise
[episcopus Chichestrie.]he sat adoun; an þe bischop of chichestre &punctelev; sone gan op arise
¶ "bev pere," he seide to þe pope &punctelev; "me þinchez it fallez to þe
To ondon ech þing þat fallez to harme &punctelev; In þe communaute
Þat o Man ne beo isoffred &punctelev; to gon forth mid is wille
to bring al þat lond to schame &punctelev; and holi churche to spille
Þat hath þe Erchebischop iþou&yogh;t &punctelev; and þat is isene, iwis
&YOGH;wane ech man of al þat lond &punctelev; faste a&yogh;ein him is."
Aros op and bigan to telle &punctelev; is tale al on hei&yogh;
"Sire," he seide, "no man ne knoweth &punctelev; so wel ase ich do
Þene Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; ne þe bischopriche also
Þe Erchebischop is willesful &punctelev; and &yogh;wane he is alles ibrou&yogh;t
In ani wille þat is luytel wuyrth &punctelev; he nele bileue it nou&yogh;t
Þat man ne may for noþing &punctelev; bringe him of is þou&yogh;t
he is nouþe In swuyche folie— &punctelev; þat we habbeth deore abou&yogh;t
li&yogh;tliche he is þareInne icome &punctelev; ake he it nele lete neuere mo
bot &yogh;e þoru&yogh; ower pouwer &punctelev; bringe us out of wo."
[episcopus Exon'.]¶ "Sire," quath þe bischop of eccetre &punctelev; baldeliche he spac þo
"Þis cas &yogh;e moten amendi sone &punctelev; hovso it euere go
And &yogh;e ne leuen nou&yogh;t þe soþe &punctelev; þat men doth ov to onderstonde
Send with us fot with fot &punctelev; ane legat into Engelonde
And lat him ofgropi þe soþe þere &punctelev; and þareafter þu lat him wurche
[Comes Arondelie]¶ Þe Eorl of Arundel aros op þo &punctelev; a man of gret dignete
"Sires," he seide, "for godes[MS. guodes] loue &punctelev; ane stounde herkneth me
Þe lewede Men þat here beoth &punctelev; þat ne connen latin non
We ne onderstondez nou&yogh;t &punctelev; of þat &yogh;e habbez itold echon
Ake In langage þat we conne &punctelev; swuche men ase we beoth
hei&yogh;e barouns and noble kni&yogh;tes &punctelev; ase &yogh;e nouþe iseoth
¶ Tellen ichulle for us alle &punctelev; &yogh;wy we beoth hidere iwend
For ore louerd þe king of Engelonde &punctelev; Þat hauez us hidere isend
to schewi furst þe reuerence &punctelev; and grete loue also
Þat he hath to eov ibore &punctelev; and euere he þenchez to do
And þareof he sent þe word bi us &punctelev; ase we bifore þe stondez
Eorles, barones, and bischopes &punctelev; þe hexte of þe londe
&YOGH;if he hadde ani herre ihaued &punctelev; hidere he hadden iwend
Ake to one so hei&yogh;e court ase þeos is &punctelev; he hath us hidere isent
to schewi eov furst in his name &punctelev; þat, also wid ase þe world is
So trewe prince nis onder god &punctelev; ne þat so muche ov loueth, iwis
Ne þat so muche Anoureth holi churche &punctelev; and euere hath ido
Þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; is a noble man also
Þat, &yogh;if omanere of him nere &punctelev; ase ich me onderstonde
Þare nere no lond In cristinedom &punctelev; a&yogh;einest engelonde,[MS. engelonge]
Ne holi churche so wel iwust &punctelev; and ischild fram ech wou&yogh;
Onder noble prince and prelat &punctelev; boþe guode men inou&yogh;
Ake þes thomas, þis guode Erchebischop &punctelev; so hath a luyte wille
Þat muchel apeirez his guodnesse &punctelev; and biguynneth þat lond to spille
his wille is suych þat, &yogh;wane he is &punctelev; icomen in fole þou&yogh;t,[This verse on the margin.]
In swuche folie he is nouþe icome— &punctelev; ore louerd is þou&yogh;t wende
bote men mouwen is þou&yogh;t wenden &punctelev; þat lond he wole al schende
Þarefor mi louerd þe king ov bit &punctelev; þat &yogh;e with us sende
Ane legat into engelonde &punctelev; to ofgropi al þen ende
Oþur certus he is ope þe poynte &punctelev; al þat lond to spille
And þat &yogh;e him chasti þoru&yogh; ri&yogh;te lawe &punctelev; & binime him is fole wille."
Of alle þe clerkes þat þare seten &punctelev; non of heom þar nas
Þat ne preisede muche þis hei&yogh;e man &punctelev; for he so renable was
Ake we ne mouwen þarof non dom &yogh;iue &punctelev; bote himsulue here were
For we ne mowen bihinden him no Iuggement &yogh;yue &punctelev; ne no ri&yogh;t iwis it nere."
[comes.]¶ "Sire," quath þe Eorl of Arundel &punctelev; "&yogh;e moten bet onderstonde
A certein dai us is iset &punctelev; to come into engelonde
And þane dai ne dorre we nou&yogh;t breke &punctelev; for ore louerd þe kingue
Þarefore &yogh;e moten us grace don &punctelev; sumdel of þis þinge
&YOGH;e moten, &yogh;if it is ower wille &punctelev; ane legat wis[r. wiz] us sende
And þene Erchebischope hoten also &punctelev; to Engelonde iwende
And ase þe legat þare enquereth &punctelev; þaraftur he mai do."
¶ "Certes, beu frere," quat þe pope &punctelev; "Inelle nou&yogh;t take on so
&YOGH;wane þe erchebischop hidere comez &punctelev; Inot &yogh;wat he wole telle
Þarefore are ich iheore him speke &punctelev; noþing don þarof inelle."
"Certes, sire," seide þis oþur &punctelev; "we ne dorren abide nou&yogh;t."
"Nov de pardeus," quath þe pope &punctelev; "doth ase &yogh;e habbeth iþou&yogh;t!"
Þis oþure weren wroþe inou&yogh;. &punctelev; wel faire heore leue heo nome
And wenden heom forth in grete wrathþe &punctelev; And to londone heo come.
Seint Thomas was þo In Flaundres &punctelev; In huydinge ase þei it were
In þe Abbeie of seint Bertyn &punctelev; and longe he hadde ibeo þere
Atþe laste he aros bi ni&yogh;te &punctelev; and out of Flaundres wende
Al priueliche Into Fraunce &punctelev; ase ore louerd him grace sende
Þe king of Fraunce þat was þo &punctelev; louwis guod and hende
heorde telle of þis holi Man &punctelev; he let sone after him sende
Þo þis holi Man to him cam &punctelev; gret Ioye he gan him make
And het him in eche stude opon is lond &punctelev; jnov&yogh; of his take
¶ to spene to him and alle his &punctelev; &yogh;wareso heo euere come
Nolde seint thomas nou&yogh;t abide &punctelev; are he come to rome
Þe king him fond spence inov&yogh; &punctelev; to him and alle his
And sende with him guod conduyt &punctelev; to bringe him þare, iwis
¶ þo seint thomas to Rome cam &punctelev; faire he was onderfonge
And sumdel þe pope was anuyd &punctelev; þat he hadde ibeo so longe
Men acoupeden him of þulke trespas &punctelev; þat þe bischopes tolden er
And beden him ansuerie for is stat &punctelev; and aleggi þarefore þer
Seint thomas wolde op arise &punctelev; Men beden him sitte adoun
And he bigan agodes name &punctelev; and schewede þis reson
"Sire," he seide, "ich am Imaked &punctelev; þei ich onwuyrth beo
to wardi þe churche of Caunterburi &punctelev; ase &yogh;e mowen iseo
Þulke churche was iwoned to beo &punctelev; Ase lauedi, and schynde wide
bri&yogh;te ase þe sonne among alle oþure &punctelev; of al þe westside
Þe sonne þat was erore so cler &punctelev; deork heo is bicome
brode cloude and strongue inou&yogh;: þat[om. þat?] hire li&yogh;t habbeth binome
Ouercast heo is with þis cloudene: þat heo ne &yogh;ifth lij&yogh;t non
And alle þe churchene of Engelonde: deorke beoth echon
Þe kyng, þat hire scholde upholde: he binimez al hire ri&yogh;te
And ase þe cloudene hire ouercast: þat heo ne mai no leng li&yogh;te
Ich þat scholde hire wardein beo: þarea&yogh;ein ich mot fi&yogh;te
And stonde a&yogh;en and withsegge: þe luþere costomes bi al mi mi&yogh;te
For þei ich hadde a þovsend liues: ase ich nabbe bote on
raþur þane ich it þolie wolde: &yogh;yue ich wolde echon
Þe costomes a&yogh;en holi churche: þat þe king hath forth ibrou&yogh;t
here &yogh;e mouwen heom iheore: &yogh;if heo buth to graunti ou&yogh;t."
¶ Þis holi man bigan to rede þe luþere lawene: ase he heom hadde iwrite
he wep þat þe teres ornen adoun: þat deol it was to wite
Þe pope and alle is cardinales: þat sei&yogh;en him wepe so sore
And heordene alle þe luþere lawene: heo ne mi&yogh;ten forbere non|more
Ake bigonnen to wepe faste echone: and hereden god also
Þat heo mi&yogh;ten finde a swuch prelat: ouer holi churche ido
Þat holi churche so heold to ri&yogh;te: and ne soffrede no wov&yogh;
heo þonkeden god of swuch a Man: and honoureden him inov&yogh;
Þe pope het is clerkes alle: þat[om. þat?] þoru&yogh; al cristindome
Þat heo witseiden suyche luþere lawes: &yogh;wareso huy euere come
And[om. And] þat heo neren isoffrede nou&yogh;ware: hovso heo comen to ende
And þat heo &yogh;euen heore lijf þarefore: raþur þane holi churche schende
[Thomas]¶ Þo spac eftsone seint thomas: wepinde swyþe sore
"Inabbe nou&yogh;t," he seide, "so muche wo: þat inere wurþe wel more
Ake ich me drede a&yogh;en godes wille it be: for onwuyrth ich am þarto
Þarefore ore louerd for ri&yogh;te wreche: vuel biginninge me deth sende
And ich drede for mine wrechche gultes: þat worse worth þe ende
Þarefore, þat holi churche: ne beo to grounde ibrou&yogh;t
For mine sunnes and for mine onmi&yogh;te: þat Ine may hire wardi nou&yogh;t
Ich &yogh;elde ov op here þe bischopriche—: an oþer &yogh;e moten þare do
Þat mowe bet loki holi churche: for onwuyrth ich am þarto."
¶ his Ryng he nam and bitok þe pope: and op &yogh;eld þe bischopriche
Þe pope swiþe deolfulliche: and wel Inliche bigan to siche
Þerof conseillede al þe court: &yogh;wat þe beste red were
to laten him witien holi churche: oþur to don anoþur þere
"Me þinchez," quath a cardinal: "In swuch cas ase nouþe is
best it were to don an oþur: In his stude, iwis
Forto paien bet þe kinge: and swuc[h] cas mi&yogh;te bifalle
Þat þe kyng wolde aswagi and bileue: is luþere lawene alle
For betere it were In faire manere: hoso it mi&yogh;te to ende bringue
Þane contec arere In swuche londe: and nameliche a&yogh;en þe kingue
And man mi&yogh;te purveien þis gode manne: an also guod ase þat is
Ine wot &yogh;wat conseil &yogh;e wollez rede: for ichulle reden þis."
Þo seide an oþur cardinal: "Ine rede nou&yogh;t so, iwis
For þat wolde &yogh;iuen men ansaumple: al dai to don amis
For &yogh;wane þe king were wroth with ani bischop: for anie cunnes þinge
to don þane bischop anon adoun: þe mo vuele lawene he wolde bringe
And þanne were holi churche ischend: þat lauedi scholde be
For þis red me þinchez feble: a betere &yogh;e moten biseo."
[papa.]¶ Þe pope nam þo seint thomas: and tok him a&yogh;ein is ring
to bileue erchebischop forth: and stable þoru&yogh; alle þing
studefastliche to holden up: alholi churche ri&yogh;te
And he him wolde a&yogh;en ech man: helpen bi is mi&yogh;te
Ake he ne scholde nou&yogh;t þe &yogh;eot: to engelonde wend[e]
Ake abide betere grace of þe king: &yogh;if god it wolde sende
To þe grete Abbeie to pountenie: forto soriourni þere
he sende þis holi Man: forto it betere were
With luytel folk and luytel aise: þare he dude bileue
For he nadde himsulf nou&yogh;t to spene: bote ase heo him &yogh;eue
his men he bro&yogh;te In seruise: heore mete to wynne þere
And himsulf he was al one nei&yogh;: þei he hei&yogh; Man were
hard lijf he ladde inov&yogh;!: And he hadde of harde here
Schuyrte and brech streit inov&yogh;: hardore neuere nere
Þe strapeles weren swiþe streite: with mani a knotte also
Anon to is þies þe schuyrte tilde: þe brech ri&yogh;t to is to
Þe knottes gnowen al is flechs: aboute bi eche side
Swiþe onaisi was is brech: aboute forto ride
harde mi&yogh;te he sitte adoun: and harde ligge also
Louerd, deore abou&yogh;te he heuene: wel au&yogh;te he come þerto!
¶ Þe bischopes of Engelonde: þat a&yogh;ein him weren at rome
Þe Eorles and þe oþere hei&yogh;e Men: þo heo to Engelond come
heo tolden þe kinge al heore cas: hov heo hadde isped
Þo was þe king boþe sori and wroth: þat he was nei&yogh; awed
¶ "A," he seide, "þilke traitour: þat ich habbe forth ibrou&yogh;t
Þat he me schal swuch schame don nouþe!: Ine may it þolie nou&yogh;t
And he fleu&yogh;th[r. fleu&yogh;ch?] out of londe: þat Ine may to him come
Ichulle me of is cunne awreke: heo schullen abugge some."
he let seche out clene al is kun: and is oþur frend echon
Ovt of Engelonde he let heom driue: þat þare ne moste leue non
Sike ne feble, . &yogh;ung ne old: ne womman þat was with childe
Ne þe children þat soukinde weren: —muche was he onmilde
In hire Armes þe moder bar þat child: and In heore wombene some
Þare hadde þe king, ase me þinchez: a feble wreche inome
Iharlede heo weren in grete Miseise: out of londe, alas
Ech guod man hadde revþe of heom: þat heorden of þat cas
And seiden stilleliche bitwene heom: þat he a luþur king was
Mo luþere dedene þe king biþou&yogh;te: &yogh;eot ope seint thomas
Þeos Men þat he of londe drof: were heom lef oþur loth
Ech aftur oþur he made heom swerie: opon a boke gret oth
Þat heo ne scholden in none stude: bileue none stounde
Are heo to þe Erchebischope comen: &yogh;wareso heo him founden
And tellen him fore hov heo weren: out of londe ibrou&yogh;t
to bringue him jn þe more sor: &yogh;if heo mi&yogh;ten tuyrne is þou&yogh;t
¶ &YOGH;eot þe king biþou&yogh;te a luþer dede: more ope seint thomas
he forbed þoru&yogh; al Engelond: ase fer ase his pouwer was
Þat no man ne scholde for him bidde: In churche ne elles &yogh;ware
Ase men doth nouþe for Erchebischopes: and habbez idon wel &yogh;are
Louerd, muche was þe schame þo: þat holi churche bitidde
&YOGH;wane heo ne moste among oþur men: for so holi a man bidde!
Þat folk of seint thomas kunne: wel þicke abouten him drou&yogh;
Aldai heo weren iflemde for him—: In miseise and soruwe inou&yogh;
Heo weopen and criden deolfulliche &punctelev; and tolden him al heore cas
hov heo weren for him defoulede &punctelev; and &yogh;wuch hore soruwe was
Seint thomas biheold heom deolfolliche &punctelev; and bigan to siche sore
And euere he makede fair semblaunt &punctelev; to conforti heom þe more
And seide þis word to gladie hem &punctelev; þat men onderstoden wel longe
"Ech lond," he seide, "is owene contreie &punctelev; to þulke þat beoth stronge"
Ase Man þat seith, þei &yogh;e beon here &punctelev; In vnkouþe londe ibrou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if &yogh;e beoth stronge in godes lawe &punctelev; it ne schal ov greui nou&yogh;t
Alle þe hei&yogh;e men of þe londe &punctelev; þat heorden of þat cas
Corseden þe kinge, and seiden also &punctelev; þat he a luþur man was
Þis selie men aboute men nomen &punctelev; for loue of seint thomas
And founden heom liflode inou&yogh; &punctelev; þat in miseise neuer on nas.
Þo þeos tiþinges to þe kingue &punctelev; of Engelonde cam
þat þis folk was wel onderfonge &punctelev; gret deol to him he nam
"Certes," he seide, "&yogh;wane Ine may &punctelev; in þis manere is heorte buye
In more miseise ichulle him bringe &punctelev; þat is lijf him schal anuye."
¶ Greye Monekes of Cistevs &punctelev; fram &yogh;ere to &yogh;ere
A Chapitre makeden generale &punctelev; of Abbodes þat þere were
For euerech Abbod of greie Monekes &punctelev; to þulke chapitle cam
WithInne þre &yogh;er,[al. a terme] ase [huy] &yogh;uyt doth &punctelev; þoru&yogh; al cristindom
Þo þe chapitle plenere was &punctelev; þudere þe king sende
to þe Abbotus alle plenereliche &punctelev; þat to þulke chapitle wende
Þat heo wolden him so muche do &punctelev; onkuynde dedes and wou&yogh;
forto susteiny is wiþerwyne &punctelev; among heom and is fo
In þe house of pounteneye &punctelev; þat brou&yogh;te him in swuch wo
And bote heo wolden him bileue &punctelev; and ne susteyni him nonmore
Alle þe greye Monekes of Engelonde &punctelev; abugge it scholden sore
For heo susteineden is fo &punctelev; ne[r. no] wonder he seide it nere
Þei he awreke him of þat hous &punctelev; þat ine his londe were
Þo þeos lettres to Cisteus &punctelev; among þis Abbotes come
Of þe þretningue heo dradden heom sore &punctelev; and conseil þarof heo nome
So þat heo beden seint thomas &punctelev; his heste forto do
For heo ne dorsten nou&yogh;t a&yogh;en þe kingus wille &punctelev; nonmore holden him so
Þo seint thomas þis iheorde &punctelev; he gan forto siche sore
And bad Ihesu crist him helpe þo &punctelev; and cride him milce and ore
¶ "Louerdingus, &yogh;e þat habbez me &punctelev; Isusteyned mani a day[Thomas.]
In mine grete neode, Ihesu crist it ov &yogh;elde &punctelev; þare ich misulf ne mai
Þe king þretnez ov so faste &punctelev; þat &yogh;if[r. &yogh;if þat?] &yogh;e holdez me here ou&yogh;t longe
&YOGH;if crist wole, &yogh;e ne schullen neuere &punctelev; for me harm afongue
&YOGH;wareso ich euere mai on eorþe beo &punctelev; fram eov ichulle wende
Þat &yogh;e ne beon for me apeirede— &punctelev; ore louerd is grace me sende
Þat &yogh;e habbeth on me ispend &punctelev; after me cometh on
Þat swyþe wel it wole[MS. it wole it wole] aquiten &punctelev; houso it euere gon.[v. 15234 al. om.]
For ich mai &yogh;uyt mine mete bidde &punctelev; Inam nou&yogh;t to guod þerto
Ore louerd þat fedeth þe wilde bestes and foules &punctelev; he mai me fede also
Ake hovso it euere of me bicome &punctelev; god, &yogh;if it is his wille
holde up þe ri&yogh;tes of holi churche &punctelev; þat heo fulliche naspille."
Ase þis holi man in þou&yogh;te stod &punctelev; &yogh;wodere he mi&yogh;te wende
Þe king of Fraunce, þat was so guod &punctelev; sone he gan him word sende
Cheose he himsulf, and he wolde &punctelev; finden him spense inou&yogh;
For it is soth iseid, &yogh;wane a man is &punctelev; In mest soruwe and teone
Þanne is ore louerdes grace next— &punctelev; ase it was þare isene
¶ Þis holi man nam is leue þare &punctelev; mildeliche and softe
And sore wepinde he wende forth &punctelev; he &yogh;oxede and si&yogh;te wel ofte
[Abbas ponten'.]Þe Abbot of pounteneye &punctelev; sumdel forthward him brou&yogh;te
And Axede him &yogh;wi he were &punctelev; In so deolfule þou&yogh;te
"Ichulle þe telle," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "&yogh;wi ich carie so
bot þat þov ne telle no man fore &punctelev; are mine endeday beo ido
Ich am siker þat i schal &yogh;eot &punctelev; deie in Martyrdom
[Sompnium.]For toni&yogh;t ase ich was aslepe &punctelev; a wonder[MS. &yogh;onder] metinge me com
¶ In þe churche of Caunterburi &punctelev; me þou&yogh;te i stod, iwis
And striuede for holi churche &punctelev; a&yogh;en þe kinge and his
Þo comen þere four kni&yogh;tes gon &punctelev; and smiten me opon þe croune
Ech after oþur, þat mi brayn &punctelev; schedde al abrod þare doune
For [me] nouþe[al. me] ich þonki Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat i schal dei&yogh;en so
Ake for mine Men i siche sore &punctelev; Inot &yogh;wat heo schullen do."
Þis holi man wende forth &punctelev; In care and deol bi wei&yogh;e
Forto he cam to senouns &punctelev; twelf mile fram pounteneie
[ad Senon'.]¶ Þare he bilefde In soiourninge &punctelev; alþe &yogh;wile þat he wolde
And þe king him fond to spene inov&yogh; &punctelev; of seluer and of golde
he sende to þe kinge of Engelonde &punctelev; þat he scholde late beo stille
And ne weorri non more opon holi churche &punctelev; &yogh;if it were is wille
Ouer se wende, ase god it wolde &punctelev; and into Fraunce he cam
¶ Þe king of Fraunce was aboute &punctelev; &yogh;if god wolde him grace sende
Acordi him and seint thomas &punctelev; &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te it bringe to ende
So þat heo weren togadere ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; at one dai&yogh;e Iset
Seint thomas cam bifore þe king &punctelev; and ase is louerd him gret
And to is fet fel akne &punctelev; he wep and cride is ore
"haue reuþe of holi churche &punctelev; and ne weorre þov hire nonmore
And þine wille ichulle do &punctelev; ase ich seide er, bi mine mi&yogh;te
Saue mine louerdes honur &punctelev; and holi churche ri&yogh;te."
¶ Þe king makede him wroth inov&yogh; for þat word &punctelev; ase he hadde ofte ibeo
"Novþe &yogh;e movwen," he seide, "echone &punctelev; his falshede iseo
For man[al. ine] ne mi&yogh;te don ope is[al. þis] worde &punctelev; noþing a&yogh;en is wille
Þat he ne wolde segge þat icholde &punctelev; alholi churche spille
And þat it[al. ic] were a&yogh;en godes lawe— &punctelev; and In swyche manere he mi&yogh;te
Þat lond destourbi and me binime &punctelev; mi fraunchise and mi ri&yogh;te
And gode bischopes þare habbez ibeo &punctelev; bifore him ase [&yogh;e] wyten, iwis
Ake, þat &yogh;e iseon alle mine treowenesse &punctelev; and þat al þe wronge is his
And[al. as þe] wiseste and þe beste bischopes &punctelev; þat bifore him were
A&yogh;en þe meste fole kinge þat bifore me was &punctelev; faire heo heom bere
Oþur him þinchez þat neuere bischop &punctelev; so wis ase he non nas
Oþur he me halt þe meste wrechche king &punctelev; þat euere ibore was."
[rex francie.]¶ Þo seide þe king of Fraunce &punctelev; and alle þat heorden þis
"Certes, þov bedest him loue inov&yogh; &punctelev; al þat wrong is his."
[thomas.]¶ Seint thomas stod and biþou&yogh;te him &punctelev; and gan to siche sore
"Þei ichabbe ihaued anuy &punctelev; to come me is wel more
"&YOGH;if þe bischopus," he seide, "bifore me &punctelev; hadden ido heore mi&yogh;te
hit ne hadde ibeo non[r. nou?] neod þarefore &punctelev; to contecki ne to fi&yogh;te
For are þis it were stable inov&yogh; &punctelev; þoru&yogh; gode mannes si&yogh;te
Nouþe god for is grace &punctelev; sende holi churche hire ri&yogh;te
For þat þe bischopus bifore me weren to nesche &punctelev; ase ich nouþe ifinde
Þe studefastore i mot beo &punctelev; oþur it worth al bihinde
Ich wot wel þat heo habbeth herebifore &punctelev; þe customes in engelonde
.I.vsed heom alto muche &punctelev; holi churche to schonde
And þei heo habben ibeon suffred longe &punctelev; and to custome idrawe
Þare ne may no man forsoþe segge &punctelev; þat heo beoth ri&yogh;t ne lawe
For ore louerd louez ri&yogh;t and sothnesse &punctelev; and none vuele costomes, iwis
And þat he schewez wel bi o word &punctelev; þat In þe godspel is
For ore louerd euenez himself &punctelev; to sothnesse þere
Ake he ne eueneth him in none stude &punctelev; to costome þat a&yogh;ein þe ri&yogh;te were
Þare[fore] me þinchez ri&yogh;t it is &punctelev; þat we to sothþnesse drawe
And destourbi þe vuele costomes &punctelev; þat beth a&yogh;ein þe lawe
Þarefore inelle none costomes &punctelev; soffri bi mine mi&yogh;te
Þat a&yogh;ein sothnesse beoth &punctelev; and a&yogh;en holi churche ri&yogh;te."
here man mai ise þat vuele lawes &punctelev; no guod Man nele afonge
Ake destourbi heom mid al is mi&yogh;te &punctelev; þei heo habben ibeo iholde longe
For he þat sosteinez vuele lawes &punctelev; ase wel he haueth sunne
bote he heom alegge &yogh;if he may &punctelev; ase he þat heom deth bigynne.
Þo þe king of Fraunce iheorde &punctelev; and oþure þat þare were
Þat seint thomas ne dude þe kinges wille &punctelev; noþing apayd heo nere
[rex francie.]¶ "Sire bischop," quath þe king of Fraunce &punctelev; "Ich iseo wel novþe þi wrong
Þe king þe beot loue inov &punctelev; þet strif is nov on þe ilong
Wolt[r. wost] þov nouþe is lawes him binime &punctelev; þat neuere him nere binome
Þe kingus heo[m] habbeth alle iholde &punctelev; þat bifore him habbeth icome
gret Maister þov woldest alonde beo &punctelev; to muche were þi power
to muche ich habbe honouret þe &punctelev; In mine londe her
bote þov suffri him is ri&yogh;te lawes &punctelev; Ichulle bicome þi fo
And &yogh;if we beoth þine fon boþe &punctelev; Inot &yogh;wodere þov mi&yogh;t go."
¶ Seint thomas heold him euere In on. &punctelev; þe kingues heom makeden wroþe
And departede fram him[MS. heom] so &punctelev; In grete wrathþe boþe
huy þretneden and maden noyse inov &punctelev; seint thomas heold him stille
Raþur he wolde deth afonge &punctelev; þane þolie heore luþere wille
Nov help crist seint thomas &punctelev; for neode he hath þereto
Nov boþe þe kingus beoth is fon &punctelev; &yogh;ware may he nov go
Iflemd he was out of Engelonde &punctelev; and out of Fraunce also
Alle is men maden deol inov &punctelev; heo nusten &yogh;wat forto do
And nameliche is cunnesMen &punctelev; þat for him iflemd were
"Louerd," heo seiden, "allas, allas &punctelev; þat we lifles nere
For idriue we beoth out of Engelonde &punctelev; and nei&yogh; of Fraunce also
Louerd, &yogh;wat scholde more sorewe &punctelev; þane us is icome nouþe to?"
¶ Seint thomas made him glad inov &punctelev; and confortede is men anon
"beth stille," he seide, "&yogh;e makiez deol &punctelev; neodeles nouþe echon;"
And seide "&yogh;e mouwen ofswinke ouwer mete &punctelev; ase guode men doth mani on
For beo &yogh;e fram me, huy wollez beo ouwer freond &punctelev; þat nouþe beot ower fon
&YOGH;e ne habbez hate of no man &punctelev; bote for me, with wou&yogh;
And beo &yogh;e fram me iwend &punctelev; men wollez louien ov inou&yogh;."
"A, sire, merci," þis oþure seiden &punctelev; "we wuten wel al þis
For ussulf nis us nou&yogh;t &punctelev; bote for þe, iwis
We schullen wel nouþe ore mete iwinne &punctelev; ake we nuten &yogh;wat þov schalt do
bote þov schulle for honger dei&yogh;e. &punctelev; louerd, &yogh;weþer þov schulle so?"
"Ich mai bidde mine mete," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "for inam nou&yogh;t to guod þerto
Ore louerd it &yogh;elde heom alle þat ani guod &punctelev; for his loue me habbez[r. wollez] ido
bitwene borgoyne and prouence &punctelev; ase men doth me onderstonde
gvode men beoth and almesfole &punctelev; þoru&yogh; kuynde of þe londe
&YOGH;if Ine mot In Fraunce beo &punctelev; þudere ichulle iwende
And bidde mine mete for godes loue &punctelev; &yogh;if he me wole it sende
&YOGH;eot sum[MS. sun] guod man me may iseo &punctelev; and it beo godes wille
And habbe revþe of me and beon min help &punctelev; þat miseise me ne spille."
Þe guode man among al is wo &punctelev; confortede heom and lou&yogh;
Allas þe deol þat þare was &punctelev; þat swuch an hei&yogh; man bitidde
Þat þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; is mete scholde bidde
Deore abou&yogh;te he holi churche &punctelev; and holi churche ri&yogh;te
Wel au&yogh;te ech man hereafter drede &punctelev; a&yogh;en holi churche to fi&yogh;te.
Ase ech man at oþur is leue nam &punctelev; aboute forto wende
And þe holi man In his side &punctelev; &yogh;wodere god him wolde sende
Þare ase god wolde to bidde is mete &punctelev; fort god him sende betere won
god sende is grace among heom alle &punctelev; þat sorie weren echon
¶ Þe kingus Messager of Fraunce &punctelev; to seint thomas cam gon
And seide þat is louerd him bad &punctelev; come to him anon
¶ Forth wende þis holi man &punctelev; ake he nuste for &yogh;wuche þinge
he tok him alto godes wille &punctelev; and cam bifore þe kinge
¶ Anon so þe king him sai&yogh; come &punctelev; a&yogh;en him he gan gon
And ful adoun to is fote akne &punctelev; and cride him merci anon
"blind," he seide, "ich habbe ibe &punctelev; and þat novþe ich onderstonde
Al mi lond to þine wille &punctelev; ich take þe an honde
Þe &yogh;wule ich am in Fraunce king &punctelev; ichulle finde þe inov&yogh;
For ich onderstonde þe soþe nouþe &punctelev; þat þe king hath al þe wou&yogh;."
¶ Þe king sende þis holi man a&yogh;en &punctelev; to Senouns, iwis
And fond him þere spense inou&yogh; &punctelev; him and alle his
More he dude is mi&yogh;te &yogh;eot &punctelev; and bituene he sende is sonde
Forto bringue acord bitwene him &punctelev; and þe kinge of enguelonde
At Momartre In Fraunce &punctelev; þis dai was inome
Þudere weren þis kingues boþe &punctelev; and seint thomas icome
Þe king of Fraunce dude is mi&yogh;te &punctelev; þat heo weren to acord ibrou&yogh;t
Ake þo heo hadden togadere ispeke &punctelev; al it was undo for nou&yogh;t
For þe king swor euere grete oþus &punctelev; þat acord he nolde non
bote þe status of Clarindone &punctelev; iholde weren euerechon
And seint thomas swor þat bi is dai&yogh;e &punctelev; he nolde þarof holde non
Raþur he wolde deth afonge &punctelev; bote þare were oþur iwon
So þat heo departeden with wrathþe &punctelev; þo heo nolden non oþur do
Seint thomas bigan to siche sore &punctelev; and Inliche wep also
"Louerd," he seide, "help me nouþe &punctelev; for þine swete fif wounde
Oþur holi churche is ope þe pointe &punctelev; to beon ibrou&yogh;t to grounde."
Maister bernard of bosham &punctelev; þat[MS. þaf] is .o. clerk was
In priueite bitwene heom to &punctelev; seide to seint thomas
"Sire," he seide, "þe mountmartre &punctelev; þis hul icleoped is
Þare ase &yogh;e[MS. ase &yogh;e ase &yogh;e] habbez pais bispeke &punctelev; of holi churche iwis
And ase þe name seith of þis hulle &punctelev; ase ich douti in mi þou&yogh;t
Þoru&yogh; þi martyrdom holi churche &punctelev; worth formest to pais ibrou&yogh;t."
¶ Sore sichinde seint thomas seide &punctelev; "god wolde þat it were so
And þoru&yogh; mine deþe holi churche &punctelev; Into ri&yogh;t pais were ido
And þat ich hadde with mine blode &punctelev; and with mine liue ibou&yogh;t
Þat heo were in ri&yogh;te lawe &punctelev; and Into guod pais ibrou&yogh;t!"
A&yogh;ein Midsomer it biful &punctelev; þat þe king him gan onderstonde
And In wrathþe of seint thomas &punctelev; wende Into engelonde
Forto saisi sire henri is sone &punctelev; mid al is kinedom
And forto crouny him—longe him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; are he þareto com
And is conseil seide þat it was &punctelev; mest of alle þinge
Holi churche and seint thomas &punctelev; In vnri&yogh;te forto bringe
For þe Erchebischopes ri&yogh;te it were &punctelev; þat of Caunterburie is
To crouny þene kyng of Engelonde &punctelev; and non oþur bischop, iwis
Þe king in preIudice of him &punctelev; and to binimen him is ri&yogh;te
Let oþur bischopes crouni is sone &punctelev; and [cud]de a luyte mi&yogh;te
¶ Four bischopus him crouneden &punctelev; a&yogh;en ri&yogh;te and a&yogh;ein þe wone
Þe Erchebischop of Euerwyke &punctelev; and þe bischop of londone
And þe bischop of salesburi &punctelev; and of roucestre also
In seint peteres churche at westMunstre &punctelev; þeos dede was ido
Þe fader seruede þe sone &punctelev; at þe mete adai
And with [þe] reaume saisede him &punctelev; ase al þat folk isai
Þe tyþingus of þusse þingue &punctelev; to seint thomas huy come
Of þulke onri&yogh;te he sende sone &punctelev; to þe court of rome
Þe pope him sende lettres a&yogh;en &punctelev; and bulle þat he scholde
Amansi þe king and is conseil &punctelev; &yogh;wuch tyme þat he wolde
And suspendi þe bischopes &punctelev; þat swuch onri&yogh;t duden þere
And entrediten al engelond &punctelev; forto it amendet were
¶ Seint thomas heold þe lettres to him &punctelev; forto god him grace sende
&YOGH;uyt cam king henri þe olde &punctelev; eftsone into Fraunce
Þe king of Fraunce was euere anuyd &punctelev; of þulke desturbaunce
And wende aboute to makien acord &punctelev; and bitweone he sende faste
So þat heo weren, ase god it wolde &punctelev; acordut atþe laste
Aseinte Marie dai Maudeleyne &punctelev; Idon was þis dede
In ane Mede þat men cleopiez &yogh;uyte &punctelev; "þe traitores mede"
Also ferde þulke acord &punctelev; ase þe Mede icleoped was
For þeraftur a luyte stounde &punctelev; noþing isene it nas
Muche heo speken In priueite &punctelev; and in grete loue heo wenden atwo
And seint thomas wende þat þe king &punctelev; al is wille wolde do
Maister herebard of boseham &punctelev; to þe kinge he sone wende
For þe foreward þat heo hadde bispeke &punctelev; ase seint thomas him sende
And bad him hote &yogh;elde a&yogh;en &punctelev; ase forth ase he mi&yogh;te
Þat is baillifs in is bischopriche &punctelev; nomen with onri&yogh;te
"&YOGH;e," quath þe king, "wolde he so? &punctelev; &yogh;eot he schal abide
Ichulle iwite hov he wole him bere &punctelev; formest In oþur side
parauntur so faire he may &punctelev; bere him a&yogh;en me
Þat ichulle &yogh;elden him ech feorþing. &punctelev; þarefore cheose he."
¶ Maister herebard wende a&yogh;ein &punctelev; ant tolde seint thomas fore
"&YOGH;e," þou&yogh;te seint thomas &punctelev; "þis pais is alforlore."
Sethþe seint thomas himsulue &punctelev; to þe kinge he wende
to speken more of þe acord &punctelev; &yogh;if he it mi&yogh;te amende
Þe king him welcomede al li&yogh;tliche &punctelev; ase he ne heolde nou&yogh;t þerto
And wende him forth to heren is masse &punctelev; and seint thomas also
he was iwoned to habbe is masse &punctelev; ase it ful to þe dai&yogh;,[MS. dai&yogh;e]
Þe holi Man þou&yogh;te wel &punctelev; &yogh;wat þe Anchaisoun was
Wel narewe þe king him gan biþenche &punctelev; to derne is luþere þou&yogh;t
Ake to him þat wot ech derne þing &punctelev; þing[om. þing] it nas [to] hele nou&yogh;t
Þo þe Masse was ido &punctelev; In conseil longue heo stode
Wel ofte þe king him opbraid &punctelev; þat he dude him er of guode
And þat he au&yogh;te vuele a&yogh;ein him beo &punctelev; &yogh;if he him wel biþou&yogh;te
So þat heo weren togadere longe &punctelev; and þo heo hadden al ido
Þei it luytel &yogh;wile ilaste &punctelev; with loue heo departeden ato.
¶ Seint thomas bigan to sike sore &punctelev; þo he gan him onderstonde
[reprimacio thome.]Þat he hadde longe ibeo &punctelev; oute of engelonde
Þei it were a&yogh;ein is wille &punctelev; it þou&yogh;te him luþer dede
Þat is bischopriche so longe was &punctelev; withoute conseille and rede
to þe king of Fraunce he wende furst &punctelev; and to oþere guode and hende
And faire he tok is leue at heom &punctelev; to engelond forto wende
he þonkede heom of alle honur &punctelev; þat heo him hadden ido
With fair conduyt and gret loue &punctelev; fram heom he wende so
Fram Fraunce he wende with gret honour &punctelev; toward engelonde
At one hauene he gan abide &punctelev; þat Men cleopiez &yogh;witsonde.[near Calais]
Þe lettres þat he hadde of rome &punctelev; to Engelond he sende
to don þe sentence al abrod &punctelev; bifore him ase he wende
Þe Erchebischop of Euerwyke &punctelev; In sentence he let do
And þene bischop of salesburi &punctelev; and of londone also
for heo hadden icrouned þene &yogh;onge king &punctelev; a&yogh;en þe dignete
With onri&yogh;te In is bischopriche &punctelev; he amansede hem alle þre
And þretneden þis holi man &punctelev; þei it were with wou&yogh;
Seint thomas eode toward þe schipe &punctelev; Into engelonde forto wende
A man þare cam fram engelonde &punctelev; a&yogh;en heom,[r. him] guod and hende
"A, sire," he seide, "for godesloue &punctelev; ne passe nou&yogh;t þe se
For þare beoth kni&yogh;tes in Engelonde &punctelev; Iporueide þe forto sle
At eche hauene Men awaytiez &punctelev; to kepe þe, mani on
&YOGH;if þou comest among heom ov&yogh;t &punctelev; þov worst aslawe anon."
"Certes," quath þis holi Man &punctelev; "Inelle no leng abide
to Engelonde Ichulle me drawe &punctelev; tide &yogh;wat bitide
Þei ich beo drawe lime mele &punctelev; Inelle bileue nonmore
to longe ich habbe þaunes ibeo &punctelev; þat rewez me wel sore
Þe soulene þat ich habbe þare forto loke &punctelev; six &yogh;er and more, iwis
Withoute wardein habbez ibeo &punctelev; allas! to longe it is
Aslawe ich worþe, wel ich wot &punctelev; þare, are come ou&yogh;t longe
Ichulle for holi churche ri&yogh;te &punctelev; gladliche þene deth afonge
Ake biddez for me Ihesu crist &punctelev; i bidde eov par charite
bifore alle oþere nameliche &punctelev; o þing biddeth for me
Þat god for is holi grace &punctelev; to Caunterburi me sende
Þat ich mote aliue oþur ded &punctelev; Into mine owene churche [wende]
&YOGH;if ine mai þudere aliue come &punctelev; are ich imartred beo
Þat mi bodi mote &yogh;wan ich am ded— &punctelev; god it graunti me."
his leue he nam wel deolfolliche &punctelev; and to schipe he wende so
he þonkede heom al honour &punctelev; þat Men him hadden ido
And bitei&yogh;te al Fraunce Ihesu crist &punctelev; and blessede it wel faste
Þat folk wep and makede sorewe gret &punctelev; heore deol longe ilaste.
¶ At douere were kni&yogh;tes &yogh;are &punctelev; þat heorden of him telle
Sone ase he come op þere &punctelev; al aredi him to quelle
Sire Reinaud of wareygne &punctelev; and sire Randolf þe brok
And also Gerueis þe schyrreue &punctelev; gret folk with him tok
to kepe þis holi Man at douere &punctelev; ase he come op of þe se
And bote he wolde heore wille do &punctelev; al&yogh;are him forto sle
to þe hauene of sandwiche &punctelev; þat schip wel euene drou&yogh;
In þe schipes seile an hei&yogh; &punctelev; þis holi man let do
Ane Croiz, þat Man fer isai&yogh; &punctelev; Iseuwed faste þerto
Þat was signe of is baner &punctelev; oþur ne kepte he non
Men stoden at sandwich and biheolden &punctelev; þe Croiz wel manion
And seiden, "we iseoth nouþe hiderward come &punctelev; oure bischop thomas;"
Þe &yogh;uyt he was fer in þe se &punctelev; heo wusten &yogh;wat he was
Þat cri was sone wide couth &punctelev; þat folk orn faste inov&yogh;
heo criden and þonkeden Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat heo mosten him aliue iseo
And welcomeden him with Ioye inov&yogh; &punctelev; non more ne mi&yogh;te beo
Þene þridde day of þe Aduent &punctelev; bifore cristemasse it was
Þat he to Engelonde cam &punctelev; þe guode man seint thomas
Þe seuenþe &yogh;er þat he wende furst &punctelev; out of engelonde
Six &yogh;er and a Monthþe he was fleme &punctelev; ase ich me onderstonde
Þis was endleue hondret &yogh;er &punctelev; and sixti &yogh;er and tene
After þat ore swete louerd &punctelev; In is moder ali&yogh;te, ich wene.
[Accusatio militum.]¶ Þat word to þe kni&yogh;tes cam &punctelev; to douere of þis cas
hov seint thomas þe holi man &punctelev; at sandwych ariued was
to sandwich heo wenden faste. &punctelev; seint thomas heo founden anon
With[MS. withith] luþer semblaunt and fals heorte &punctelev; heo welcomeden him echon
And seiden, "hou hauestþov þene wei &punctelev; to engelonde inome
Þat destourbest al þat lond &punctelev; sone so þov art icome
And also alholi churche &punctelev; ase we alle iseoth
Þat þov amansest þus þeos bischopes &punctelev; þat þine felawes beoth
Þov au&yogh;test mid alle lawe &punctelev; loue and pais arere
And þare nas neuere alonde pais &punctelev; sethþe þov bischop were
&YOGH;if þov wenest wel forto do &punctelev; withdrau&yogh; þine dede sone
Oþur Man schal bi þe do &punctelev; ase with swuch a man is to done."
And bi mine louerdes leue þe king &punctelev; þat ech man in ri&yogh;te were
Þat so gret trespas ne wende forth &punctelev; þat it amendet nere
And were eftsone afterward &punctelev; with onri&yogh;te and a&yogh;ein lawe
In desertison of mine churche &punctelev; to costome i[MS. it]drawe."
Þo þe kni&yogh;tes heorden þat þe king &punctelev; consentede þerto
heo bileueden al heore grete mod &punctelev; and heore þretningue also
And in faire Manere beden him &punctelev; ondon is Mansingue
to norisi loue with is felawes &punctelev; and bitwene him and þe kinge
So þat respit bituene heom &punctelev; of þis Ansuere heo nome
Forto seint thomas amoruwe &punctelev; to Caunterburie come
[Aduentus Cantuar.]¶ Seint thomas amoruwe &punctelev; to Caunterburi him drou&yogh;
Ech preost somonede is paroche &punctelev; clanliche in euerech ende
