to beon alle &yogh;are a&yogh;ein him &punctelev; with procession forto wende
So þat with processiones &punctelev; manie and faire inov&yogh;
Þare was Ioie and blisse inou&yogh; &punctelev; more ne mi&yogh;te non beo
heo þonkeden &yogh;eorne Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat aliue him mosten iseo
Of bellene and of tabours &punctelev; so gret was þe soun
Of eche manere gleo and of song &punctelev; þo he cam into toun
Þat man ne mi&yogh;te iheore non oþur þing &punctelev; bote þe noise þat was so gret
Non more ioie ne mi&yogh;te beo &punctelev; þane þare was In euereche stret
Þo he rod into Ierusalem &punctelev; and toward is deþe drov&yogh;
Also was þis holi man &punctelev; ase men mi&yogh;ten iseo þere
For ore louerd wolde þat is deth &punctelev; semblable to his were
Are seint thomas þe holi man &punctelev; to is churche come
Þe Monekus with procession &punctelev; a&yogh;ein him þene wei heo nome
Of is palefrai he li&yogh;te adon &punctelev; and custe þe Monekes echon
to þe weuede wel mildeliche &punctelev; heo ladden him anon
Þo he hadde at churche ido &punctelev; al þat him was to done
With is men wel mildeliche &punctelev; to is In he wende sone.
[Milites retro veniunt.]¶ Seint thomas ne hadde ibeo &punctelev; at is paleis nou&yogh;t longe
Þat þe kni&yogh;tes ne comen &punctelev; heore answere forto afonge
heo beden him ase heo beden er &punctelev; ondon is mansinge
And asoilli þe bischopes[MS. bischepes] &punctelev; þat he let þareInne bringe
"bev freres," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "þat ne mai i do nou&yogh;t
For heo beoth In mansinge &punctelev; þoru&yogh; þe pope ibrou&yogh;t
And .I.ne mai nou&yogh;t ondo is dede &punctelev; &yogh;e wuten wel, in none place
Ake nou&yogh;tforþan ich truste wel &punctelev; so muche In his grace
Þat ichulle asoilli heom &punctelev; In þusse fourme fawe
Þat heo don sikernesse forto stonde &punctelev; at holi churche lawe
And to þe lokinge of holi churche— &punctelev; ake in oþur fourme non."
Þe kny&yogh;tes, þo heo herden þis &punctelev; chidden faste echon
And þo heo nadden non oþur word &punctelev; in wrathþe forth heo wende
And tolden þe bischopes heore ansuere &punctelev; þat heom þudere sende
Þe bischopes maden heom wroþe inou&yogh; &punctelev; ant þretneden him wel faste
Ake naþeles þe tweyne of heom &punctelev; withdrowen heom atþe laste
¶ Þe bischop of salesburi &punctelev; and of londone also
to holi churche heo wolden stonde &punctelev; and to is lokinge also
¶ Ake þe Erchebischop of Euerwik &punctelev; anonri&yogh;t heom withsede
"Daþeheit habbe þat so atstonde &punctelev; so folliche at ower rede
Forto don us in is grace &punctelev; þat euere hath ibeon ore fo
And hath idon us mani a schame &punctelev; and þanne he wolde wel mo
Þei he habbe ouer ov power &punctelev; ouer me ne hauez he non
For erchebischop ich am, wel &yogh;e wutez &punctelev; ase wel ase he is on
Ich habbe a luytel Coffre &punctelev; þat stant hol and sount
Atþe leste þare beoth Inne &yogh;eot &punctelev; Ei&yogh;te hundret pound
&YOGH;are ich am to spene þat &punctelev; and &yogh;eot me þinchez to luyte
Forto awreken us wel of him &punctelev; and forto alegge is pruyte
Wende we to þe kinge anon &punctelev; and telle him of is dede
Þat him ne tit neuere pais &punctelev; bote he þarof him rede."
[hic ueniunt ad regem.]¶ Þeos þreo bischopus hasteliche &punctelev; ouer se þene wei nome
A luyte bifore cristemasse &punctelev; to þe kinge heo come
And founden him in Normandie. &punctelev; adoun heo fullen akne
heo beden him holden op his honour &punctelev; stifliche hore help to beo
And tolden him hov þis holi Man &punctelev; þo he to londe cam
Destourbede alholi churche &punctelev; and is kynedam
And hov he hadde with gret pruyte &punctelev; In mansinge ido
Al þat maden is sone king &punctelev; and consenteden þareto
And hov in despit of him &punctelev; he dude swuch luþer dede
And þat he ne scholde neuere in pais beo &punctelev; bote he nome anoþur to rede
[Rex iratus.]¶ Þe king, þo he heorde þis &punctelev; for wrathþe he was nei&yogh; wod
he eode op and doun ase witles &punctelev; and ofte in þou&yogh;te stod
"&YOGH;if he amansez alle þat maden &punctelev; mine sone king," he seide
"Mid þe furste he amansez me &punctelev; for it was min owene dede
Þe traitur aspillez al þat lond &punctelev; and bringez us in wrechhede
ho mi&yogh;te In swuch soruwe &punctelev; longe eni lif lede?"
Ofte he corsede alle þeo &punctelev; þat he hadde forth ibrou&yogh;t
Of þe false preost and is fo &punctelev; þat heo ne awreke him nou&yogh;t
Þat destourbede al þat lond &punctelev; and brou&yogh;te in wrechhede
Ase he eode op and doun[MS. don doun] &punctelev; ofte þat word he seide
¶ Þe kni&yogh;tes þo [heo] heorden þis &punctelev; stoden some stille
And biþou&yogh;ten heom wel priueliche &punctelev; to paie þe kinges wille
Þe foure þat mest schrewes weren &punctelev; biþou&yogh;ten hem of guyle
Sire reynaud le fiz ovrs &punctelev; and sire huwe de moruile
And sire willam traci &punctelev; and sire Richard de bruiz
heore names for heore schrewehede &punctelev; ne beoth nout for&yogh;ite &yogh;uyt
huy nomen heom to rede stilleliche &punctelev; to passi þe se
to paie þe kingus wille &punctelev; seint thomas forto sle
Stilleliche heo wenden forth &punctelev; þat no man it nuste
heo weren nei&yogh;wat atþe se &punctelev; are þe king it wuste
Þo þe king it onder&yogh;at &punctelev; After heom he sende
Þat heo bilefde heore folie &punctelev; and a&yogh;enward to him wende
Ake þis messager ne mi&yogh;te nou&yogh;t &punctelev; ouertake heom for none ginne
For are he cam to þe se &punctelev; heo weren fer withInne
Þo made þe king deol inov &punctelev; þat heo weren forth iwend
And þat is messager ne ouertok heom nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat he after heom hadde isend.
[Predicatio thome.]¶ Seint thomas at Caunterburi &punctelev; amidewynteres dai
Stod and prechede al þat folk &punctelev; þat mani a man isai
In is prechingue he bigan &punctelev; to siche swiþe sore
And deol and sorewe made inov &punctelev; ne mi&yogh;te no man more
Swiþe sore he gan to wepe &punctelev; þe teres ornen adoun
Þare was mani wepinde Ei&yogh;e &punctelev; wel sone &yogh;eont al þe toun
"Mine leue freond," quath þis holi man &punctelev; weopinde suyþe sore
"Ouwer preost ich habbe ane &yogh;wyle ibeo &punctelev; ake ine mai no lengore more,[This v. added on the bottom.]
For min endedai is nei&yogh; icome &punctelev; Ine worþe here nou&yogh;t longe
Ich am redi for holi churche ri&yogh;te &punctelev; deth forto afonge
biddez for me for godes loue &punctelev; and for holi churche also
Þat geth almest nouþe to grounde &punctelev; bote god nime &yogh;eme þarto
Deth ichulle wel fain take &punctelev; &yogh;wan it is godus wille
For þe ri&yogh;te of holi churche &punctelev; raþur þane heo spille."
bok and candele he nam anon &punctelev; and amansede ri&yogh;t þere
Alle þat werreden[MS. weṛrṇeden] holi churche &punctelev; and a&yogh;ein hire ri&yogh;tes were
And nameliche sire randolf þe brok &punctelev; and sire robert de bruyz[r. Brok] also
Þat þe Erchebischope of Caunterburi &punctelev; gret onri&yogh;t habbez ido
For þe &yogh;wuyle þat he was out of londe &punctelev; þe king henri bitok
Þe bischopriche al forto loke &punctelev; sire Randolf þe brok
And he mad Robert de brok &punctelev; is clerk þat was þo
Of al þis wardein onder him. &punctelev; þat dude is londe wel wo
And dude him fair bold arere &punctelev; of þat he nam with wou&yogh;
Þerinne acristemasse dai &punctelev; þo þe mansinge was ido
he sat and .et. wel nobleliche &punctelev; and manie with him also
Seint thomas (!)[r. he (so the other MSS.)] caste houndes of is bred &punctelev; þat bifore him lai
Þo handlede he oþur bred &punctelev; and let menge hit at þe laste
Wit oþur bred þat lai biside &punctelev; and to þe houndes let it caste
Al þat he ihandlet hadde &punctelev; þe houndes al forlete
And chosen out þat oþur þareamong &punctelev; and wel clanliche it ete
Þe guodnesse[al. mansinge] was on him isene &punctelev; anonri&yogh;t þat ilke dai
&YOGH;wane þe houndes þat bred forsoken &punctelev; þat bifore him lai
¶ bi a fridai þulke &yogh;eres &punctelev; was cristemassedai
[Milites.]Þare was gret miracle of god &punctelev; þat al þat folk isai.
¶ Þis four luþere kni&yogh;tes &punctelev; of &yogh;wuche we gunne telle
to engelonde wel sone comen &punctelev; seint thomas to quelle
to þe castel of saltwode &punctelev; aseint Iohanes dai heo come
Six milene fram caunterburi &punctelev; and þare heore In heo nome
And sire Randolf þe brok &punctelev; to hem cam wel sone
heore conseil heo nomen þulke ni&yogh;t &punctelev; þe luþere dede to done
Þene morewe, achildremasse dai &punctelev; þo god þene dai sende
Sire Randulf þe brok wel stilleliche &punctelev; to Caunterburi he wende
Forto enqueri of seint thomas &punctelev; &yogh;ware heo mi&yogh;ten him finde
Þat he ne drowe him nou&yogh;t awei &punctelev; ne hudde him no&yogh;were bihinde
[Milites.]¶ Þis kni&yogh;tes þene Tywesdai &punctelev; no lengore nolden bileue
Ake wenden heom to Caunterburi &punctelev; wel are it were eue
A luyte bifore compelin &punctelev; to seint thomas heo come
Þene ri&yogh;te wei ful baldeliche &punctelev; Into is chaumbre heo nome
heo comen and founden him stilleliche &punctelev; In is chaumbre stonde
With priue clerkes &punctelev; and gret conseil hadden on honde
Sire Reynaud le fiz ours &punctelev; grimliche forth iwende
"Sire," he seide, "ore louerd þe king &punctelev; in message us hidere sende
Fram him out of Normandie &punctelev; Ane heste we habbez ibrou&yogh;t
Þat þov do is heste— &punctelev; ne bilef þov it nou&yogh;t
And þat þou wende sone to is sone &punctelev; þat &yogh;ong king imaked is
Forto amendi a&yogh;einest him &punctelev; þat þov hast is fader idon amis
And swer þene othþ to beon him trewe &punctelev; and of þe baronie also
Þat þou halst of him in chef &punctelev; do þat þo[u] au&yogh;test him forto do
Þe clerkes þat þov bringest with þe &punctelev; &yogh;if hereate heo wollez atstonde
Schullen suerie þe kinge trewe to beo &punctelev; oþur heo schullen out of londe."
[Thomas.]¶ "Bev frere," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "Inelle þe noþing lie
Þe kinge ichulle don ri&yogh;t and lawe &punctelev; of þe baronie
Ake nolde it god þat holi churche &punctelev; onder fote were so
Þat ich oþur mine clerkus &punctelev; scholden ani othþ þe kinge do
For þov wost wel alle þe lewede Men &punctelev; þat beoth In his londe
Ne sweriez him nou&yogh;t þene oth &punctelev; as ich me onderstonde
Nov wolde &yogh;e holi churche &punctelev; In grete seruage do
In more þane ani lewede man beo? &punctelev; nai, it ne worth nou&yogh;t so."
[Miles.]¶ "Me þinchez wel," quath sire Reynaud &punctelev; "þat þov nelt do noþing
Of þe heste þat we bringez &punctelev; fram ore louerd þe king
Also in is half we hotez þe &punctelev; þat þov asoili also
his bischopes þat þov hast &punctelev; In mansinge ido."
[thomas.]¶ "bev frere," quathþ[MS. quathy] seint thomas &punctelev; "it nis mi dede nou&yogh;t
Ake þoru&yogh; þe popes owene mouthþ &punctelev; in sentence heo beoth ibrou&yogh;t
¶ And þou wost wel it ne fallez nou&yogh;t to me &punctelev; þe popus dede ondo."
[Miles.]"Þei þe pope it hete do," quat sire Reynaud &punctelev; "þoru&yogh; þe it is ido."
¶ "&yogh;if þe pope hath," quath thomas &punctelev; "In sentence ibrou&yogh;t[thomas.]
heom þat habbez me misdon &punctelev; he ne mispaiez me nou&yogh;t."
[Miles.]¶ "In eche manere þov schewest wel" &punctelev; sire Reinaud seide þo
"Forto anuye ore louerd þe king &punctelev; and þat þov art is fo
&YOGH;wareþoru&yogh; we iseoth wel &punctelev; þat þov wilnest to don him wo
And woldest beo king in is stude— &punctelev; ake þou ne worst neuere so
And &yogh;if þou mi&yogh;test, binime him is crovne— &punctelev; ake so ne schal it nou&yogh;t go."[both lines transposed in other MSS.]
¶ "Certes, bev frere," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "Ine þenche noþing þerto
Ake raþur ichulle him þerto helpe &punctelev; so muche so ich mai
And for him and for his honour &punctelev; ich bidde ni&yogh;t and dai
For þare nis nouþe man on eorþe &punctelev; þat ich louie, iwis
So muche ase him, sauue is fader &punctelev; þat &yogh;eot mi louerd is
Aseinte Marie dai Maugdeleyne &punctelev; forsoþe i segge þe
Þo þe acord was formest imaked &punctelev; bitwene mi louerd and me
he seide me þat ich lete amansi &punctelev; alle þat hadden misdo
Mine churche þat is his owene Moder— &punctelev; and ich habbe idon so."
[Miles.]Seistþov þat mi louerd þe king &punctelev; In mansinge let do
Alle þat maden is sone king? &punctelev; ne consentede he þerto
Nas it al is owene dede &punctelev; and bi none oþur mannes lore
Avoy, sire preost, biþench þe bet &punctelev; ne seie þov so namore."
¶ "Certes, sire," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "þou wost wel it was so,[thomas.]
For þou were þare þiself þo &punctelev; and manie oþere þerto
bischopus and Erchebischopus ek &punctelev; and oþere grete and hei&yogh;e
&YOGH;e fif hundred men and mo &punctelev; also þov wel isei&yogh;e."
[Miles.]¶ "beo stille," quath þis luþere kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "hold þinne mouthþ, ich rede
Þov misseist mi louerd þe king &punctelev; daþeit alle þat it seide
ho mi&yogh;te soffri swuch sclaundre &punctelev; bote he nome þarof wreche
bi þe fei þat schal to god &punctelev; man schal þe anoþur teche!"
his felawes euerechone &punctelev; heore Armes abrod caste
And ferden ase Men þat weren wode &punctelev; and þretneden him wel faste
to þe Monekus heo wenden anon &punctelev; "comieth here forth," he seide
"&YOGH;e holdeth here þe kingus fo &punctelev; witiez him wel, ich rede
Þat &yogh;e to þe kingus wille &punctelev; is bodi &yogh;e[om. &yogh;e] habben al&yogh;are
Oþur he schal ouwer londes aboute &punctelev; and ower maneres maken wel bare!"
[thomas.]¶ "Sire Reynaud," quath seint thomas &punctelev; "wenstþou þat ichulle fleo
Nai par deu, nou&yogh;t a fote &punctelev; for þe king ne for þe."
[Miles.]¶ "bi god, sire bischop," quath þis oþur &punctelev; "bi þat þou wost þen ende
Þi fleoinge schal beo luyte wurth &punctelev; þou ne schalt nou&yogh;t wel fer wende."
Þis kni&yogh;tes in grete wrathþe þo &punctelev; wenden heom forth echon
And leten heom army swyþe wel &punctelev; and comen a&yogh;en anon
W[i]th suerdes and with axes &punctelev; and with oþere armes mo
Robert de brok, þe luþere clerk &punctelev; he was with heom þo
Into þe cloistre of Caunterburi &punctelev; with grete noyse heo comen weue
Þe Monekus songen Euesong &punctelev; for it was welnei&yogh; eue
Some for þe grete noyse &punctelev; fullen adoun for fere
And some bigonne to fleon aboute &punctelev; ase men þat witlese were
Seint thomas nam ane Croyz &punctelev; ake oþure armes non
And þarewith wel baldeliche &punctelev; he eode a&yogh;ein is fon
Þis Monekus ornen[MS. ornem] to him some &punctelev; "sire, merci," heo seiden
"For godes loue abid &yogh;ut here &punctelev; ore louerd þe mai &yogh;uyt rede
Soffre þat we helpen þe &punctelev; oþur þat we with þe dei&yogh;e."
Some wolden makien þe doren &punctelev; þo heo þat folk isei&yogh;e
"bileuez," quath þe holie Man &punctelev; "&yogh;e ne doth nou&yogh;t as þe wise
Singuth forth ower auesong &punctelev; and doth ore louerd is seruise
Man ne schal of holi churche &punctelev; castel maken non
latez foles ane stounde awede &punctelev; and in heore folie gon!"
Þe kni&yogh;tes comen reken In &punctelev; heore folie forto do
And seiden, "&yogh;ware is nouþe þis traitour &punctelev; and þis false bischop also?"
[thomas.]¶ Seint thomas bar þe Croiz on honde &punctelev; and answerede is fon
"Ich am here, godus preost &punctelev; ake traitour nam ich non
Sechez him þat wole ov fleo &punctelev; oþur þat drede ovwer þretninge
Non rediore ne beoth ower swerdes &punctelev; me to deþe bringue
Þat min heorte prestore nis &punctelev; þene deþ forto take
For þe ri&yogh;tes of holi churche &punctelev; Inelle nou&yogh;t det forsake."
Þare wende forth on of heom &punctelev; and is huyre of him drou&yogh;
And is mantel anon afterward &punctelev; with gret uilte inou&yogh;
Sire Reynaud le fiz ours &punctelev; pursiwede him anon
¶ "Sire Reynaud," quat seint thomas þo &punctelev; "hov schal þis nouþe gon
Ofte ich habbe þe guod ido &punctelev; and manie oþure mo."
"Þov schalt sone," quath þis oþur &punctelev; "iwite hou it go
Traitour, þou art ded anon &punctelev; non oþur nelle ich do."
"Forsoþe," quath þis holi man &punctelev; "wel prest ich am þerto
For þe ri&yogh;tes of holi churche &punctelev; dei&yogh;e ichulle wel fawe
&YOGH;if heo mi&yogh;te þereafterward &punctelev; in pais beo and in lawe
Ak ich ov bidde &yogh;if &yogh;e sechez me &punctelev; in ovre louerdes name
Þat &yogh;e ne comen nei&yogh; non oþur man &punctelev; harm ne do ne schame
For non oþur gulti nis &punctelev; of þat &yogh;e witez me
heo buth alle gultlese bote ich one &punctelev; þarof sikere &yogh;e beo
And also ase heo gultlese beoth &punctelev; harmles latez heom wende."
Þe guode man sat adoun akneo &punctelev; þo he sai al þe ende
Forto afonge þene stronge deth &punctelev; is heued he buyde adoun
And softe, ase some iherden &punctelev; he seide þis oresoun
[Oratio thome.]¶ "Ore louerd and seinte Marie &punctelev; and seint Denis also
And alle þe avouwes of þis churche &punctelev; In &yogh;was ore ich am ido
Ich bitake mine soule here &punctelev; and holi churche ri&yogh;te."
&YOGH;eot he bad for holi churche &punctelev; þo he nadde non oþur mi&yogh;te
Sire Reynaud le fiz ovrs &punctelev; mest schrewe of echon
Forto smite þis holi man &punctelev; is swerd he drou&yogh; anon
¶ Ake Edward grim, þat was is clerk &punctelev; in g[ra]untebrugge ibore
his louerd to helpe &yogh;if he mi&yogh;te &punctelev; his Arm he pulte bifore
he woundede is Arm swyþe sore &punctelev; þat blod orn faste adoun
W[i]th þulke dunte he smot also &punctelev; seint thomas ope þe croun
Þat blod orn bi[MS. bi corr. to to] is face adoun &punctelev; In is ri&yogh;t half of þe wounde
Lovde gradde þis luþere kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "smitez alle to grounde!"
Edward grim and[MS. and and] alle is men &punctelev; þat þo aboute him were
Atornen aboute ech in is side &punctelev; ope þe weuedes for fere
Ase it bi ore louerd ferde &punctelev; þo þe giwes him nome
his desciples flovwen anon &punctelev; men nusten &yogh;ware heo bicome
For in þe godspel it is iwriten &punctelev; þat ore louerd himself seide
"&YOGH;wane a man smit þene schepherde &punctelev; þe schep wollez tosprede"
And ore louered bad for is desciples &punctelev; þat men ne scholden hem[MS. him] non harm do
Þaron þou&yogh;te seint thomas &punctelev; he bad for is men also
An oþur kni&yogh;t smot seint thomas &punctelev; in þulke sulue wounde
And made him bouwie is face adoun &punctelev; and loke toward þe grounde
Þe þridde in þulke sulue stude &punctelev; þareafter him smot anon
And makede him loute adoun &punctelev; is face to þe ston
In þulke stude þe feorþe smot &punctelev; þare þe oþere hadden er ido
Þat þe point of is swerd brak &punctelev; In þe Marbre ato.
¶ &YOGH;eot þat ilke point at Caunterburi &punctelev; þe Monekus doth wite
For honour of þe holi man &punctelev; þat þarewith was ismite.
With þulke stroke he smot al of &punctelev; þe scholle and þe croune
Þat þut brain ful on þe pauement &punctelev; al abrod þare doune
þat &yogh;wite brayn[MS. braym] was imeind &punctelev; with þe rede blod þere
Þat colur was wel fair to seo &punctelev; þei ich[al. hit] reulich were
Al round it orn aboute is heued &punctelev; ase it were a dyademe
And alround þareabouten it lay &punctelev; &yogh;wareof men token grete &yogh;eme
For &yogh;wane men peyntiez an Anletnesse[al. halewe] &punctelev; &yogh;e ne seoth it nou&yogh;t bileued
Þat þere nis depeint a Roundel &punctelev; alaboute þe heued
Þat rondel men cleopiez þe diademe. &punctelev; for manie iseien þat cas,[al. as me se&yogh; þer a fair cas]
bi þe diademe of is brayne &punctelev; þat he holi was
Þo þis holi man imartret was &punctelev; þis kni&yogh;tes graden echon
"Þis traitour is to deþe ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; wende we henne anon
Siwieth us &yogh;e kingus men alle &punctelev; and alle þat with him beoth
Of þis traytur &yogh;e beoth awreke &punctelev; ase &yogh;e nouþe iseoth
he þou&yogh;te beo herre þane þe king &punctelev; and binimen him is croune
And bringe to nou&yogh;t al engelond &punctelev; ake nouþe he lijth þare doune."
Ase þe giwes bi ore louerd seiden &punctelev; þo heo wolden him to deþe do
Þat he made him kin[g] and non nas &punctelev; and godes sone also
Þo þis luþere kni&yogh;tes weren &punctelev; fram þis holi man igon
Robert de brok him biþou&yogh;te &punctelev; and turnede him a&yogh;en anon
And þoru&yogh; þe scolle smot is swerd &punctelev; deope withInne is heued
Þo þe scolle al amti was &punctelev; and no brayn Inne bileued
Ase þe giwes leten smite ore louerd &punctelev; to þe heorte grounde
After þe deþe with a spere &punctelev; and maden þe fifte wounde
¶ Þis luþere men alle in one stude &punctelev; smiten seint thomas
In þe scolle ri&yogh;t euene abrod &punctelev; þare is croune was
he nas nou&yogh;t þe man þat he wolde &punctelev; is heued enes withdrawe
Ne fondi forto fleo heore strokes &punctelev; ne enes aweiward wawe
Ne nou&yogh;t enes groni ne makien cri &punctelev; bote mildeliche and softe
Euere he heold is heued forth &punctelev; alþei heo smiten him ofte.
Þis luþere kni&yogh;tes wenden anon &punctelev; to is tresorie
breken is doren and is coffres &punctelev; and duden gret robberie
heo nomen is cloþes and is hors &punctelev; and is tresor also
Chartres and oþur priue writes &punctelev; þat in is coffres weren ido
heo it bitoken sire Randolf de brok &punctelev; þat he þarewith wende
to þe kinge into Noremandie &punctelev; and segge þat heo him sende
And þat he dude þarewith &yogh;wat he wolde &punctelev; and &yogh;if þare ani were
A&yogh;en is wille oþur is fraunchise &punctelev; þat he[MS. heo] sone totere
Among is tresor heo founden also &punctelev; tweie wel stronge heren
Wel filliche heo casten heom awei &punctelev; ase þei heo nou&yogh;t wurth nere
Ake naþeles heo biþou&yogh;ten heom þo &punctelev; and weren somdel in fere
And seiden bitwene heom stilleliche &punctelev; "guod man we wenez he were."
Sire willam traci tolde sethþe &punctelev; of þis guode man seint thomas
Þe bischope of Eccetre in is schrifte &punctelev; ase he of him ischriue was
Þat þo þe guode man was aslawe &punctelev; and heo ovtward were
So sore heom agros þat heo weren &punctelev; nei&yogh; witlese for fere
For heom þou&yogh;te euere ase heo eoden outward &punctelev; ne wenden heo no so bliue
Þat þe eorþe openede onder heom &punctelev; forto swolewen hem aliue.
¶ Þo þis guod man imartred was &punctelev; and þe kni&yogh;tes weren out igon
Into al þe toun of Caunterburi &punctelev; couth it was anon
Þat folc cride deolfulliche &punctelev; and to churche heo drowe
And onovreden þat holi bodi &punctelev; and custen it ofte inowe
Þe Monekus comen sone þerto &punctelev; and þis holi bodi toke
And leiden faire In one bere &punctelev; and bifore þe Autere it biwoke
Þat face was &yogh;wy&yogh;t and cler inou&yogh; &punctelev; and no blod nas þarinne
bote fram þe ri&yogh;t half of is frount &punctelev; toward þe left chinne
A smal rewe þere was of blode &punctelev; þat ouer is nose drou&yogh;
More blod þar nas in al is face &punctelev; ase folk isai&yogh; inou&yogh;
Þe woundene bledden al þe ni&yogh;t &punctelev; and men henten þareof, iwis
And In þe churche of Caunterburi &punctelev; of þulke blode &yogh;eot is
Ake he nas neuere of þe worse hewe &punctelev; for al þat he bledde þere
bote in guode heowe and cler inov &punctelev; ri&yogh;t ase he liues were
And somdel ley&yogh;inde with þe mouþe— &punctelev; he lai ase þei he slepe
Muche folk was aboute him &punctelev; þat blod forto kepe
And forto gaderi of þe blode &punctelev; þat isched was on þe grounde
And of þat eorþe þat was bibled &punctelev; and glade weren &yogh;wan heo it founden
And hoso mi&yogh;te enes þat bodi cusse &punctelev; he was glad inou&yogh;
Amorewe þe luþere kni&yogh;tes &punctelev; Armeden heom eftsone
And withoute toun nome heore red &punctelev; &yogh;wat heom was to done
heo biradden forto nime þat holi bodi &punctelev; and with wilde hors todrawe
And sethþe hangen it on a waritreo— &punctelev; heo seiden þat it was lawe
For he nas nou&yogh;t wuyrþe to beon ibured &punctelev; In churche ne In churche|&yogh;erd
Þe Monekus þou&yogh;ten þis swiþe wel &punctelev; and weren ful sore aferd
heo bureden þat holi bodi &punctelev; hasteliche þerebiside
With luyte solempnete inov&yogh; &punctelev; for heo ne dorsten no leng abide
Þis holi bodi was ibured &punctelev; In þe munstre of ihesu crist
bifore seint Austines weuede &punctelev; and seint Iohanes þe baptist
heo ne dorsten nou&yogh;t so longue &punctelev; forto þat bodi iwasche were
Al ongreiþet to leggen it In &punctelev; [heo] hei&yogh;eden bliue for fere
Ase heo strepten of is cloþes &punctelev; al aboue heo founde
Clerkene cloþes ase him to bifeol &punctelev; and oþere bi þe grounde
Monekene Abite withInne &punctelev; ase heo founden þere
boþe Covele and stamin &punctelev; he founden next is here
So þat he was Monek withInne &punctelev; and seculer withoute
Nuste no man is priueite &punctelev; of þa[t] him was aboute
And next is flesche þe here was &punctelev; with knottes mani on
Þat deope in is flesche seten &punctelev; some ri&yogh;t to þe bon
Þarof he hadde schurte and brech &punctelev; luytel aise he mi&yogh;te ifele
So þat he was þareinne ibounde &punctelev; fram þe scholdre to þe hele
With luytel aise he mi&yogh;te sitte &punctelev; and ful onaisiliche ride
And onaisiliche ligge also &punctelev; opon eþur side.[This v. on the margin.]
Ful of wormes was is flesch &punctelev; to al oþur wo
In none creature, ich onderstonde &punctelev; neuere ne weren iseie mo
For in euereche stude of is flesche &punctelev; so þicke heo weren isete
Þat þe grete ne mi&yogh;ten for þe smale &punctelev; comen to heore mete
Faste heo schouen and cropen also &punctelev; ase ametene[formice overwr.] al aboute
Ake þe smale cleoueden faste to &punctelev; þe grete bilefden withoute
¶ he deide endleue houndret &yogh;er &punctelev; and seuenti and on
After þat ore swete louerd &punctelev; of is moder nam flesch and bon
Of þreo and fifti &yogh;eres elde &punctelev; himsulf he was þo
Mani a fair dai he hadde ileoued &punctelev; in care and in wo.
Þe king was in normandie &punctelev; and herof nuste nou&yogh;t
he made deol and sorewe inou&yogh; &punctelev; þo þe tiþinge him was ibrou&yogh;t
In þe Castel of Argenteyn &punctelev; he soiornede þo
Withoute þe &yogh;ates ne cam he nou&yogh;t &punctelev; fourti dai&yogh;es ne mo
Ake euere he heold him in priuete &punctelev; In wepinge and oþur wo
For none neode þat Man mi&yogh;te habbe &punctelev; withoute he nolde go
Ne rou&yogh;te he noþing of þe world &punctelev; wel luyte he eat also
Þe sorewe and þe deol þat he made &punctelev; ne mi&yogh;te neuere beo ido
he sende anon to Caunterburi &punctelev; for þis deolful dede
And bad þe Monekus pitousliche &punctelev; þat heo for him bede
And sende heom þat it nas &punctelev; noþing bi is rede
Ake þat þe kni&yogh;tes wenden forth &punctelev; and noþing him fore ne seide
And þat he sende after heom &punctelev; forto comen a&yogh;e
¶ And are þe messeger were to heom icome &punctelev; huy weren fer in þe se
to þe pope also god &punctelev; þe king sende sone
And bad is conseil pitousliche &punctelev; &yogh;wat him were to done
he bad him for þe loue of god &punctelev; In swyche anguise him rede
Þat he were ischriue and asoilled &punctelev; of so luþer a dede
Þe pope hadde ful gret pite &punctelev; þat he swuch word him sende
¶ And gret Ioye for he hadde wille &punctelev; is lif forto amende
twei cardinales he sende him &punctelev; wise men boþe to
to schriuen him of þulke sunne &punctelev; and asoilli him also
And þe bischopus forto asoilli also &punctelev; þat weren in mansinge
Welle, þat þe Cardinales &punctelev; welcome weren þe kinge
Þe king bad heom deolfulliche &punctelev; to schriuen him of þe dede
And bihet heom studefastliche &punctelev; to stonden alto heore rede
he swor on þe halidom &punctelev; þat þoru&yogh; him nas it nou&yogh;t
Ne bi is wille, ne bi his heste &punctelev; þat he was to deþe ibrou&yogh;t
And &yogh;et he seide þat for is fader deþe &punctelev; so sori man he nas
Ne for is moderes noþemo &punctelev; Ase he for is deþe was
And he seide he wolde with guode heorte &punctelev; alle þe penaunces afonge
Þat heo wolden on him legge &punctelev; ne weren heo no so stronge
For he was enchaison of is deþe &punctelev; and of is anuy also
Þe kni&yogh;tes, forto paien him &punctelev; brou&yogh;ten him þerto
heo asoileden him and setten on him &punctelev; stronge penaunce inou&yogh;
In priuete ase ri&yogh;t was &punctelev; þat no man þarof nuste
And þis also þat ichulle novþe telle &punctelev; þat alle Men of wusten
his priue penaunces some weren &punctelev; fastinge forto make
[vv. 22612 om. in the other MSS.]And In fale tymes linne cloth and schurte of selk &punctelev; for is sunnes forsake
Into þe holie londe he scholde finde &punctelev; to hundret kny&yogh;tes, to fi&yogh;te
Al ane &yogh;er with þe templers &punctelev; for holi churche ri&yogh;te
¶ And þat he scholde þe status of Clarindone &punctelev; al clanliche with|drawe
Þoru &yogh;wuche statuz þis holi man &punctelev; ibrou&yogh;t was of lijfdawe
And þat he clanliche &yogh;olde a&yogh;ein &punctelev; al þat binome was
Þe bischopriche of Caunterburi &punctelev; for wrathe of seint thomas
And þat he scholde is vuele wille &punctelev; also clanliche for&yogh;iue
Alle þat he hadde out of londe &punctelev; for wrathe of him idriue
Þe king grauntede al heore wille &punctelev; weopinde swiþe sore
And seide þat it was to luyte &punctelev; and bad on him legge more
And &yogh;eot, "al to ouwer wille here &punctelev; mi bodi ich bitake
&YOGH;iueth me penaunces inowe &punctelev; Inelle neuer on forsake."
he wende out atþe Churche dore &punctelev; asoiled forto beo
And seide þat he nas nou&yogh;t wurthe &punctelev; þat men scholde him withinne iseo
And withoute churche pitousliche &punctelev; he sat adoun akne
Ake þe Cardinales nolden nou&yogh;t &punctelev; is bodi al onwreo
And somdel aboue is cloþes &punctelev; heo asoileden him ri&yogh;t þere
For deol heo weopen pitousliche &punctelev; and manie þat þare were
his sone also made one biheste &punctelev; with wel dreorie chere
Þe faderes penaunce to folfulle &punctelev; &yogh;if he of power nere
Oþur &yogh;if he felle into feble stat &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te it nou&yogh;t fulende
Opon himself þe charge he nam &punctelev; and dude ase guod and hende
Þus was þe holi man &punctelev; ibrou&yogh;t to martyrdom
Mani was þe fair miracle &punctelev; þat for him sone com.[Both verses are written in one line.]
[Jerusalem.]¶ For In Ierusalemes londe men wusten &punctelev; of is martyrdom
WithInne þe furste fourteneNi&yogh;t &punctelev; þat he þe det nam
For a Monek in þulke londe &punctelev; In is deþe vuele lai
And is Abbod cam to him &punctelev; bifore is endedai[Both verses are written in one line.]
And conIurede him[MS. him þat him] þat he scholde &punctelev; after is deþe þere
to him comen and tellen him fore &punctelev; in &yogh;wuch stat he were
So þat þis Monek deide sone &punctelev; ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas
to is Abbod sethþe he cam &punctelev; ase he Iconioured was
he tolde him þat þulke tyme &punctelev; þat he to heuene cam
Þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; þolede martyrdom
And þat is soule þulke tyme &punctelev; to heuene wende anon
"Fair was þat processioun &punctelev; þat a&yogh;en him cam gon
Of Aungles and of patriarks &punctelev; and of apostles also
Of Martirs and of confessours &punctelev; and of virgines þerto
heo nome alle þeos holi soule &punctelev; And bifore ore louerd sone
brou&yogh;ten hire with Ioye and blisse &punctelev; ase he sat in is throne
his croune was al of ismite &punctelev; and blodi was is heued
And is brayn was al isched &punctelev; þare nas nou&yogh;t bileued
¶ 'Thomas, thomas,' quath ore louerd &punctelev; 'þus it fallez to þe
To þine louerdus court to come &punctelev; In swuche manere to me
For þi seruise ich þe &yogh;yue &punctelev; ase muchel Ioie and blis
Ase ich &yogh;af seint peter &punctelev; þat min Apostel is.'
he sette ane Croune opon is heued &punctelev; of golde cler and guod
Swyþe wel bicam þat bri&yogh;te gold &punctelev; opon þe rede blod
More Ioie ne mi&yogh;te non beo &punctelev; þane In heuene for him was
For þe Erchebischope of caunterburi &punctelev; is name was seint thomas
Þe Tywesdai after Cristemasse &punctelev; þe furste þat þere cam
Þis holi man in Engelonde &punctelev; þolede martyrdom
And &yogh;wan þov iheorst of is deþe telle &punctelev; of Men of Engelonde
Þov ileue me of þis tale &punctelev; and þe soþe onderstonde."
Þe Abbod sone amorewe &punctelev; ne fur&yogh;at nou&yogh;t seint thomas
Ake þe patria[r]cke of Ierusalem &punctelev; he tolde al hov it was
So þat forþere in þe &yogh;ere &punctelev; it was wel onderstonde
Þo pilegrimes þudere comen &punctelev; out of Engelonde
In &yogh;wat manere he was aslawe &punctelev; and &yogh;wuch tyme he was ded
Þe pilegrimes tolden al þe soþe &punctelev; ase þe Monek hadde er iseid
Þus was ikud In Ierusalem &punctelev; þe deth of seint thomas
WithInne þe furste fourtene ny&yogh;t &punctelev; þat he imartred was.
[Guerra regum.]¶ þe fifte &yogh;er, ich onderstonde &punctelev; after is martyrdom
bitwene kyng henri and is sone &punctelev; gret contek þare bicom
Þe sone bicam prout anon &punctelev; for is kynedom
And of is fader tolde luyte &punctelev; and werre ope him nam
Þe meste del was with is sone &punctelev; of al Engelonde
And þe kyng of Fraunce also &punctelev; and þe king of scotlonde
So þat þis seli oldeman &punctelev; In sorewe was Inov&yogh;
he wende him out of Normundie &punctelev; toward Engelonde
Are he come to Caunterbiri &punctelev; he nolde nou&yogh;were atstonde
And þo he cam fer w[i]thoute þe toun &punctelev; he gan to li&yogh;te adoun
Al afote and barefot &punctelev; he wende into þe toun
Ri&yogh;t so he wende to þe stude &punctelev; þere seint thomas lai
At is toumbe he feol adoun akneo &punctelev; wepinde wel sore
he heold op is hondene deolfolliche &punctelev; and cride him milce and ore
¶ Wepinde in is oresones &punctelev; al fastinde he lai
At þis holi mannes toumbe &punctelev; a ny&yogh;t and al a dai
Of euerech Monek of þe hous &punctelev; he tok is discipline
With a smart &yogh;eorde, and &yogh;eot him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; þere was to luyte pine
he bad heom alle deolfulliche &punctelev; bidden for him one
And swor he wolde legge adoun &punctelev; þe luþere lawene echone
¶ So þat he let singe ane masse &punctelev; are he þannes wende
In þe honour of seint thomas &punctelev; þat he is grace him sende
Þe &yogh;wyle men þe masse songe &punctelev; ase ore louerd &yogh;af þat cas
Þe kyng of Scotlond was inome &punctelev; þat mest is fo was
And manie oþere also with him &punctelev; þat weren is stron[ge] fon
So þat heo þat weren vnnome &punctelev; to him nadden power non
his folk dude þe bataille &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle þe masse ilaste[MS. staste]
Þarto heo hadden luyte help &punctelev; and weren wel sore agaste
Ake ore louerd for seint thomas loue &punctelev; his grace wel sone him caste
So þat heore fon weren some[m MS. sone] inome &punctelev; and some flouwen wel faste
So þat þis seli olde king &punctelev; þat al bineþe er was
Al aboue was sone ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; þoru&yogh; bone of seint thomas
And is sone was al bineþe &punctelev; and so he bi&yogh;at wel luyte
Forto weorri a&yogh;ein is fader &punctelev; for is sori pruyte
bi him men mowen nime ensaumple &punctelev; to beon to hastiue
to &yogh;iuen heore sones op heore lond &punctelev; þe &yogh;wyle heo hemsulue beoth aliue
And furpinede in þe menisone &punctelev; þat is lif him þou&yogh;te long
he deide sethþe deolfolliche &punctelev; in gret pine and strong
his broþer also, sire Geffrei &punctelev; þat Erl of brutayne was
Deide also in þe menison &punctelev; In þulke sulue cas
So þat after is fader deþe &punctelev; þare ne lefde eir non
bote heore &yogh;ongue broþer king Richard &punctelev; and sethþe þe king Iohan
Ake sire Geffreies child &punctelev; with ri&yogh;te lawe of londe
Þe heritage scholde habbe ibore &punctelev; ase ich me onderstonde.
[Mors Militum.]¶ Þeos luþere kni&yogh;tes alle foure &punctelev; þat slowen seint thomas
Deiden in stronge deþe inou&yogh; &punctelev; ase wel ri&yogh;t it[MS. it it] was
heo weren echone repentaunt &punctelev; ne mi&yogh;ten none men more
euere heo criden on seint thomas &punctelev; to &yogh;iuen heom milce and ore
Sone afterward þat he was aslawe &punctelev; al heore guod huy lete
And wenden to þe holi lond &punctelev; heore sunnes forto bete
Ake sire Willame traci ne wende nou&yogh;t &punctelev; forth with þe oþere þreo
he hopede here In Engelonde &punctelev; Inou&yogh; repentaunt to beo
his flesch bigan to breken out &punctelev; and rotede an fovle stonk
So longue þat he stonk so foule &punctelev; þat deul it was to se
Þat onneþe ani man mi&yogh;te &punctelev; for stunche nei&yogh; him beo
his flesch rotede on him also &punctelev; and al dai ful awei
Þat is bones weren al bare— &punctelev; þo ne likede him no plei
Wit is hondene he todrou&yogh; also &punctelev; his flesch atþe laste
pece and oþur al abrod &punctelev; awei fram him he caste
hondene and Armes he todrov&yogh; &punctelev; mest of echon
Þat þere nas no flesch bileued &punctelev; bote senue and bare bon
Manie men it þou&yogh;ten wel &punctelev; þat bi is wille it were
Al forto biete[MS. biete] is sunnes here &punctelev; þat is soule in helle nere
Wrechchedore gost ne mi&yogh;te non beo &punctelev; þane þis prisun was
And euere he cride deolfulliche &punctelev; "merci, seint thomas."
Atþe laste he let is lijf &punctelev; In wel stronge pine
And &yogh;if ore louerdes wille was &punctelev; he cam to guode fine
Þis kni&yogh;tes aftur heore luþere dedene[al. dede] &punctelev; deiden sone echon
So þat withInne þe þridde &yogh;ere &punctelev; aliue ne lefde þer non
For þe sauter seith þat swuche men &punctelev; þat of tricherie beoth
Ne schullen nou&yogh;t halue heore dawes libbe &punctelev; ase &yogh;e alda[i] iseoth
Þei heo beon swyþe repentaunt &punctelev; ase þis kni&yogh;tes weren, ich wene
&YOGH;uyt ne libbeth heo nou&yogh;t half heore lif &punctelev; ant þat was bi heom isene.
¶ Seint thomas þis holi man &punctelev; onder eorþe he lay
Are þat he Ischrined were &punctelev; wel mani a long day
he lai þere nine[al. inne] and fourti &yogh;er &punctelev; and half a &yogh;er þerto
And aboute ane Ei&yogh;te dawes &punctelev; are he were of eorþe ido
god wolde abide ane guode tyme &punctelev; to don so noble þing
Þat þare weren boþe guode &punctelev; Erchebischop and king
For þe king Iohan þat longue was &punctelev; euere of luþere rede
luyte þou&yogh;te bi is daie &punctelev; to don so guode dede
¶ Ake þe king henri, is &yogh;onge sone &punctelev; nolde nou&yogh;t longe afine
After þat he was king imad &punctelev; are seint thomas were in schrine
he nas nou&yogh;t þrettene &yogh;eres old &punctelev; þo he dude þis noble þing
And it was in þe feorþe &yogh;ere &punctelev; þat he was imad &yogh;ong king
Þe guode Erchebischop steuene &punctelev; radde faste þerto
So þat bi hore boþe redes &punctelev; þis dede was ido
Þe pope honorie, þat was þo &punctelev; hidere he gan sende
Ane legat fram Rome, þat het pandulf &punctelev; to bringe þis dede to ende
Þe pope &yogh;af alle pardon &punctelev; þat þudere wolden gon
Þat men nusten in Engelonde &punctelev; suuych pardon non
Of bischopes and of Abbodes &punctelev; mani on þudere drou&yogh;
Of priores and of persones &punctelev; and manie oþur clerkes also
Of Eorles and of barones &punctelev; and manie kni&yogh;tes heom to
Of seriaunz and of squiers &punctelev; and oþere housebondes inowe
And þe simple men of þe londe &punctelev; so þicke þudere drowe
Þat al þe contreie þareaboute &punctelev; þe tounes wide and longe[MS. londe]
Vnneþe mi&yogh;ten al þat folk &punctelev; þat þudere cam afonge
¶ So þat þis hei&yogh;e men &punctelev; þat scholden þis dede do
Weren in care hov heo mi&yogh;ten &punctelev; for prece comen þerto
So þat Erchebischop steuene &punctelev; of &yogh;wam ich er ov seide
And þe bischop Richard of Salesburi &punctelev; þarof heom nomen to rede
And prior water of þe house &punctelev; and þe couent also
Wenden heom in priuete &punctelev; þis dede forto do
bi ni&yogh;te, þo men weren aslepe &punctelev; and luyte þaron þou&yogh;te
heo nomes[r. nomen] op þe holi bones &punctelev; and in one cheste brou&yogh;te
And setten heom in a priue stude &punctelev; forto þe time was icome
þat[MS. hit] was icrid into al þat lond &punctelev; þat heo scholden beo up inome
It was in þe monþe of Iulie &punctelev; euene þene seuenthe dai
bi a tiwesdai it was þo &punctelev; ase al þat folk isai&yogh;
Þo þe dai was icome &punctelev; to þe munstre heo wenden anon
Kyng henri þat &yogh;onge child &punctelev; an þe hei&yogh;e men echon
Aboute onderne of þe daie &punctelev; to þis holi bones heo come
PAndulf wende furst þerto &punctelev; þat legat was of rome
And þe Erchebischop of Caunterburi &punctelev; and þe Erchebischop of reins also
Þat for þulke þinge cam &punctelev; fram bi&yogh;eonde se þerto
Þeos foure grete louerdes &punctelev; þat noble men weren and wise
On heore scholdres huy nomen up &punctelev; þis holi bodi anon
¶ Bischopus and Abbodes also &punctelev; it beren ful mani on
to þe hei&yogh;e weuede of þe trinite &punctelev; þe holie bones heo bere
And leiden þe Cheste al þarewith &punctelev; In a noble schrine þere
Þis king henri was so &yogh;ong &punctelev; þat he ne dorste nou&yogh;t
With þe oþere bere þat holi bodi &punctelev; laste men him hurten ou&yogh;t
It was bi a tiwesdai &punctelev; þat heo þe bones op nome
Alle is chaunces þat he hadde &punctelev; bi tiwesdawes him come
In a tiwesdai he was ibore &punctelev; and of is moder wombe he cam
And also ase men bringuth ane þeof &punctelev; forto afonge is dom
bifore þe kynge at Norehaumptone &punctelev; opon a tiwesdai&yogh;
Filloker þane ani þef &punctelev; folk him þare schende
bi tiwesday he was iflemd also &punctelev; and out of londe he wende
And bi a tiwesdai&yogh; at pounteneie &punctelev; ore louerd to him com
And seide to him þat swete word &punctelev; of is martyrdom
¶ "Thomas," seide ore swete louerd &punctelev; "&yogh;eot schal of þine blode
Al mi churche honoured beo—" &punctelev; þis wordes weren wel guode
bi a tiwesdai also gud &punctelev; to engelonde he cam
After þat he was iflemd &punctelev; to afonge is martirdom
bi a tiwesdai at Caunterburi &punctelev; to deþe he was ido
And sethþe bi a tiwesdai &punctelev; Ischrined he was also
Þeos seuen Auntres bi tiwesday &punctelev; him comen atþe leste
Þarefore we iseoth manie men &punctelev; makien one biheste
to bileue flesch þene tiwesdai &punctelev; oþur to o mel faste
Forto heo comen to Caunterburi &punctelev; oþur þe &yogh;wyle heore lif ilastez
Nov Iesu crist for þulke loue &punctelev; þat seint thomas on þou&yogh;te
&YOGH;yue us part of þulke Ioie &punctelev; þat he so deore abou&yogh;te
AL þis bok is imaked of holi dawes &punctelev; and of holie mannes liues
Þat soffreden for ore louerdes loue &punctelev; pinene manie and riue
Þat ne spareden for none ei&yogh;e &punctelev; godes weorkes to wurche
Of &yogh;was liues &yogh;wane heore feste fallez &punctelev; men redez in holi churche
Þei ich of alle ne mouwe nou&yogh;t telle &punctelev; ichulle telle of some
Ase euerech feste after oþur &punctelev; In þe &yogh;ere doth come.
Þe furste feste þat in þe &yogh;ere comez &punctelev; we cleopiez &yogh;eresdai
Ase ore louerd was circumciset &punctelev; In þe giwene lay
For to fulfullen heore lawe &punctelev; and for cristinedom non nas
Are longe þareafturward &punctelev; þat he Icristned was
¶ He was Nyne and twenti &yogh;er &punctelev; and þrettene dawes old
Are he ibaptized were &punctelev; ase þe bok us hath itold
Also it fel a twelftedai &punctelev; seint Iohan þe baptist
Baptizede in þe flum Iordan &punctelev; ore louerd Ihesu crist
In þat dai a twelfmonþe &punctelev; ore louerd was at one feste
Þare he turnde water to win &punctelev; þoru&yogh; is moder heste
We holdez also þat dai feste &punctelev; of þe þridde þinge
Ase þe þre kingues to ore louerd &punctelev; presaunt dude bringe
to him heo comen ase is moder &punctelev; achildbedde lay
After þat he ibore was &punctelev; þane þretteþe day
Ase it fallez atwelftedai— &punctelev; longe heo erore him sou&yogh;ten
gold. and. mirre. and Ansens &punctelev; In presaunt heo him brou&yogh;ten.
Seint Fabian þrettene &yogh;er &punctelev; pope was[MS. was was] In rome
he turnede mani men þat luþere weren &punctelev; into cristinedome
Decius, þat prince was &punctelev; of heþenesse þo
he let him martri þerefore &punctelev; and oþere with him mo
Telle ichulle of þe holi man &punctelev; seint Sebastian
he seruede ane heþe amperour &punctelev; þat het dyoclician
hext maister he was onder him &punctelev; to don al is wille
Cristine Man he was bicome &punctelev; bote þarof he heold him stille
for no doute of Martyrdom &punctelev; ake for þat he wolde longe
Serui god almi&yogh;ti, are he wolde &punctelev; deth onderfonge
Alle þe men þat cristine weren &punctelev; þat þe Aumperor ou&yogh;wer founde
Sone he let to deþe bringe &punctelev; with fuyre oþur mid wounde
&YOGH;wane ani man for cristindom &punctelev; to deþe scholde beon brou&yogh;t
Seint Sebastian heom confortede &punctelev; þat heo ne dradden heom nou&yogh;t
Deth afonge for godes loues &punctelev; Ake þat heo studefaste were
Mani he heold in þe ri&yogh;te bileue &punctelev; þat flechchi wolden for fere
¶ Marcus and Marcellian &punctelev; breþren weren tweie
Þe Aumperour for cristinedom &punctelev; Inome hadde heom bei&yogh;e
he let heom binde togadere faste &punctelev; boþe to o piler
And to þe Eorþe naylli heore fet &punctelev; þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten fer ne ner
So heo stoden al ane day and a ni&yogh;t &punctelev; þat non ne mi&yogh;ten fram oþer
Eiþur of heom ofte to oþere seide &punctelev; "here is ioye, leue broþer!"
guod it is and murie &punctelev; breþren to wonie ifere
Euere heo precheden cristindom &punctelev; mid wel glade chere
Þe Aumperor let nimen ane spere &punctelev; ase heo stoden togadere ibounde
Þoru&yogh; heore heortene he let heom smite &punctelev; þat heo deiden in a luyte stounde
Sebastian was þo iwreid &punctelev; þat he heom &yogh;af þane red
to holden op faste heore cristindom &punctelev; þei heo scholden beo ded
Þe Aumperor let him cleopie &punctelev; "Sebastian," he sede
"to þe al mi truste was &punctelev; mi lond to wissi and rede
Of alle þing þat min is &punctelev; Ich &yogh;af þe mest power
to holden op min honour &punctelev; and to saui it fer and ner
Ich habbe to þe suspecion &punctelev; Ake forsoþe ine segge it nou&yogh;t
Þat þov a&yogh;en me and a&yogh;en min honour &punctelev; Itorned hast þi þou&yogh;[t]."
Sebastian seide, "sire Aumperour &punctelev; A&yogh;en þe neuere I nas
Ake mid þe and al þine þinge &punctelev; to þin honour ich was
And ofte ich habbe ni&yogh;t and dai&yogh; &punctelev; godes sone bisou&yogh;t
Also wisliche ase he with is heorte blode &punctelev; deore us hauez ibou&yogh;t
Þat he þe &yogh;yue power gret &punctelev; and wille and eke þou&yogh;t
to leten þine false godes— &punctelev; for heo ne helpeth þe nou&yogh;t."
¶ Wodwroth was þis Aumperor. &punctelev; "Sebastian," he seide
"habbe ich þus iholde þe? &punctelev; turne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede
bote þov honouri ore godus &punctelev; to swuche pine i schal þe take
Þat, are þov beo to deþe ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; ech lime þe schal ake."
"Sire," seide Sebastian &punctelev; "þine þretningue ne drede i nou&yogh;t
More me greuez þat þou nelt &punctelev; habbe reuþe in þi þou&yogh;t
And honouri him þat made þe man &punctelev; ant þine maumates bileue
Þat ne mouwe helpe nou&yogh;t &punctelev; for heo beoth doumbe and deue."
Þe Aumperour in grete wrathþe was &punctelev; þesne holi man he let take
And dude him leden into þe feld &punctelev; and binde him to a stake
he let archers to him scheote &punctelev; ase it were to one marke
With quareles and with Arewene &punctelev; heo maden him woundes starke
Mani on wende þoru&yogh;out him &punctelev; in a luytel &yogh;wyle
heo stikeden also þicke on him &punctelev; so yrichon deth of piles
Þo heom þou&yogh;te þat he was ded &punctelev; hom heo gonne iwende
Onbured heo bilefden him þare &punctelev; his bodi forto schenden
A cristine womman, þat hei&yogh;te Yreine &punctelev; wende þudere bi ni&yogh;te
Forto burien þat holi bodi &punctelev; &yogh;if heo it finde mi&yogh;te
heo cam and fond him hol and sound &punctelev; he nadde nou&yogh;t one wounde
With gret Ioye heo ladde him to hire hous &punctelev; and glad was þat heo him founde
¶ Þene feorþe dai Sebastian &punctelev; wende to þe Aumperour
"Sire," he seide, "ichulle þe telle &punctelev; þat fallez to þin honour
&YOGH;e misbileuez, and men doth eov &punctelev; amis to onderstonde
Þat cristine men scholden harm do &punctelev; to þe and to al þine londe
For isosteyned and isaued &punctelev; it is þoru&yogh; heore bone
More þane þoru&yogh; ouwer Maumates &punctelev; þat ne beoth nou&yogh;t wurhþ a spone
For we biddez ny&yogh;t and day &punctelev; god, þat me hidere sende
Þat he eov &yogh;iue long lijf &punctelev; &yogh;if &yogh;e eov wollez amende."
"hou is þis?" quath þe Aumperour &punctelev; "&yogh;weþur þov aliue beo
Nartþou nou&yogh;t Sebastian &punctelev; þat ich afelde let sle?"
"&YOGH;e," he seide, þis holi man &punctelev; "aliue ich am nouþe her
hol and sound, withoute wounde &punctelev; to schewen þe godus pouwer
And to schewen þat &yogh;e onri&yogh;t doth &punctelev; cristine Men to sle
For heore bileue is ri&yogh;tful and guod &punctelev; and ouwere nis wuyrth a stre
Þarefore on þine soule þench! &punctelev; ne bilef þou nou&yogh;t on a stone
Ake on him þat us deore abou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat is godes sone al one."
¶ "Ov&yogh;," seide þe Aumperovr þo &punctelev; "&yogh;ware is ovre mi&yogh;te
Schal þis þeof þoru&yogh; is wichchinge &punctelev; a&yogh;en us with wordes fi&yogh;te?"
he let nimen sebastian &punctelev; and hom to is paleis lede
For no miracle þat he dude &punctelev; to wide scholde sprede
Laste Men torneden to cristindom &punctelev; Into a priue stude he him ladde
With staues he let him to deþe beten. &punctelev; and þo heo aslawe him hadde
In one Chaumbre foreine &punctelev; amidde þe fuylthþhede
he let him honge with a rop— &punctelev; and þat was a vil dede
Þat bodi forto schende &punctelev; for he hadde drede
Þat cristine Men him wolden stele &punctelev; and is bodi awei lede
bi ni&yogh;te cam þis holi Man &punctelev; to a womman, þat het lucine
And tolde hire hou he ymartred was &punctelev; and in &yogh;wuche pine
An hou filliche is bodi heng &punctelev; and þat heo ase sone ase heo mi&yogh;te
his bodi fette, and burien it &punctelev; among cristine men bi ni&yogh;te
Þis guode womman at Midni&yogh;t &punctelev; dude ase he hadde ibede
Fette þat bodi and burede hit &punctelev; In a wel fair stude
Þus seint sebastian þe holi man &punctelev; is lif brou&yogh;te to ende
And fram þe pine of is liue &punctelev; to þe blisse of heuene he gan iwende
SEint Anneis, þat holi Maide &punctelev; wel &yogh;ong heo bigan
to serui god almi&yogh;ti &punctelev; to beon cristine womman
heo nas bote of þrettene &yogh;er &punctelev; þo heo was to deþe ibrou&yogh;t
For þe loue of Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat deore us hath ibou&yogh;t
In rome, þare he wonede &punctelev; so fair creature nas non
Ase was þis maide forthward &punctelev; of felle noþer of bon
Ase þis Maidechild cam a dai &punctelev; goinde fram schole
Þe constables sone hire isai&yogh; &punctelev; and heold hire for fole
he gan to louien hire in folie &punctelev; and for hire was in mourninge
And carede hov he mi&yogh;te best &punctelev; to ende his fole þou&yogh;t bringe
For stille mourninge þat he hadde &punctelev; he iwerth swuyþe lene
Þarof wondrede muche is frend &punctelev; and &yogh;erne him duden bimen[e]
heo axeden him a dai in priuete &punctelev; hov he dude fare
he gan to telle fram on to oþur &punctelev; &yogh;wareof was is care
And hou he wolde himself asle &punctelev; bote he þat maide hadde
Þe consta[b]le non oþur ne sai&yogh; &punctelev; is sone forth he ladde
heo comen to Anneyse, þat Maide hende &punctelev; and nomen hire bi þe honde
Þe fader seide &punctelev; "lo here mi sone &punctelev; þat wurth riche heyr of londe
¶ A fair grace þe is icome &punctelev; he hath is heorte to þe itake
Riche womman þou worst inou&yogh; &punctelev; he schal habbe þe to make
hext þov worst of al þi kun &punctelev; of londe and oþur þinges
gold and seluer þe worth inou&yogh; &punctelev; broches and eke ringus."
Þat maide seide &punctelev; "go fram me &punctelev; þov luþe[r] deþes fode
Woldestþov defouli mi bodi? &punctelev; þov ne bringest me neuere in þat mode
Ich habbe me one spouse inome &punctelev; þou ne wost nou&yogh;wer swuch non
bri&yogh;tore þane þe sonne oþur ani li&yogh;t &punctelev; þat euere on eorþe schon
Of &yogh;was kuynde wondri may ech þing &punctelev; for is moder is clene mayde
his fader of womman neuere ne wuste &punctelev; so þe prophetus us saide
Al þene world he made of nou&yogh;t &punctelev; and &yogh;af us ovre fode
Wel deore with is swete blod &punctelev; he bou&yogh;te us on þe rode
Ane marke he hathz on me ido &punctelev; þat Ine scholde non oþur take
Deorewurþe þing he hath me bihote &punctelev; Inelle him neuere fursake."
¶ Þe Constable het Symproni. &punctelev; "hov geth þis," he seide
"&YOGH;weþur þov bileue on þe false gode? &punctelev; torne þi þou&yogh;t, ich rede
And nim þis child to þi spouse &punctelev; and þenk on þine owene guod
Oþur ischal do þe so tormenti &punctelev; þat þov schalt nei&yogh; beo wod."
"beo stille," seide þis maide þo &punctelev; "be stille, þou deueles lime
Þov ne schalt todai for no þretning &punctelev; mi guode þou&yogh;[t] me binime
Ich am redi for is loue &punctelev; þat deore me hath ibou&yogh;t
tormenz afonge, and þe deth also &punctelev; for Ine drede me ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t."
þe Constable let somony al þe cite &punctelev; and brou&yogh;te þis mayde heom bifore
hire forto schiende, he dude hire strepe &punctelev; so naked so heo was ibore
Þat ech man scholde iseon hire derne limes &punctelev; þe more hire to schende
"Onwreste man," þis mayde seide &punctelev; "schame þe worth atþenende
¶ Ne schameth þe noþing in þi þou&yogh;t &punctelev; bi womman þus to do
&YOGH;wan þou of womman art icome &punctelev; and ech man is also?"
Þat[al. þat maide] was not[ags. hnot] for hire &yogh;onghede &punctelev; are hire smok were of inome
Þare was[MS. was was] on hire swete heued &punctelev; so muche fair her icome
Þat hudde al hire swete bodi &punctelev; þat it tilde bineothe hire kne[MS. kneo]
Þo ne mi&yogh;ten men for here &punctelev; of hire bodi nou&yogh;t ise
An hous þat seruede of bordel &punctelev; þare was biside
ÞareInne þe constable hire let do &punctelev; and sethþe het crie wide
Þat alle þat wolden folie don &punctelev; þudere scholden wende
And finde þare a fol womman &punctelev; of bodie fair and hende
Þo þat Maide was þareInne ido. &punctelev; so ful was þat hous of li&yogh;te
Þat no man for brij&yogh;thede &punctelev; þat Mayde iseo ne mi&yogh;te
Þat Maide sat adoun akneo &punctelev; and seide hire oresun þere
"Louerd," heo seide, "&yogh;ong ich am &punctelev; among mine fon ibrou&yogh;t here
Euerech fondeth to don me schame &punctelev; þat he[r]aboute wendez
Louerd, ne &yogh;if neuere no luþer man power &punctelev; mi bodi forto schende!"
Þis Maide sat euere in hire beden &punctelev; to ore louerd heo gan crie
hire ne mi&yogh;te no man for li&yogh;te iseo &punctelev; þat come þereIn for folie
Ake euere &yogh;wane heo comen In &punctelev; to don heore fole þou&yogh;t
heo heorden hire crie on ore louerd so &yogh;erne &punctelev; and hire ne sei&yogh;en nou&yogh;t.[Vv. 63, 64 are tr. in the MS.]
¶ Þo bigan ech after oþur &punctelev; ase euerech withInne cam
For Miracle þat heo sei&yogh;en þere &punctelev; tuyrne to cristindom
And bigonne forth with hire &punctelev; to ore louerd &yogh;eorne crie
Þo was þat an hous of beden &punctelev; þat raþer was of folie
Ase þat maide sat and bad hire beden &punctelev; an Aungel þare cam gon
A Roket he brou&yogh;te on is hond to hire &punctelev; &yogh;wittore nas neuere non
Þat [maide][om.] dude on þis Roket. &punctelev; al naket heo was er
Naþeles heo ne mi&yogh;ten nou&yogh;t hire bodi seo &punctelev; for li&yogh;te ne for her
Þo heo hadde ido þis Roket on &punctelev; nonmore ihud heo nas
Fairore lijf nas neuere iseie &punctelev; þane þis &yogh;onge maide þo was
Þe constables sone cam forto don with hire &punctelev; ase he hadde er iseid
And are he mi&yogh;te þat Maiden handli &punctelev; he fel adoun standed
his felawes þat with him comen &punctelev; withoute heo weren wel stille
And hopeden, for he so longe was &punctelev; þat he dude is wille
¶ Naþeles, þo he to longe was &punctelev; is o felawe gan in gon
And fond þat child ligge ded &punctelev; so cold ase a ston
he leop him out into þe strete &punctelev; loude he gan to grede
"Comiez hidere, men, and sleth þis wichche &punctelev; for heo hath ido a luþer dede
Þe Constables sone heo hath aslawe &punctelev; here &yogh;e mouwen iseo
Comiez nouþe bliue and nimeth hire &punctelev; þat heo awei ne fleo!"
Þat folk cam reke aboute þis hous &punctelev; and founden þat it was ded
Alle þe baillifs þudere comen &punctelev; to nimen þarof red
Some seiden þat heo wichche was &punctelev; some þat heo was guod
And alle for þe childes deþe &punctelev; wroþe weren in heore mod
heo stoden and Iuggeden hire among heom alle &punctelev; þat quelle heo wolden hire sone
Þat maide sat adoun on hire knes &punctelev; and made to god hire bone
"louerd," he seide, "&yogh;if þi wille beo &punctelev; &yogh;if me[&yogh;if me al. om.] þine mi&yogh;te and þine grace
Þov kuythþ þine mi&yogh;te[þ. m. al. om.] and send þis child &punctelev; lijf here In þis place
Þat þis folk þat here is luyþur &punctelev; þine mi&yogh;te mouwen iseo
Ne lat none mo men deth afonge &punctelev; for enchesun of me."
¶ Adoun þar cam an Aungel &punctelev; "mayde Anneis," he seide
"Ore louerd hath iheord þine bone &punctelev; þat þou to him bede."
heo blessede þat child, and hit aros &punctelev; fram deþe to liue
And þonkede god, and orn him out &punctelev; at þe dore wel bliue
he cam out among al þat fo[l]k &punctelev; loude he gan to crie
"On god þat[om. þat] is In heuene &punctelev; þat was ibore of þe Maidene Marie
Þat is fader and sone and holi gost &punctelev; louerd of alle þinge
Þat wille hadde þoru&yogh; is mi&yogh;te &punctelev; fram deþe today me bringe
Fursakez eovwer false godes &punctelev; for heo nabbeth mi&yogh;te non
Forto meoui heom enes of þe stude &punctelev; non more þene a ston."
Þe childes fader and mani oþure &punctelev; swiþe glade bicome
Þo heo isei&yogh;en þe Miracle &punctelev; and cristindom hem nome
Wodwroþe weren þe luþere men &punctelev; heo gonne bitwene heom telle
In &yogh;wuche martyrdome heo mi&yogh;ten &punctelev; þis holi maide aquelle
heo leten makien a gret fuyr &punctelev; þare amidde þe place
Forto brenne seinte Anneis. &punctelev; and þar[MS. þat] ore louerd cudde is grace
For þo it smot in eiþur side &punctelev; and barnde heom alclene
Þat Maide nas iwemned nou&yogh;t &punctelev; for it ne touchede hire nou&yogh;t ene
bote heo sat hire adoun akne &punctelev; and in eiþur half was þe lei&yogh;e
"Louerd," heo seide, "&yogh;if þi wille it beo &punctelev; þat ich here schulle dei&yogh;e
Iredi ich am forto afonge þat fuyr &punctelev; þat is me In eyþur side
&YOGH;if ich schal here Imartred beo &punctelev; oþur lengore abide."
Þo heo hadde þis word iseid &punctelev; þat fuyr aqueinte anon
Non more hete nas in þe place &punctelev; þane in þe colde ston
&YOGH;eot þulke þat bilefden aliue &punctelev; on god þat ne[om. þat] bilefden nou&yogh;t
And Iuggeden hov heo mi&yogh;ten don &punctelev; þat heo were to deþe ibrou&yogh;[t]
heo leten nime a kene suerd &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; hire þrote it smite
Þat rede blod orn adoun &punctelev; on hire limes so &yogh;wite
Fairore ne mi&yogh;te noþing [be] &punctelev; þane was þat ilke blod
On hire limes þat weren so &yogh;wite &punctelev; þo hit þaron stod
Þus þis Mayde seinte Annes &punctelev; brou&yogh;te hire lijf to fine
And wende to þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; after hire muchele pine
SEint Vincent In spayne &punctelev; to a cristine bischop cam
Þat men cleopeden valentin &punctelev; and cristindom of him nam
Þe king[al. iustice] of þe londe— &punctelev; Dacian was is name
For þe bischop cristine was &punctelev; he þou&yogh;te to don him schame
he let him nime and binde &punctelev; and don him in grete pine
Þe bischop cride &yogh;erne on god &punctelev; he nolde oþur fine
With heom þat him tormenteden &punctelev; he spac with milde speche
Seint Vincent was þarefore wrath &punctelev; and seide: "ich mot þe teche
&YOGH;wy spext þov so mildeliche &punctelev; ase þei þov adrad were
Wenstþou þat heo þine Maistres beon? &punctelev; &yogh;warof hauest þov fere
Spec hardiliche, and conforte wel &punctelev; oþure þat cristine beoth
Þat heo mowe to þe deþe hardie beon &punctelev; ase heo þe iseoth!"
"hov is þis?" seide þe king &punctelev; "&yogh;weþur þes þef wene fi&yogh;te
And withsegge us al abrod? &punctelev; Ich him schal euene di&yogh;te
Lateth þene bischop awei gon &punctelev; for is milde speche
Nimez vincent and bindez anon &punctelev; we schullen him oþur tech[e]
With scourges and with staues &punctelev; faste &yogh;e him bete
Þat he ne mouw iwielde neuere a lime &punctelev; are þat &yogh;e him lete!"
"&YOGH;e," seide vincent, "þov pai&yogh;est me wel &punctelev; þi word ne þinchez me nou&yogh;t ille
Ine fond neuere Man þat so wel &punctelev; acordede to mi wille
¶ Nov ich hopie to habbe game &punctelev; for erore me þou&yogh;te longe
hit schal me tuyrne to Ioye and gleo &punctelev; and þe to[MS. to þe] pines stronge."
Þe tormentores nomen þane holie Man &punctelev; and to a piler him bounde
With staues and scourges heo leiden on him[al. him on] &punctelev; and maden him mani a wounde
Þo heo &yogh;euen him sorest duntes &punctelev; lei&yogh;en he gan wel smere
Þe tormentores seten adoun and cleopeden help &punctelev; þo heo werie were
he[l]pez us and betez þesne[MS. þesne þesne] þeof &punctelev; for we ne mowen non[MS. nou] more."
Þo was þe king wroth with heom &punctelev; he let heom anou take
Some he let tormenti sore &punctelev; þat ech bon heom gan Ake
And some he let to deþe bringue &punctelev; and some in oþur turment
Euere he let ferschi and nevny[r. nevuy?] &punctelev; tormentores to seint Vincent
&YOGH;wane heo weren werie of bete &punctelev; þe holi man bigan to speke
"Louerd, iwuyrþed beo þi name &punctelev; nouþe ich am swiþe wel awreke
Þe more þat heo betez me &punctelev; þe betere me is, iwis
to heom i[t] torneþ to pine and sor &punctelev; and me to Ioie and blis."
¶ "Ne mowe we nov&yogh;t," seide þe king &punctelev; "with noþing þarto it bringe
Þat þov nelt nemme þine false god &punctelev; for no luþur betinge?"
"Þov luþere Man," seide Vincent &punctelev; "&yogh;eot þou most tormenti more
Ine habbe nou&yogh;t &yogh;eot tormenz inouwe &punctelev; þarafter me longez sore."
Þo he was iscourget so &punctelev; þat men mi&yogh;ten iseo ech bon
And euerech Ioynt and senue &punctelev; þe king gan ner him gon
"Vincent," he seide, "haue of þiself &punctelev; revþe and merci
Ne lat þov nonmore þi fa[i]re bodi &punctelev; þus defouli
bilief on ovre godes and torne anon &punctelev; þi þou&yogh;t and þi mod
And ischal þe &yogh;iue ope al mi lond &punctelev; pouwer gret and guod."
"beo stille," seide seint vincent &punctelev; "al Atter is þi lore
beo stille anon, þou deueles tonge &punctelev; þou makest me drede sore
hit me greueth þat þov feinest þe &punctelev; more þane al þe pine
And alle þe tormens þat þov me dest &punctelev; þov and alle þine
Þat þov bileuest þine tormenz so sone &punctelev; and art bineoþe ibrou&yogh;t
&YOGH;eot þou most more Ioye &punctelev; bringen in mi þou&yogh;t."
"Þov schalt &yogh;eot," seide þe king &punctelev; mo tormenz afonge."
he let him lede withoute þe toun &punctelev; and on a gibet him honge
Vincent for Ioie bigan to eorne &punctelev; þo he iheorde þis dom
Þare nas non þat him mi&yogh;te ouertake &punctelev; are he to þe gibat com
Þo þat he anhengut was &punctelev; gret Ioye he made and blisse
Euere he prechede ase he heng &punctelev; godes wordes to wisse
Þe lengore þat he þare heng &punctelev; þe more Ioie he made
Þo gradden þe tormentores &punctelev; "we ne schullen neuere ouercome þis tade."
¶ Atþe laste he nomen him adoun &punctelev; and ladden bifore þe kinge
And seiden þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten him &punctelev; for noþing to deþe bringe
"Alas," seide þe king þo &punctelev; "is ore mi&yogh;te us binome
&YOGH;wareof seruieth ovre godes &punctelev; þat þes þeof us schal ouercome
Ledez him withoute þe toun &punctelev; a gret fuyr &yogh;e þare make
And þat he beo amidde ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; and ibounde to one stake
Forbrenne he schal euerech lime &punctelev; ne schal he þus him wer[e]
And &yogh;wane he is to douste Ibarnd &punctelev; we beoth ibrou&yogh;t of care."
Þe tormentores nomen seint Vincent &punctelev; and duden þe kingus heste
Þe holi man wende into þe fuyr &punctelev; ase gladliche ase to one feste
Þo heo wenden þat seint vincent &punctelev; to douste ibrend were
heo ornen hom and tolden þe kinge fore &punctelev; gladdore neuere heo nere
heo ne mi&yogh;ten so sone hom come &punctelev; þat seint vincent nas er
At home and stod bifore þe kinge— &punctelev; mani sori man was þer
¶ Þe tormentores tolden þe kingue &punctelev; hov he ibarnd was
"Alas! alas!" þe king seide &punctelev; "neuerer ischend inas
Schal þeos þef us ouercome? &punctelev; Mahun, nou þin ore
Þei he grete tormenz habbe ihaued &punctelev; &yogh;eot ich can biþenche more."
he let nime platus of Ire &punctelev; sumdel þunne and brode
And let heom legge amidde þe place &punctelev; wel nei&yogh; ane cartes lode
gret fuyr he let þaron make &punctelev; and þo heo glowinde were
Þat wodefuyr heo duden al awei &punctelev; þane guode man þudere heo bere
And on þe berninde plates him casten &punctelev; and some þarof heo toke
And leiden anouewarde is holi bodi &punctelev; mid one Irene croke
Al he was þaron ihud— &punctelev; þe &yogh;ut nadde he none fere
Þat grece of him orn abrod &punctelev; ase þei it frijnge were
Þe swyþere þat he barnde &punctelev; þe gladdore he him made
he lou&yogh; smere, &yogh;wane þe plates &punctelev; In is flesch gonne wade
Atþe biginningue he was glad &punctelev; and gladdore atþenende
"Alas! alas," þe king seide þo &punctelev; "þes þef us wole schende
Þis torment ne helpez us nou&yogh;t &punctelev; anoþur we moten biþenche."
he let maken a swyþe gret fuyr &punctelev; þat noþing ne mi&yogh;te aquenche
¶ Seint Vincent huy lei[den] amidewarde &punctelev; and sethþe salt heo nome
And Mid ladeles on is wondene it casten &punctelev; in[al. & in] þe fuyr ilome
So þat þe salt scholde is woundene frete &punctelev; with þe brenninde fuyre
Þe spranglinge of þe blode iselt &punctelev; wide men mi&yogh;ten ihuyre
"&YOGH;e," seide þis guode man &punctelev; "þis is a swete feste
Mani Ioye ichabbe ihaued &punctelev; ake þis is on þe meste."
&YOGH;wane is blod spreinde In þe rof an hei&yogh; &punctelev; he gan to lei&yogh;en smere
Þanne was þe king and alle is men &punctelev; In swyþe grete fere
Schal þes þef with is wichchinge &punctelev; a&yogh;en þi power fi&yogh;te?"
"&YOGH;eot Ich þenche," seide þe king &punctelev; "of one pine stronge
beo þes þef þaron ido &punctelev; he ne schal nou&yogh;t libbe longe."
heo setten him in a swyþe deork put &punctelev; þat in þe gayhole was
So ful of sweordes pointes ipi&yogh;te &punctelev; ase Mede is ful of gras
Þareoppe þanne holi man &punctelev; heo casten, faste ibounde
Þat þe pointes of þe swerdes scholden &punctelev; &yogh;iuen him deþes woundes
Faste heo loken alle þe dore &punctelev; and leten him longe þere beo
Ope þe swerdes pointes in deorkhede &punctelev; he ne mi&yogh;te noþing iseo
Þare cam an Aungel with a taper &punctelev; brenninde in is hond
Of his pine he bar him op— &punctelev; and þare was godes sonde
¶ Þe Aungel was þar with him &punctelev; ase longe ase he þare was
Mid a brenninde taper, and Ioie gret &punctelev; þat neuere more nas
Þo it was longe þareafturward &punctelev; þis men comen þerbiside
And wende þat he were ded &punctelev; ane stounde heo gonne abide
Þo iheorden heo þis holi man &punctelev; loude and murie singe
And herede god in heuene. &punctelev; heo tolden þat þe kinge
Þo was þe þing nei&yogh; iswowe &punctelev; and seide, sichinde wel sore
"Alas, we beoth nouþe ouercome &punctelev; Ine can[MS. cam] þenche non more
Ovre godes ne helpez us nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat alle þing habbeth to wolde
Inelle neuereeft a&yogh;ein him fi&yogh;te &punctelev; creaunt ichulle me holde
¶ &YOGH;wane no pine ne mai him sle &punctelev; oþur þing ichulle fonde
"goth," he seide, "and maketh a bed &punctelev; þat softeste in anie londe
Of quoiltene and of materasz &punctelev; of cheisel and of palle
And þanne leggez him þaron &punctelev; swiþe softe withalle."
Þo þat bed was imaket &punctelev; to þe gayhole heo wende
And founden þare þat lij&yogh;t of heuene &punctelev; þat ore louerd þudere sende
Wel softe heo nomen þis holi man &punctelev; and custen is sore wounden
to Relikes heo gadereden stilleliche &punctelev; þat heo of is blode founden
heo leiden him in þat nesche bed. &punctelev; and þo he was þaron
his preiere he dude to ore louerd crist &punctelev; and deide þo anon
Þo þe king isai&yogh; þis þat he deide &punctelev; so mildeliche in is bedde
"tormenz," he seide, "we him habbeth ido &punctelev; vuele þarof us spedde
Ded we wolleth him ouercome &punctelev; &yogh;wane we ne mi&yogh;ten aliue
Into þe wilde felde &punctelev; þat bodi &yogh;e beren wel bliue
Wilde bestes and foules &punctelev; todrawe heo schullen it sone."
Þis men brou&yogh;ten þat bodi þare &punctelev; and duden þe kingus bone
Þare cam fleo a Rauon &punctelev; and adoun þarebi he ali&yogh;te
Kene and suyþe dredful &punctelev; iredi he was to fi&yogh;te
&yogh;if þare come ani foul to &punctelev; þat þis bodi isei&yogh;e
Þe Rauon smot to grounde &punctelev; ne mosten þare come non nei&yogh;e
¶ Ake Euere he drof heom awei &punctelev; þudere &yogh;wane heo come
Ne mi&yogh;te þare come none so kene &punctelev; þat o mossel þarof nome
A wolf cam also þuderward &punctelev; is mete forto fette
And wolde of þat bodi nime. &punctelev; þe Rauon a&yogh;ein him sette
he flev and smot with bile and fot &punctelev; þat þe wolf atþen ende
blodi was and ouercome &punctelev; a&yogh;en hamward he gan wende
Þe Rauon wuste þis bodi longe &punctelev; Iwemmed nou&yogh;t it nas
Þo þe king it onder&yogh;at &punctelev; þat þe bodi ihol was
hom he let it fette a&yogh;en &punctelev; and seide, "&yogh;wat may beo ovre red
þat we ne mouwen him ouercome &punctelev; noþer quik ne ded
&YOGH;if we ne mouwen quik ne ded &punctelev; ouercome him alonde
For no[MS. ne] quoyntise þat we mouwen do &punctelev; awatere we wollez fonde."
he let it lede fer into þe se &punctelev; and bonde þarto mani a ston
And casten it out of a schip. &punctelev; it bigan to sinke anon
þo þe Mariners iseien þis &punctelev; glade heo weren and bliþe
Forto telle þe kinge fore &punctelev; heo hi&yogh;eden hom wel bliue
heo ne mi&yogh;ten so sone to londe come &punctelev; þat heo ne founden alonde
Þis holi Man wel faire ligge &punctelev; abouen þe sesonde
Sore agremed and aschamed &punctelev; hom huy gonne wende
Þe kinge heo tolden al heore cas &punctelev; fram þe furste to þe ende
"Alas, alas," þe king seide &punctelev; "þe schame and þe schonde
We ne mowe him neuere ouercome &punctelev; quik ne ded, awatere ne alonde
¶ Do we him out of ovre þou&yogh;t &punctelev; we ne mouwen us neuere awreke
Ich drede þat he mi bane worþe &punctelev; Ihere ich more of him speke."
Ani&yogh;t In slepe seint Vincent cam &punctelev; to A womman þarebiside
And tolde hire &yogh;ware is bodi lai &punctelev; and bad hire nou&yogh;t to longe abide
Ake þat heo it scholde burie sone &punctelev; for him longuede after reste
Þis guode womman it onderstod &punctelev; þo heo awok, with þe beste
heo wende and sou&yogh;te þis holi bodi &punctelev; and fond it swiþe sone
heo dude it burie with gret honour &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t was forto done
Þus seint vincent þe holie man &punctelev; in Spayne endede is lif
And wende to þe blisse of heuene &punctelev; after þis pines and strif
Men nusten neuere martyr non &punctelev; þat hadde more torment
Ne þat with som pine ouercome nas &punctelev; bote þe gode man seint vincent
SEint powel was a luþer Man &punctelev; are he icouerted were
Alle þe cristine Men of þe lond &punctelev; hadden of him gret fere
For he was muche and strong and feol. &punctelev; &yogh;wareso he eni founde
In chaumbre ne in bedde he ne sparede nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat he ne slov&yogh; heom alle to grounde
Þo he hadde aboute Ierusalem &punctelev; In eche stude isou&yogh;t
And alle þe cristine men þat he fond &punctelev; to stronge deþe ibrou&yogh;t
he cam to þe souereyns of þe lawe &punctelev; and seide, "ich habbe imad al clene
Al þis lond of cristine Men &punctelev; [&yogh;e][om.] ne dorre of heom more mene
Wende ichulle to Dam[a]sche &punctelev; and clansi þat lond also
Alle þat ich aliue finde mai &punctelev; to deþe ichulle heom do
Oþur ichulle heom faste binde &punctelev; and hidere to eov sende
Alle þat ich aliue finde may &punctelev; ichulle asle oþur schende."
¶ Saul was þo is ri&yogh;te name. &punctelev; he gan forth iwende
IArmed, and mani a man with him &punctelev; to bringe is þou&yogh;t to ende
Ase he cam amidri&yogh;t þe wei &punctelev; a li&yogh;t him cam aboute
Þat he ne mi&yogh;te for li&yogh;te iseon. &punctelev; þo gan him sore adoute
he stod ase þei he astoned were. &punctelev; þo cam þare in a stounde
A drem ase þei it a þondre were. &punctelev; þarewith he ful to grounde
And lai, þat he ne mi&yogh;te him wawie nou&yogh;t. &punctelev; þo herde he a uoiz telle
"Saul, &yogh;wi werrestþov opon me &punctelev; mine Men forto quelle?"
"ho art þov?" seide saul &punctelev; "louerd, artþov þare?"
A voiz seide, "&yogh;e, ich am þi god &punctelev; þat þov hast iweorred so &yogh;are
to wynci a&yogh;ein þe pricke &punctelev; swiþe strong it is þe."
"Louerd," seide Saul þo &punctelev; "&yogh;wat woltþov do mid me?"
"Þov schalt," seide ore louerd þo &punctelev; "Into þe toune wende
Þine ri&yogh;te bileue þe schal teche &punctelev; a man, to &yogh;wam ischal þe sende."
Þis was þene fourteoþe &yogh;er &punctelev; aftur þulke stounde
Þat Ihesu crist soffrede on þe rode &punctelev; for us deþes wounde.
Þo Saul hadde longe ileie &punctelev; wel softe he op aros
And stod op—he ne mi&yogh;te iseo neuere a del &punctelev; ful sore him agros
he let him lede to þe toun. &punctelev; it was þane þridde dai
Are he .et. oþur dronk &punctelev; oþur ani si&yogh;t isai&yogh;
¶ Ore louerd cam to a guod preost &punctelev; is name was ananye
"go," he seide, "into þe toun &punctelev; and to Iudases hous þov hi&yogh;e
Saul þov schalt þare finde &punctelev; þat iweorred me hauez longue
&YOGH;if him cristindom in mine name &punctelev; and he it wole onderfonge
sei&yogh;e þat god þe þudere sende &punctelev; þat In þe weie a&yogh;ein him cam
Þo he wolde a&yogh;ein him weorri &punctelev; and is power him bi[bi overlined]nam."
'Louerd," seide Ananie &punctelev; "ich habbe muche iheord telle
Þat Saul was a luþer man &punctelev; and cristine men dude quelle."
"Ne dred þe nou&yogh;t," ore louerd seide &punctelev; "lomb he is bicome
him þinchez longe are he habbe &punctelev; cristinedom inome
to beo prechour of mi word &punctelev; ichose ich him habbe
he schal beo wis and studefast &punctelev; nanne betere inabbe."
Þo Ananie iheorde þis &punctelev; hardiliche forth he wende
he cam to Saule and seide him so &punctelev; þat ore louerd him þudere sende
Þat he scholde cristine beo. &punctelev; saul was þo wel bliþe
And er þane he ibaptized was &punctelev; ech &yogh;wyle him þou&yogh;te fiue
Þo he ibaptized was &punctelev; powel was is name
Wel au&yogh;ten men herien þane god &punctelev; þat of þe wilde makez þe tame
Anon so he Ibaptized was &punctelev; þare feol out of eiþer ei&yogh;e
Fuylþe ase þei it were slym &punctelev; þat alle þe men it sei&yogh;e
þo mi&yogh;te he swiþe wel iseo. &punctelev; he heold op is honde
¶ Aknevwes he sat in his bedes &punctelev; and þonkede godes sonde
tendre metes men greiþede him &punctelev; and &yogh;af him þarof wel ofte
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te is strencþe coueri &punctelev; heo beddeden him wel softe
Þo seint powel icouered was &punctelev; and hadde strencþe of Manne
he purueide him of prechingue &punctelev; and wende anon ri&yogh;t þanne
Into þe giwene synagogue &punctelev; and prechede cristindom
Ech man wondrede þat him isai&yogh; &punctelev; þo he prechour bicam
In þe londe of Ierusalem &punctelev; þat he mi&yogh;te o&yogh;were cristine men Iseo?"
Manie Men he tornede to cristinedom &punctelev; and manie him þou&yogh;ten quelle
And bispeken hov heo mi&yogh;ten do &punctelev; for he bigan a&yogh;ein heom telle
he ne let for no drede &punctelev; þat he ne prechede wel bliue
For euere þoru ore louerdes grace &punctelev; he ascapede with þe liue
he sou&yogh;te &yogh;ware þe Apostles weren &punctelev; to heom he cam wel sone
to prechi mid heom godes word &punctelev; ase hore ri&yogh;te was to done
Þe apostles weren formest aferd of him &punctelev; and leueden him wel vnneþe
For he so muche cristine folk &punctelev; hadde ibrou&yogh;t to deþe
Ake þo heo wusten hou it was &punctelev; to felawe [heo] him toke
For þare ne iwerth non so wis &punctelev; holi churche to loke
Seint powel to cristinedom &punctelev; cam In þusse manere
god us graunti for is loue &punctelev; In heuene to ben is fere
Seinte Bride of hei&yogh;e men &punctelev; In scotlond heo cam
Of riche men and of gret power &punctelev; In lawe of cristindom
Þis Maide bigan wel &yogh;ong &punctelev; to beo of porture hende
Þare ne scholde vil dede ne word &punctelev; neuere fram hire wende
heo bigan ore louerd crist to serui &punctelev; in worde and in dede
&YOGH;wane hire &yogh;ongue felawes weren atþe plei&yogh; &punctelev; hire oresones heo seide
¶ hire moder louede hire swiþe wel &punctelev; þat, þo heo was of elde
Al hire chese and al hire milk &punctelev; heo bitok hire to welde
And al þet &yogh;wijt þat In þe court was &punctelev; heo scholde ope hire helde
At a certeyn dai þarof &punctelev; trewe acountes &yogh;elde
Þat Maide let gaderi swiþe clene &punctelev; þe Milk ant þe chese
botere and al þat þarof cam &punctelev; nolde heo nowi&yogh;t leose
&YOGH;wane heo sei&yogh;e anie pouere Men &punctelev; heo delde it heom wel clene
hire deierie was euere of chese and botere &punctelev; bar and swiþe lene
&YOGH;wan hire dai&yogh; was nei&yogh; icome &punctelev; acountes forto &yogh;elde
Of hire moder heo was aferd &punctelev; glad heo was ful selde
&YOGH;eorne heo bad ore louerd crist &punctelev; þat he scholde beo hire red
he nadde &yogh;warof acountes &yogh;elde &punctelev; ase hire moder hadde iseid
Þo þe day was icome &punctelev; heo nuste &yogh;warewith hire aquite
For þare nas in þe deierie &punctelev; nou&yogh;t adel of none &yogh;wite
Naþeles þe moder eode þudere &punctelev; to loke hou it ferde
heo fond ech lome iheped ful &punctelev; al aboue þe brerde
Of chese and of botere &punctelev; and of oþur &yogh;wijte also
he ne may neuere is &yogh;wyle leose &punctelev; þat for þe guode wole ou&yogh;t do
hit bifeol þat þis Maydenes frend &punctelev; nomen heom to rede
Þat heo iweddet scholde beo. &punctelev; and heo anonri&yogh;t heom withseide
to þe bischope heo wende anon &punctelev; and avouwede chastete
