And seide heo nolde neuere man habbe &punctelev; þe sikerore forto beo
For Ioye þat þe bischop hadde of hire &punctelev; he seide þa[t] he wolde ete
And alle is Men, a dai with hire &punctelev; he bad hire maken heore mete
Þarof was þis Maide glad &punctelev; and naþeles sore heo hire dradde
For bote bred and Ale and one kou &punctelev; non more mete heo nadde
heo bigan to milken þis cov &punctelev; and muche milk of hire heo nam[MS. mam]
Þe lengore þat heo hire Milkede &punctelev; þe more milk þare cam
Þis kov &yogh;af so muche Milk &punctelev; þat þaremide heo fedde
Þene bischop and alle is Men þat dai &punctelev; and muche þonk þarof hadde
¶ hit bifeol þareafterward &punctelev; þat Maide afeld wende
Forto loki to hire schep. &punctelev; so gret rein ore louerd to eorþe sende
Þat hire cloþes al wete weren. &punctelev; and a&yogh;en hom[MS. heom] heo gan gon
Þe sonne schon In at one hole &punctelev; and ope þe bem of þe sonne
hire wete cloþes heo heng forto druy&yogh;e &punctelev; þat þe stremes adoun ronne
Museles comen to hire adai &punctelev; ofhongrede and ofcale
heo beden hire mete and drinke for godes loue. &punctelev; he nadde nou&yogh;t a sponeful ale
A fat þare stod fol of baþewater &punctelev; heo &yogh;af it hire blessinge
Þe beste Ale aliue it bicam &punctelev; he &yogh;af it þe Museles drinke
A womman cam and bad hire salt &punctelev; and heo ne hadde non
With hire blessingue heo turnede to salte &punctelev; ane wel grete ston
Þre sike men beden hire guod &punctelev; ase heo to hire come
A seluerne coppe heo [heom] &yogh;af &punctelev; and gladliche heo hire nome
And bigunne forto striui &punctelev; hov heo hire dele mi&yogh;te
"Abidez," seide þis Maide &punctelev; "and ichulle it euene di&yogh;te."
Þis Coppe heo smot a&yogh;en a ston &punctelev; þat heo tobrak aþre
Euerech heo &yogh;af iliche muche &punctelev; ase euene ase it mi&yogh;te beo
Þeos miracles, and manie oþure &punctelev; seinte Bride wrou&yogh;te
Þe blinde and þe doumbe &punctelev; to guode hele heom brou&yogh;te
Þe furste dai of feuerer &punctelev; hire lijf heo brou&yogh;te to ende
god us graunti alle forth with hire &punctelev; te[r. to þe] blisse of heuene wende
SEinte Agace, þat guode Maide &punctelev; In cisile was ibore
Wel &yogh;ong heo bigan cristine to beon &punctelev; þat hire soule nere fur|lore
Of faire porture þis Mayde was &punctelev; and stable in godes lore
Þe Duyk of þe londe it onder&yogh;at &punctelev; it him ofþou&yogh;te sore
he ne mi&yogh;te for revþe don hire in pine &punctelev; Al for hire &yogh;onghede
And for heo so fair was &punctelev; he hopede hire out of þulke bileue lede
An old quene þare was biside &punctelev; strong hore and baudestrote
heo hadde Ni&yogh;e dou&yogh;tren li&yogh;t wummen. &punctelev; þe Duyk bigan hire gret mede bihote
Þat heo scholde þat maide wite &punctelev; and mistechen hire and rede
And fondi &yogh;if heo mi&yogh;te hire bringe &punctelev; in fol þou&yogh;t oþur in fol dede
Þis clene þing was to þis hore ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat hei&yogh;te Affrodose
heo, and hire dou&yogh;tren also &punctelev; maden hire þe glose
And bihete hire quoynte þingus fale &punctelev; of seluer and of golde
Richesse and oþur Ioye inou&yogh; &punctelev; þat heo hire þou&yogh;t chaungi scholde
hende and milde and swete inov&yogh; &punctelev; withoute Iolifte [beo]
Þi &yogh;ongue blod nolde it þolie nou&yogh;t &punctelev; scholde þi Ioie beon þe binome
In þis lond nis prince so hei&yogh; &punctelev; þat þov ne mi&yogh;test him wel bicome."
¶ Þis Maide, þei heo were &yogh;ong &punctelev; bigan to Answerie anon
And seide, "beo stille, þou deueles bouk! &punctelev; þe ne worth here non iwon
Þe hexte prince þat is ani &punctelev; In loue ich habbe itake
In mine &yogh;onghede and eueremore &punctelev; to holde him for mi make
Swete and hende and milde he is &punctelev; on him is al mi þou&yogh;t
Ich am so faste to him ibounde &punctelev; þarof ne bringuest þou me nou&yogh;t."
Þritti dawes heo was with heom &punctelev; þat heo fondeden euere
to bringue hire into þe deueles lore &punctelev; Ake heo ne spedden neuere
Þis wychche wende to þe Duyk þo &punctelev; þat het quincian
And seide, "sire, ine mai chaungi nou&yogh;t &punctelev; þe þou&yogh;t of þis womman
Li&yogh;tloker man may þane hardeste ston &punctelev; make nesche ase wolle
Þane þat Maide þoru&yogh; any gin &punctelev; of hire þou&yogh;t bringe schulle."
Þe Duyk let anon þis mayde fette &punctelev; and Axede &yogh;wat heo were
"godes schulchone," heo seide, "ich am" &punctelev; heo nadde none fere
he Axede of &yogh;wat kunne heo were. &punctelev; heo seide, "of gent and freo."
Þe Duyk seide, "hov mi&yogh;t þov gentil womman &punctelev; and eke a schulchone beo?"
"&YOGH;us," seide þat maide þo &punctelev; "hit is more fraunchise
to beon gode[s]schulchene oþer is þral &punctelev; þane king oþur Iustise."
"Anovre ovre godes!" seide þe Duyk &punctelev; "ne spec of þi god nonmore
Oþur ichulle þe swuch pine do &punctelev; þat it schal þe rewe sore."
"Ine schal so sone," þat maide seide &punctelev; "In pine beo ibrou&yogh;t
Þat it nele aswagi &yogh;if ich habbe &punctelev; on ihesu crist mi þou&yogh;t
&YOGH;if þou bringest me in ani fuyre &punctelev; and ich me biþenche
On þe pine þat he þolede for me &punctelev; anon it wole aquenche."
Þe Duyk let nime þat maide anon &punctelev; and Into þe gayhole lede
Þat maide was þo also glad &punctelev; ase þei men hire to feste bede
In stronge prisone heo was ido &punctelev; þarinne longe heo lay
Þe Duyk let þareafterwarde &punctelev; atfore him þat mayde bringe a day
¶ "Agace," he seide, "biþench þe wel &punctelev; bilef þi fole þou&yogh;t
Anovre ore[MS. ore ore] godes þat mowen þe helpe &punctelev; are þou beo in pine ibrou&yogh;t."
Þat maide seide, "þou spillest þi breth &punctelev; and þou tellest embe nou&yogh;t
Ake ich rede þat þou Anouri him &punctelev; þat deore us hath ibou&yogh;t
And bilef þine false godes &punctelev; þat power nabbez non
Þat beoth imad of an old stoc &punctelev; oþur of þe harde ston."
"Neltþou [nou]&yogh;t[MS. Neltþou&yogh;t]," seide þe duyk &punctelev; "þine folie &yogh;uyt bileue
In stronge pine þov schalt beo idon &punctelev; today are it beo eue."
hokes and witthene he let nime &punctelev; and faste to hire breoste binde
And let is tormentores with þe withþene &punctelev; hire breostene of wynde
"Þov onwreste bouk," þis Maide seide &punctelev; to þe duyk quincian
"Ne hastþov no schame in þine heorte &punctelev; defouli þus ani man
Þat lyme þat þov þi moder of soke &punctelev; and þe hath forth ibrou&yogh;t
Do þov þin owene confusion &punctelev; and ne dred þe ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t."
¶ gret pine þolede þis clene [may] &punctelev; are heo weren of idrawe
So muche was hire þou&yogh;t on gode &punctelev; þat it ne greuede hire nou&yogh;t an hawe
Þo heo weren of idrawe &punctelev; Into prisone heo was eft ido
Þe Duyk let witie þat prison faste &punctelev; þat no man ne come hire to
hire woundene to hele with aniþing &punctelev; oþur hire pines forto lisse
Ake ore louerd ne for&yogh;at nou&yogh;t hire &punctelev; þo ne þorte he misse
Ase heo in prisone al one was &punctelev; an old man þare cam gon
boxes fulle of Oygneme[n]z &punctelev; he brou&yogh;te mani on
And seide þat he hire hele wolde. &punctelev; "þov ne schalt," heo seide
"Ine kepe no man bote god &punctelev; þat me hele and rede."
"Ich am," seide þe olde man &punctelev; "In his name hidere iwend
For ich am his apostle— &punctelev; to þe he me hath isend
Þine woundene forto hele &punctelev; þat þov hast for him stronge
In þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; þine mede þou schalt afonge."
Þe woundes he gan smeorie &punctelev; heo weren hole in one stounde
Þat Maide nuste &yogh;ware he[MS. heo] bicam &punctelev; þo he hadde iheld hire wounde
Þe Duyk let þat maide bifore him bringe &punctelev; þene feorþe day
Þi word," heo seide, "ne doth non oþur &punctelev; &yogh;wane þov spext þus to me
bote fuylez swiþe foule þe eyr &punctelev; þat it deth inne fleo
he is wod þat stok oþur ston &punctelev; wole to helpe calle
And nou&yogh;t to god of heuene &punctelev; þat hath iheled mine wounden alle."
"Darstþou &yogh;eot," seide þe Duyk &punctelev; "of þine false gode more telle
Beo þov so wod to nemmen him more &punctelev; in stronge deþe Man schal þe quelle."
"Onwreste bouk," þat Maide seide &punctelev; "Inelle it lete nou&yogh;t
Þe &yogh;wyle þat ich libbe may &punctelev; to nemen him with worde oþur with þou&yogh;t."
Þe Duyk het men hire forbrenne &punctelev; a gret fuyr he let make
Þo heo [hire] wolden þarinne do &punctelev; þe eorþe bigan to quake
¶ Ase wide ase þe cite was &punctelev; and felde adoun þe domhalle
Twei men þat hire Iuggeden to deþe &punctelev; aslawe weren with þe walle
Þat folk of þe cite was adrad. &punctelev; to þe duyke heo seiden
"Þis Mayde is guod, and we beth for hire &punctelev; In grete perile and in drede
gret pine þov hast [hire] idon &punctelev; þou ne schal so nonmore."
Þo þe Duyk iherde þis &punctelev; adrad he was wel sore
Þat Mayde he let to prisone lede &punctelev; and he himseolf ascapede awey
bi one posterne stilleliche &punctelev; þat no man him ne sey&yogh;
Þo þat mayde into prisone cam &punctelev; adoun heo sat akneo
"Louerd," he seide, "fram mani pine &punctelev; þou hast isaued me
fram fuyr and fram woundes stronge &punctelev; þou me hast ibrou&yogh;t
And fram mi childhod þou me hast iwust &punctelev; þat ine misbilefde nou&yogh;t
Lat me, louerd, to reste wende &punctelev; for here me þinchez long
Tyme it is to endi mi lijf &punctelev; mine soule þov onderfong."
Mid þusse worde bifore al þat folk &punctelev; heo bigan to dei&yogh;e
Þare was mani a sori man &punctelev; and mani a wepinde ei&yogh;e
Þat folk þat hire louede &punctelev; siwede hire wel faste
hire bodi heo nomen with gret honour &punctelev; and bureden it atþe laste
Þo heo bureden þat holi bodi &punctelev; a felaweschipe þare cam go
Of þe faireste children þat mi&yogh;ten beo &punctelev; þre hondret and wel mo
&YOGH;onge þingus of on age &punctelev; in &yogh;wite cloþus of palle
Ane table of Marbre In is hond &punctelev; þe on bar atfore heom alle
¶ heo Ioyneden it to seinte Agace toumbe &punctelev; þo heo comen þerto
Wel sweteliche heo wenden a&yogh;en &punctelev; þo heo hadden so ido
Angles it weren þat þare ali&yogh;ten &punctelev; for seinte Agace to grounde
Clerkes biheolden þe table &yogh;eorne &punctelev; þareInne iwrite huy founde
"Þis Maide hadde holi þou&yogh;t &punctelev; god heo dude honour
Aserued heo hath to alle þe contreie &punctelev; deliueraunce of langour."
Forsoþe heo mi&yogh;ten þis laste word &punctelev; þarafter onderstonde
þulke time a twelfMonþe &punctelev; of an hul in þe londe
Strong fuyr þare cam eornen out &punctelev; ase water doth of welle
And barnde al þat þare was aboute &punctelev; quic þing it gan aquelle
hit spradde wide into al þat lond &punctelev; þat folk hadde grete fere
And barnde þe hard roche of ston &punctelev; ase þei it Col were
heo ne dorsten bileue at no toun &punctelev; ake ornen ase men þat were wode
At seinte Agace Toumbe &punctelev; þare heo formest atstode
Also it bifeol in hire daye &punctelev; ase sone ase heo weren þere
Þat fuyr queinte anon into al þat lond &punctelev; ase þei it neuere nere
And bifore it hadde six dawes ilast &punctelev; and six Nij&yogh;t also
And orn ase þei it water were &punctelev; forbarnde al þat him cam to
Þo schewede ore louerd þat it was soth &punctelev; þat þe maide seinte Agas
Aseruede deliueraunce to al þe Contree— &punctelev; þare wel isene it was
Also w[i]sliche we schullen hire bidde &punctelev; ase heo þe contreie &yogh;af bote
Þat we to þe Ioye þare heo is Inne &punctelev; with hire come we mote
SEinte scholace, þat holie mayde &punctelev; heo was of clene liue
Leouere heo hadde to beon Nonne &punctelev; þane beon iwiddet to wiue
Seint Beneit hire broþer was &punctelev; and þe Ordre furst bifond
Of Nonnes and of blake Monekus &punctelev; þat is &yogh;uyt into al þat lond
Of blake Monekus at Duyn &punctelev; An Abbeye he let arere
himsulf þe Abite furst he nam &punctelev; þe &yogh;ongore forto lere
Seinte Scholace, his soster &punctelev; blac Nonne he let hire make
And tei&yogh;te hire penaunce forto don &punctelev; to faste and to wake
Þeos twei&yogh;e holie creatures &punctelev; eche &yogh;ere hadden ane wone
to comen togadere some Tyme &punctelev; and tellen of godes sone
Ake heore noþer in oþeres Abbeye &punctelev; bileue come ne mi&yogh;te
Ne duelle for none þinge &punctelev; oute of heore celle bi Ni&yogh;te
¶ Þo þis guode holi mayde &punctelev; ibrou&yogh;t was in grete Elde
hire longuede with hire broþer to speke &punctelev; feble heo hire felde
Þo heo hadde to him isent &punctelev; and togadere heo weren icome
Al dai heo tolden of godes priuetez &punctelev; seinte Marie sone
Of þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; hou holi men heore [lif] ladden
Þareof al heore Ioye was &punctelev; þat heo togadere hadden
Seint Beneit to is soster seide &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te no leng bileue
Seinte scholace sori was. &punctelev; "broþur," heo seide, "þin ore
Þis holie wordus so murie beoth &punctelev; &yogh;eot we moten telle more
&YOGH;wane we In godes seruise beoth &punctelev; we ne doz nou&yogh;t ore ordre breke
Ich am so feble þat ich ne wene &punctelev; neuereft more with þe speke
bileue we þis one Ni&yogh;t togadere &punctelev; for his loue þat deore us bou&yogh;te
Ich wot þat he it wole us for&yogh;iue &punctelev; &yogh;wane we it doth in guode þou&yogh;te."
"beo stille," seide seint beneit &punctelev; "loke &yogh;wat þou dest telle
Wel þov wost þat ine mai beo &punctelev; bi ni&yogh;te fram mine celle."
Þo scholace isai&yogh; þat it ne heold &punctelev; to bidde hire broþur more
hire heued he hangede adoun &punctelev; and bigan to wepe sore
"Louerd," heo seide, "þat þov art &punctelev; ful of milce and ore
Lat me, louerd, &yogh;if þi wille it beo &punctelev; iheore more of þi lore
¶ Ne lat nou&yogh;t mi broþur toNi&yogh;t &punctelev; fram me, louerd, wende
Ake soffre us with tales of þe &punctelev; bringe þis ni&yogh;t to ende."
Ase þis Maide loke[r. lokede] opward &punctelev; þo heo hadde idon hire bone
Þat weder þat was so cler and fair &punctelev; bigan to chaungie sone
hit bigan to þondri and hauli &punctelev; lei&yogh;ten and eke rine
Þat feor withInne Ni&yogh;te it was &punctelev; er þat weder wolde afine
¶ Þo ne mi&yogh;te seint beneit &punctelev; for þe wedere þannes iwende
"Soster," he seide, "&yogh;wat hastþov idon? &punctelev; þou fondest me to schende
&YOGH;if it nere ore louerdes wille &punctelev; wel ne dost þov nou&yogh;t
Þat ischal mine ordre breke &punctelev; so nadde ich neuere iþou&yogh;t."
"Leue broþer," þat maide seide &punctelev; "ich bad þe swiþe &yogh;erne
Þat þou þis ni&yogh;t bilefdest here &punctelev; and euere þov dudest me werne
Ich bad mi louerd of heuene &punctelev; and he me iherde anon
Cheos nouþe &yogh;waþer þov bileue wolt &punctelev; oþur heonnes forto gon
bilef me alone &yogh;if þov mi&yogh;t &punctelev; for no þonk ne can ich þe
Ake ich þonki god of heuene &punctelev; þat so sone iheorde me."
Þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten departi nou&yogh;t &punctelev; togadere al ni&yogh;t heo woke
Þe Ni&yogh;t heom þov[&yogh;te] suyþe schort &punctelev; and sorie at þene ende
heo weren þo heo þane dai&yogh; isei&yogh;en &punctelev; &yogh;wane heo scholden ato iwende
heo ne dorsten no lengore togadere beo &punctelev; ac wenden to heore celle
heo weren boþe swiþe sorie &punctelev; þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten no leng togadere duelle
Þo þat Maide was hom icome &punctelev; sore sik heo lay&yogh;
And ase it godes wille was &punctelev; heo deide þane þridde dai&yogh;
Seint Beneit in is celle eode &punctelev; his soster soule he isei&yogh;
In fourme of a &yogh;wi&yogh;t Coluere &punctelev; fleon op into heuene an hei&yogh;
heouene openede a&yogh;eines hire &punctelev; þe Coluere gan in fleo
glad was þis holi man &punctelev; þat he it mi&yogh;te iseo
Amoruwe he and is couent &punctelev; þudere wenden sone
And bureden þat holi maide &punctelev; ase it was ri&yogh;t to done
bidde we suete Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat is so fair and hende
Þat we moten þudere comen &punctelev; ase scholace dude iwende

div1.head: 35 Purgatorium sancti Patrici abb[at]is.[I have published this legend before in Altengl. Legenden, Paderborn, 1875, p. 177 ff, together with two other versious.]

lg.l: SEint paterik þoru godes grace &punctelev; makede ane put in Irlonde
Þat seint patrike purgatorie is icleoped &punctelev; &yogh;eot, ase ich onderstonde
Ore louerd him bitok ane staf &punctelev; mid is owene honde
Þat he fond þulke purgatorie with &punctelev; ihered beo godes sonde
For gret relike he is iholde &punctelev; and elles it were wou&yogh;
Seint paterik in þulke stude &punctelev; þat his purgatorie is
Of religion bigan an hous &punctelev; þat &yogh;eot stant, iwis
Ant Chanoynes þareinne he makede &punctelev; ase &yogh;eot þare beoth also
Þane put he let faste closi aboute &punctelev; þat noman ne come þarto
¶ In þe churche&yogh;erd is þat ilke putt &punctelev; ri&yogh;t toward þe Estside
ri&yogh;t est fram þe hei&yogh;e Au&yogh;ter &punctelev; þat manie men &yogh;wylene sou&yogh;ten wide
he is biwalled faste aboute[MS. abooute] &punctelev; and faste iloke þe &yogh;ate
And þe prior haueth þe kei&yogh;e in warde &punctelev; þat no man ne mot In þarate
Al bi seint paterikes dai&yogh;e &punctelev; men wenden þudere ilome
And sethþe also mani on &punctelev; and fewe a&yogh;en þare come
Ake þulke þat þare comen a&yogh;en &punctelev; of þat heo isei&yogh;en, heo tolde
Ase it is in þe house iwrite &punctelev; and in priue conseile iholde.
¶ Þe manere is of euerech man &punctelev; þat forsoþe þudere iwent
Þat it beo to bete is sunnes &punctelev; &yogh;if ore louerd him grace [sent]
to þe bischope of þe lond &punctelev; furst he schal him schriue
And bidde him leue þene wey to go &punctelev; in amendement of is liue
Ake þe bischop schal rede heom[r. him] þarea&yogh;ein &punctelev; and manie resones schewe
And segge þat manie þudere wendeth &punctelev; and a&yogh;ein þare comieth fewe
Ake &yogh;if he is stable in is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; for al þat men him habbez ibede
Þe bischop him wole is lettre make &punctelev; to þe prior of þe stude
¶ Þe prior him wole also rede inov&yogh; &punctelev; forto chaungi is þou&yogh;t
And, &yogh;wane he si&yogh;kz him studefast &punctelev; þat he nele bileue it nou&yogh;t
Into churche he wole him lede &punctelev; and sette him adoun akne
Fiftene dawes he schal þare &punctelev; in is oresones beo
And &yogh;if heo ne mouwen for noþing &punctelev; maken chaungi is þou&yogh;t
With gret procession[MS. precession] of preostes &punctelev; to þe putte he worth ibrou&yogh;t
With þe croiz and with þe haliwatur &punctelev; heo schullen blessi him echon
himsulf he schal him blessi also &punctelev; and þanne into þe putte gon
And þat procession schal tuyrne a&yogh;en &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t is forto done
Amoruwe In þulke tyme &punctelev; heo schullen come þudere eftsone
And, bote heo finden him þanne a&yogh;en icome &punctelev; with gret deol and sor
heo schullen tuyrne a&yogh;ein, and sikere beoth &punctelev; þat he ne comez a&yogh;en nonmore.
¶ hit bifel bi þe kingus dai&yogh;e steuene &punctelev; þat novþe late was
Of a kni&yogh;t, þat hei&yogh;te sire Ovwayn &punctelev; a swiþe wonder cas
to þe bischop þis kni&yogh;t eode &punctelev; and to schrifte to him he cam
In grete repentaunce of is sunnes &punctelev; deol and sorewe to him he nam
Þe bischop bigan to chide faste &punctelev; for þat he hadde misdo
And seide þat he was manne worst &punctelev; forto sunegun so
And seide þat he ne mi&yogh;te so muche schame afonge &punctelev; þat he nere wuyrþe more
Þe kni&yogh;t sat with careful heorte &punctelev; he si&yogh;te and weop ful sore
¶ "Sire," seide þe kni&yogh;t, "&yogh;wan ich habbe &punctelev; manne worst ido
to þe sunne þat grettest is &punctelev; mest penaunce mot þarto
And &yogh;if ich among alle men &punctelev; mest sunful am, alas
Þe gretteste penaunce ichulle take &punctelev; þat euere bifounde was
Ichulle me take to godes grace &punctelev; and in is name iwende
Into seint paterikes purgatorie &punctelev; and take þat god me wole sende."
"Ov, beu frere," quath þe bischop &punctelev; "be stille, &yogh;wi seistþov so
Crist forbeode þat þov euere &punctelev; swuch folie do
Onneþe comez þare ani a&yogh;en &punctelev; þat doth þareIn iwende
Nolde god þat þov þe dede dudest &punctelev; bodi and soule to schende
Ake wend into religion and bilef þare &punctelev; to þine liues ende
Þine sunnes þou mi&yogh;t bete wel &punctelev; &yogh;if god þe wole grace sende."
"Certes, sire," quath þis kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "ase wel þov mi&yogh;t beo stille
For þulke penaunce ichulle do &punctelev; &yogh;if it is godes wille
For ase muche ase ich habbe ofserued &punctelev; Ine mai nou&yogh;t habe of wo
Þerefore sei&yogh;e &yogh;wat i schal &punctelev; for þudere ichulle go."
¶ Þe bischop prechede him faste inov&yogh; &punctelev; forto chaungi is þou&yogh;t
Ake atþe laste, þo he isai&yogh; &punctelev; þat it was al for nou&yogh;t
To þe prior of þe stude &punctelev; his lettres made sone
Þat he scholde bi him do &punctelev; ase bi swuch a man was to done
¶ Þe prior prechede him faste inov&yogh; &punctelev; and schewede him resones inowe
&YOGH;if he mi&yogh;te changi is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; þat he him withdrowe
bote is prechinge was al for nou&yogh;t. &punctelev; ase he sai&yogh; atþen ende
Þat he nolde lete for noþing &punctelev; þene perilouse wei to wende
Þe prior nam him bi þe hond &punctelev; and into churche him brou&yogh;te
Þare he ful akne adoun &punctelev; and ore louerdes grace bisou&yogh;te
In fastingues and in oresones &punctelev; fourtene ni&yogh;t he lai
Forte bidde ore louerdes grace. &punctelev; and in þe fourteþe dai
Þat Couent cam aboute him &punctelev; and oþere preostes also
And clerkes, with procession &punctelev; þe seruise for him to do
¶ For him heo songun þe hei&yogh;emasse &punctelev; and to ore louerd criden faste
And ore louerdes flechs and is blod &punctelev; heo &yogh;euen him atþe laste
And spreinden him with holi watur &punctelev; and heore oresones heo seide
With Croiz and with procession &punctelev; to þe put heo gonne him lede
And hei&yogh;liche songun þe letanie &punctelev; and holi water with hem bere
And alle louerdes halewe beden &punctelev; þat heo heore[r. his] help were
Þe prior onlek þe puttes dore &punctelev; bifore heom echon
Ake &yogh;if þou wolt bi ore rede do &punctelev; þi þou&yogh;t þou schalt wende
And in oþur manere þine sunnes bete &punctelev; ase god þe grace wole sende
Fewe here comen euere a&yogh;en &punctelev; þat wenden hereIn bifore
Ake heo beoth for tormentingue and for wo &punctelev; lif and soule forlore."
¶ "Certes, sire," quath þis kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "rede &yogh;wat þov me rede
In ore louerdes name þane wei ich take &punctelev; to bete mine misdede
Ake for is loue þat us deore bou&yogh;te &punctelev; biddez for me echon
Lif and soule god ich bitake &punctelev; and In his name ichulle In gon."
he blessede him, and wende forth In &punctelev; and bitok god is flesch and is bon
Þe prior spreinde him with holi water &punctelev; and lek þe dore anon
Þis guode kni&yogh;t wende him forth &punctelev; wel baldeliche and faste
In one holewe weie onder eorþe &punctelev; and to god is heorte caste
Swyþe deork it was, þat he ne say ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t &punctelev; ne noþing him ne agaste
So longe þat him þou&yogh;te he isai&yogh; &punctelev; wel feor li&yogh;t atþe laste
Þe faireste feld þat mi&yogh;te beo &punctelev; atþe wei&yogh;es ende he isei&yogh;.[Pulchra via.]
¶ ÞareInne he wende murie inov&yogh; &punctelev; and amidde þe felde he fond
Þe faireste halle and þe nobleste &punctelev; þat mi&yogh;te beo in ani lond
Ake þet weder nas nou&yogh;t cler &punctelev; bote ase it were nei&yogh; eue
Forto biholde þat noble weork &punctelev; ane stounde he gan bileue
Þe walles neren nou&yogh;t ihole &punctelev; ake al aboute iwis
With pilers and with qvoynte Arches &punctelev; ase þis Monekene cloistre is
In he wende a godes name &punctelev; and sette him al one an hei&yogh;
Ase he biheold also aboute &punctelev; þare come In at þe on ende
Twelf men in &yogh;wite cloþes &punctelev; swiþe faire and hende
Alle heore crounes weren newe schaue— &punctelev; and suyþe faire heo him gretten
And alle heo seten faire adoun &punctelev; and þane [kni&yogh;t] bi heom heo setten
¶ Þo seide on of heom, ase þei it þe prior were &punctelev; wel mildeliche and stille
"bev frere, ihered beo Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat on þe brou&yogh;te swuche wille
And late þe þat þou&yogh; agodes name hast bigonne &punctelev; for is holi grace wel ende
leue broþur, &yogh;wane þou woldest þis wei &punctelev; for þine sunnes wende
Oþur þov most beon studefast and hardi &punctelev; and in none manere tuyrne þi þou&yogh;t
Oþur þov worst forlore, lif and soule &punctelev; and sone to þe deuel ibrou&yogh;t
For alsosone ase we beth heonne iwent &punctelev; þe feondes luþere and wicke
heo wollez come aboute þe &punctelev; Into þis hous ful þicke
And don þe tormens and wo inov&yogh; &punctelev; and bihote þe wel more
And heo wollez also bihote þe Ioye inov&yogh; &punctelev; &yogh;if þov wolt leue heore lore
And &yogh;if heo mouwen þoru&yogh; ani biheste &punctelev; oþur enie gile, þe ouercome
Forsoþe þov worst, lif and soule &punctelev; adeuele wei al clene inome
Ake &yogh;if þov art studefast of heorte &punctelev; and on Ihesu crist wolt þenche
Ne for biheste[MS. heste heste] ne for wo &punctelev; fram him þou nelle blenche
Þou worst quit of alle þine sunnes &punctelev; þat þov hast euere iwrou&yogh;t
And þov schalt iseo alle þe Ioies &punctelev; þat guode men beoth inne ibrou&yogh;t
And also þe pine þat luþere men &punctelev; habbez for heore misdede
Ake in &yogh;wat wo þat þov euere art &punctelev; euere þench on god, ich rede
¶ And euere &yogh;wane heo tormentiez þe &punctelev; cri Iesu milce and ore
And, &yogh;if þou art studefast in gode bileue &punctelev; heo ne schullen defouli þe nonmore
We bitakez þe god of heuene &punctelev; and ich rede þov do bi ovre lore."
Þo nuste þe kni&yogh;t &yogh;ware heo bicomen. &punctelev; he sat and si&yogh;te sore
Elinge he bilefte alone &punctelev; and cride on godes mi&yogh;te
And Armede him with holie beden &punctelev; a&yogh;en þe deuelene to fi&yogh;te
On þe holi gost he cride faste &punctelev; þat he ne scholde him faile
he lokede euere &yogh;wane heo comen &punctelev; him forto asaille
Ase he sat agodes name &punctelev; þe bataille forto abide
Þare cam a sori reuful cri &punctelev; aboute in eche side
Ase alþe world toborste and tobreke &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te it was also
Þat, þei alle þe bestes of þe worlde &punctelev; togadere weren ido
Ase[al. & ase] loude and ase grisliche ase heo mi&yogh;ten &punctelev; &yogh;eollinde echone heo were
Ake[al. om.] heo ne mi&yogh;ten among heom alle &punctelev; make so grisliche bere
Þat[al. þat &yogh;if] is hope and is heorte on ihesu crist &punctelev; eueremore heo were,[r. nere]
Elles he hadde wod bicome &punctelev; and ilore is wit for fere
¶ Þo comen heo abouten him &punctelev; þicke and grisliche þere
&YOGH;eonijnde and grenninde on him &punctelev; with ful lodlich chere
"bel ami," quath þe on of heom &punctelev; "þou hast ari&yogh;t ido
We owez wel alle anouri þe &punctelev; for al to fewe doth so
For alle oþere men wollez abide &punctelev; þat heore lif heom beo binome
And &yogh;eot it is a&yogh;en heore wille &punctelev; þat heo schullen hidere come
And þov art icome al bi þine liue &punctelev; and bi þine guode wille also
Wel ou&yogh;te we þine mede &yogh;elde &punctelev; and gre[t] þonk also þe do
&YOGH;wane þov hast boþe bodi and soule &punctelev; i&yogh;yuen us bi þine liue
Saunt faille we ne beoth nou&yogh;t so onkuynde &punctelev; þat we it nellez &yogh;elde þe bliue
For þe kundenesse þat þov to us come &punctelev; al bi þine owene lore
Ake naþeles, &yogh;if þou wolt on eorþe &punctelev; habbe Ioye more
Sikere us an hond þat þov wolt &punctelev; In ore seruise bileue
And we þe wollez a&yogh;en to eorþe bringe &punctelev; al sauf, are hit beo eue
And þov schalt habbe þare Ioye inou&yogh; &punctelev; in halle and eke in boure
For none men ne fareth so murie þare &punctelev; ase þulke þat beoth ovre
hei&yogh; man and noble þov schalt beo &punctelev; and alle men schullen honouri þe
&YOGH;wane þov art ded ant comest to us &punctelev; þou schalt habbe ase guod ase we."
Þis kni&yogh;t þou&yogh;te euere on Iesu crist &punctelev; and nolde chaungi is wille
For þretninge ne for fair biheste &punctelev; ake sat him euere stille
Þo he nolde graunti nou&yogh;t &punctelev; to heom forto wende
heo &yogh;ollen and grenneden on him foule &punctelev; and strong fuyr bigonne forto tiende
¶ Þis kni&yogh;t heo bounden honden and fet &punctelev; and amidde þe fuyre him[Prima pena.] caste
With Irene Ovles and pikes &punctelev; heo todrowen him wel faste
Þis kni&yogh;t hadde gret pine &punctelev; wel loude he cride anon
"Ihesus, Ihesus, help me nouþe &punctelev; and do awei mine fon!"
Anon so [he] hadde þis word iseid &punctelev; þat fuyr aqueinte ech spronke
And þe deuelene ne mi&yogh;ten him non more todrawe. &punctelev; ore louerd he gan þonke
And þe lasse he was of heom adrad &punctelev; þat weren him so nei&yogh;
Wel grisliche heo &yogh;ollen, þe schrewes &punctelev; þo heom faillede heore mi&yogh;t
And flouwen echone out of þe halle &punctelev; and drowen with heom þis kni&yogh;t
A&yogh;en þe grounde heo drowen him harde &punctelev; boþe bi fet and honde
longe, him þou&yogh;te, and swiþe feor &punctelev; alaboute in a waste londe
Ake swiþe softe wind þare was &punctelev; þat he heorde onneþe
Ri&yogh;t colde he wende þoru&yogh; is heorte &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; al is bodi also
Þat him were leouere þane al þe world &punctelev; þat þe pine were ido
Þus colde heo drowen him, ase heom[r. him] þou&yogh;te &punctelev; forth ri&yogh;t est, iwis
Ase þe sonne arist in somer &punctelev; &yogh;wane þe dai lengest is
Þo heo comen, ase heom[r. prima Secunda1 pena] þou&yogh;te &punctelev; ri&yogh;t to þe worldes ende
bi a brod valeie heo torneden heom &punctelev; and southward gonne iwende
toward þe stude þat þe sonne &punctelev; In winter doth arise
Þis seli kni&yogh;t was idrawe &punctelev; and ipined in fale wise
Þo þou&yogh;te him þat he iheorde feor &punctelev; bifore him ase it were
Swiþe deolful cri and wop &punctelev; and swyþe revful bere
Euere þe neor þat heo comen &punctelev; þe revlokur was þat cri
So longe [heo] drowen him, þat him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; þat heo weren ri&yogh;t þerbi
¶ Þo comen heo into a wid feld &punctelev; non more ne mi&yogh;te beo
So long and brod in eche side &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te non ende iseo
Of men and of wummen þis feld was &punctelev; ful in eche side
Þe wombene toward þe grounde &punctelev; ispradde abrod ful wide
hondene and fet al abrod &punctelev; to þe eorþe faste ibounde
With Irene nailles al fuyrie &punctelev; ismite þoru&yogh; heom to grounde
Þis wrechche gostes weren[al. om.] so ipinede &punctelev; with Irene and with fuyre
So deolful cri heo maden þare &punctelev; þat gret deol it was to huyre
heo criden merci deolfulliche &punctelev; Ake no merci men nolde heom do
For Anguische þe eorþe heo freten &punctelev; and hore tongene gnowen also
Þe deoulene ornen opon hem &punctelev; and treden heom to þe grounde
And with Ovles swiþe kene &punctelev; maden heom mani a wounde.
Allas, &yogh;wy nellez men beon iwar &punctelev; and heore sunnes here bete
Are heo comen to purgatorie &punctelev; and with þe luþere gostes mete
For ase wel beth þe schrewes in purgatorie &punctelev; and oueral, ase in helle
And schullen forto þe dai&yogh;e of dome come &punctelev; telle &yogh;wat men telle.
bote þov wolle þi þou&yogh;t wende &punctelev; and after ovre rede do."
¶ And þo he nolde in none manere &punctelev; to grounde harde heo him caste
And tormenteden him ase þe oþere weren &punctelev; and to þe eorþe naileden him faste
Ake he criede anon to ihesu crist &punctelev; þo him smert so sore
Þare nas non of þe schrewes þo &punctelev; þat mi&yogh;ten serui him so more
heo drowen him into an oþur felde &punctelev; wel ful of more wo
Of Men and wummen it was ful &punctelev; opri&yogh;t isprad to grounde
Fet and hondene ato idrawe &punctelev; and to þe eorþe faste ibounde
With glowinde biendes al of Ire &punctelev; inailede heo weren þerto
Al fuyrie naddrene ope heom seten &punctelev; and foule crapoudes also
Some of þe naddrene biclupten heom &punctelev; so faste al aboute
Þat heom þou&yogh;te heo scholden toberste &punctelev; so streite heo gurden heom withoute
Some seten ope heom &punctelev; and heore flesch altognowe
And with kene tieth al fuyrie &punctelev; wombe and breoste todrowe
Some with hore scharpe tounges &punctelev; þoru&yogh; þe heorte sore heom smite
Some heo gnowen, and some heo stounge &punctelev; and some with scharpe tieth heom bite
Þe Crapoudes also, þat weren so foule &punctelev; opon heore breostene sete
And stoungen heom þoru&yogh; heore heortene &punctelev; with heore foule wrottes grete
Þe luþere gostes ornen also &punctelev; aboute heom inowe
With hokes and with ou&yogh;les &punctelev; a[nd][MS. a] with gret eir heom todrowe
Þe wrechche gostes, so forpinede &punctelev; in swuch torment weren[al. om.] ibrou&yogh;t
heo criden alle deolfulliche &punctelev; ake hit ne halp heom nou&yogh;t
¶ Þe feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t &punctelev; and wolden him pini also
Ake anon so he cride on Ihesu crist &punctelev; ne mi&yogh;ten heo bringe him þerto
&YOGH;eot þe feondes eftsone him nomen &punctelev; and to þe þridde feld him[Quarta pena.] brou&yogh;te
Þat weren ispradde on þe eorþe abrod &punctelev; and ismiten þoru&yogh;out echone
with nailes þicke al abrod &punctelev; ase þare mi&yogh;ten stikie one
Þat man ne mi&yogh;te finde ane amtie place &punctelev; on al heore bodie so luyte
Þat man mi&yogh;te for þe þicke nailles &punctelev; a fingres ende to heom puyte
¶ A smart wind also to oþur wo &punctelev; on heom bleu&yogh; wel faste
Þe feondes ornen faste aboute &punctelev; fram ech to oþur inowe
And heore wrechche flesch with oþur wo &punctelev; mid Ovles heom todrowe
Þeos wrechche gostes, so furpinede &punctelev; and in swuch torment ibrou&yogh;t
Revliche heo criden ase heo mi&yogh;ten &punctelev; ake it ne halp heom ri&yogh;t nou&yogh;t
For heo weren so clene ouercome &punctelev; þat heo ne mi&yogh;ten onneþe
Ani voiz outbringe bote ase a man &punctelev; þat were ope þe pointe of deþe
In heore þrote heo criden dimmeliche &punctelev; for heore strencþe heom was binome
With muche pine, and no wonder it nas &punctelev; þei heo weren ouercome
Þe feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t &punctelev; and to grounde him caste
And seiden, bote he wolde turne is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; heo wolden naili him þare wel faste
Ake he cride on Ihesu crist &punctelev; and nemde is holi name
Þe schrewes ne hadden none mi&yogh;te þo &punctelev; to don him more schame
[Quinta pena.]&YOGH;eot heo nomen and drowen him &punctelev; into þe feorþe felde
Ful of brumston al brenninde &punctelev; with stronge lei&yogh;e and spelde
Some with chaines of Ire &punctelev; al fuyrie, hengen on hei&yogh;
Some bi Armes, some bi fet &punctelev; and bi þe necke mani on
heo weren anhangede in stronge fuyre &punctelev; of pich and eke brumston
Some hengen bi stronge crokus &punctelev; Ipulte þoru&yogh; eiþur Ey&yogh;e
Þoru&yogh; þe þrote some also &punctelev; and þoru&yogh; eiþur ere wel hei&yogh;e
Þat leuere heom were þane al þe world &punctelev; heore lyf to habbe ilete
Some opon grediles of Ire &punctelev; irostede weren also
Some ase gyes, þe spites of Ire &punctelev; þoru&yogh;out heom ido
Some leyen opri&yogh;t a&yogh;ein þe grounde &punctelev; &yogh;eonijnde wel faste
Þe feondes welden led and bras &punctelev; and in heore mouþes caste
he ne mi&yogh;te biþenche no manere pine &punctelev; þat he ne sai&yogh; mo þer
him þou&yogh;te he sai&yogh; þare mani on &punctelev; þat he knev on eorþe her
Þe feondes him casten amidde þis pine &punctelev; among þis oþere echon
And he cride on Iesu crist &punctelev; and was deliured anon
[Sexta pena.]¶ &YOGH;eot þis feondes þis selie kni&yogh;t &punctelev; into an oþur place huy drowe
ÞareInne he isai&yogh; a grislich &yogh;weol &punctelev; with spokene longe inowe
Ful it was of hokes and pikes &punctelev; wel þicke, ase he isei&yogh;
Þis hokes and þis pikes weren &punctelev; faste iriuen also
With wrechche gostes alaboute &punctelev; þat þaron weren ido
Al brenninde was þis sorie &yogh;weol &punctelev; and stinkinde of brumston
Þe wrechche gostes þat þaron hengen &punctelev; brenninde weren echon
Þis feondes wenden forth anon &punctelev; and heore hokes þaron caste
In eiþur side, a[nd][MS. a] tur[n]den aboute &punctelev; þis sori &yogh;weol so faste
Þat of þe gostus þat þaron hengen &punctelev; noþing heo ne sei&yogh;e
So faste heo torneden þat &yogh;weol aboute— &punctelev; bote þe brenninde lei&yogh;e
Ake deolfulliche heo criden and &yogh;ollen &punctelev; euerech in is ende.
Alas, &yogh;wi nellez men beon iwar &punctelev; are heo heonnes wende
&YOGH;wane he mi&yogh;ten here with a luytel pine &punctelev; bete heore misdede
And þare heo schullen so bitere abugge &punctelev; alas, þe wrechhede!
Þis feondes nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t &punctelev; and on þis &yogh;weol him caste
And with þis oþere wrechche gostes &punctelev; torneden him aboute faste
Sone he cride on Ihesu crist &punctelev; deliuered he was anon
Þe feondes stoden and biheolden &punctelev; with dreori mod echon
[Septima pena.]¶ Eft heo nomen him bitterliche &punctelev; and ferrore &yogh;uyt him ladde
And harleden him forth wel revfulliche &punctelev; and loude &yogh;ollen and gradde
bifore him he sai&yogh; an hous stonde &punctelev; long and brod inov&yogh;
he withstod, and nolde, is þonkes &punctelev; for stunche gon non ner
"Ferrore þov schalt," þe fendes seiden &punctelev; "þou ne schalt nou&yogh;t abide her
A bath it is þat þov isijcst &punctelev; and þarinne þov schalt beo
And baþi with oþere þat þare beoth &punctelev; ne schalt þov nou&yogh;t so fleo."
Þe gostes þat þareinne weren &punctelev; wel deolfulliche cride
And &yogh;ollen loude, ase he iheorde &punctelev; aboute in eche side
Þis kni&yogh;t with þis foule wi&yogh;tes &punctelev; Into þe grete house cam
Of tormens þat he þare isai&yogh; &punctelev; gret gome withalle he nam
ful of puttes and of diches &punctelev; þat hous withinne it was
More seoruwe ne more stunch &punctelev; neuere isei&yogh;e nas
heo weren folle of stronge tormens &punctelev; boillinde euerechon
Of wallinde led, and ifulde heo weren &punctelev; of piche and brumston
Wrechche gostus þareinne seten &punctelev; þe torment tilde wel hei&yogh;e
Some aboue þe heued &punctelev; and some ri&yogh;t to þe Ey&yogh;e
Some to þe nose, and some to þe mouth &punctelev; and some op to þe swere
And some to heore breostene &punctelev; and abou&yogh;ten heore sunnes ful deore
And some to heore nauele &punctelev; and some neþerrore more
And some stoden op to heore knen &punctelev; and criden and weopen sore
And some stoden In with boþe fet &punctelev; and some with þat on
Deolfolliche heo weopen and criden &punctelev; and &yogh;ollen euerechon
bote þov wolle anoþur speke &punctelev; and to us tuyrne anon."
heo nomen and casten him In a putte. &punctelev; on Iesus anon he cride
Op he cam anon a&yogh;en &punctelev; and no lengore he ne moste þare abide
[Octaua pena.]heo nomen him in grete wrathþe &punctelev; and harleden him ferrere more
And brou&yogh;ten him opon a swyþe gret hul &punctelev; ful of sorewe and sore
Iclui&yogh;te heo seten ope heore ton &punctelev; and quakeden revliche for fere
Þat foule stonk, and caldore was &punctelev; þane ani ys oþur snov&yogh;
A norþerne wind faste blev&yogh; &punctelev; þat him þou&yogh;te is flesch torende
Euere þare seten gostes &punctelev; and a&yogh;ein þe winde heom wende
heo quakeden and chyuereden faste &punctelev; in grete pine and stronge
Ase hoso seith abidet þare heore time &punctelev; heore deth forto afonge
"lo," seide on of þe feondes &punctelev; "þov nost nou&yogh;t &yogh;wat istis
bote þov torne þi þou&yogh;t sone &punctelev; þou schalt iwite, iwis."
Ne hadde he bote þis word iseid &punctelev; þat þare ne cam a wind blowe
And drof alle þis wrechche gostes &punctelev; into þe deope watur ful lowe
¶ Þe Norþerne wynd drof heom adoun &punctelev; al mid one blaste
And alle þe gostes, and þene kni&yogh;t &punctelev; amidde þe watere hem caste
More pine ne mi&yogh;te non beo &punctelev; of stronge chele ne of stunche
Þane þis gostes þarinne hadden &punctelev; þare ne mi&yogh;te non atblenche
Þo þe kni&yogh;t þe stronge pine &punctelev; of þis water ifelde
he gan to crie on Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat faillede him ful selde
For in þat water, þat was so cold &punctelev; and so foule stonk also
Þis gostes swymden op and doun &punctelev; in muche sorewe and wo
Þe feondes ornen opon þe watere &punctelev; so men doth on þe londe
And &yogh;wane ani wolde coueri[al. cleueri] op &punctelev; with fote oþur with honde
heo pulten him adoun a&yogh;en &punctelev; þat þare ne ascapede non
Þare was wo and sorewe inou&yogh; &punctelev; among heom euerechon
¶ Þis feondes wenden forth anon &punctelev; and þe seli kni&yogh;t eft nome
And drowen him into a sori stude &punctelev; þare neuer er heo ne come
heo comen and stoden ouer a put &punctelev; wyd it was and deop inov&yogh;
A brenninde smoke, þat foule stonk &punctelev; op of þe putte drov&yogh;
Wrechche gostes in þis put &punctelev; in þat sori smoke he sei&yogh;
Fleo op and doun al brenninde &punctelev; ase speldene doth of fuyre
And into þe putte eft fullen adoun &punctelev; þo heo ne mi&yogh;ten no leng duyre
"&YOGH;wy stanst þov so?" þe fendes seiden &punctelev; "þinchþ þe þarof wonder
Of þis swete smoke þat here bloweth &punctelev; and &yogh;wat put beo þareonder
[Puteum Inferni.]¶ In þis put is ovre woneingue &punctelev; for þe put of helle it is
And, for þov us hast iserued wel &punctelev; here þov schalt wonie, iwis
For alle þat us seruieth wel &punctelev; hidere heo schullen wende
And, &yogh;if þov comest herein with us &punctelev; þov worst here withouten ende
Þarefore i rede torne þi þou&yogh;t &punctelev; and do us here manrede
And we schullen þene wei ase we come[MS. conne] &punctelev; al sauf a&yogh;en þe lede
Þov schalt on eorþe al þi lijf habbe &punctelev; richesse, and Ioye also
For we schullen on eorþe þe finde inov&yogh; &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t is þat we do."
Þo þe kni&yogh;t forsok heore biheste &punctelev; ase he hadde er ilome
heo smiten heom adoun into þe putte &punctelev; and þene kni&yogh;t with heom nome
Þe deoppore þat heo comen &punctelev; þ[e] braddere þe put was
Ake[al. þat] al þe wo þat he isai&yogh; er &punctelev; a&yogh;ein þat nou&yogh;t it nas
Of stunch, of brenninge, and of oþur wo &punctelev; þe kni&yogh;t was so ouercome
Þat is þov&yogh;t toward Iesu crist &punctelev; nei&yogh; him was binome
So muche pine nas neuere isei&yogh;e— &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te ase þei he felde
Ake ore louerd among al is wo &punctelev; grace him &yogh;af atþe laste
Þat he þou&yogh;te on Ihesu crist &punctelev; and to him cride [faste].[MS. atþe laste]
A smoke þare cam smite up anon &punctelev; mid one wel stronge blaste
Þene kni&yogh;t an hei&yogh; aboue þe putte &punctelev; and manie oþere[al. om.] gostes, caste
Þe kni&yogh;t &yogh;wirlede op in þis blast &punctelev; ase speldene doth, wel wide
Atþe laste he li&yogh;te adoun &punctelev; aboue þe putte bi side
Þare he stod and biheold aboute &punctelev; ase man þat witles were
Þat for þe pine þat he hadde ihaued &punctelev; he nuste hov he cam þere
Þo he hadde longe istonde al one &punctelev; and biholde aboute
Þare comen blaste op of þe putte &punctelev; deuelene a gret rou&yogh;te
And [stoden] bi him al aboute &punctelev; al newe as þei heo were
Ase him þou&yogh;te, he ne sai&yogh; hem &punctelev; neuer er bote þo þere
heo biheolden him wel grisliche &punctelev; and grenneden on him alaboute
And seiden, "&yogh;wi stanst þov here al one? &punctelev; þov most come into ovre rovte."
heo seiden, "tolden ore felawes þe &punctelev; þat þis was þe put of helle
hit nis nou&yogh;t so, ake we wollez sone &punctelev; for ri&yogh;te soþe þe telle
Nostþov nou&yogh;t þat it is ore ri&yogh;te &punctelev; to li&yogh;en eueremo
And þat we with lesingues bitraieth men &punctelev; bote it mowe oþur go
And so ore felawes louwen þe &punctelev; þat þis was þe put of helle
Ake þov schalt come þudere with us &punctelev; and þe soþe we wollez þe telle."
¶ Þis deouelene harleden þane kni&yogh;t forth &punctelev; þat wo was him todrawe
Þat him were leouere þane aniþing &punctelev; þat he hadde ibeo of lifdawe
A strong mist, þat foule stonk &punctelev; op of þis watere drov&yogh;
Of brumston and of oþur wo— &punctelev; so strong stunch neuere he ne sei&yogh;
A brugge þare was ouer þat watur &punctelev; smallere ne mi&yogh;te non beo
Þe smoke was so þicke alaboute &punctelev; þat onneþe he mi&yogh;te [it] iseo
þo seiden þe sorie fendes &punctelev; "we seggez þe iwis
Þat onder þis deope watere &punctelev; þe put of helle so is
And þat þov schalt sone iwite &punctelev; for þov schalt sone anon
ouer þis watur, þat is so deop &punctelev; opon þis brugge gon
And we schullen þe sende swuch a wynd &punctelev; þat schal þe amidde caste
And ore felawes þat beoth bineothe &punctelev; schullen þe nime wel faste
And drawe þe doun forth with hem &punctelev; Into helle grounde anon
Cum novþe forth and þou&yogh; schalt &punctelev; opon þis brugge gon."
heo nomen þis seli kni&yogh;t &punctelev; and opon þis brugge drowe
And maden him go þere, is onþonkes &punctelev; with wrechhedes inowe
Þreo þingus vuele inowe &punctelev; on þis brugge were
Þat on was, for heo was so hei&yogh; &punctelev; þat no gost ne[al. vnneþe me] mi&yogh;te for fere
Þareoppe gon and so deope adoun &punctelev; habbe so grisliche si&yogh;te
Þat oþur was, for heo was so narov&yogh; &punctelev; þat onneþe aniþing[al. me] mi&yogh;te
Þareoppe sette ani fot &punctelev; þat he ne fulle adoun anon
Þe þridde, þat heo was so slider &punctelev; þat man ne mi&yogh;te þareoppe gon
bote he slide and felle adoun &punctelev; so slei&yogh; man neuere nere
Þeos þreo þinges þesne selie kni&yogh;t &punctelev; brou&yogh;ten in grete fere
For heo was narov&yogh;, and slider, and hei&yogh; &punctelev; þat he ne scholde him so bitelle
&YOGH;if þat he glufte[al. glide] in ani half &punctelev; þat he ne fulle into helle
¶ Þareoppe he was with strencþe ibrou&yogh;t &punctelev; and þareoppe imaket to gon
So gret drede, ase him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; ne hadde he neuer er non
Ake sone he þou&yogh;te on ihesu crist &punctelev; þat so ofte him sauede er
And cride on is holie name &punctelev; þat he were is helpe þer
he eode forth we[l] baldeliche &punctelev; and þe innore þat he cam
Þe hardiore him þou&yogh;te he was &punctelev; and þe betere heorte to him he nam
And þe braddore was is wei— &punctelev; so longe forth he eode
Þat it was so brod þat þere mi&yogh;te &punctelev; a carte gon for neode
And so longe, þat tuei cartes mi&yogh;te &punctelev; meten heom wel inov&yogh;
Þe kni&yogh;t þo wel baldeliche &punctelev; ase a maister forth him drou&yogh;
Þe feondes stoden bineþe þe brugge &punctelev; and sei&yogh;en him so faste gon
And for al þe wo þat heo him duden &punctelev; ne ouercam him nou&yogh;t on
heom þou&yogh;te, it was al for nou&yogh;t &punctelev; after him to honten more
grisliche heo gonne forto &yogh;eolle &punctelev; ant to crie and wepe suyþe sore
Þat for þe &yogh;eollinge þat heo maden &punctelev; he hadde wel more fere
Þane of al þe pine þat he hadde er &punctelev; so lodlich was þe bere
¶ heore Oules heo nomen and heore hokes &punctelev; and toward him casten an hei&yogh;
So þat al sauf with alle Ioye &punctelev; ouer þis watere he him drov&yogh;
heo leten him go &yogh;wodere he wolde &punctelev; and ne fondeden him non more
And heolden heom cleneliche ouercome &punctelev; for al heore false lore
Þis kni&yogh;t wende him forth, sauf inou&yogh;— &punctelev; þat he hadde erore deore a|bou&yogh;t
And þonkede &yogh;eorne Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat þe feondes ne siweden him nou&yogh;t
Þat watur he passede sauf inov&yogh; &punctelev; and forþere þene wey he nam
So riche weork nas neuere isei&yogh;e &punctelev; ase him [þou&yogh;te] þat þaron was
And swyþe fair &yogh;at þaron he sai&yogh; &punctelev; þat neuere swuch isei&yogh;e nas
Þat &yogh;at schon swyþe bri&yogh;te &punctelev; ase þei it al gold were
Folle of derewurþe stones ipi&yogh;te &punctelev; none richere neuere nere
him þou&yogh;te, are he þudere cam &punctelev; is wei ful longe laste
Þo he cam forþere a luytel wi&yogh;t &punctelev; he stod and biheold it faste
Þat [&yogh;at][om.] wende op a&yogh;en him &punctelev; and anonri&yogh;t with þe dede
Þare cam smite out a swote smel &punctelev; and wide aboute gan sprede
Þat him þou&yogh;te, þei al þe world &punctelev; swote spices were
So muche swotnesse ne mi&yogh;te &yogh;iuen &punctelev; ase þat suote smul dude þere
In so gret Ioye him þou&yogh;te he was &punctelev; þat þei he hadde beo ibrou&yogh;t
Into al þe soruwe þat he was er &punctelev; it ne schulde him habbe igreued nou&yogh;t
Ase he wolde þareIn wende &punctelev; a&yogh;ein him þare cam gon
A procession fair inov&yogh; &punctelev; of noble men echon
with creoiz and with taperes &punctelev; and with baneres clere
Ireuested faire muche folk was &punctelev; and ech hadde is fere
Some were bischopus and Ercedeknes &punctelev; and some Monekes and freres
And euerech, him þou&yogh;te, hadde þe Abite &punctelev; þat heo wereden here
with þe meste Ioye þat mi&yogh;te beo &punctelev; þis kni&yogh;t was onderfonge
And ilad In with Ioye inov&yogh; &punctelev; mid solas and murie songe
Þo þis murie song was ido &punctelev; to him sone þare come
Tweien ase it maistres weren &punctelev; and bi þe honde him nome
And welcomeden him wel mildeliche &punctelev; and þonkeden ore louerd faste
Þat him sende so guode bileue &punctelev; so stableliche forto laste
heo ladden him aboute and scheweden him &punctelev; þat lond fer and ner
¶ Ase þe sonne binimez þe li&yogh;t &punctelev; of Candle aboute Midday
So long and brod þe place was &punctelev; þat he ne mi&yogh;te non ende iseo
A fair Medwe he sai&yogh;[al. Al murie med] with swete floures : swottere ne mi&yogh;te non beo
Treon also with noble fruyt &punctelev; þat smulde swote Inov&yogh;
And þe[al. So gret] swotnesse of euerech stude &punctelev; al aboute op drou&yogh;
Þat þare withoute mete and drunch &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te, eueremo
he mi&yogh;te libbe with alle Ioie &punctelev; &yogh;if he moste þareInne go
It was þere euere iliche li&yogh;t &punctelev; and euere it was dai
So muche folk in none place, him þou&yogh;te &punctelev; neuer er he ne sai&yogh;
Ech Compaygnie to oþur drov&yogh; &punctelev; and ech bi oþur stod
With murie song and Melodie &punctelev; and gladnesse in heore mod
Þat ech of oþur þe more Ioye &punctelev; togadere heo mi&yogh;ten afonge
Almi&yogh;ti god, þat heom schop &punctelev; heo hereden In heore songe
And ase sum steorre þat &yogh;e iseoth &punctelev; bri&yogh;tore þane oþur is
Also was bi heom, for some weren &punctelev; clerore þane some, iwis
Ake þulke þat mest dosk was &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te, was more cler
And bri&yogh;tore schon, þane ani gold &punctelev; þat he isai&yogh; euer er
¶ Ech werede cloþes of þe entaile &punctelev; þat heo wereden on eorþe here
Monekes ase it to Monek bifeol &punctelev; and freres ase to frere
So þat heo hadden heore ri&yogh;te fourme &punctelev; ake wel bri&yogh;tore was hore hev
Ant &yogh;wat men heo were on eorþe &punctelev; bi heore cloþinge he knev
Some hadden þe croune of golde &punctelev; anouewarde þe heued ido
And some beren in heore hond &punctelev; &yogh;eordene of golde also
And alle heo þonkeden Ihesu crist &punctelev; þat so studefast heorte him sende
Þe kni&yogh;t, for al þe pine þat he hadde &punctelev; is heorte enes ne wende
Echone heom þou&yogh;te þat for him &punctelev; In þe more Ioye heo were
he stod and biheold al þis Ioie &punctelev; as þei no wit on him nere
Þe on, ase it heore maister were &punctelev; is Mouth ondude wel softe
And welcomede him wel mildeliche &punctelev; and þonkede ore louerd ofte
Þat swuch porpos him hadde isend &punctelev; and studefast heorte also
Þat he ne chaungede nou&yogh;t is þou&yogh;t &punctelev; for al þat him was ido
"bev frere," he seide, "iherd beo god &punctelev; þat þe hauez hidere ibrou&yogh;t
And among alle þine stronge fon &punctelev; studefast iwust þi þou&yogh;t
¶ Þov mi&yogh;t here sumdel iseo &punctelev; þat þov wilnest more
Of þe Ioye þat guode soulene habbez &punctelev; þat comieth to milce and ore
Þis place þat we inne beoth &punctelev; ich wene þov ne knowest nou&yogh;t
It is eorþelich parays &punctelev; þat Adam was Inne ibrou&yogh;t
And þat he was Inne ymad &punctelev; and sethþe for is misdede
he was icast out þarof, and we also &punctelev; on eorþe into alle wrechchehede
¶ Al þe Ioye þat þov isixt her &punctelev; he hadde to is wille
Ake he ne mi&yogh;te, þo he was out icast &punctelev; þarof iseo wurth a fille
Of wrechhede we beoth ikened &punctelev; and of sunful blode icome
And þat us is þoru&yogh; godes grace &punctelev; ant þoru&yogh; ore cristinedom binome
Ak þat we aftur ore cristindom &punctelev; of sunne on eorþe wrou&yogh;te
On eorþe oþur in purgatorie &punctelev; wel deore we it bou&yogh;te
For we alle þat þou here isixt &punctelev; þareforth hidere come
And ore sunnes þare betten &punctelev; and harde penaunce nome
Ne mi&yogh;te we elles here come. &punctelev; ase guod bi þe it is
For &yogh;if þine sunnes nere for&yogh;iue &punctelev; þov ne come nou&yogh;t here, iwis
And alle þat þov þare isei&yogh;e &punctelev; to us þudere heo schullen wende
And al dai doth some, &yogh;wane heo habbez &punctelev; heore penaunce ibrou&yogh;t to ende
Neuer on not hov longe he schal &punctelev; þare bileue, iwis
For hoso ani freond on eorþe hath &punctelev; mid him þe betere it is
Man mai hore pine muche alegge &punctelev; and þe sonore ovt þarof heom lede
And &yogh;wane ani of heom hidere comez &punctelev; a&yogh;en him we wendez echon
Ase we duden a&yogh;ein þe, with Ioye &punctelev; and ledez him In anon
Ake non of us nis &yogh;uyt wuyrthþe &punctelev; into heuene forto wende
Ne neuere on not &yogh;wane ovre louerd &punctelev; after ani of us wole sende
For ech man þat into heuene schal &punctelev; þoru&yogh; purgatorie mot
And sethþe into eorþeliche parays &punctelev; ase we beoth novþe, wel ich wot
For þis is ovre kuynde heritage &punctelev; iwrou&yogh;t we weren þarto
Al forto ore furste fader it agulte &punctelev; and forto he hadde misdo
here we scholden alle habbe ibeon ibore &punctelev; and ileoued ore lif also
For ore louerd wold þat we weren &punctelev; In þe more Ioye ido
Þei men beon ovt heonnes icast &punctelev; hereforth heo moten wende
And[om. and] a&yogh;en, ar heo to heouene come &punctelev; aftur heore liues ende
Ake al þe Ioye þat is here &punctelev; nis noþing, iwis
A&yogh;ein þe leste Ioye of heouene &punctelev; wel muche þe meste is
Sumþing þov schalt of heuene iseo &punctelev; In a place herenei&yogh;."
he ladde him opon an hei&yogh; hul &punctelev; and bad him biholde on hei&yogh;
And axede him of &yogh;wuch colur were &punctelev; heuene opri&yogh;t þere
he seide, him þou&yogh;te ri&yogh;t ase gold &punctelev; þat puyr wallinde were
"&YOGH;e," seide þis oþur, "þis is þe wei &punctelev; þat geth ri&yogh;t to heuene blis
And þat is þe &yogh;at of parays &punctelev; þat withoute heuene &yogh;eond is
¶ Ech day some of purgatorie &punctelev; comez hidere us to
And some of us to heuene wendez &punctelev; euereche daye also
So þat [we] wexez eche daie &punctelev; and waniez, þov sixt lo
We nutez &yogh;wuch of us it schal beo next &punctelev; bote as god wole habbe ido
Ech dai þe &yogh;wuyle we here beoth &punctelev; ore louerd us fedez ene
with riche metes of heuene &punctelev; þat swete is and clene
&yogh;wuche þulke metes beon &punctelev; are þov heonnes wende
with us þov schalt sone iwite &punctelev; &yogh;wane god it wole us sende."
Ne hadde he bote o word iseid &punctelev; þat þare ne cam ali&yogh;te
A manere brez fram heouene adoun &punctelev; þat schon wel clere and bri&yogh;te
Þat ouerspradde al þat lond &punctelev; and a cler leome þarewithoute
And[al. om.] opon euereches heued ali&yogh;te adoun &punctelev; wel faire, withouten doute,[al. clerore þane aboute]
And opon þis kni&yogh;tes heued also &punctelev; an þoru&yogh; him smot anon
And þoru&yogh; euerech lime and lith of him &punctelev; þat swete li&yogh;t gan gon
Þa[t] so muche wille[r. winne?] and Ioye &punctelev; him þou&yogh;te, neuere he nadde
he stod, ase þei he were inomen &punctelev; for Ioye þat he þo hadde
&YOGH;weþur he were quik oþur ded &punctelev; bote ase he in metingue were
louerd, murie is þe Ioye of heuene &punctelev; ase he ifelde wel þere
Þe kni&yogh;t stod and biheold aboute &punctelev; and is ri&yogh;te stat onderstod
So fol he was of þat holi leome &punctelev; þat so swete was and guod
him þou&yogh;te, þei he leouede eueremore &punctelev; and neuereft more ne ete
Ne scholde him neuereft to mete luste &punctelev; so guod was þe leome and swete
"Lo," seide þis oþur gost &punctelev; þat schewede him al þis place
"Sumdel þov hast nouþe isei&yogh;e &punctelev; of ore louerdes grace
¶ Of þe pine þat þe wrechche gostes &punctelev; habbeth for heore mis|dede
And of þe Ioye þat guode gostes &punctelev; in parays doth lede
And sumdel of þe grete Ioie &punctelev; þat in þe ri&yogh;te heuene is
Eche dai&yogh;e we beoth ifedde &punctelev; ones with swuche Ioie and blis
And þanne beo we al dai fulle inov&yogh; &punctelev; forto ore louerd more us sende
In swuche Ioie heo beoth þat beoth in heouene &punctelev; and worþez with|oute ende
And &yogh;uyt sumdel in more &punctelev; it ne faillez heom neuere mo
And we ne beoth a day bote enes &punctelev; forto we þudere go
And &yogh;wan þat we þudere comieth &punctelev; we schulle withouten ende
And þou, &yogh;if þov aseruest heuene forth &punctelev; þudere forto wende
Þov mi&yogh;t don ase þov wolt &punctelev; &yogh;wane þov comest to eorþe, iwis
And þudere anon a&yogh;en þou most— &punctelev; forsoþe, at þe time it is
And &yogh;if þov wolt guod lif lede &punctelev; þine mede þov mi&yogh;t iseo
And &yogh;wat pine heo habbez, þov hast iseie &punctelev; þat luþere wollez beo
A&yogh;ein þou most wende anon &punctelev; go forth agodes name
For sikerliche þov mi&yogh;t gon &punctelev; þe feondes ne mowen don þe no schame
heo beoth adradde wel sore of þe &punctelev; and aschamede in eche side
Agodes name go forth þi wei &punctelev; þov ne mi&yogh;t no leng here abide!"
"A, sire, merci!" quath þis kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "bitide &yogh;wat me bitide
A fote inelle fram eov go &punctelev; for wrechchehede[MS. hedede] goth so wide
¶ Ake soffriez me bileue here with ov! &punctelev; for, &yogh;if ich fram eov wende
Adrad ich am of þe feondene mi&yogh;te &punctelev; laste heo with sunne me schende."
"Do wei, beu frere," þis oþur seide &punctelev; "ase wel þov mi&yogh;t beo stille
A&yogh;en þov schalt to eorþe anon &punctelev; and[al. om.] þov mi&yogh;t don þare þine wille
And &yogh;if þov seruest wel ore louerd þere &punctelev; siker þov mi&yogh;t beo
to comen a&yogh;ein hidere to us &punctelev; and sethþe to heuene fteo
Agodes half wend a&yogh;en anon &punctelev; forsoþe, þov schalt so."
"Alas, alas!" quath þis kni&yogh;t &punctelev; "&yogh;wat schal ich nouþe do
Al þe Ioye þat ich habbe nouþe isei&yogh;e &punctelev; it worth me binome
And to þe wrechhede of þe worlde &punctelev; alas, schal ich novþe come!"
Ovt ate &yogh;ate heo brou&yogh;ten him &punctelev; wepinde, at þe laste
And beden him gon wel hardiliche &punctelev; and herien ore louerd wel faste
Anon so he was withoute igon &punctelev; þat &yogh;at heo maden wel bliue
With dreori mod he wende a&yogh;en &punctelev; and was adrad of is liue
Ase he cam er, with careful mod &punctelev; þene wei a&yogh;ein he nam
And, &yogh;wane ani deuel þat him pinede er &punctelev; ou&yogh;were a&yogh;en him cam
Ase wode schrewene heo flouwen faste &punctelev; and ne dorsten abide him nou&yogh;t
So atþe laste þis kni&yogh;t was &punctelev; to þe halle a&yogh;ein ibrou&yogh;t
Þare as þe holie compaygnie &punctelev; þuderward to him wende
And sat him adoun wel softe þere &punctelev; forto ore louerd him grace sende
Ase he sat and biheold aboute &punctelev; to him heo comen þere
Al þat faire compaygnie &punctelev; þat a&yogh;ein him cam er
And honoureden him wel faire &punctelev; and conforteden him wel faste
And þonkeden Iesus, godes sone &punctelev; þat his bileue so wel ilaste
¶ "bev frere," heo seiden, "&yogh;wane þov hast &punctelev; swuch penaunce i|driue
Siker beo þou þat þine sunnes &punctelev; al clene þe beoth for&yogh;iue
loke, &yogh;wane þov comest to eorþe a&yogh;en &punctelev; þat þov clene lif lede
So þat þov neuereft in pine ne come &punctelev; for sunne ne for misdede
Þov most don þe heonnes anon &punctelev; for at hom in þine londe
hit dawez clere and is nei&yogh; dai &punctelev; ase ich me onderstonde
And þe prior with procession &punctelev; to þe &yogh;ate comez wel sone
to loki &yogh;weþur þov beo icome &punctelev; ase ri&yogh;t is forto done
And, bote he þe finde þere &punctelev; he wole maken þat &yogh;at anon
And wole beo siker þat þou ne comest nonmore &punctelev; and sori wole a&yogh;en gon."[This verse on the margin.]
Þene kni&yogh;t heo brou&yogh;ten out of þe halle &punctelev; and blesseden him echon
And bitei&yogh;ten god boþe lif and soule &punctelev; fel and flesch and bon
Forth he wende wel dreoriliche &punctelev; bote ase he nede moste it do
And ri&yogh;t ase he cam to þe &yogh;ate &punctelev; þe prior cam also
A&yogh;ein him with procession &punctelev; to loke hou it were
Anon so he hadde þe &yogh;ate onloke &punctelev; þene kni&yogh;t heo founden þere
Þare was Ioye and blisse inov&yogh; &punctelev; þo huy togadere come
With song and oþur melodie &punctelev; þane kny&yogh;t þareout huy nome
Ant ladden him forth to churche anon &punctelev; ant þonkeden god wel faste
Þis kni&yogh;t bifore þe hei&yogh;e auctere &punctelev; aknes wel sone him caste
Ant stableliche in his oresones &punctelev; fiftene dawes he lay
And þonkede ore louerd & on him cride &punctelev; boþe ny&yogh;t and day
And sethþe on his bare flesch &punctelev; þe holie croiz he nam
And wende to þe holie lond &punctelev; ant suyþe holi man bicam
he ne tolde neuereeft nou&yogh;t of þe world &punctelev; bote ase he were euere in þou&yogh;te
Ake wende euere forth wel stilleliche[al. simpleliche] &punctelev; as he of noþing ne rou&yogh;te
Ofte he tolde of alle þe men &punctelev; þat in parays were
As him þou&yogh;te, grei&yogh;e Monekes &punctelev; mest Ioye hadden þere
Nonemanere men in so gret Ioye &punctelev; ne in so grete honour he ne sei&yogh;
hit nis no wonder sikerliche &punctelev; for þe ordre is noble and hei&yogh;.
Novþe &yogh;e habbez alle iheord &punctelev; þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace
hou seint paterik þulke purgatorie &punctelev; founde in þat place
Forto warni men aboute &punctelev; heore sunnes here to bete
For þe loue of Iesu crist &punctelev; and of is moder swete
Alle ower sunnes betez here &punctelev; as god ov wole grace sende
Þat &yogh;e mouwen withoute pine &punctelev; to parays hennes wende
god leue us ovre sunnes here so biete &punctelev; for is holie wounde
Þat we ne þoruen in purgatorie &punctelev; bileue bote luyte stounde
